reviews.review: Posh Boutiques and Restaurants in a Gorgeous Building. Whether shopping of not, you must visit the Queen Victoria Building that was erected in the late nineteenth century. It is a Romanesque Revival building designed by George McRae and is located in downtown Sydney and is a city block in size. It was originally a marketplace but also had additional uses. After suffering years of decay, it underwent remodeling and restoration and is now home to designer boutiques and upscale restaurants. You should walk through it just to observe the fantastic tile work on its floors and the fabulous stained glass windows. The center cupola is totally "off the wall" as is the clock. You have to see it to believe it. This is a worthwhile activity to partake of.

Beautiful building with interesting shops. The QVB is a beautiful building and has interesting shops. The shops are mainly targeted toward women shoppers, no surprise. The only complaint is that it was very crowded the day we were there, and the physical layout really makes you feel the crowds.

Elegant history. If you are in Sydney Australia visit the most elegant building in Sydney. The 'powers that be ' nearly knocked it down years ago but it was saved to house magnificent shops plus places to eat on a few floors. The bottom floor leads to Town Hall station so very handy to get to and spend a whole afternoon .wonderful architect . Don't miss it
dream in old times. when walking in the building I felt myself as if I lived in the years of Queen Victoria. Building is a great example of renovation.
an historical building with shops. If you are in the city it is a good building to view, looking very much like old buildings in London. Two unique clocks inside are of special interest.

Wonderful old building filled with stylish boutiques and nice food outlets.. Very busy the day we were there but the architecture and the retention of some of the historical features make it a must see.

High end shopping. A beautifully restored building in the heart of the city. Many chic shops on 3 levels. Cafes too. Go there to look at the architecture as much as the retail outlets. Lovely old tiled floors, pretty ceilings & a central dome.

An outstanding building in tip top condition. This building is a work of art in pristine condition. I visited on a fairly busy Saturday and still enjoyed walking around. Check out the tiles floors, the clocks, the ceiling and enjoy a pot of tea in Wedgwood Chine at The Palace tea room.

High Victoriana. Whenever we visit Sydney, this is one destination we head for. This building is beautifully restored and takes up a whole city block. There are many high-end retailers of all types. The coffee shops are great as well.

A Beautiful Building with Lots of Shopping. This building is 5 or 6 levels with a variety of stores/budgets for shopping. There are also several little cafes located throughout where you can grab a bite or drink. Some were all enclosed establishments others were tables situated in the walkways. The entire middle of building is open so you can look up/down on the other levels. Escalators at ends of levels and believe there are elevators in the middle. The building is a full city block long. Beautiful architecture. There is a huge clock in the middle between levels which has little ships/boats that move around the clock as minutes tick by that is enjoyed by young an old.
Shop in a Victorian Splendor.. Beautifully restored Victorian Era building filled with top shops and Near midtown, this is a great photo opportunity

Great blend of old and modern. Another of Sydney’s must visit buildings. A magnificent historical building with the Victorian Dome as it’s centre master piece of stained glass and the statue of Queen Victoria outside.Inside it is an upmarket shopping centre with a great variety of stores, but be warned it can be expensive. These give the inside it’s blend of history and modern where ever you wander. There is a Food Court in the basement with a large selection of eats or just take coffee and watch the patrons pass by.A must see if in Sydney and well worth an hour or two to wander through.
The clock alone is worth the visit. Lots of cool shops and places to eat but, for me, the highlight is the clock and watching it strike the hours.

High end shops in a historic setting. Having just arrived from visiting Melbourne where we enjoyed the Queen Victoria Market with its 600 vendors hawking a wide array of goods and foods in a spirited environment, we were anxious to see how the QVB compared. What we found were high end shops in an interior, 3 story, covered block long mall. It wasn't our style - and most of the shops were closed when we walked through in the early evening.The building was of architectural interest, but a quick walk through sufficed for us.

Nice break . Very nice building with history that goes way back. There are very expensive shops inside that are well designed so it's fun to walk around and do some window shopping or actual shopping:)Many cafes with cool atmosphere. Don't miss the 2 huge clocks hanging from the ceiling. It's good for 1 hour tour including the coffee stop.Enjoy
One of Sydney's nicest buildings, with upscale shopping. Nice old building in the middle of the city with upmarket shops. Some decent places to eat and some interesting specialty stores.

Classic. We love this building and its graceful stores, however a lot of the ambiance has been ruined by the pop up type kiosks in the centre of the aisles.The overcrowding really negates that luxe feel.
Beautiful Shopping Area. This is a wonderful, beautiful building to see from inside and out. There are many high end shops to enjoy and cafes and restaurants for every taste.
Beautiful building. Took pics of the outside. Very crowded. A lot of trendy shops, nothing special. Then caught the train downstairs

Best shopping arcade in Sydney. The QVB was in danger of being demolished a few decades ago, but luckily was saved and beautifully renovated and restored . The exterior is a great example of Sydney sandstone. The shops are top quality and the overall atmosphere is delightful and busy without being too crowded. The clock in the centre is an interesting feature, and there are several cafes in the building and nearby. At Christmas time, a very tall Christmas tree decorated with crystal ornaments is installed.

World class. Shortly after returning to Sydney in 1988, I visited the QVB and experienced what had been wrought on an old car park. It was stunning. I returned to Royal Leamington Spa, UK where a similar building had just been completed, supposedly inspired by the QVB. The British architect got nowhere near the brilliance of the QVB. Note: the 'When did you travel?' choice does not allow truth to emerge; redesign.

WWW. Wow, Wow and Wow so that is my review, this is not my first time here but I am simply amazed how the administration keeps shops open whilst elsewhere in Sydney there are many closures. The shops are unique, craftsman skills, low traffic but so beautiful. These shops form more of the brilliance of Sydney than anything else, overseas shoppers loved walking slowly window to window, so did I. A must visit, no really!

a Sydney Icon. Once the site of the original Sydney Market, this wonderful sandstone emporium was constructed in the late 1880's. It fell into serious neglect and was a Government utility office building in the 1960's. It was rescued fro demolition by the Ipoh Company from Malaysia and restored to its former glory as an upmarket shopping experience. Well done Ipoh!
Stroll through. One of Sydney most beautiful & historic buildings. From high end to high street shops. Cafes to sit & people watch. At Christmas time even better.

Hi Tea . Had my first Australian hi tea in the Queen Victoria building on Sunday. It was so so amazing. Beautiful building, the hi tea food was the best and the waiters were very polite, friendly and helpful. Will be coming here again
Great Shopping Experience. There are great shops in here, most high end stores so can be a little pricey. A few cafes also to enjoy.

Tourists and residents love this building. From Town Hall Station one enters another world in the Queen Victoria Building- food, fashion, cosmetics, antique and designer jewellery in an opulent Victorian domed building lit by stained glass panels that take your breath away. One could easily spend the day here window shopping and snacking or seriously shopping.

This was a commsumate experience in the excess!. This is a 4 storey building with exquisite architectural appointments AND.... you should NOT miss the opportunity to walk through it.The entire building is filled with boutiques offering beautiful items at high prices.... so? Who's going to force you to buy?There are also food outlets (pricey, but not out of reach), but you'll pay a premium to sit down at the establishment's tables.... there are other seats on the top floor and it's a great place! On the 1st floor (2nd level) there's an open piano for anyone to sit at and play... my wife enjoyed herself there, both listening to others and playing.
Great architecture and an enjoyable shopping mall. In the heart of Sydney this old building really stands out - some great old architecture and then some great shopping to boot. Enjoy.

QVB was a delightful place to visit my friends were delighted with it, same as the Strand Arcade. A visit to Sydney is a wonderful way to spend a week or two. Plenty to see and do. Must make mention of the taxi drivers, they were most informative and helpful. A big improvement on what I had found on previous visits.
BEAUTIFUL. There is a lovely little boutique cafe in here that does afternoon teas. Lovely food, quaint decorations

Amazing building. While not an obvious highlight like the Opera House or Harbour Bridge the Queen Victoria Building should be on everyone's itinerary. A fantastic building where you can experience great food downstairs and remarkable shopping throughout.

Take your time.... Try to ignore the masses of people moving around (especially on the lower floors. Try to ignore the never- ending upgrade work on the train station. Wander around the upper floors and marvel at the uniqueness of this place. Top tip: there is a great place for afternoon tea right at the very top.

Beautiful shopping center, nice shops and quaint cafes. I love the qaint cafes so much; food was always amazing, and not that expensive. There are also several international brands as well as local brands, and it's a rich place to see aboriginal art souvenirs, specialty jewelry, and artisan chocolate. :)
Beautiful Building/Unique Stores. Centrally located off Georges Street, it's a beautiful building with many unique stores in its three stories.

need time and money here.... What a great way to revitalize a grand old building, make it into a high end shopping centre in the downtown core. it was very busy on a typical Saturday morning. four floors of shops from women's and men's fashion, pen shops, souvenirs, hobby shops, food and more. The stairways are beautiful when the sun streams through the stained glass windows. The main clock is so unique showing a history of Australia as the ship sails around in a minute. Quite a piece of work. And then access to the train station right below. Perfectly laid out. Wish I had more time to explore it fully.

Fantastic old building with lots of really good shops. This is one of the most stunning buildings in Sydney that would not look out of place in some of the most historic buildings in Europe. It's in amazing condition and has plenty of shops (expensive ones) to look in.

Beautiful. Absolutely stunning building.From The outside it reminds me London's Harrods a bit (size and colour). Inside its full of boutiques and cafes and restaurant. You will find beautiful hanging clocks, staircases and old school lift.Well worth visiting!

Worthy of a Visit. We happened upon QVB while looking for an art gallery that featured Aboriginal art. What a beautiful building! Outstanding architecture from the past. Several levels, all accessible by lift of escalator. It continues many exclusive and unique shops as well as restaurants and cafes. It is definitely worth a visit.

Same old, same old. It has been 13 years since I have been to Sydney and I had very fond memories of the QVB building. Mmmm...maybe i am a bit jaded and more well traveled. This is just another high end shopping mall without all the quirky little shops that I remembered. However, I did have a very good lunch at The Palace on the second floor. Next visit i won't be back here though.

Love QVB!. Not my first time here, I just love the vibe in this building. There's a buzz and a quaint sort of charm with the tiled floors and pretty coloured windows and so much going on. Great shops and lots of choices to eat and/or drink. A must see when in Sydney
Must See. Antique mall in the inside with quite expensive stores. I enjoyed experience of walking within the building.
Sisters Time. Awesome place to hang out with sis and friends. So many shops in classical Victorian setting, and nice domes within the market.
Shopping . I adore this place, it has so many shops and services. Everyone seems friendly and no dealing with car or traffic
Great piece of architecture. I just adore that the integrity of the building has been preserved. Take time to appreciate the original tiled, windows and stained glass.

A veritable piece of high Victoriana in the middle of Sydney. Always fun to shop there.....or just to look at the beautiful building, inside and out. The Zsydneysiders wanted to pull it down...like all the other beautiful buildings in Sydney that omce existed but a Malaysian conglomerate bought it, restored it, saved it from the Sydneysiders that wanted another carpark/pebble-crete building there. The huge christmas tree that goes through all the stories, from basement to top ceiling is a must to see at xmas.
Visit QVB at Noon to watch the clock. A visit to QVB is a must for all visitors - visit it timed at noon to watch the clock do it's thing in the main hall.
Worth a stroll through. It's massive and I didn't buy anything, but it's a beautiful building inside and out. I enjoyed walking through it, snapping photos here and there.

Interesting Historical Building with upmarket shops. Very interesting Historical Building with great furnishings and a good atmosphere. There is a wide range of upmarket shops and eateries inside. The building is also on top of Town Hall Train station. The only down side is if you need to use the lift, they are very small and slow

Wow, shops and cafes par excellence!. What an amazing shopping emporium, probably one of the finest in the world. All manner of fashion boutiques and fancy cafes all housed in 4 floors of an opulent & classic victorian building. Worth a vusit just to look and stare at the range and quality of the magificent things which money can buy if you have enough of it!
Right downtown, great arcitecture. The building is downtown, it's part of a downtown walk. It's be restored and has great architecture.

It's always interesting to go there. I have been to QVB a couple of times - always admire its interior decorations and the selection of stores / cafe it possesses. You can get an excellent view from the top level - and in case you are into photography - thats one of the location you should go to take a good pic.
Beautiful building. This is such a beautiful place to see. The tile work and grand high ceilings are just stunning. A treasure trove of shops within

Impressing. The building is posh, the shops are posh, but the staff and security are down to earth. I have seen homeless assisted by shop owners and security on many occasions. I would expect a centre like this to distance itself from the less fortunate. Quite impressing, somehow still a centre for the people.
Interesting. Many shops to choose. great day, wondering from shop to shop, and the history of the building is very interesting & beautiful. definitely recommend.
Lots of womens fashion stores and cafes. Virtually no mens stores but lots of cafes to sit in while the "Little Lady" shops. The Building is a wonderful example of Architecture beautifully renovated.

Stunning Victorian architecture. I only went to visit QVB because of the architecture. This is a very attractive building set in the heart of Sydney and worth a visit just for the architecture. The store is on a similar line to Harrods of London but to me is more impressive The place is full of high end stores and plenty of cafes and restaurants. The clocks hanging from the ceiling are beautiful as is the stain glass windows and dome The tiles on two floors are laid in the mosaic style and are most impressive. Overall, I wouldn't go there for high end shopping bot for the building itself which is a treasure and is well maintained
Awesome architecture . Awesome building with lots of cool boutique style shops and great architecture. Almost like a church to shopping. It's cool to lookAround.

Multi-storey designer stores and a complex of fabulous stores in the heart of Sydney. Many restaurants and takeaway food shops are found here.Lots of clothing stores and accessories stores.Handful of Cafe's are located nearby.Closer to the Townhall, train station and buses.A major supermarket is also across the road from QVB.

Swarovski . We visited the queen Victoria building. All of the shops and cafes anf public areas were lovely and well maintained. It was a bit crowded so we didnt mind. I had always admired the jewelry shop Swarovski so we went in for a look. Well we had the biggest pretty woman experience. YES we were snubbed and no i did not purchase anything from there. These girls looked down their noses at us. We got a hello from 2 people and that was it. So the head office got a nice complaint email last night. If you want good service go to lovisa as they are a lot more friendly.

Upscale. Beautiful building. Worth visiting even if you are not a shopper. If shopping is your thing, this is for you. Mostly clothing, shoes and bags. Some nice specialty stores. Good food area. Must try the freshly roasted nuts.
Amazing. I love to eat zumbo, no doubt. Its a must to try in QVB. enjoy all historical building inside and outside

Beautiful buidling. I love meeting friends here for a lunch at Palace Tea Room. The building is such an iconic location and the hoards of tourists and locals alike make for excellent people watching. A great place to grab lunch or coffee while you're out and about in CBD and definitely worth the visit for tourists.
Historical building. Queen Victoria building turned to mall has been very good . Enjoyed fully while been there during the Christmas season.
Perfect Mix. Magnificent historical building with nice stores inside. Really enjoyed to shop inside the amazing details of old architectures. Modernization mix with historical...perfect combination

Bring Your Wallet!. After passing this building while taking a city tour. My wife and I just had to explore it. It is a beautiful building with a lot of character. There are many expensive shops to visit, so even if you are "just looking" plan for at least a 2 hour visit.
Very nice interesting building!. Totally loved walking through the building. It's old and full of character. But the shops are quite high end so I didn't buy anything (haha).

Majestic relic of Victorian times and the British Empire.. Iconic building in the heart of Sydney continues to enthrall the public.Flanked by a monumental statue for Queen Victoria at the southern entrance, the architectural features appeal to those interested in history. Inside the best of the past is updated by features of the modern: escalators with mirrors underneath reflect the glory of the original features.Great dome of stained glass is a masterpiece - central to the whole building. It's a shoppers paradise: specials for tourists and locals. Australiana and delicacies of pastries abound. Wonderful clock has musical displays on the hour.Each separate floor has its special features and offers. Basement specials and Food Court will satisfy most. The top floor may appeal to those who wish to have a special High Tea Experience. All tastes are satisfied with merchandise and food!It is a marvel. A must. Right opposite the Sydney Town Hall - another architectural marvel.

a historical building for free. it was a great building . we spent 3 hours looking to the walls and the iron elevator .everything is old and designed with Victorian elements . do not forget to visit a cafe , have cup of tea and enjoy the view.
Beautiful Building. This building is worth a visit simply to appreciate the magnificence of the environment, if not for the shopping. Give yourself a bit of time to explore as it can get busy.

A MUST-SEE at Christmas. This place is nice on its own, but at Christmas time its spectacular. The massive Christmas tree with decorations and lights. Santa available for photos. So beautiful.
Plenty to see and do with a variety of shops and cafe's available.

Gorgeous Building!. The QVB as its better known is a gorgeous building. Its an upscale mall and has some great restaurants. get on the second floor to see the magnificent clock better. If your in the QVB close to an hour (when the minute hand strikes 12) you must watch the bizarre show put on by the clock! I won't give more details and spoil the surprise but let me tell you its worth the visit!

the reason I moved to Sydney. As a back backer I watched people drinking coffee outside the QVB from a bus scooting passed. I swore I would come back to live in Sydney and drink coffee at that cafe. I did and I have. As a tourist attraction it's a nice to do but not essential. And don't go if you don't want to leave your home country.
Nice for tea . Take the stairs to the 3th floor and have a nice afternoon tea in the tearoom. Beautiful and nice tea
A must see attraction. Have to visit every time we come to SYD. Must come near midday to see the beautiful clock from 2nd floor. Stunning!! Very interesting shops and eateries. Lovely!!
it's free!. Great looking building inside and outside. The stained glass dome and windows were amazing. The restoration retained the spiral stairs, tiles and columns. Worth the 30 minutes we stayed.
Historical Building to visit. Wonderful historical building with detail. Inside shops and restaurants were nicely kept. One of the historical buildings that you should visit while in Sydney

Australian Travellers. Covering a city block in the centre of the Sydney CBD this beautiful building is worth a visit just for the architecture and the working clock as well as the regal statue of Queen Victoria at one entrance. Home to many high end shops and places to enjoy a meal or coffee it is a great place to spend some time while visiting the city area.

Victorian architecture. Currently a shopping center (high end store in this premium location) it is a beautiful example of Victorian architecture, lovingly cared for, the wrought iron works are spectacular
Architecture at its best. A relaxing stroll through the QVB reveals a stunning architectural beauty. The exterior and interior is just a delight to see. A must visit if you get to Sydney

Iconic Building in the CBD. The outer appearance of the QVB is wonderful, and the several levels inside this iconic Sydney building are likewise wonderful, from boutique shops and cafes, to the magnificent 'working' clock, this is a 'must see/do' for visitors and locals alike.
Time traveling experience. QVB has been renovated beautifully. The two clocks, the stained galls, the wrought iron - well worth the time to visit.

Like walking in London including the sound of the Big Ben!. Beautiful building with ok shops and restaurants. I would go for the architectural part not for the shopping. Great stop on a rainy day since you can go underground to the translation without getting wet.

Beautiful Building, Interesting Stores, Good Cafes. Always enjoyable to drop into the QVB even for a bit of window shopping. They have lots of interesting stores on all the different levels from clothing to antique jewellery. The many cafes are always buzzing and usually serve excellent coffee and tea. Its a lovely building that has been restored well and a delight to wander through.

The Heart of the City. This building is a must see for all tourists. It is beautiful old building, with inlaid floors, gorgeous windows and a picturesque facade. The shopping is expensive but a lot of the major luxury brands are represented. I always take my kids in to see it if we are nearby, and the Christmas tree is always a must see.If you are a tourist, go in and buy some Adriano Zumbo desserts from the ground floor stall in the centre. Then enjoy them while you window shop. You won't regret it!

shop till you drop. Great place to shop very high end but great just to window shop as well. Little cafes dotted around, great atmosphere in an old Victorian building, well worth a trip. Just outside is Westfield shopping centre which has more high street shops.

Magnificent structure, beautifully built. What a beautiful building, full of history and character.Several floors to explore, shops expensive and the restaurants BUT well worth it.The clock is an attraction on its own and many people love having their photos taken here. A long wait for your coffee and food but worth it. Take plenty of money if you plan to go shopping.

QVB is historic. This a beautiful, historic building that has essentially been turned into a shopping mall. There are some wonderful shops as well as restaurants, in addition to a terrific chocolate shop whose heritage dates back over 100 years. There are some lovely stained glass windows as well as some beautiful old ceiling clocks
Not sure about the hype. Nice building with shops in it. Not sure what the hype is about since it is very crowded with lots of shops.
Great shopping experience. Tons of awesome unique stores and amazing architecture. Lots of great tea places and cafes to grab food. Perfect for a day shopping in Sydney

Fantastic window shopping. This is one of the loveliest pieces of 19th century architecture in Syndey. It is a magnificent building which now houses many shopping retailers. It is being wonderfully preserved and cared for. There is a lot of great windowshopping and people watching opportunities in this lovely building. Stopping at one of the many Cafes is a great way to experience this lovely building. Try to visit when you have time to visit the upper floors and remember to look up as you stroll along.
Great historic place to visit. We stumbled upon this building and so glad we did. It is so beautiful and historic. Beautiful stained glass roof. A must see!
Archetectural beautiful!. Take a train to this station. There are shops, restaurants, and the building is supreme. It is very crowded. Wedding photos were shot while we were there which was sweet.
Must visit in Sydney!. A wonderful regal experience in the middle of Sydney. Totally worth a visit. Come here for a cup of coffee and walk over to Pitt Street mall for a seamless shopping experience.
Great shopping and high tea!. Beautiful, but expensive clothing and jewelry stores. Lovely place to have high tea...the pastries looked amazing!
Boutique Shops and quality jewelers.. Several levels of business and busyness.We got our engagement ring here so a good place to throw away money ;)

Historic building filled with shops. It is a charming and very beautiful historic building filled with character. The details are lovely and the clock and dome are wonderful. The building is filled with shops most rather expensive.

Shopping and history. This is an Historical building and nowadays have some stores for shopping. The building is really beautiful and the most exiting is that there is a piano free to play at the second floor. I had the experience to listen an student playing some songs at the time I visited and it.

Fabulous at Christmas time. This Victorian building is beautiful inside and out with divine architecture and stained glass windows. At Christmas there is a giant tree decked out in exquisite Swarovksi crystals. Make sure you visit the top floors to escape the crowds and find some peaceful window-shopping in the heart of the city.
A must see. This is a stunning building which is a must see on any tourist agenda. Beautiful architecture, great shopping or simply strolling along answer people watching. Love this place

SHOP & EAT TIL YOU DROP..IN STYLE!! . Excellent quality shopping in the heart of Sydney. Nestled under 1 gigantic beautiful HISTORICAL BUILDING...Enjoy the variety of cafes; restaurants; entertainment; & great bargains..@The QVB. Enjoy & be inspired with the busy commuters, tourists, locals & all walks of life in this magical gem.All public transport at the door..trains underground level.Convenient & family friendly for commuters being centrally situated in Sydney City within walking distance to the famous Darling Harbour Tourist Attraction. My friends from Melbourne & I enjoyed a thorough day of "Catching up"; shopping; delicious lunch with a glass of wine or two; excellent cappucino & sweets. Relaxing, fun, fruitful & positive conversation. Ah what a blissful day it was! Cant wait to meet up again. Fun, romantic, magical, historical & tremendous atmosphere. The Queen Victoria Building (QVB), Sydney. Opens for late shoppers & commuters.

Old School Charm. A vast Array of really nice shops that everyone should visit at least once. the Top floor has a beautiful Jade Carriage as well as an amazing clock. Christmas time is special with a Huge tree spanning four floors and lost of decorations. There really is something for everyone in this great old building.

A must see!. This is a gorgeous building full of wonderful cafes and mid-priced and upscale stores. The stain glass windows are beautiful, the tile floors are too, and the ambiance is special. If you are visiting Sdney, do yourself a favor and spend some time in the QVB.
Nice visit . The building has a very nice architecture.Pay special attention to de clocks that hang from the ceiling. Is a nice short visit to do while in Sydney's CBD.

Great shopping. During our visit to Sydney we found ourselves drawn to walking through the Victoria Building on many occasions. Just loved the mix and variety of the shopping and eating available. Our visit was visit in November 2015 therefore there was Christmas songs and decorations everywhere and it made for a fantastic, almost magical atmosphere.
Grand building. Its like walking back 150 years the décor is outstanding heaps of shops and plenty of cafes and restaurants
Beautiful old building. Such a beautiful old building. Great shopping and connects directly onto Myers and Westfield. Also the train system connects directly onto it.

A pearl in Sydney. It is wonderful that someone saved this building and turned it into the majestic beautify that it has become. Consisting of 4 levels with a range of shopping experiences from the simple and cheap through to designers and awe inspiring collectibles. General rule of thumb is that the higher you go the bigger the wallet you'll need. But don't let that dishearten you. The spectacle of there place is equally fulfilling ... And there are some good food joints in there too. Whether you grab a quick coffee or sit down in hidden Asian food fest you won't be disappointed. There's plenty to look at while you enjoy the architecture of the Victorian era so head down and spend the day there.

its ok.... This is a nice old building but really just has become little more than a fancy shopping mal these days. Many big name brande are here but the shops are all small and better shopping can be had at the new wesfield.
shop and take photos. it's a really nice mall where you can also get amazed by the architecture. the big clock at the middle is so nice to look at

Unique shopping mall. The Queen Victoria building is really worth to visit . It has a big variety of attraction. Inside, has showrooms, coffee shops, restaurants, tailor shops, and others . Outside, everyday some people make some show , dancing or singing. We really loved it .
Upscale shopping. If the shops are too posh for you the building is still worth a visit, especially if you like architecture. Cafes great, too

A grand old building. So much to like - wonderful stately, classy , a beautiful piece of architecture that is probably thought of by most people for its fashion shopping and cafes than its original purpose.

A historic part of Australia. The Queen Victoria Building... what can i do there ? I don't want to do shopping, but I decide just to have a look. Surprise ! A wonderful building, nice shops and a very nice piece of the UK and Australia history. For example to take time to watch the clock, and to be back at the old time... A nice trip, surely

Beautiful old building, great to walk through. I'm not a shopper but this is an amazing and beautiful building, updated with lots of higher end shops and eateries. Make sure to go all the way to the top and look down on the tile work on the floors below.

A large mall in a beautiful building. Yes, you're probably going to blow your budget there.. It's fairly typical upscale shopping mall inside, but a couple of things make it irresistible. First of all, the building. It's named Queen Victoria Building for a reason. It's absolutely stunning. Second, it's the location. A lot of tourist routes pass by this building, so most of the tourists are going to see it. And, remember, it's irresistible :) Once you get inside - be prepared to blow your budget. Most of the brands are fairly typical, but they service is excellent and the presentation is great.

Must-see!. This building is more than a commercial area where you can shop, it's a piece of art, you feel like you're transported into another century, not your ordinary shopping mall, it's refreshing and not as packed and crammed as european shopping centers. It has luxurious boutiques as well as restaurants. They offer free wifi and everytime you come back to visit it will tell you how long it's been. There are benches here and there, if you'd like to seat and rest inbetween. Definitely worth the visit!
a beautiful building with amazing shops. Definitely a must visit while in Sydney. We spent quite sometime visiting the shops and then enjoying a delicious gluten free chocolate cake
Beautiful Building. This is a must visit building. It is a beautiful building, with so many amazing shops and restaurants. We had as much fun looking at the building as we did shopping.

TERRIFIC SHOPPING AND GREAT CAFES. We've been through QVB several times and its always great experience. The shops are wide ranging and classy andf there are some really good eating places, but the overall impression of the architecture is its greatest asset

Beautiful, historic and vast array of quality shops. Great place to shop and socialise with friends. This is landmark in Sydney and a must see venue for friends and family visiting from overseas. Also a great place to hang out on the weekend.

Charming building. Went here at Christmas time and it was so stunning. It had a lovely Christmas tree right up the middle surrounded in lights and goes all the way from the bottom floor to the ceiling. It has lovely shops inside and a wonderful chocolate factor on the outside. It was the original (i think) elevators inside & the banisters are pretty too.

Cool clocks inside. Nice little gallery style mall with rail access on the lower floors. Many nice boutiques inside although not many real shoppers. If looking for a quick snack head downstairs, many cheaper options available. Some cool clocks inside and also don't miss the talking Monument of Islay just outside the main entrance.

beautiful building. even if you don't want to buy anything or don't like shopping, you can't fail to be impressed by this beautiful old building, a must see if your in Sydney and its one of the few things that is free to see and walk around.
Sydney Break. One for the shoppers, beautiful building and well looked after. Close to the City Centre and within few minutes walking distance.

Beautiful old building full of charactor. The shops in the QVB are expensive but also interesting and different. There are lots of eating places and coffee shops and also the upstairs Ballroom which is a lovely restaurant that serves High Tea. Worth a visit.
Beautiful area . Beautiful area from outside. Inside lots of luxury stores. Very pleasant to chill and drink coffee with friends.
Great shopping. If you like shopping in grand old buildings and very nice surroundings, this is the place for you. Great variety and something for everyone and merges into Westfield.

Pretty cool.. As said in the title, this is a pretty cool place. The clocks hanging in the middle are the neatest part. Check those out. For the rest, you probably will want to know that the shops here carry expensive luxury good. I marvelled for instance at $1400 Bally men's shoes. There is a Uggs store here as well that I found quite reasonable in price--must be an official store perhaps--compared to the scores of supposed discount stores scattered throughout Sydney. This one, with as I mentioned reasonable cost that did not exceed the "discount" stores, feel upscale and luxurious.

holy what an amazing place batman!. where do you start. What an amazing building. You have to see it to appreciate the massive amount of work and beauty from floor to ceiling inside & out.the shops are amazing. I gave myself 2 hours to look at this place before I had to go to the airport, thinking this would be ample time. Needed more time!The shops are absolutely amazing and I didn't get to see it all. I would love to go back, save up first though as some of these shops are very exclusive. Had a lovely light lunch in one of the restaurant cafes on one of the levels.Purchased a couple of things from the SOL Alpaca store, lovely customer service from the gentleman working there.Can't say enough about the gorgeous shops and things for sale. Lovely customer service everywhere I went. Saving up to go again!! Allow lots of time for this place it's huge. I didn't get to see it all.
Afternoon tea. A stunning building,and a wonderful example of Victorian architecture. The afternoon tea was gorgeous,thoroughly enjoyed the experience.
Vintage Shopping Mall. Complete shopping center and eaccessible, surrounded by small stores like souvenir store. According to me the toilet cleanliness could be improve.

Take time out to look at the clocks. I was saddened to see so many people using this fantastic building simply as a thoroughfare and not appreciate the spectacular architecture and the incredible clocks, most people I observed didn't even look up to see what was above them, their loss. I was absolutely enchanted with the clocks, especially the one with the revolving time and date mechanism and the circling galleon. Praise should go to those people who maintain these clocks in such a wonderful working order, thank you. Wandering around the various shops is also interesting as they offer wares that are not your every day retail items and to be able to sit and have a light meal or coffee to admire all of this is wonderful.
Magnificent Building. One of my favourite places to visit in SydneyThe building is Fantastic and the variety of shops is very good
Glories of the past. What a beautiful building. Built by craftsmen and beautiful restored. Lovely to see this glorious building kept for future generations to enjoy.

A Grand Sydney icon. The QVB is a magnificent edifice right next to Sydney Town Hall at the top of George Street, and is a beautiful restoration of a once sadly neglected pile. The array of shopping experiences available throughout its four levels of galleries/arcades, is incredible and ranging from a 'pop up' style mobile phone or key cutting 'kiosk' to the Metropolitan Museum of Art (USA) shop and everything in between, but my own favourite spot has long been the amazing Tea Rooms, accessed by the lift at the northern end. it is a former ballroom, and looks it, a great place for afternoon or a 'high' tea or formal dining if you feel like lashing out!!

Graceful. even if you don't spend a sent at the QVB, you will still enjoy the atmosphere of the building, it is historical and amazingfrom boutique shops to food and chocolate, this place has it all, there are hair dressers on the ground floor including a food court for a bite to eatyou could wander the hallways and window shop or just admire the roof top glassthere is a train station at town hall so you can get off and wonder for hours if you had the timeI love just wandering around and enjoying the buildings history

Get ready to be amazed!. The building alone is amazing. The shopping is great. There are a ton of options as far as style and price ranges. There are also a lot of great food choices. A great place to buy authentic UGGs.

Australian vacation. This is a must see for the architecture.Beautifully redone,The tile, the Windows, the clocks , But it is a very expensive mall.It was defenitly a worthwhile walk through.But close buy are plenty of cafes, restaurants, and shops that are a lot less expensive.

Don't miss QVB Clocks-FREE. We went to see the clocks and the architecture.The Royal Clock, located on Level 2 performs on the hour from 9am-9pm, showing six scenes of the Royal English History, (between England and Australia). The Australian Clock, located north of the QVB Centre Dome, the world largest hanging animated turret clock, chimes at half past the hour. It tells the story of Australia from the perspective of both Aboriginal and European settlers and includes 33 pictures scenes, 15 of the animated. Highly recommend a visit.

A must if you are visiting Sydney. We always go to the Queen Victoria Building when we visit Sydney. The atmosphere is quaint, many interesting coffee shops and love the bargin store in the basement. We spend at least an hour just looking around.
Didn't spend a penny!. Lot's of lovely shops! We wandered thru and took lots of photo's . It seemed busy with local working types We meant to go back, just never got there. Glad we saw it.

Spectacular Building, some interesting shops. This has something for everyone. Some high end stores down to a toy shop with aboriginal art thrown in. Spectacular stained glass windows and amazing architecture. Worth a stroll even if you are not shopping. Recommended.

Beautiful place to shop. The QVB is a Sydney landmark, there are lots of boutique shops that will sell anything from fashion, kitchen and home products. There's lots of cafes, book shops, hobby shops etc. A real designer style shopping building.

A favourite place to visit....The QVB. Thi s is a beautiful building to have coffee, lunch or afternoon tea. I enjoying popping in and relaxing over coffee and cake. This is such a beautiful building with so many fantastic shops for all ages.

Positive Vibe. QVB has certain vibe about it. The management of the mall managed to marry the modern and the past and not overdid it. The mall looks classy, with the right combination of branded stores and cafes. The elevators are certainly ancient (but upgraded) even if they are not the 1st elevators to be installed in Australia.We enjoyed visiting this mall even if majority of the goods there are beyond our budget.We were also entertained by a 3D artist doing his drawing near the Queen Victoria statue. Talented street artists like this should be encouraged to strut their stuff at public places like QVB.
Excellent. Most favourite place to shop in the world. The German bakery on the lower ground floor is a must and so is Top Juice

QVB is a happening place. This was our fist stop each morning, as the almond croissants at the Metropole are THE BEST. French pastry is alive and well in Sydney! Of course their coffee is too. Sydney has developed a coffee culture.
Historic Mall in Sydney. This mall is huge, the century old clocks that are hanging there are probably the most interesting thing you will see Inside along with the queen's letter
A beautiful old buildingb. Wandered through this building which houses lots of shops, cafes and restaurants. The architecture is beautiful, make sure you look up and down
lovely. Lovely old restored building. Heaps to see and appreciate and a unique mix of shops too. Also handy to have the subway underneath.
Love this building. Love coming here. Impressed by the stationery shop "Florentine" and the Hobby Shop, both on the top floor. Check out the old elevators at either end.

A must while in Sydney. Beautiful architecture; nice shops and wonderful small cafes to have a quick muffin and cappuccino, or a light salad for lunch.
The building is located in the middle of the CBD, on your way from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour

Shopping arcade designer . Not my sort of thing. Beautiful building great architecture. A lot of original features remain.
Plenty of coffee shops too

Sydneytrip. An interesting building with unusual clocks on the top floor. Lots of nice places to eat whether you want afternoon tea or lunch, with plenty of variety. A good mix of shops including both well known names and one-off shops.
A not to be missed place to visit when I'm Sydney.
Centre Point. Easily accessible by almost all sorts of travel modes where you will have most of the brands and access to giant retailers.

Amazing architecture and shopping. I really enjoyed my visit to this building, its Victorian style architecture gives it quite a nice atmosphere add to that the nice little cafes dotted around the structure and it rounds up to a pleasant visit.

Strolling through the QVB. The QVB is a shopping experience not to be missed when touring the City of Sydney on foot. It is a building of great charm and character with its quirky clock display. There are many up market boutiques including an excellent hobby shop, Cafes and public toilets are available. Lifts and escalators supplement the stairs

beautiful building with a lot of restaurants and stores. The Queen Victoria Building was completed in 1898 in the elaborate Romanesque architecture. The dominant feature is the lovely centre dome, consisting of an inner glass dome and an exterior copper. Glorious stained glass windows and splendid architecture endure throughout the building and an original 19th century staircase sits alongside the dome. There was a model of the building made out of matchsticks. You can catch the trains under the building (town hall station) as well as gain access to the other malls. Bathrooms are located on the bottom floor and the very top floor.

old artsy place that turned into a mall. QVB is pretty and has an old, quirky charm. We walked through it after an hour at the Sydney Tower Eye. It houses shops and boutiques and is a pathway to Townhall Station.

just go down............ to the basement. Victoria is waiting for you - in the most cheap and vulgar way. Take her for all that she has to offer you !!
The absolute best kitchen bargains are down there.

Beautiful historic building. The QVB is worth a visit, I live near by so have been here many times. The building is lovely, especially at Christmas when they have the beautiful Christmas tree in the middle of the building. There are quality stores and places to eat with many options. It is right in the heart of the CBD, so see it for sure when you are in Sydney.
Very beatiful old building. We visited this QVB during our trip to Darling Harbor. Amazing place, full of art, a lot of high quality shop.
a grand old building. what a change and how busy it has become - lots of shops and places to eat - access to the railway - a beautiful old building with loads of character

Not particularly as expected . We had visited the building expecting to find a historical site, and slightly unsure what else we would find we ventured inside. What the place actually is is a glorified shopping center, filled with the same overpriced chain shops that one can find in any town in Australia, New Zealand, or much of the western hemisphere for that matter.Some of the architecture is nice, but it's well hidden behind the modernisation leaving not a lot to see. In the square outside, zealots from the opposite maniac church of St Andrew's cathedral preach to, threaten, and intimidate passers by, making the area even more unpleasant to be around.

Beautiful - words of my daughter 'this is a bit flash'. Having visited QVB Sydney many times it wasn't until this visit with my twin girls, now older and more interested and curious - can we take that old lift - look at that clock!!! - wow look at roof and the floors - yes it is beautiful - I knew the building was but had never stopped to appreciate or view it through my children's appreciative perception Go and visit it for yourself - yes do some shopping but don't forget about the beautiful building The building was designed by George McRae and completed in 1898, replacing the original Sydney markets.
Beautiful decor. I always enjoy this magnificent building. The decor is superb & the shops are very elegant. There are some lovely coffee / food areas and also easy access to the underground trains
Just take a look.. The stores are quite expensive but take time to look around and at least stop by for a tea in a cafe to get the feel of the ambience. A lovely restored building.

Nostalgic atmosphere, cozy cafe, nice place to rest. Shopping is not my purpose of travel, but spending time to walk through north to south this good-old-days corridor was so fun. A big old clock at the centre of this building is worth to see. Every floor you will find cafes, and best place to watch local people. At the end of the south, there is a toy store, which creates an old good days atmosphere, and fascinates both every kids and adults.

A Must is you like achietecture. We walked into Queen Victoria Building looking for somewhere to have brunch on Saturday morning. The cafes on the edge of the entrance on ground floor were very busy so we decided to go up a floor and found this lovely Italian Cafe called Vanto. They provided us with fresh produce which was used to produce two tasty cooked breakfasts. The coffee was also excellent. The waitress was very friendly and willing to share information about the coffee and produce. Being a lot quieter this experience was relaxing and the service was prompt. I do not hesitate in recommending this cafe.
Brilliantly renovated. What a brilliant brilliant building that was highlighted by wonderful food. Not to be missed on a walking tour of Sydney. A must go to place if ever there was.

A step back in time. If you want to step back in time visit QVB. It's above Town Hall Station with plenty of shops. Not ideal for someone o. A budget as. The cafes are pricey. Short walk to Pitt Street Mall where a lot more cheaper shops are available.

So much HISTORY - look past the shops and explore this beautiful building. Take a ride down the old lift, to the floors below. Look past the shops and see this building for its beauty. Old world charm from the tiles to the glass dome above. See each floor and the elegance of the building. Have a coffee, window shop but enjoy mostly the heritage that is QVB.

Grand Old Dame. The Queen Victoria Building is definitely worth a visit. The architecture is awe-inspiring, attracting many photo enthusiasts. However, shopping-wise, the shops belong to the luxury category and may not suit the budget of the average shoppers. There are many eateries offering beautiful high tea sets, which are popular with tourists, but the prices are higher than average.

Beautiful building to do some shopping. This was a cool spot that wasn't originally on my list of places to visit in Sydney. After doing a quick search to catch anything I missed, I found the Queen Victoria Building. It's a beautiful building both inside and out, full of upscale shopping. I didn't stay long, but I'm glad I worked it into the my tour. Definitely worth a stop.
Wasn't that impressed. Apart from the Hobby Store, wasn't very impressed with the shops. The building it self is great though.
Beautiful but luxury shops. It's a nice place to visitBut don't expect to find something cheap even food.Bring a wide angle to make better pictures
Lots To Explore. The Queen Victoria Building had at least 5 levels of shops and diners. The building itself is just beautiful! We spent hours roaming around.

Definitely worth a visit in Sydney. This is an iconic building in Sydney, with 4 floors of designer and other shops throughout, a number of cafes and restaurants, and a couple of interesting clocks.The building is particularly beautiful at Christmas when the huge tree dominates the centre stage.

Amazing architecture. Visited the Queen Victoria Building on our first day. Lovely architecture and features. Keep an eye out for the clock which comes to life depicting various historical scenes. Lots of photo opportunities in this building.

BEAUTY. The queen Victoria Building is an amazing building where you get to shop have coffee and enjoy amazing architecture as well.
To my surprise one of the amazing places was the gallery of Dr Seuss.
amazing prints which were original.
its also a great place to visit just because its very close to Darling Harbour as well.
A step back in time. so lovely, especially to see the gigantic xmas tree through the centre at christmas. My tip is to head up the top for a coffee and visit the button shop, its a treat.
Nice old building. Great for shopping having morning tea,lunch,afternoon tea plenty of shops and the history of this place looks great

one of Sydney's must visit places. Great place to visit for locals and tourists, the beauty of the actual building that was built in 1898 mixed with a variety of quality stores for shoppers makes it worth visiting

Restored Victorian building well worth a visit. The Queen Victoria Building was constructed between 1893 and 1898. By the end of the 20th century it had fallen into disrepair and at one time there were plans to demolish it. However it was restored between 1984 and 1986 at a cost of $86m. It now houses mostly high end shops as well as restaurants and cafés. A feature of the building is its original tilework, and the modern replacement tiles are in keeping with the original style. A further $48m refurbishment took place between 2008 and 2009.Well worth a visit.
such a nice place for a different taste to sydney. experience the old side to sydney with glamour great restaurants shops and architecture. great place to spend your afternoon.
Fantastic Architecture . Certainly a step back into history! I love the building, the stores inside and the location within the CBD. QVB is an integral part of what makes Sydney CBD so special.

Eye opening. As you walk in, from any street or train level, you should stop for a moment, look all around, feel the atmosphere of the shops, the people, the activities the movement! Put your huge smile on, look people in the eye & just enjoy walking around up each level & down again! Life is way to short for elevators!
Another World.... This place is another world. It provides a cozy and classy atmosphere in the midst of the hurried activities around!

Absolutely Beautiful!!. My boyfriend & I vacationed, in Sydney, Australia, in May 2016. While walking around downtown Sydney, I noticed this building and had to go inside. So glad we did!! It is absolutely beautiful with great architecture, decor and ambiance. The highlight, of the building, is the gorgeous large clock, in the middle of the building. This is the grandest clock I have ever seen! The design of it is amazing and something you must see in person if you visit Sydney. There are also historical pieces placed throughout the building. There are upscale shops & also restaurants inside.

Nice place to spend a rainy afternoon. 5 levels of shopping in a historical grand building. You will find everything from international brands to Australian brands to specialty shops like a toy soldier store or an antique store or an antique print store. Cool cafes and places to eat on all levels.
Stunning. It is worth going just to see the stunning architecture of this beautiful building. Be warned the shops inside are all designer brands si unless you're into this not worth shopping there

Historical Pleasure. Surrounded by history and beauty one can shop, relax, indulge or just enjoy for free. I have always enjoyed just simply browsing, indulging in a girls high tea, desserts from the zumbo shop, chocolates from the different chocolate boutiques, the stained glass and architecture environment adds rich glamour of old and and unique.

Perfect place to see and a wonderful rain day stop.. We actually came in to see the famous clock at the hour doing it's show. For the new children it may seem no big deal but in its day the clock was and still is fantastic. The Christmas decorations gave the QVB that special holiday feel. There are so many fine places offering treats, snacks and full meals. Make your selection and enjoy the fine nourishment, the wonderful indoor climate and the people watching on multi-floors.
Shops!!!. A beautifully restored building in the heart of Sydney filled with expensive shops. Window shopping is fun

Beautiful building. Had read about this in the lonely planet Sydney book, and it didn't disappoint.Such a quaint building with loads of shops and eateries. We stopped and had a lovely afternoon tea in the 'Palace'. Definitely worth a visit if in Sydney even if to just see the lovely clock!
Beautiful, a walk in history.. A lovely cafe, beautiful shops a a chocolate store to die for. Just stroll and savour the colors, styles, designs and the culture displyed in every detail.
I love this place. Window shopping or buying there is something for everyone here wonderful old world charm and modern shops mixed together.

Great place to visit to shop or just have a coffee.. A friend and I were visiting Sydney over Christmas and found the Victoria Building great with its beautiful decorations. Loved the shops and got a bargain in the sales! Lots of places to have a coffee or a more substantial meal.
Visit to QVB a must. Grand Old Building full of atmosphere & great shoppingA visit & purchase from Haigs Chocolates a must

A truly beautiful building . The QVB is a very beautiful building. The stone work is amazing. The stained glass windows are beautiful. Take the time to have a really good explore. Go up to the top floors. Don't just use the building as a passage way to the train station. The shops are high end but worth visiting even if just for a look. There is a great Hobyco shop. Art dealer, clothes and jewellery. Check out the two amazing clocks. Well worth a visit.
Nice Building. Nice to go for sight seeing or shopping if you got enough Money. Nice cafes inside, always worth a visit.
Full of History. To check out about all of the History of this beautiful building go to the Concierge & book a walking tour with a guide to explain all the nooks & grannies & its wonderful history

Old world opulence. This has to be one of the most beautiful shopping galleries in the world - equal to the one in Milan. The design is late Victorian, the decor delightful with old massive clocks, stained glass windows worthy of a cathedral , delicate lace iron-work and beautiful Italianate tiles. The shops are high quality and really an after-thought - wander around slowly when you visit, and have a snack and drink. If you go in just to shop you miss out.

A stunning landmark. One of the few buildings to survive the 1900s in Sydney. This building is an architectural gem that must be seen. At Christmas time, there is a Christmas tree that rises from the ground floor through to the ceiling. Probably the best tree in Sydney. There's heaps of shops including our favourite Hobbyco (well our kids love it anyway). There's plenty of places to eat and you could easily spend a few hours browsing all the floors. Tip: Town Hall station is underneath the QVB and you can walk underground from there all the way through to Pitt St Mall.
Ohhhh, WOW!. This is definately the highlight of any trip to Sydney. A must-see for beautiful designer shops and the architecture is just beautiful!

Enjoy shopping and dining in a beautiful building. The beautiful heritage building houses a large number of shops and restaurants. Transport is convenient with location at the centre of the business district. Simply window shopping and taking photos of the decorations are enjoyable. There is also free wifi connection for guests visiting the shopping mall.

Magnificent shopping centre with historical touch. Expensive designer shopping but you can also just go for the experience of a magnificent old building, soft carpet underfoot (beats all those hard floors in modern centres), quieter and more peaceful shopping, have a coffee and admire the architecture.

Queen Victoria Rocks. An unabashed monument to the late 19th C heyday of British cultural, mercantile and colonial imperialism. Now a temple to refined and genteel consumption, it really has to be seen to be believed.

Always good for a visit . The QVB is our favorite spot to visit when we have been in Sydney. Over the past 30 years we have seen the QVB change. The outlets offer a range of services for every price range. Easy access through Town Hall station and close to the Pitt Street Mall. Worth a visit anytime.

A good time spent !!. We were just crossing by and saw this place which looked really historic just like most of Sydney. The place gives the feel of something antique from inside and outside. Worth a visit.

shopping hell - too many people going in every directions. there is just too many people visiting, most sightseeing, that it is difficult to move around and any joy you might have found is taken away by the crowds.

Some old and something new. Loved to come here and look at all the shops. There used to be loads of antique shops but now only one left. The building is magnificent and with characters. Food here can be a bit expensive if you want a quick bite but its a nice experience to be sitting here enjoy a cuppa with friends.
Beautiful Building. This building is amazing. We enjoyed walking through, checking out the clocks and beautiful window, and browsing the neat stores. We liked the toy store and the Dr. Seuss store.

Lovely Building - Expensive Shops. Went to the QVB during our Sydney trip - beautifully restored and pretty well kept. Shopping was very expensive and some assistants in boutiques obviously thought they were above the customers!
Beautiful architecture and many shops to browse. This is a beautiful old building with many shops inside, and it is easily accessible from Town Hall Station.
Old school beauty. Just love the history of this building. Has great shops and had a great haircut. (Wish I could go monthly.).
Lovely. Such a stunning building! Fun to have a stroll through. Shops are varied, some a bit more old-fashioned, others more hip. Something for everyone.
Multi level mall. QVB mall is old fashioned place carpeted throughout building,but modern clothing shops and cafes to visit,central location.

Great Shopping. I just love going to this Building. The QV Basement is great if you want kitchen equipment and they also have some lovely glassware and cups and saucers. Very good quality and very reasonable prices. A great place to shop if you are looking for a Wedding gift. There are a range of speciality shops as well. There is also a Haigh's Chocolate shop which has very nice hand made chocolates.
A teastimony what Sydney could look like. The QVB and Town Hall next door are a testimony to what Sydney looked liked before globalized glass and steel towers took up the skyline

OIne of Sydney's gems. This mall has been in place for many years and is a favourite spot for visitors with many restaurants and coffee places, high end shops and a clock from which figures appear as it strikes the hour. for me I go there each time I am in Sydney.

Architectural history!. A historical site with many updates and great shopping. I love how the Aussies make use of the underground spaces. Everyone we met was friendly and accommodating. Stay a while and watch the clocks chime, hard to believe their age.

Mesmerising . Loved the ambience!
Enjoyed a great eve and would definitely go in one more time during our visit here.
Also enjoyed great coffee and desert at Jet

A Highlight!. Great range and diverse shopping location. Lots of floors full of all sorts of goodies - food and beverage included. Wonderful tourist venue too. Check out the antique print and map shop - hidden treasure! Recommended.

Remarkable building. Magnificent building , inside shops . I'm not sure it's worth the visit.
It is situated in a key location in central business district .

Gorgeous place, lots of good shopping. QVB is definitely worth visiting. Not only is it beautifully restored, but lots of shops and lots of cafes. Plus it connects underground to the other side of the busy George Street, where there are more shops. Worth exploring and the visit.

She still got it!. I used to live in Sydney and forgot how beautiful this building is. You travel the world and experience bold buildings but this grand lady's still got it. Beautiful on every level and inside and out, every traveller must experience it.

Simply Stunning !. This building and the shop units inside transport you back to a bygone age.
We visited previously near to Christmas and the place was magical.
Whilst in the city make a detour here.

Still the most gorgeous building ever!!!. Spent Saturday shopping around and the QVB is still the most gorgeous building ever!!! Didn't get a chance to wander in the basement on Sat but managed to shop around in the basement. Very nice!!

beautiful decor. great place to look about, not so good with shopping, but sit and watch with a cup of coffee, the internal clock is great at midday, to watch. the specialist shops are very expensive but the atmosphere is good, been several times, never changes.
spectacular building. Very old but spectacular historical building, like going back to the old centuries. Got some nice cafes and lots of good shops :)

Excellent place for lunch. Lovely architecture, several good restaurants. The shopping is fairly high end--I recommend the Dr. Seuss shop for viewing if not purchasing. There are a number of restaurants, which can suit a variety of diets and price ranges. Clean, well equipped rest rooms as well.
Photo pretty. Great photo spot and good for a meander and maybe a big spend up. Beautiful Victorian era architecture well worth a look.
Lots to see. Lots of different shops. something for everyone. Highly recommend High tea on level 3, excellent service and food

How on earth is this top 20 on TA. Typical Sydney tourist rubbish. There is no way this is a top 20 on TA, even for tired over-priced Sydney this falls well short of being an event.QVB is an over-priced shopping centre located in an old building done up like mutton to look like lamb. If you are a tourist don't waste your time - you'll be very disappointed at the usual array of Sydney tourist shops - opals, ugg boots and didgeridoos at exhorbitant prices.Nothing worth seeing here folks, just move along

Grand old lady. I walk regularly through this historic building. High street shops abound above the ground level and there are a variety of restaurants and cafes throughout.The feature though is the ceiling and the clock suspended from it. The outside has many tourists photographing this grand old lady

QVB is a grand old lady. The QVB is my go to place for breakfast. You seem far away from the 'madding crowd'. It's beautifully restored, from its fascinating suspended time pieces to its Victorian architecture and decor. There are a bounty of eateries on all levels and you can get a great high tea upstairs. There's a range of higher end retail shops if that's your thing. Basically it is a must visit Sydney icon.

Beautifully Restored Building. The Queen Victoria Building was built in the late 1890s, as a market place. It has been beautifully restored to a magnificent building we see today. It is a pleasure to stroll and examine the high end shopping in the QVB, or to just take a seat and relax and enjoy tea or coffee and sweets in one of the many lovely cafes that now fill the building. The location of the QVB in the center of Sydney, near the Town Hall makes it an excellent place to take in and take a break.

Shopping. So much to see and do 3 floors of shopping great for lunch or afternoon tea, centrally located and easy to get around, it was Friday afternoon when we got there and rather busy so plan your visit maybe early morning is better

A grand lady!. A beautifully transformed building, this is like a mini step back in time as one strolls through and admires the shops or sip a coffee and quietly watch people move around. Queen Victoria watches over all outside.

Took lots of pictures!. Magnificent building well worth the visit. The architecture was magnificent. Didn't concentrate much on the shops because I was too busy taking photos! But there's an amazing array of them and I'd love to go there another time just to shop.
Awesome buillding. Very impressive building, must see when in Sydney. Take some time to enjoy the vibe inside the building and soak in the history.

Great shopping and great food. A great range of shops from the ordinary to the sublime. It's worth a visit just to see the beautifully restored building.
Don't forget to get a treat from Adriano Zumbo Patissiere. Divine!
Beautiful heritage buidling. A must see in Sydney. Gorgeous old building that takes one back in time. Lovely for morning or high tea. Great example of tessellated tiling from that era.

SOMETHING OLD SOMETHING NEW. Well worth visiting as this heritage building received a makeover a few years ago.Take the lift or climb the wonderful old staircase.See the amazing clock that chimes every 15 minutes.You are right next to the Sydney Town Hall & rail station.Do you like to shop well walk right in & go for it.High class clothing & jewellery stores as well as lovely cafes to sit & rest your shopping legs. A must for the visitor to Sydney with dollars to spend.

Nice place for a walk. Filled with moderate to upscale stores, it's not the type of shopping mall that my wife would shop in. However, it did provide a nice area to just walk around and people watch. Closer to the train station is where you will find many places to grab breakfast/coffee/lunch. We also liked the toy store, HobbyCo, which has a lot of things hobbyists may be interested in, such as model trains, airplanes, etc. In general, it's also in a very convenient area for connection to public transit or simply walking to various attractions in the downtown area.
Historic architecture building. Good shop, good food but pricey. we only like the building and art.There's a cake shop/patisserie that sell maccaron name Adriano Zumbo.

Elegant architecture . Completed in 1898; this lovely iconic elegant building is a favourite of mine. The architecture is stunning; soaring domes, lead light windows, wrought iron lacework, original timber handrails and mosaic tiles. There are also two very beautiful clock prices suspended under the dome. There have been some changes since I last visited, there are glass and steel handrails, some modern stairs and escalators including one that is suspended from the third to second levels that might be a challenge for those suffering vertigo. A great place for shopping where you can have a meal, put together a complete outfit from head to toe with underwear, shoes and jewellery. There are lots of gift ideas too and for those with a sweet tooth, Haigh's Chocolates.

QVB. We love the architecture in Queen Victoria Building. It is a good to visit place especially for tourist to appreciate the English style architecture. Good for photo taking. Shopping wise, you will be able to see more toward expensive brands like UGG, Fossil.
beautiful historic building and shops. lovely walk through the QVB for any visitors to Sydney. The shops are often a bit pricey, but experiencing the historical building inside and out is very fun.
Shopping, eating and viewing. Has it all, good shops, good food over many levels, and all in an authentic early Sydney sandstone building lovingly restored.

Iconic Shopping in Sydney. I never tire of this excellent shopping venue. Beautiful surroundings, good mix of middle budget to expensive shops and when you are done shopping, heading for a good cup of tea and scones on level 2 at Celline's Bar and Restaurant.
Queen Victoria - Shopping . This is a must see venue firstly for the architecture and secondly for the shopping experience. I would recommend this venue to all international tourists.

Charming.. A lovely historic building to visit, whether window shopping or serious shopping - handy item shops to the more boutique type stores. Nice place to sit for a meal or coffee and watch the world go by. Conveniently attached to Town Hall Train Station and Woolworths.

Have a tour in a 19th Century building while shopping!. The building itself is a tourist site. The architecture and details of the ceiling, walls, windows and banisters are a sight to see.Take the steps all the way to the top floor and you will have a beautiful view. Notice as well how the escalators are protruding out --- assume they wanted to keep original design while the accommodated technology.So when in Sydney, it seems like you are going through a tour while shopping!
Shopping spot. This place is just next to Town Hall Station and I strongly recommend for shopaholic. Underground passage is links between shopping area and also very useful in rainy day.
Cracking Building. I sat and enjoyed an exceptional espresso watching the crowds go by, whilst my lovely lady shopped till she dropped.Win win I say!

Amazing building, not to be missed in Sydney!. I could not imagine a trip to Sydney without a stroll through the beautiful Queen Victoria Building. It is truly breath taking, consuming an entire city block in the heart of downtown Sydney. It's such a jewel and to think that at one point it needed active conservation as it was considered for demolition. The shops inside are of a mixed nature. You can find just about anything inside and are really interesting to just look through. I love the details in the gilding and paint. There are stained glass windows that of course add to the charm and appeal of this amazing building.

Sydney's top shopping spot. The Queen Victoria Building (QVB) dates from the late 19th century. Neglected for years, it fell into decay, until it was rescued by a transformative renovation project. The QVB is now Sydney's top up-market shopping venue, taking up a whole city block. The QVB looks in good shape, take a look -- looking costs nothing!

Expensive Elegance. Multi-storey mall in block-long fully-restored historic building with fine entrance lobbies and a central dome. Few bargains, but a lively environment. Located in central Sydney. Escalators and stairs run between the basement, ground and upper levels.

Shops, restaurants and beautiful building . Beautiful building with lots of stained glass. Fun to walk through to observe the architecture and shop interesting businesses. Fast food on the lowest level. Some sit down restaurants in the building. I ate at Yuma Japanese restaurant on level 2 that was very good. Worth stopping just to view the inside and outside of the building.

Beautiful building. A must if you either like shopping (or strolling around for window shopping ) or architecture (ideally a bit of both).Such a beautiful building with some luxury specialty stores on level 1 & 2.I specially recommend the toy store (only white toys or something like that). They had most amazing toys and in a variety that I have never seen anywhere else in Australia.I would have liked a chocolate shop that offered hot drinking chocolate.
Shopping and High Tea. Enjoyed a few hours of shopping and an exquisite high tea in this gorgeous building. A few blocks walk from the harbor - or take taxi or bus.

In need a ne refurbishment last refurbishment 1986. Good for a single visit once same shops as a normal shopping centre a part from top level with a few very expensive antiques & jewelry shops. Saw mainly lots of Asian tourist in the QVB I suppose that the very expensive branded stores are catering for the market. Lovely fancy old clock upstairs .

Gorgeous . This is a gorgeous building inside and out. I love the inside archetecture. It is a very busy place with lots of designer shops. There are a few aces to get dessert, there is a fresh juice place e, a doughnut place, and many more places too!

A must see when in Sydney.. You cannot miss this heritage building in the Town Hall area. Take a photo with the stern faced Queen Victoria ( her Statue) prior to entering this edifice. A shoppers paradise, starting from designer wear to luxurious chocolates, a delightful kiosk selling nuts and the unbeatable Adriano Zumbo counter. One can enter through the station entrance too, which connects via a corridor of shops and food courts. If it happens to be a rainy winters day as I experienced this July. Well, here is the place to do your Sydney shopping.

Love this place !!. Great place to visit especially if its an overcast or rainy day.... Fabulous shops, definitely up market ranging from the top fashion labels, to hand made toys, delicious eateries and if you are visiting at Christmas a wonderfully HUGE decorated tree in place. Underground close by, China Town and the Rocks a walk away. Well worth spending time there.

Great Historical Shopping Center. The Building is more than 100 years old. It is so well kept and the building has lots of history and the lifts are old but still working well. Very nice and the shops are interesting and many cafe as well to marvel at the spectacular architecture of this old Building.
Like you are in London, including the sound of the Big Ben. Beautiful old building with really nice shops. With Christmas time the Swarovski Christmas Tree is amazing

Great for a stroll. While you may not end up buying anything (pricey), the QVB is an iconic part of the Sydney CBD. Since it doesn't cost anything to pop in and look around, it is definitely worth your time if you are already in the area. Some nice cafes to sit and enjoy the atmosphere. The clock show (every hour) is a favourite for the kids. An interesting piece of Sydney history.

Beautiful place to visit. So this is a very nice building with nice crafting and old mosaic, impressed with the hanging clock. Really awed by the decorations and paintings. This is a must visit place but if you like shopping too, this is a place for luxury brand shopping.
Visiting the Queen Victoria Building. My experience visiting the Queen V Building was an experience I will not forget...The shops, the food and the people were very distinguished and considerate.
Great shopping, very high end though . The building itself is amazing very Victorian style English. All of the stores are very expensive brand name stores such as Tommy Hilfiger & Chanel etc !
Beautiful building. Wonderful architecture, lovely place to have a coffee and shop. Shopping is designer-brand prices so not for a budget shopping experience. Tea Rooms are lovely.
