Great shopping. . Beautifully restored, class shopping and eating. Love this place. Art, food, clothes and Nic-nacs in the heart of Sydney with a major Transport hub underneath you can get here going to or from anywhere else.The building alone is worth a visit.

Beautiful building.. A stunningly beautiful building, the QVB, as it is known, was built in the late 19th century in honour of Queen Victoria, who sits on a huge horse just outside the Town Hall side of the building. It was completed in 1898. It has seen many changes and transformations over time, and its Romanesque architectural beauty has fascinated all visitors since the beginning. It now houses numerous fashion shops, as well as restaurants and cafes, and all kinds of other establishments, such as pawn shops, jewellery shops and tourist shops. It's a place to pass your time window shopping, or doing some serious shopping or enjoying a cup of coffee or whatever.
Disappointing compared to European similar places. Don't expect to see a place similar to the Duomo in Milan. Unless you want to buy some brands, don't go.
Amazing building. As the name of the building says, the victorian style is one of the main characteristics, and the clock in the middle is wonderful.
Beautifully restored. Each time I visit Sydney I have breakfast at least once at one of the excellent cafes in this beatiful building. Being surrounded by upmarket shops adds to the atmosphere.
A meeting place. Just love meeting friends for coffee or lunch at QVB then wandering around the different levels window shopping or even buying from the variety of dress shops.

Waiting for O'Clock. Just walking thru the building and getting to the centre dome, it's hard to put words to it.YOU must wait for the on the hour attraction from the clocks to see the movements and sounds

Landmark in anyones view. The QVB is a shopping mecca serving all thicknesses of wallet. Window shoppers delight in the designer apparel and recognisable brands set amongst the emporium style interior. The centre clock is a marvel and if you stop and watch for a little while the ship circling the ceiling hung clock tower is but a small dimension to the grander design. The leadlight windows, bold colours and old world charm make this a must visit locatioo
Queen Victoria Building. A lovely place to walk around, enjoy night tea or visit the many cafes, some lovely shops to explore.. Visiting Sydney is complete without visiting QVB.
interesting Building. This is a very interesting building to visit, lot's to see and do for all ages. A good place to go if it is raining as you can spend some time there.

Cosmopolitan. I worked in a shop in this building before it was renovated. What was hidden away and revealed with the renovation is wonderful.My favorite music store is in here too, so is 1st stop when I visit Sydney.
Hop off the train at Town Hall. Beautiful, historic building of old Sydney. Shops are well presented with plenty of eateries, old world style and a must see when in Sydney.

Grandure - old meets new. This historic building (Used to be cattle sale yards!) has been converted into an upmarket shopping precinct that is a 'must do' while in Sydney. The range of shops provide mostly higher end goods, but good pricing is also available. Food outlets are plentiful and food is of good quality. Especially if you have children plan your visit to include the passing of an hour i.e. 10:00 am or 11:00 am etc and get close to the hanging clock on the top floor. On the hour, it's 'chimes' are quite entertaining.
Just the best to watch the clock. You need to be there to listen to the clock tower turning around ,and look at all the shops in the building some of them are amazing
Old Time beauty. The amazing old architecture is fantastic and beautifully maintained which I feel is a tribute to those who designed and built this building.
Wander for hours. If you look past all the shops, this is an amazing building. I can spend hours walking around it and always find new things to admire
Loved the Ambience of the Old Building. Take a walk through the different levels of this building and discover a great Sydney gem. Take your time, take a look… you won't be disappointed.
Beautiful Old World Mall. Beautiful Old World Mall well worth a visit. There are lots of interesting unique shops. Many antique jewelry shops. A good place to find Opals at good prices.
Hustle and bustle in QVB. Beautiful building, but appreciating it is hampered by the constant flow and crowds. Otherwise, lovely to wonder through to see the details.
Excellent shopping precent with extraordinary architecture.. Many floors of brand name shops which is always busy. Great relaxing place right in central business district of Sydney.

Grand old lady . The Queen Victoria Building or QVB as it is most commonly called us a beautiful shopping precinct filled with great cafes very good shopping over a few levels. Much of it focuses around a central atrium so there are views from the higher levrls. Quaint tea rooms and a lovely function srea. Abd the lower levels comnect you to lots of other shoping areas like Myer and David Jones plus the trains. It's like an underground city that you might find in Toronto in Canada. A tourist attraction in its iwtn right.Browse shop or simply gawk at the gorgeous ceiling. Highly recommend a visit.

Cool vibe . We love browsing through the lovely shops here and sampling lots of delicacies. It has an old world charm. We often catch the train into the city and walk through here after getting on and off at Central. When hubby worked in the city he brought home lots of surprises. Well done QVB!
Gorgeous building with wonderful shops.. This is a must see as the clocks, stain glass and shops are amazing. Recommend this to anyone in Sydney as you will get to see some classic architecture.
Great historical building . This is a must visit if in Sydney's CBD, stunning architecture, stunning stained glass windows and a great selection of shopping at the same time.
Alot to see and do. There alot of shops for everyones needs.Great place for a coffee, lunch and more.I would deff recommend Qvb for everyone

Stunning. Old world charm with a modern edge. Shops and eateries are within the complext with a number of high end market shops. S Central and within the shopping district of Sydney. A must see and do!

Another world. How could I have forgotten how beautiful this place is. The tea houses, old-fashioned shops, quality good - wow, the bag shop is incredible. doesn't matter there are no bargains, so good to just look or splash our in an atmospheric tea shops - plenty to choose from and cakes are just to die for.

Don't miss it. If I'm not mistaken, it's on the corner of George and Market Street. A CBD attraction. The building itself is too beautiful, unique, its boutiques a little pricey, but how about having some coffee and skylight gazing?

Electric souk. Whether you like shopping or not, wandering through the Queen Victoria Building is entertaining. It is jam full of shops-generally very high end/pricy merchandise. When we were there (July) there were seasonal sales throughout, but the pricing was still well above modest. There are several cafes within the building that offer table seating on the sales floors so you can order a lunch or tea, enjoy the bustle of the shoppers, and admire the stunning architecture and art of the building which has been tastefully restored. In many places with examples of the original tiles retained for you to see.
Luxury shopping . The Building is certainly worthwhile a visit. The shops inside are all adressing those tourists who are willing to pay the standard retail price. I wouldnt go back there.
Nice. This beautiful building is the place to be if you want to shop. It houses lots of quality stores. You can also buy food and drinks.
shopping!. a great place to be during sale! that's twice a year. fabulous bargains. spoilt for choice. easy to get to. check it out.
Beautiful Old Architecture. A definite piece of architectural history in the CBD. Lots of interesting shops & cafes to explore. Transport is easy via trains, buses etc.

A Stunning Building. If I am in the city and I have time I always try to walk though do some shopping or have a coffee or snack. I always visit every December as the tree is amazing. If you are into Christmas trees it is a must visit location.

Beautiful shopping plaza with such variety. I loved shopping in this building. It was clean, spacious, bright and had a nice variety of shops. I loved going into the Dr Seuss gallery, the first of its kind, the Kitten D'Amour boutique where i got some incredibly unique and beautiful outfits, and eating at a gorgeous cafe.It was truly a lovely shopping experience.
The architecture is breath taking. I love the architecture and how the shops and cafes are done up. The centre piece is the antique clock hanging so majestically

Certainly a beautiful building to visit in Sydney. There is more to this building than you realise. Not only is it good to look at but it is also a place to spend time in the shopping areas and having a coffee. If your schedule allows, stop for a moment or ten!

Beautiful peice of architecture. WOW, JUST WOW
We stayed at the Hilton across the road. The building is stunning, as are the shops. Sitting and enjoying a coffee and breakfast what a way to start the morning. A must not to be missed.

Nice building. Amazing building. Many patrons at the various tea and dessert shops. The Hobby shop at the top floor should keep any kid occupied for at least an hour, and good luck in walking out of there without buying anything.

Grand Old Lady. This building is just beautiful to stroll through. There are some lovely shops selling custom-made clothing, and several very elegant tea-rooms serving beautiful high teas - but the lower floors are being taken over by some more "run of the mill" shops which is a little disappointing, as a special venue like this needs special tenants for it to remain as a "different and special" place to visit.
Incredible building for a shopping mall!. What an incredibly beautiful building! All the stained glass and architecture, and design. The shopping is fun, and in a building like that, it is fabulous!

Boutique Happiness. Stunning building showing the diverse history of Sydney back when it started to grow. This building has a large varirty of boutique shops and restaurants and cafés also a hobbyco. Also the Town Hall train station is underground

Beautiful Old building. I loved the Queen Vic Building it has some great shops and beautiful views. it also has a trail station underneath which is convenient also and an olden day elevator Incredible!

QVB: Absolutely the Best Building in the Sydney CBD. Sydney is full of horrible glass and metal buildings. The QVB is however a jewel. Built in the late 19th century it is a sandstone masterpiece. It now houses Sydney's most up-market shops and is a joy to stroll through. Be sure to visit on the hour, every hour (is 9AM, 10AM etc etc through the day and into the night) because each hour the main clock (go up to the top floor) puts on its display of "6 famous scenes of English History". There are great cafes, and a lovely "Tea Room" if you like drinking tea and having cakes and scones, English Style. Also take a look at the historic photos that are on display in the stair wells. This building was derelict for many years and was slated for demolition in the 1970s. It was only through a group of activists that the building was saved and totally renovated in the 1980s. Stand back opposite the Sydney Town Hall and you get a great view of the outside architecture. Truly a gem.

Posh Shopping Center in Sydney. Victorian style building that holds high end boutiques. Hallways are carpeted. Lift also looks like it was from Victorian age. This shopping center carries exclusive items that cannot be found in others. The interiors are picturesque.

Grand Old Dame. Wonderful that this iconic building is maintained and preserved so well as it's beautiful and majestic. Love the many shops and especially love the Art of Dr Seuss' Gallery on Level 2.
Enjoyable stop while in Sydney. We wandered through before going to Darling Harbour. There are retail shops and cafes. It is a lovely building, so it is worthwhile stopping in if you are in the area.

Expensive Shopping but great visual experience. The QVB is in the hub of the downtown shopping area of Sydney. The reason to stop in is not only for its high end shopping but for its long history and architectural beauty.

Something for everyone. QVB, as it is popularly known, has lots of different shops. You can buy lunch or just a coffee, pick up a designer handbag, or buy saucepans - something for everyone. And the architecture is fabulous and faithfully restored in Victorian paint colours - so look up but don't pass by.

High End and Bargain Shopping and Cafes All In The Same Building. The Queen Victoria Building (QVB) is a Historical Building in the middle of Sydney's Central Business District (CBD) and is a hub of activity as I shall explain in this review.If you like cafes, there are many of those, both indoors and outdoors.For shopping, you will find bargains in Victoria's Basement downstairs from the lower level.On other levels you will find health foods, pharmacies, high end fashion boutiques, jewelry, novelty items and of course, more cafes.I mentioned before that the Queen Victoria Building is a HUB of Activity. Let me now explain why.You can exit Town Hall underground station at the QVB end and in a few steps you at the lower ground level of the QVB.There are throngs of hurried people heading towards the station after finishing work and it can be quite an art to navigate through if you are heading in the opposite direction, which I usually am. You see, I come from home into the city to attend meetings held after office hours,This is a great time if you want to grab a packed meal at half price because shopkeepers are clearing unsold stock before closing their shops.As you exit the station there are two ways you can go, as well as upwards to street level. You can keep going straight ahead, in this case you are in the QVB.If you branch off to the right, you end up in Victoria Galleries, which could become the topic for another review.However, when you are in QVB, there is shopping and cafes on three levels. The lower level leads through to Myers and a large food court. The street level leads to York Street on one side, from which a number of Bus Routes can be accessed, and to George Street on the other side, which will soon access the Light Rail.The very top floor of QVB consists of professional suites plus banquet rooms and function halls that can be hired for occasions.The Queen Victoria Building is a popular place with overseas visitors because it combines the charm of the era with up to date shopping facilities.

Great space to stop, shop and eat. This space is incredible. It was originally designed as a marketplace and it still holds a contemporary feel to what it was originally intended. It's a great place to have lunch and browse the shops.

Maybe not for the claustrophobic - or hungry. The QVB is striking, don't get me wrong. Architecturally, historically, curiously... but it is not an experience that is guaranteed to lift the spirits. It is often very crowded, the narrow galleries weren't designed for this many voyeurs :-) and even though I have been here many times, I have yet to be able to capture a coffee without a crazy long wait - let alone try to sit down and drink it. Don't get me wrong, it is an experience, from without and within...but don't plan on a leisurely visit.

Magnificent. To think that this now magnificently restored building was once a "boarded-up structure" is almost unbelievable. But today, its wonder is apparent to all. Situated in the centre of Sydney's CBD, there is no excuse to miss out on seeing and experiencing its magnificence.

The most beautiful building in Sydney. This is an outstanding and beautiful building and we really enjoyed walking round it and browsing the interesting and lovely shops etc. We were lucky to be there when the Christmas decorations were up and they were absolutely gorgeous, especially the huge Christmas tree.

Historical buildings near town Hall St. We stayed in Swissotel Sydney CBD which only 20-30 m fr QVB, nice historical building with luxury items. Many good coffee shop inside, just pick any, with long queue..One day we stop at town hall st, and to our surprise that they are connected through QVB exit at the LG, lucky for us as it was rainy so we dont have to walk that far under the rain to get back to our hotel
Lots of pretty things.. Loved how close it was to my CBD hotel (the Grace). Was filled with floors and floors of shops. Tons of cool stained glass and yummy treats await you.

Very nice building. Expensive stores. Haha.. We had our afternoon coffee at the Metropole which was very nice. Coffee was good. Stores were ... standard, if you're planning on shopping then this would be a good place for you.

Shopping with a touch of history. I was a bit surprised to know that this building is a shopping mall. It was very scenic walking inside and it was also pretty historical for a shopping mall. It was really a unique experience to shop and stroll while sight seeing!

Beautiful building with fantastic shopping. I ran into the Queen Victoria Building somewhat by accident. I was absolutely captivated walking through this building as it's absolutely beautiful. I had already exhausted myself shopping further up the road, but it was such a striking place that I spent another good hour or so walking around and taking it all in. A LOT of great stores... I'm looking forward to checking them out more thoroughly on my next visit.
Cool place. It's an upscale shopping mall, but in a really beautiful building, with some interesting old clocks as well. Fun to shop and fun tomsit in the middle and have coffee.

A gem of a building. Fixing up the QVB into a retail building is one of the best things that has been done in that part of the city. The stores are quite pricey, but the interior is worth the visit with its stained galss windows and Victorian bathrooms. At Christmas, a huge tree covered with Swarkovski crystals dominates the centre of the building . Make sure you watch the western clock which has a movable show about Henry the 8th and Queen Elizabeth I on the hour. There are many places to grab a bite to eat, although they are a bit expensive for cafe style meals.
Beautiful. Stroll the shops & take in the beautiful architecture in this magnificent building .Grab some lunch, drinks or a coffee at the Vienna.
Nice shopping center…. honestly before visiting here was imagening something else..it is a cute shopping mall, with some cafes in central location

Outstanding mix of old world charm and modern shopping. We really enjoyed the times that we spent in this centre. Really well restored and an awesome range of shopping, with some more boutique type coffee shops offering good quality coffee.

Convenient shopping great location . A good tourist shopping site. Access via town hall station exit is excellent. It gets more expensive the higher up you get. Most restaurants are on the upper levels

BEAUTIFUL REFURBISHED VICTORIAN STYLED BUILDING. If you live in Sydney you're either walking through or underneath the QVB to get from point A to B... and its ESPECIALLY helpful when raining.Even if you're not into high end shopping, or like me have no funds to do so, it's so worth it to just saunter in here and absorb the atmosphere of the building. Tall ceilings with vaults and classic architecture with ornate staircases and glass windows will blow you away. Make sure you have a cheeky look at how the escalators were installed retrospectively to the building! They are suspended off the giant trusses above. Interesting!For tourists this place is a must! Browse through the boutique (and fairly expensive) fashion and jewelry stores or grab a pastry at any number of cafes on each level. QVB also hosts a really neat spot to take your kids... a hobby shop that boasts planes, trains and automobiles, and anything that involves your hands and brain.
What an amazing building. So love to visit the QVB ever time I visit Sydney. There is always a big variety of shops to visit, eateries and delightful window displays to enjoy.

Sydney Shopping Glory. Feel like you need to be well dressed to visit the upper floors of this historic shopping centre, but you don't really have to worry. The Hobbyco shop on the top floor southern end, is well stocked and proves to be a hit with families on school holidays. Every floor has restaurants and cafes which fill to the brim at lunchtime. The upper floor shops have expensive merchandise and are really worth a browse. In the lowest floor there is a Victoria's Basement shop for crockery and cutlery. There are lots of ladies and men's clothing stores and other shops selling art, posters, model soldiers, jewellery, cuddly toys, bread, nuts, take away food. Something for everyone here. The QVB is a hop step and jump from Town Hall Railway Station, so it is really easy to find on Sydney's main street called George Street. And it is a great place to visit on a wet day, as you can get to it in an underground walkway form the railway station.

Lovely building. This is a lovely building with a lot of shops in it this is just across the bridge from darling harbour just near the sky tower. There is a great variety of shops from budget to expensive boutique
Love love love!. Boutique shopping, of course, but really look and enjoy the architecture of the grand old building - just beautiful.
Fascinating slice of history. This is a great piece of architecture and houses some interesting shops. Well worth a visit when visiting Sydney

Model is the Burlington, Piccadilly, London. This building has been shops, then City Government offices and, now, an upmarket shopping experience.Don't miss the "History of England" chiming clock at noon with its diorama scenes.Excellent shops, including a Metropolitan Museum branch, along with the usual clothing offerings. There is an especially attractive business selling old maps and prints, either framed or in a roll.A couple of souvenir shops offer better quality Australian produced goods. There is a limited foodhall in the basement. As it is in the centre of town, hard to not visit it.
Impressive building. An impressive building with own style and atmosphere, plenty of stores and cafes, but a little overcrowded.
beautiful. Beautiful building, even though very busy. Nota shopper to speak of but still enjoyed visiting here.

Always an interesting place to visit. The QVB is so easily accessible that it is a great place to visit - the subway arrives underneath at Town Hall and from here there is easy underground walking access to other shopping complexes within the city.

fascinating retro building in the earth of Sydney. one of my favourite sites to go shopping, the QVB offers a great variety of shops and nice places to grab a coffee.'
At the very bottom of the building, you can find a store which sells stuff for the house at very convenient prices.
a must do in Sydney
Great shopping. Excellent shopping destination, with train taking you right there. Lots of quirky small shops and cafes in a gorgeous building.
Shop till you drop. Lovely shopping centre in a great building! Great shops , great choice but do not forget to bring your wallet.

Lovingly restored. A beautiful old building restored to it's original beauty. Today it houses three floors of shops and cafes. Located on George Street one of the main streets in Sydney and close to the Westfield Shopping Centre & Sydney Tower. Even if you're not interested in shopping it's definitely worth a visit to see the architecture, stained glass windows, iron spiral staircase, painted ceilings etc.

Beautifully restored heritage building full of amazing shops and cafes/restaurants. The building itself is worthy of a visit just to gaze at the beautifully restored architecture. Inside there are a vast array of shops to suit all ages and interests with restaurants and cafes to suit all tastes. It is easily accessed via Townhall Station which is located on the lower floor.

I think it's a TARDIS because it's much bigger on the inside.. Ok, I love shopping, there I said it, I love shopping and shops and crowds and people, I'm one of those weirdos who can wander all day long and buy little. From the outside this building is stunning, more like something you'd see in London than Sydney, but in Sydney is where I found myself. I'd actually stumbled upon this building by accident, I was looking for a cinema but ended up finding the entrance to the QVB. I expected a few shops, I didn't expect 3 floors of every type of shop you could imagine.And it just keeps going, and going and going.....I felt like I would come above ground in Melbourne such was the length of the it. If you want to shop in a very cool surround then it's the perfect place.
Upscale Shopping - fit for a Queen!. Great place for some upscale shopping - but first take a minute to enjoy the amazing building (inside out) and the great detail.

Old world charm meets modern shoppers. Beautiful building with lovely architecture, but it's a little sad that such a historic building has been converted to a shopper's haven. With that said, there are heaps of lovely shops and cafes within. You will find locals and tourists bustling around. Easy access via public transport available as well.

Just a beautiful building. Every time we visit Sydney we always have a quick walk through this magnificent building - on our way to Haigs Chocolate to pick up some goodies.With each visit there is something else to look at, it is just a beautiful historical building and well worth a look especially in December, the Christmas decorations are incredible!

What a beautiful building and I love the shops!. I often walk around QVB building because I can always find what I want with so many shops and cafes. It goes directly into Myers onto David Jones which is great when its wet. I can then go straight to the Train station under QVB whiteout getting wet if its raining.
Great shopping and fantastic location. I love going here when in Sydney to shop and enjoy this stunning building. Make sure you explore all 3 levels to see everything.

Iconic building with great architecture!. Located in the middle of this city, the QVB is iconic looking, with it's beautiful architecture and history behind it. It's also full of great shops to check out. Whenever I come to Sydney and stay in the city, I'd come here at least once for breakfast in one of its cafes on the 2nd floor. Not to mention, it's right above a train station, so very easy to locate and get to.

butique shops, old world charm, stunning architecture. Whilst staying at Sydney Mecure a few weeks ago, I visited QVB, found its atmosphere to be relaxing and refreshing in comparison to today's modern Malls Plaza's etc, QVB exuded the old world charm of yesteryear.

Grand old building!. I have been to this wonderful shopping place many times over the last 30 years and it is one of my highlights visiting Sydney!!!!Well done to the shop owners for keeping this place wonderful and unique!!Thank you!!
always a lovely place to visit. Fabulous building with every shop imaginable inside. There are also heaps of restaurants there. Great for a rainy day

A must visit for Sydneysiders and tourists. A magnificent building that provides a variety of retail therapy, from exclusive brands to generic brand shopping experience. The building also provide a great variety of food outlets from coffee break outlets to mid range restaurants. the convenience of its central location, allow easy access by public transport and for those who dare to drive to the CBD, weekend parking is quite affordable and convenient.

A true Sydney gem. Right in the middle of the city, next to the Town Hall, is this fabulous building, easy to get to by public transport and full of things to see, a great array of fashion boutiques, places to eat at, magnificent stained glass windows, period tessellated mosaics and antique giant clocks with automatons that move on the hour, for the great pleasure of tourists and children alike..This lovely landmark was going to be demolished and replaced with a car park many years ago, thankfully, it was saved and restored to its present glory. Not to be missed..
grand old dame. one of the best shopping precincts in Sydney,as well as a great old reclaimed building ,if you want to shop this for you or just a quiet coffee in great atmosphere

Eye candy for shoppers. Whether you're hear to shop or browse the city the QVB is a must. So much history, you wouldn't believe this exquisite building was almost demolished. The dome is a delight. Stop for high-tea at the The Tea Room or enjoy a Devonshire Tea. A great array of shops to suit most budgets.
Beautiful old historical building.. Unique and elegant stores offer unusual products together with well known brands. Great to take overseas guests.

There is possibly only one better place in the world to shop - Milan. Nothing is missing. Quality shopping at every turn. Nice cafes simply for a tea or coffee or a full meal. The decor is beautiful. I never tire from visiting this location.

Christmas joy. To visit the QVB at anytime is an experience as the building is beautiful and very well restored. The shops and café are the best in Sydney and to go there at Christmas time and see the tree is fantastic

Old fashioned elegance. Beautiful building. Stained glass windows, old fashioned elegance. Varied selection of shops from the bargain basement to fashion boutiques and jewellers. Felt it was more expensive for every level you ascended. Lots of coffee, cafe options. Easy access from Town hall station mall.

Being in the history of this building!. Details of unique architecture outside and inside, really is moving to previous years this architectural wonder, recommend putting special attention on the giant clock in the center of the building!
Fabulous. Beautiful building , inside a great treasure trove of shops and eateries , close to public transport .
Beautiful!. Sydney does a wonderful job of preserving their history through the architecture. We really enjoyed just standing and looking the stain glass, the clocks, the ceiling.

Historic building with good shopping for both international & local brands. ❤️ QVB. With 2 basement and 3 top levels, QVB is a good place for you to check international brands as well as local art. You can find a nice range of mid-price brands such as Camper, Fossil and Country Road. If you have more budget, then you can just pop into the higher end shops like Bally, Longchamp and Coach. We were there in early Jume this year which was a good time for shopping since it coincides with Sydney's end of financial year sale. Being an eclectic art layperson, I also enjoy the whimsical pieces at Dr Suess Art Gallery and the Metropolitan Museum of Art (New York). You cam also pick up aboriginal art at the art gallery on the third floor of the building. For more affordable shoe and clothing stores, you can hit the basement floors for well-designed products.Tired out by all the shopping? Then head to any of the restaurants and cafes housed in QVB which offered both Italian and Asian fare ranging from the higher end Chinese restaurant, The Laughing Buddha to cool vibe cafes found mainly on the third floor.For caffeine fixes and healthier juice options, just go to level 1 and B2.By the way, there is a modeling and craft store in QVB called HobbyCo. The shop is a dream come true for toy enthusiasts. My son got himself some good Lego Star Wars and paints there.The high point for me is not the shopping but the beautiful Victorian architecture and design of the building. The building was restored and much of the historic design was preserved. One thing to look out for is the two clock chandeliers installed in side the building. The facade of the clock turns at every hour and thus, all the decorative pieces depicting important historical moments in Aussie's history can be seen from all perspectives.So, put on your shopping shoes and have a jolly good time at QVB.

Stunning architecture. I've been to Sydney a few times and only walked into this building on my recent trip. The architecture stopped me in my tracks. Make sure you go all the way to the top and look down, then find the circular staircase, it is truly beautiful. The shops in this centre are worth going to as well, mostly high end but worth it.
Beautiful. What a beautiful, stately building. Could spend hours in here enjoying the characteristics. A must if you are interested in wonderful architecture.
Great Shopping Experience. This place is Beautiful! Filled with some of the best quality brands, there is definitely something for everyone!

A step back in time. Always a launching pad for a visit to the big smoke.You can't help but stream through the QVB when alighting at Town Hall station.However, to 90% of people it is just another trip to work or the shops.Like a beautiful garden where you need to stop and smell the flowers, the QVB has so much to offer.Take some time. Stroll around each level. Try the food, drink the coffee stare at the beautiful shops and the goods they offer.

Beautiful building with cool shops.. Nice quiet vibe, especially as you get go up the levels with a variety of interesting shops such as antique maps, jewellery and clothes. Nice to look and walk around even if you're not buying anything.

Add QVB to your tourism plan!. Eye-candy of simply decadent shopping and an amazing restored building.Easy train ride from almost anywhere to Town Hall. Don't even have to walk outside to get to the QVB (Queen Victoria Building). If you do go outside, you can't miss the huge statue of Queen Victoria. Once inside take time to admire the stunning ornate architecture, stained glass windows, intricate stairs and ceilings. Start from the top and work your way down to the lower levels. Take the escalators or elevator to the 3rd floor (top) and admire the 2 amazing center clocks suspended from the ceiling. The castle clock is a must-see on the hour with trumpeters, followed by 6 scenes with animated figures, including wiggling girls near Henry VIII and the final scene of a beheading (thought it was hysterical). Meander and window shop the designer stores, or stop to eat. The desserts in the tea shops looked amazing, unfortunately wasn't particularly hungry at the time. A variety of stores on every level with some unique items and some expensive designer things, but worth a look around, even if you don't buy. Finally, make your way to the lower level and visit Victorias Basement store - tons of deals here! Specializing in kitchen type items that are bargains; purchased as gifts - linen tea towels for $6, set of nice cheese knives $10-$20, pot holders $4. And the store never seems to end, so many nooks and crannies of kitchenware, glasses, & gadgets. Plus the staff is super friendly and will help you find anything. It's easy to spend an hour in the basement store alone. When you're done, simply hop back on the train.

Charming!. the Queen Victoria Building (QVB) has to be one of the prettiest shopping centres in Australia. It has a lot of clothing shops and connects via an undergound walkway with the town hall train station. Most of the shops are fairly up market but the place is gorgreous and definitely worth checking out

High Tea and Shopping Treat. Beautiful old building with lots of charm and character. Browsed through the shops and indulged in 'High Tea' in the top floor 'Ballroom'. Booked for lunch time and had the $50/head option: a champers, selection of savoury tarts and sandwiches as well as gorgeous sweet treats with choice of tea. More than enough for our group of ladies. Great service in a wonderful setting!

Hgh End. Beautiful Building. Great design. Very high end. Worth a trip to see if you are not shopping or even a brief stop at the eateries in the building to people watch and admire the impressive clock they have in the middle of the building

Beautiful Building, Variety of Shopping. What a gorgeous building to convert into a shopping mall. There is a wide range of stores, cafes, and specialty stores. Even if you just walk through to see the beautiful stained glass, original lifts, and intricate details of the clocks.
The Tea Room is just gorgeous. The food was really good and the service was efficient and friendly. The decor is to die for, it's like being in a fairy tale. Really lovely.

Eclectic British monument in Sydney, Australia. This is basically a shopping mall with wonderful but expensive goods on display. Good for window shopping and buying original stuff. A visit to Sydney won't be quite complete without this. I bought a couple of opal necklaces for my sisters

Grand building just above Town Hall Station. A grand building that's worth visiting just by itself. Situated directly above Town Hall Station where all the city actions are. Within are the branded goods stores which you can choose to just window shop.

This sandstone building architecture is Beautifully located and presented. I once worked in this building when it was Sydney Council. It is now one of the best sandstone buildings in its architecture. Beautifully located and presented with five levels of shopping.

The variety of shops did not interest. The building itself is beautiful, right down to the old-fashioned lifts, but the stores were not interesting, except for the toy store on the upper level and we were disappointed that we were ready to shop but had nothing to shop for.

A classic and historic building.. Not to be missed when in Sydney. Beautiful and historic building in the middle of modern, glassy skyscrapers. Even if you don't plan to shop, the building is an attraction in itself.

GREAT for cafes and shopping!!.. We went to QVB every day in Sydney. We would take the trains from Town Hall to our destinations for the day. We had breakfast at Vienna cafe (GREAT), bought chocolates from the shop on the corner (FANTASTIC), and generally enjoyed walking through every day.

QVB. A beautiful piece of architecture in the middle of Sydney. A free attraction full of expensive shops but worth a walk through this also links with other malls along the ground floor so great for rainy days
A must see attraction in Sydney. It is a place with the appeal of the past and the traditions mixed with the new and modern. Nice cafés, chocolateries and several stores to visit.
Beautiful building and a history to match.. Great for shopping (pricy), but still good fo a scroll and being fascinated by the intricacies of the building.

I dearly miss this place for shopping . When I studied in Sydney, QVB is a place which I always hanged out with my friends for coffee catchups. It's also a wonderful place for shopping. This building is so beautiful and is a place which I'll go back every time when I'm back in town.
Shopping!!. Absolutely love the architecture of this building, it's stunning. It is built on many levels so it has every store you need inside of if it.

Most Beautiful Mall I've Ever Seen!. It's too hard to explain - you just have to visit this stunning building. Three things I love about it: the details in the architecture - like nothing I've ever seen; the history; and the numerous shops and restaurants that are each unique and interesting...no chains here! Whether you're a shopper or not, this is a must visit place.

History in the Centre of Sydney. This is an institution for wonderful shopping and food, just to look at the magnificence of the building and walk around the shops is entertaining but do see the clock as something magical happens on the hour. At Christmas time Santas magic comes alive with a magnificent tree and the grotto with Santa.

Historic Glory in the CBD. Thankfully Sydney did not lose this gloriuos building in the 1960s, when so many were lost to the wreckers ball. The Queen Victoria building hints at what glories of colonial architecture were lost in that period.The complex now provides host to many an expensive high end designer shop and tourist drawcards. Fortunately, these include fine restuarants and high end souviniers!Do'n't miss a visit to this magnificent building, even if only to explore thae marvellous multi level heritage architecture. Probably the closest thing Australia has to Galeries Lafayette in Paris, with an equally awe inspiring stained glass atrium.Make sure you have deep pockets if you intend having a big shopping spree here though. Your dollar will go much further at the Paddington Market!Highly recommended for its sheer beauty, scale and history!

A beautiful shopping experience.. I have always loved the QVB since it's opening several years ago now. On my first visit I was so intrigued by the building itself that I didn't even bother looking at the shops and that's saying something for a shopaholic like me.There are tours I believe and I keep meaning to go on one but haven't yet.The shopping is fabulous and suits all pockets starting with the cheaper stores on the ground floors and going up to the more expensive designer shops and antiques and jewellery on the top.The building is accessible on several sides from the various streets in the city as well as underground leading into some of the other main stores across the road and also has access to the underground rail system.There are many coffee shops and cafes and also a very elegant restaurant which does an excellent high tea.Well worth a stroll around if not to shop just to admire the building itself and it's magnificent mechanical clock at it's centre which comes to life on the hour.
Fantastic Building. I LOVE this building. It has such an amazing atmosphere. It has beautiful little shops and gorgeous places for Brunch. I would have happily went there every day if I could.

Oh MY!. This stunning interior and unforgettable Sydney architectural monument was done up for Christmas with a tree suspended in a 4 storey atrium that you circled as you climbed each stair. Magnificent architecture of the Victorian era...beautifully and sensitively maintained. I was sorely tempted by high tea in the gorgeous tea rooms at the top, but had to scoot...there is too much to sea in Sydney!

Lovely building, expensive shops. Lovely old Victorian building - worth a visit to look at the clocks and stained glass windows alone. Great variety of designer (expensive) shops but we had a reasonably priced flat white each at a gorgeous old fashioned coffee shop.Thoroughly recommend a visit!

Beautiful Building to wander through. This is a great area to wander around in - lots of great little shops and the huge basement is worth a visit. Lots of great places to get a bite to eat from as you progress through.

Amazing Historic Building. A lovely old building well worth a wander through. Plenty of shops and cafes. Walk to the top floor and see the amazing clock showing the history of Australia and watch the time go by.The shop in the basement, Victoria's basement is well worth a visit for any home ware you may be looking for.

Absolutely beautiful. This building is a must see. It's wonderful heritage and architecture is timeless. So many special spots to sit and enjoy your surroundings. The shopping is good also. Don't forget to stop of at Haigh's for some amazing chocolate.
QV Buildings. My favourite place. Love the building inside and out. Well worth the walk round - just to admire the architecture is enough.

High Brow . As far as a place to shop, I would only describe QVB for people like me as a window shoppers paradise. The architecture inside is incredible. I am unaware of any signage, so not sure what is original, which bits are extensions made to look like originals. Queen Victoria's statue outside came from Ireland some time ago, a gift to NSW. So worth a visit, take the ornate stairs, enjoy the ambience if in the area.
awesome architecture,. if you appreciate good architecture, then this is the place for you. you will also find some amazing shops and great coffee while you're there !
Beautiful building with upmarket shops. The shops themselves are a bit upmarket (and pricey) however the building itself is definitely worth a visit. Beautiful old style architecture
she still reigns. what a fantastic arcade 3 floors of shops and eateries and such beautiful surroundings off a bygone era

Great shopping spot. Very much for the high end shoppers this one but it does have some quality stores such as asics flagship Sydney and some great little eating places as well. The Qvb connects to town hall station and MYER Sydney as well..

Classic old building with a great range of shops and eats. Lots of speciality shops in a beautifully restored old building. Lots of places to stop and eat.Don't forget to pick up a sweet treat from Adrian Zumbo's!

Stunning architecture. My favourite building and a must to visit each time i go into the city. Lots of shops ranging from designer boutiqes to popular shops. Great little cafes to stop and grab something to eat.Take a walk and admire the architecture.
Nice building. Great historic building with direct access to the public transports from the underground.Its very beautiful and fancy, nice place to have a nice shopping day
Great restoration. Very pretty building but unless you have deeeeep pockets be prepared to window shop only. Building very well restored.
Grand Architecture. Visited the Queen Victoria Building.Grand internal and external architecture, worth exploring slowly and enjoying a drink within

Elegant landmark building - shops high end. Beautiful architectural building, with a great statue of Queen Victoria at the far end. Lots of cafes and great little coffee shops to choose from. The shopping tends to be high end though, so no bargains to be had here!

Specilist shopping and the cafe style restuarents. Plenty of specialist shops and good café style restaurants. Easy to get there using public transport. The clocks at the top level is a good tourist attraction. Has a good function centre
A Shopping mall with history. The mall is well preserved with items from the past, ie the arc staircases, Lift elevators from the past, Clocks which tells a story rather than time.
Nice Building. Great shopping experience. Good selection of places to eat, but generally the food is reasonably priced and of a not quite as good quality ... sometimes the service can be quite slow

Wonderful Historic Building - Great Architectural Features. As soon as you walk inside this building you see the lovely floor tiles from a bygone era that show this building to be of great character, with beautiful woodwork and classical liftsWell worth a visit just to see these unique features in SydneyThere is a central clock that is marked as Made in Hastings & is very ornate - see photos There are of course great shops as well but the building gives off this great vibe alone!Recommended - Enjoy
Gorgeous old girl. It is just lovely wandering around the Queen Victoria building and window shopping. Staff in the shops are very friendly. Gorgeous building.
Stunning, Worth a walk around. Lovely place to walk around & take in the architecture. Great on a rainy day. Way to easy for a spot of shopping too.

Vivid 2016 get away wend!. Gracious building outstanding décor..stylish staircases.....lead lighting ...windows... doors... shops.... architecture...flooring...tiling... awesome! Historically one of the most beautiful buildings in Sydney a must see to all tourist far and near.

Heritage site. Lots of antiquities in this building. Don't miss the very old lift at the end of the building. I had second thoughts when I took it. Wished that it would not stall. The restroom has both modern and classical fixtures. Spent time looking around and paid no attention to the shops.

Elegance and Grace.. The Queen Victoria Building is a beatifully preserved piece of historical Sydney architecture. The shops are varied and interesting to browse, shop or just admire the store windows. I highly recommend a visit to The Tearooms on the upper floor. There you can enjoy the company of friends or family for a couple of hours in the elegance of a bygone era, with its high ceilings, amazing lightinf fixtures, comfortable seating and beautiful table settings. The food is delicious and the service excellent.

More than just shopping. With stores on 3 levels plus plenty of delightful eateries you are bound to find a way to part with your hard earned cash. The building offers so much more with its interesting architecture and features such as its clocks and historical exhibits.
A visit to Sydney without a trip to QVB would be like strawberries without cream.

Charming heritage shopping structure with dozens of interesting novel shops. Was really enamoured with the old style charm yet latest and greatest of shops offering good variety of cafe style food and drink, an exquisite asian eatery upstairs, and so many options for shopping. My favourite was the leather shop on the ground floor -- so many well made (many Australian) cases, wallets, purses, belts, etc. Don't miss the massive music store in the basement area.

Victorian Charm and History. This restored shopping mall was absolutely packed on our visit but it was worth it. Beautiful jewelry stores, cafe's and galleries in this large structure with stained glass and original floors. It's right in downtown Sydney CBD.

Beautiful building. We came here to take some nice pictures of this historic building. There are 2 big clocks at the 2 ends of the shopping centre. One of them has a moving hand indicator represented by a ship. It is really interesting. We were there around 9 plus. Some of the shops are not open yet. The walkway are all carpeted. They must have put in a lot of efforts to maintain this building. There are also cafe and many restaurants including a chinese restaurant. After taking some nice pictures. We went to Pandora shop to buy some accessories. Their service was really good. Must visit this building.
Shop till you drop. This is the place to shop till you drop the building is very old and old world charm love what shops they have too offer

Beautiful historic marketplace. Having been to Sydney before we remembered well this beautiful complex. It is lovely outside as well as in and has a great selection of shops both moderate and very high end. The collection of food kiosks in the center as well as full restaurants at the ends provide good food in an exquisite setting. If you don;'t buy anything you must take some time for a stroll through it.

Historic Shopping Temple. QVB is a traditional classical shopping-temple as they were created in the 19th century, when money and shopping became more popular with the more egalitarian society.There were quite a few built across old Europe, Milan, Paris, Rome etc. Some of these still exist, but have lost their vitality and now feel more like museums than shopping malls on life support. One that has been kept alive, thanks to oil-money, is Harrods in London, but being under one owner, it again is different.QVB appears to be unique with is mix and variety of shops, restaurants, diverse offers and mechanical clock. All in perfectly maintained condition and lively and spunky, lots of people.On the top floor there is even a shop offering antique high-quality engravings and prints mainly maps and Australian fauna and flora.Several toy shops, one huge one over two floors at the end of the mall. We had problems finding our way out again.Almost can call it a cultural experience.

historical market feeling , good for pictures expensive shops. pictures are great if u use your camera well , historic looks , expensive brands , but must go place if you want visit full sydney in city centre

Great shopping. We enjoyed the vast range of shops that allowed you to brouse and/or buy. Good variety and lots of good eateries ranging from cheaper eats or more fancy places depending on your likes.

Romance of an era long gone. This is the sort of place that ticks all the right boxes for me. Architecture, artwork, decor and ambiance. It's about great tilework, cast iron features, stained glass, tall ceilings, natural light, beauty and old world charm. Don't even bother entering if these are not the types of things that take your fancy. Not one for expensive shopping, I was happy just admiring the sheer beauty of the place.

Queen Victoria Building. Building architecture is of colonial building. This is the up market shopping center where you can find all the branded products. Located within City Centre which is walking distant from my hotel, The Grace.

Must Visit. the place is full with all type of shops. Required around 4-5 hours to cover enteir market. You can get everting thing in this market. The Building is very beautiful. In the night lights are on gives different view. I like it.

Pretty but that is all. Just a nice old building full of fancy expensive shops. Kids most enjoyed the escalators. The architecture is nice and good to see they have mantained the originality of the building.
Nice clock. Interior is renovated and kept in good condition. good cafe's in there . didn't try shopping though. Just a quick visit

Not for the average tourist. It is an interesting building and beautiful landmark, but not a shopping destination for mainstream items. They were specialty shops with high prices, even at 50% off in some cases. What it truly lacks is a spot for tired shoppers to rest. Chairs are reserved for those eating in the restaurants that are lining the perimeter of the three floors. There is no room for a simple general seating area. Many people were sitting on the floor using their cell phones.

Interesting and fun to walk . The building's architecture is beautiful. The mall (inside) has pretty and nice stores. The café's are trendy and nice. Fun to walk and /or sit have a cup of coffee with some delicious pastry.
An incourtonable place!. Well to do shopping is the place where u have to go!And you have all trains lines there too!!An incredible architecture!!It's impossible to miss out this place!!

Great Atmosphere and Shopping. The QVB is simply stunning. There are some wonderful quirky shops and great eateries. The clocks that sound on the hour are simply amazing and worth waiting for. There are good clean toilets available here and don't forget to visit the hobbyco shop which is awesome.

Iconic building in Sydney City centre . A must go, iconic and luxurious building in Sydney City. Experience Sydney cafe culture in one of its elegant coffee shops or enjoy shopping on one of the city's best chocolatiers "Haig's". Just 1 minute from Town Hall station.
Very fancy and colourful!. An easy place to find and explore for a bit of something different. Feels a little like being on board the Titanic!
Old building but very interesting. We came here visit the place we heard before it was amazing The outside and inside of the QVB is beautiful. The architecture, both inside and out

Stunning older building that retains its elegance. The QVB connects onto the Town Hall station on the bottom floor, the elevators, stain glass windows and dome are from a time long past. The QVB retains its elegance and grandeur even with the updated and somewhat expensive shops. Great place to visit, even passing through to the station.

Stunning interiors. We visited the Queen Victoria Building which is converted to a shopping mall and had a great experience.Good collection of stores, some pretty high end ones occupy this great building. Thoroughly enjoyed window shopping and walking through this building.

Great place to see, not necessarily shop at. The outside and inside of the QVB is beautiful. The architecture, both inside and out, is worth the look. The shops inside are high end, so we just walked through each flour looking at the different parts of the building.
Stunning heritage building. A gorgeous part of Sydney's heritage and am always happy to go shopping at QVB when in Sydney, and it looks extra special at Xmas time.

Beautiful building to shop and relax. Stopped by to do a little shopping and it's a really beautiful building. I wouldn't get out of my way to come here but definitely worth stopping by if in the area.

One of my favourite places in Sydney. Love to walk around and have a look at the architecture. Love the clock in the centre and lovely place to sit for a cuppa. People are friendly and is just a lovely place to visit

Gorgeous building to walk through. For those with an interest in architecture (and I am NOT one of them), this place is a must visit. Even for me, just looking at this building and walking through it was a great experience. While I am not a big fan of shopping malls, this doesn't feel like one even though it's full of branded labels. There's some fun shops such as Haighs chocolate shop and a few nice cafes in the hallway that mean you spend a good amount of time in this wonderful building.

Love it!. Every time I go to Sydney I make a stop here. The building is beautiful and iconic. It's a very busy place with mostly specialist shops. Always visit my favorite clothing store. Clothing, jewellery, shoes, perfume. I love the food upstairs, has a great vibe. It's what Sydney is!
A nice landmark . A nice contrast to the modern parts of the city in town hall. It's a bit of a maze at times which adds to its charm. Worth a visit.
Amazing place for shopping. Shopping place. Good place to spend time. Good food outlets to eat. beautiful architecture. Good place for the shopping lovers.

A Sydney Icon for retail. Sydney is wonderful city has a lot of competing places for your attention. The Bridge, Harbour, Opera house, etc. This very nicely renovated vintage building covers a whole city block with options for food, dining, shopping that will interest anyone. It's not an over the top hard sell retail space, it's engaging. It has several basements which link with the railway and the rest of downtown, so you don't even need to wait for traffic lights. If you just stroll either way, it's a very interesting way to spend time, even for the locals.

Upmarket shopping.. A must for any visitor to Sydney, along with the other tourist sites.Some really lovely (and expensive) shops on two levels in this Victorian building. Be there at midday by the clock in the centre and be surprised! It is within easy walking distance of the CBD. There are also places for coffee or something more substantial.
GREAT Building. great for a window shop, shopping and a coffee, one of the finest buildings in Sydney with access to Town Hall subway
Nice and expensive . It is nice to walk around and take a look at the nice shops or grab some food, the place looks great inside and outside. If you like big brands this is your spot.

A Landmark just across Town Hall Station. This is a beautiful and old building, but nicely refurbished inside and now bustling with retail shops. It is strategically located with direct underground access from the Town Hall train station. You can enjoy the external architecture which has been well preserved.
Pleasant place to stroll. For a change of pace, I walked around and through Queen Victoria Building. Not that I would have gone out of my way for it, but it was a nice diversion.
Busy. Took my family from Thailand to walk around and doing some shopping. Very busy and lot of interesting not just only people but shop for window shopping as well.

QVB - for architect lovers. Sydney is not rich with old buildings and interesting architecture so this building is one of those must-visits if you're in a city centre. Very nice mosaic on the windows, luxury shops (don't go shopping here if you're from Europe - it's cheaper to buy anything at home than here). Almost all UGGs are made in China. Local bakery in the centre of the 1st floor (macarons) - perfect!

A Historic Building . The QVB is another definitive Sydney landmark opposite Town Hall and is always buzzing with shoppers and diners.It has a range of shops, cafes and restaurants. I personally visit mainly to meet up with friends or colleagues over coffee or a meal.My wife used to shop here extensively when we visited Sydney regularly in the 1990s when it possessed an old worldly charm. It has since been modernised in line with the times.

Wow. What an amazing structure! Takes up a whole city blocks and is packed with interesting stores, even if you aren't interested in the architecture. Definitely worth a visit. And to think that at one time they wanted to tear it down to make a parking lot.
QVB. Beautiful building! a lot of shops inside the building, nice to stroll through, get coffee, shop a little, very nice!
Beautiful building. It's a beautiful building. When you enter, look up for the lovely art work. There are many touristy collector items that one can indulge in
Lovely historic building that helps give Sydney some class. This is my favourite shopping centre in the CBD as it has character along with some comfortable and interesting cafes.

Always worth a visit. The architecture is just beautiful. The building has old world charm that houses some exclusive boutiques and delightful cafes. It is easy to access both above and underground. A lovely place to stroll through the shops and window gaze at all the things you would love to buy.

Endless Shopping. This is a one stop place to shop. The building structure has great historical features. You can excess the train station from here. There is a walkway that takes you underneath to cross over to Myer. There is a variety of shops and enough to adequately sustain not shopping elsewhere. The food court is massive and has a huge range to choose from.

Eye candy for the architecture buff!. This was the one building in Sydney I was determined to see. I am not a shopper, so the stores didn't interest me, but I loved that the essence of the building has been kept intact in spite of being retail space. The two impressive clocks are a must see, as are the stained glass windows over the side entrances.If you ARE a shopper, this is a high end mall with just about everything you could want. There are plenty of little cafes and coffee places to keep you fortified.
STUNNING!. I couldn't get over how beautiful the inside if this building is! Must have spent over an hour here. One of my fav places in Sydney

High Tea at the QVB. We met up with friends at the Tea Room QVB and had best two hours. The food looked and tasted great and was set off perfectly with the atmosphere. There was plenty of staff to attend to us and if you don't drink tea, don't despair, there was coffee, champagne and soft drink. We arrived by train to Town Hall Station and it takes you right into the QVB. There were lots of shopping to be done in this beautiful building which made for a full day out, our high tea finished off our day wonderfully. The convenience of getting there and back just made it better. High Tea was reasonably priced starting at $45 a head, depending what drink you wanted. Can't wait to go back.

Olde Worlde Charm in Sydney. Each Australian city seems to have one of the delightful old arcades but walking through the Queen Vic Building is absolutely amazing! Such good eateries (including high tea), so many shops, and if you're lucky, the occasional bargain or two plus your memories of such a beautiful building!!

Unique Old Building. This grand beautiful old building is architecturally stunning. The interior designed is so attractive. Shopping is not for us but for those who can afford to splash their money because most of the goods are of high quality and high value.

Shopping in the tunnel of history. The amazing part of the QVB starts with its well-reserved historical interior and stunning exterior. In the shopping hall, we could find lots of shops but the cafes there were the most impressive for us! Having a cup of cafe in a very traditional yet colorful historical building was amazing! Don't miss the tour around different corners and corridors as well as the roofs, simply incredible!

Just Beautiful. Visited Sydney in December and visited this beautiful old building. The enormous Christmas Tree that stretches up to the top of this multi-story building is a sight to see. I loved the wonderfully maintained heritage building including the old fashioned elevator. Just beautiful.
Lovely lovely building.. Well this set of shops are rather expensive and exclusive. We just had a peep in to see what was on offer and came out again. Lovely buildings though.

A place to unwind. The QVB is one of my must visits in Sydney - it has loads of cafes for breakfast and to unwind after a day at work in CBD. I particularly like the Florentine Tea house on 3rd floor near the chiming clock . It has soft chairs and tables - and is open for dinner if you decide to stay on after the cuppa and delicious cakes. I had pistachio and my friend had cherry dome cakes - yum

Beautiful old english building. If u like victorian style Buildings u got to go there. We went there just for the Building of Course there are Shops and cafes inside but for us the Building stands it self. Old dark Wood combined with this beautiful old colourful glass Windows ist a wow !! There is also a old Elevator inside.
Magnificent . Visited this place as part of a few guided tour. It's a lovely place which is right in the middle of the city.

Beautiful Must See Building Loaded with Shops & Restaurants. We had not planned to visit the Queen Victoria Building, but ran across it while walking around the City and we were so happy we did!! The building is so beautifully done with tons of shopping, restaurants and sweet shops. We did not purchase anything from the stores, but did have a wonderful lunch there. The buildings architecture is just amazing and if you did nothing but look at the beautiful stained glass and fixtures it is well worth the visit. We definitely recommend a visit here!
Stunning . The architecture in this building is second to none. ...i love spending heaps of time here. ..walking around. ..shopping. ...enjoying gorgeous food. ..and admiring the architecture

Now this is a special place. Victorian indeed. So many great brands, great shops and a fantastic restored building worth visiting just for the architecture and ambiance. The Christmas tree during summer holidays is always a treat. Great teas and other delicious food.

Iconic building. The Qvb is a pretty iconic building in Sydney. The shopping is ok but the heritage of the building is the big draw card. The proximity to town hall makes it very convinient to visit and for anyone visiting Sydney ifs worth a wander to see

Amazing old building.. The clock tower is the centre of attention and so it should be.On the hour the top of clock has movement in the castle etc.The building has been maintained and worth a good look around as we were there just before Xmas they had a huge Xmas tree in centre of Mall touched the ceiling and weighed about 4 tonnes.Well worth a visit.
Excellent rainy day experience. What a beautifully restored building - Enjoyed the shops on a rainy day and, in particular, the tea room for afternoon tea.
Yanks shopping in Oz. If you like to shop and you love victorian architecture, you will love this arcade. There are several floors of boutiques, shops, coffee cafes that can be enjoyed.
Lovely shopping arcade. Lovely selection of shops and food outlets. Excellent location for taking the train to circular quay. Lovely clean shopping environment

It's shopping time.. My wife and I walked in this place to find some shoe shop, and were very impressed with the building. It is lovely to see such a majestic building being used as a shopping center, rather then to demolish it. Inside there is a nice vibe and perfect to enjoy a snack or a coffee, there are plenty of shops for everyone's needs.
Beautiful building. When I visit Sydney, I like going to QVB not to shop but just to enjoy the beauty of this building. I especially love its staircases.

Love all the cafes. Go there for food!Ground floor there's a few cafe and all of their food is nice. Just go to anyone and u won't be disappointed. Whole building is worth a visit! There's so many shops!

A great place to visit in Sydney. Nice decor in an old shopping center. Plenty of shops and connections to public transport and other attractions. There are a few cafes that look very much like Europe and Victoria's Basement has always specials for house staff.

Amazing place. If you are in Sydney then you shouldn't miss this. It's a shopping mall with a difference. The architecture is amazing yet the place is buzzing with busy people. Walk around and don't miss the clock.

Beautiful building. This was built in 1898 and named for the Queen. There is a large statue of her at the entrance. The inside is filled with lots of shops, restaurants and whatever. The architecture is impressive. Worth walking through even if you don't care to shop.

Beautiful Old Building. Love the Architecture and history of the building The varied shops cater for all pockets from the glamorous couture shops on the top levels to the bargains in Victoria's Basement High Tea is also to be experienced in the upper level QVB Tea Rooms. Enjoy!
Amazing historical building.. Great shopping and great eateries, in a wonderful historical building, beautifully preserved in the heart of the city.

Gorgeous structure. QVB as it is referred, was built in 1898 as a tribute to Queen Victoria. Her statute is right outside the Druid St. Entrance. The building has three floors in addition to the basement level. The architecture is stunning and the lay out of the stores, shops and restaurants is so evenly structured and shapely. Lots of unique shops selling local goods, and shops selling internationally recognized specialties. The building is on George St. starting at Market down to Druid and Park, just opposite Town Hall. If arriving by underground Metro, you are able to walk underground from the Town Hall station right into the QVB. And also at the opposite end of the building you can cross over right into Myer Department Store. Good use for inclement weather. The huge astronomical clock is interesting, but the 12:00 clock show never happened. You may not want to buy anything here, but a stop for lunch or tea sounds good, and watch out for the Haigh's Chocolate Store at the Druid St. exit. You'll be drawn in by the sweet aroma of chocolate.

Absolutely Stunning Building. What an amazing building to visit and shop.There is a great range of shops, cafes and restaurants to tempt you inside this fantastic building.The road works on George Street aren't helping the situation here at the moment, but worth ignoring that and enter this beautiful building and spend a few hours here enjoying the atmosphere and the things to see.

Great Victorian architecture, with up scale shops. This 3 floored building is best seen from outside or above. It is always very busy and crowded more so in rush hours, and used to get through the city underground, linked to Town Hall Station. Hi quality shops, with high end prices, but small scale at least.

shoppers paradise. This is a place to shop and eat in a perfect setting. We spent hours looking for items and when tired, there were plenty of eateries and cafes. The place is connected to train station and other shopping malls like Myers, making the whole area a gigantic shopping paradise.We discovered the basement area which sells all kitchen items and we were totally immersed browsing the items there.

Worth a Look. Lots of great shops and restaurant/cafes to visit here. The building is beautiful, the architecture is remarkable. The building has been well cared for and upgraded ~ it is an 19th century building. Walked by it most days we were in Sydney. The shops are very upscale, nice if you are looking for something special.

A must for architecture buffs. The building is connected to the transit system, so you don't have to worry about the weather. High end shops, but still wonderful to walk around and see the preserved architecture, with beautiful stained glass windows. You won't be disappointed spending a couple of hours wandering through this gem.
Very good classy shopping. Busy at all times makes this a great place to mix with the Sydney culture. Shopping for watches somewhat expensive.There are no specials at this gallery. A must to visit
Intricate interiors. The building itself is a tourist spot in the city. I always pass by this building going to Woolies in George st. Sadly, can't afford to buy anything in there. Too pricey.

Busy but beautiful. What a lovely building that never fails to impress. Plenty of upmarket shops to browse in and plenty of dining choices. A special mention to the Nut Shop on the lowest level where you can indulge in macadamia, cashew nuts and almonds in a light toffee coating, sold in various portion sizes. They were delicious!
Beautiful building. Lots of great shops and restaurant/cafes to visit here. The building is beautiful and has the most amazing tree at Christmas time. Its well worth the visit when in Sydney.
Beautiful Shopping area. This is a lovely way to spend your money. Upscale and beautiful. There are a lot of stores here. The clock is the feature point of the arcade.
High-end stores in an historical building!. Loved wandering through this majestic building. Lots of shops, food and fashion! Hard to believe this building was built all of those years ago.
interesting building. very interesting building. lots of stores for shopping. We took the train and it let out in the basement. Lots of steps and so many levels and so much to see. Clean

For History Buffs, Foodies and upmarket shoppers QV is must do!. The first time I went to the QV I was delighted and intrigued.. The building has retained it's old world charm, with stunning lead lights, mosaic tiling, ornate lift and stairs a happy snap on every level. I never get bored, as there is always a plethora if new foods at the side walk cafes and although the shops offer high end designer brands, I can always find a must have bargain to take home. This is definitely not your DFO outlet stop, but even if you just look around (which doesn't cost anything) it's worth a visit.. The Block Arcade in Melbourne has the same vibe, albeit on a much smaller scale.

An architectural gem. I'm not a shopper so the upscale stores in the QVB don't have much appeal for me, but the well-preserved Victorian details in the interior are charming and definitely worth a visit. You can window shop and stop for a coffee under stained glass and watch the clock turn to mark another hour.
Beautiful building. Shops are mostly expensive but go anyway just to have a look. It's a lovely place, beautifully restored.

Shoppers Paradise - but bring lots of money!. This was our cloudy day, rainy attraction but worth the walk. the building is beautiful with lots of stained glass and wonderful architecture. The shops on the first three levels are very pricey as are the restaurants, but truly worth a visit. There is a great toy store on the third level which children of all ages would love to see as it has a super railroad attraction. Also loved the Toy Soldier store! There are many tea shops and other eateries for all tastes. The clothing and jewelry stores are a suburb collection for one-stop shopping. Just bring lots of money.

Great place to spend time shopping and exploring. Absolutely tons and tons of shops and places to eat are in here.The QVB connects with both the Galerias and the department stores nearby, and though it can sorta be confusing for a newcomer there are signs and maps to help you as you roam through this labryinth of downtown shopping malls and seemingly endless food shops and food courts of all kinds.There are ATMs, bathrooms, DVD rental machines, you can connect walking in here to theTown Hall station for the metro or you can walk all the way to near tbe park if you don't mind a seemingly endless amount of elevators, stairs, escalators, and pedestrian skyways.

Received a great education on Australian Opals. I went to the second floor to observe the animated clocks and found a wonderful shop that sold opals. The kind gentlemen took me through Australian Opals 101. When I left there, I felt well informed. There are many lovely shops with a wide selection of merchandise. Price Boutiques, as well.
Just an amazing building. Loved the shops and the atrium. High tea served late and very popular. The clock was fantastic. Great for a rainy day. Kids loved the hobby shop. Stunning shops
History and today. Liked this old building how it was renovated to a comfortable and a bit luxury shopping mall. It offers clothes, shoes, jewelry, kitchen ware and much more.
Lovely place to window shop.. Beautifully presented shops that entice you to stroll up and down the building. Great Cafes to have coffee and breakfast in as well.

A walk in wonderland!. Had a night in Sydney and decided because the weather was inclement, to visit this grand old building. It has great services, coffee lounges , restaurants amenities, but the actual building is the draw card.

One of the best stops while visiting Sydney. This was one of the first stops we made after we checked into our hotel in Sydney. We returned several more times during our visit there. First, the architecture of this building, as in many of the buildings in Sydney, is just so beautiful, you keep looking at detail after detail, and each time you see more beauty. The building now houses a really great shopping mall, which is a wonderful place to browse or shop. It is carpeted and all the details inside are continuously fascinating. It is about the feeling you get while you are in this space, it is like you do not want to leave. Just a great feeling of satisfaction being in the surroundings, and very much like you are taken back in time, say 100 years ago. This is definitely a must see and again and again, and if you like to shop, some lovely shops, even if to just browse. Check it out.
Beautiful building. The Queen Victoria Building was a beautiful building with plenty of shops to browse through inside. Stunning architecture, a must see while in Sydney!

The Queen's Mall. We wandered through this imposingly beautiful mall full of high end boutiques and shoppes. Interior has been left to reflect Victorian times and it is a lively place to take refuge from the rain and for us to "window" shop. Several cafes and restaurants are avaiable for light meals, tea or lunch. It is worth your time if only to see the architecture.
A 'MUST SEE' WHEN IN SYDNEY. No trip to Sydney is complete without a visit to this fantastic and charming old building. Great shops, great food, a beautiful building - a photographer's dream !
Beautiful Building and Shopping!. This building is beautiful and has allot of wonderful stores to shop in. I wish I would have had more time to explore the many levels of this building.

The Dr Seuss Gallery. I love this place, I really do.On a cold, wet, lunchtime with nothing to do.The gallery is located in the QVB,On the upper level, you will see.Designer art from Victor Harvey.Sketch drawing and sculptures, they are rather gnarley. To look at like the gallery is nice and free. To purchase a piece costs more than a the price of a trip to Bali…So what to do, what to do, if your in Sydney with nothing to do,Stop in and see The Grinch, The Cat in the Hat, and even the Who!
