Amazing Architecture. Looking for somewhere to go on a rainy day we were pointed in the direction of this amazing building. Apart from the exclusivity of many of the shops the building itself is a definite asset to the city. Beautifully restored and maintained this building also contains restaurants and cafes with a choice of food to suit all tastes.
Beautifully preserved building. From the beautiful tiled floors to the magnificent clock suspended from the roof, this building is well worth a walk through. The shops are pretty interesting too!

A walk back in Time. If you have the time and you are on a walking tour, this is a place where you need to stop and go back in time. Words can hardly describe it, you need to see it with your own eyes.

Great place. We happened on this mall by accident but were so happy to have found it and thoroughly enjoyed walking through here with the beautiful architecture and had a lovely lunch. Highly recommend!
Beautiful building . Outstanding restoration. Beautiful. The most upscale shopping I've seen plus numerous excellent restaurants. Well worth the time. All visitors to Sydney sound make this stop.
Elegant historical shopping arcade. A beautiful building providing exclusive goods and clothing. Also some great little cafes and restaurants with interesting food on offer. Enjoyed our visit.

Great restoration - worth a detour on your trip. Once a dilapidated building with very limited access housing a variety of shops and the Sydney City Library, a lengthy restoration around 30 years ago now enables visitors to appreciate the interiors of this grand building.
Extraordinary!!. I was in awe of this building and all the glass lead lighting and tiled paved floors. Just beautiful. We also had the most magnificent choc dipped fruit from a cafe in this building.
Fill your senses. Almost a Spencer Street Station. The world passes by. What do you want??? It has it and it feeds out underground to all the amazing shopping of Sydney Centre

Very Nice . A well preserved classic in the heart of the city transformed to good use. The exterior is very appealing. I was in awe walking through the building even when i did not go into any shops or stop to grab a bite. Piece of art!!!!

Immerse yourself in this beautiful building. An iconic building rich in history with modern shopping and more on the inside. Great cafes, shops and beautiful architecture to take in. Spend a few hours in the Queen Victoria Building and don't forget to take your camera.

Great shopping. My sister and I had a great time shopping here. Lots of nice shops...many of the usual upscale retailers and some unique boutique stores. Many good options for having a snack or light meal, as well.
Lovely shopping and special for afternoon tea. A lovely shopping area, lovely atmosphere and ideal for a special,morning or afternoon tea experience.

Beautiful old building housing a huge variety of shops. This beautifully restored old building in the heart of Sydney has many levels of shops to satisfy all tastes. From the Qheen Victoria Basement where you find top brand crockery cutlery glass wear etc etc at amazing prices to the top women's labels and everything in between you can spend many hours browsing throughout. Town hall station is accessed from here

Victorian Heritage. That classic feel of the Old Victorian age mixed eclectically with modern day concept stores raised a shiver through my spine. How could a place be maintained, turned into a mall, and with a train station below. The architects and engineers must have put a lot of effort to conserve the building and creativity to turn itinto a functional place while people going around have a sense of the past. By 2085, the people of Sydney will be opening up an envelope from the Queen, herself.

an old building with lots of shops on several floors. Lots of expensive shops in an architectural treasure that is worth a trip just to see how a shopping center used to look before there were shopping centers.

Gorgeous carvings. Indeed a beautiful architecture though I do not know much about it. However, I'm not into shopping malls and shopping complex (i consider this as one of it) so, I just spent about an hour or maybe less looking around. For those who are into it, maybe you can pop into one of the fancy cafes and try the tempting macarons and cookies.

Shopping......................... Whatever you need you will find here. Lovely restored arcade with a wide array of shops and eating establishments. Located in the heart of the city lots of transport or easy walking distance to most hotels.
Back to Victorian Age.... Hi guys, this building seems bring you to the Old Victorian Age..inside there are a lot of shops, there a train station and the atmosphere is simply amazing!!
good to visit. always good to visit and walk through shops can be expensive but the building is beautiful and very historic a lovely old building and well worth a look
Breathtaking!. Love the grand architecture of the building especially the wooden escalators! Crowded and busy as usual but worth the visit!
So much individuality under one roof. An eclectic collection of mostly individually run shops. Do try afternoon tea in the tea rooms on the 3rd floor

Great architecture and good quality shopping.. Easily the best shopping centre for visitors to Sydney. Get a glimpse of a historic building (inside & out), which is now repurposed as a shopping mall, on 4 levels (including underground). Don't take the elevators! You'll miss out on the great stained glass windows in the middle of the building, and do go to the top level, to see the historic clock, which feature hourly shows.
An experience. There is always something different going on. Reminds you of yesteryear. Like the tea room on the top floor. Real tea served in a teapot and lovely service.

Female Shoppers' paradise in Central Sydney CBD. This iconic century old building in Sydney's George Street is a female shoppers paradise. Men are welcome -- but the vast amount of goods on sale are designed to cater to women. having said that, there are numerous small cafes and pop-up type restaurants -- some with kitchens so small that they can barely contain a stove, let alone 5 or 6 busy staff. However the ambience and food quality are great. This shopping precinct is well located with easy underground access from Town Hall Station and is directly across the road from the renovated Sydney Hilton Hotel. A great spot to retreat to after an exhausting few hours shopping !

QVB to the locals. Great arcade / old building which was nearly demolished in the 1980's but thankfully was saved. It has some really nice looking restaurants, loads of shops and toilets underground. Also has an underground passageway with shops) to the Westfield centre. There is a great Dr Seuss shop on the top floor and also a really interesting clock hanging from the ceiling.

An elegant shopping centre. The Queen Victoria Building is near the Town Hall, it is opposite to the Hilton Hotel. There are several cafes serving English afternoon tea sets and there are a few shops selling fancy high-end goods.

Old Time Class. Sydney doesn't have much of the old world charm left but the Vic Building still retains its old world charm in abundance. Free to walk around. Forget the overpriced shops.Check out all levels not just the ground floor. Nice tea room upstairs but a bit expensive

enjoy the opulence. QVB had undergone major refurbishment to maintain the opulence of the past and merge it to the present.You can't help but marvel at the ingenuity of the colourful mosaic designs that withstood time. In fact it has that wow factor at first sight. it grants you an insight to the rich historical past when no expenses were spared.There is a transition from old Town Hall at one end and then as you walk through all the interesting boutique stores with cafes/restaurants sprinkling in between, back into the modern day concrete buildings when you exit..The collapsible iron gates for the old fashioned lifts provide another peep into the past. these or the curved stairs will lead you to lower and upper floors of more surprises.There is plenty to savour for the architecture historians, and there are plenty to window shop, from pink diamonds of Musson jeweller to boutique curiosities.Do look up at the many-faced clock, and if you come in December, you will see one big colourful shinning X,mas tree Definitely worth a visit
Architecture. Beautiful building with fun shops and food. Great place to rest with free WiFi. Access to trains and buses. Central location for meeting friends.

Always a pleasure to visit. An excellent example of how the old and the new can blend well. Also an excellent place to catch up with friends over a meal or coffee/tea followed by shopping or browsing in shops.There's a very good selection of cafes and restaurants as well as shops from well known high end brands to the more affordable.

Great shopping area with a history. This is no ordinary shipping place. History, shopping and good food all under one roof. The shops are varied from high end fashion to pharmacies. Great place to have afternoon tea.

Beautiful historic building in Sydney. The Queen Victoria Building covers an entire city block next door to the Sydney Town Hall. It was built as a market in the late 19th Century and had many incarnations over the years. It was beautifully restored in the 1980's and is now full of upmarket shops and lovely little cafes on its four levels. If you get off the train at Town Hall Station you can even walk straight through the lower ground floor of the QVB and follow through to link with the Myer department store on the other side of the road. There is a large dome in the middle of the building and at Christmas time a huge Christmas tree stands in the lobby reaching up into the dome, covered with Swarovski crystals. There are two fascinating historic clocks hung from the ceiling on the second level which are fun to watch as characters move around at certain times. A great place to shop and then meet for coffee or lunch.

Wonderful to visit. The restoration of this wonderful old building has created a place of beauty and enjoyment. There is a wide variety of shops to cater for the varying needs of people - fashions to chocolates. Many different cafes are on different levels, giving a great variety of delicious foods.The interior of the building itself has so many sections on every level that delight the eye - and don't forget the clocks!Definitely a place to visit to shop, to dine, to admire.

WOW.. Loved visiting this old building with it's interesting shops. Most a bit beyond my budget but none-the-less good to look at. Lucn on the 2nd floor at Celinnis(?) spelling doesn't look right, was great as well.

Bring your $$$$ with you. We frequently like to visit here in the heart of the city,if your looking for a unique item or a particular brand then here's your place.I haven't purchased much here recently because it's a little costly but the times I have I've been pleasantly surprised if your in around the city come take a stroll through you won't be disappointed
Truly one of the most beautiful shopping centre. Shopping or just strolling around the shops at QVB is always enjoyable. The building itself is beautiful, and each shop is beautifully designed.

Definately worth a visit. Restored in 1986 the building now houses interesting upmarket shops and cafes. There are tunnels to other main shopping areas so its an all weather option for a very hot or a rainy day.

Shopping Shopping Shopping. Everything is here from models for kids to designer clothing. Don't forget the many cafe's. Opening hours are long and 7 days a week. It seems the higher the level in the building, the more expensive/exclusive the shops are. But you can still find a bargain or two so make sure you discover the whole building.
Elegant building inside and out. Been here many times and its elegance is maintained well. The best photo I have taken in my recent to Aussie is in this place.
Beautiful architecture. This building did not disappoint. Stained glass windows, metal circular stair cases and high end shops.

An beautiful edifice transformed into a luxury shopping mall. Not to be missed, this fantastic building is stunning. I was there at New Year and Christmas tree was still in place. It stretched from basement to the roof, and was draped in Swarovski crystals. Cafes selling pretty mouthwatering cakes and pastries. You need a half day just to soak it all in.

Shopping. Great icon of Sydney with wonderful architecture. Great shopping on the upmarket price scale with designer labels and shops. Good cafe/eating options in line with upmarket atmosphere although on the lower levels which connect to underground rail network and other shopping options plenty of other eating options to suit various other budgets and shopping experiences.
Ornate Shopping Mall. Although many of the stores you will find throughout the world, the beauty of this historic shopping mall is worth a stop.

A shoppers dream. Stayed in the Hilton, just across the street from the QVB, designer shops covering everything, a shoppers delight. Nice little cafe inside too. You could spend a lot of time wandering around, and a lot of money if you so wish!

Too late to shop. We arrived to late to actually shop but to be honest, we probably couldn't have afforded anything anyway but the building itself is worth going to see. Wonderful architecture, worth the visit
Goregous place and the higher up you go the better. Spend a coffee or tea gazing at the building the clocks and busy shoppers. A delightfully elegant way to spend some time in Sydney.
Breathtaking. On the free walking tour this building's history is explained. Afterwards you must take the time to return and let your eyes feast on the splendour.

What an amazing historic building. This is my favourite building in the world. A big call i know. The kids love the beautiful model train on display. There is a great toy shop and great gluten free dining options.

A great place to shop. I stumbled upon this beautiful building in my walk around the city. If you want a one stop shop for all your needs, this is the place. It's 4-5 levels of any type of store you might need. The bottom level is actually "underground" so you will end up coming out of another building entrance if you wander enough. I was able to get some NYE accessories and makeup done here. Even if you don't feel like shopping, you might just want to check it out for its grander.

Fantastic shopping surroundings. This really is a shopping centre not to be missed. The architecture of the building is stunning and it houses some lovely quality stores. The surroundings are so nice it is just pleasant to sit with a coffee and watch the world go by!
A Sydney icon. The interior of this arcade is gorgeous, plus the shops are very appealing. Great place to browse, admire the architecture, have a coffee ...
Good shopping. Nice way to spend a rainy day. The shops are varied although not cheap. Best to walk around and enjoy the architecture and shops but it can get really crowded at peak time periods.

Wonderfully restored building and worth walking around. The restoration job undertaken has been carefully and lovingly done. There are so many things to look at in the structure of the building and in the range of shops. Some of the food is very good and was taken back at the range of cloths and the art work available. The down side was that much seemed to be overpriced and your paying for the privilege of buying in the market not for the quality of the goods. I checked out Gould prints and they were very expensive compared to other stores I have visited but the range was huge.
Interesting. It's a good point to know if you are visiting Sydney the 1st time, but you don't have to much to do there.

So British.... If you're in Sydney and you are going shopping you cannot skip it!!!! It's such a beautiful building full of shops and restaurant. You can easily connect to other shopping centers in town and have a great time. The big clock hanging from the ceiling is an attraction of its own.

the place to go first for shopping and fantastic building. finding this building and its shops saved our day after a disappointing visit to Darling Harbour. Its next to Town Hall station and central to other major sydney shopping streets

Not too exciting. Walked through to have a look for the first time in many years. Sad to see the ABC shop has disappeared. Seemed to be a narrow range of shops - manly expensive womens clothing stores or lolly shops. Toilets were a bit shabby.

Stunning old world architectural. This building is well worth a visit for the architectural features and old world charm alone! Shopping is amazing for those inclined with cafes on all levels. Central to other main shopping venues. Make a day of it!
What a beautiful building. Not ono is QVB an amazing, historical building, but it is also a one-stop-shop to pick up a perfect gift for someone else (or yourself!).

Something for everyone - coffee, shopping, lunch and history. One of my favourite places in the city. Great to grab a coffee on the way to work or browse the shops after work or meet your friends for lunch during the day!For visitors, take the time to visit the upper levels the clock chimes on the hours, there are some great cafes and luxury shops on the higher levels. You can easily spend 2 or 3 hours here browsing the shops and soaking in the scenery.

Lovely unusual shops, beautiful decor, gorgeous clock and tiles. We enjoyed our quick visit to the ever lovely inviting interior of this beautiful old lady. All the shops are special and there is a great choice of places to sit and people watch or to have an intimate coffee or meal
Spectacular.. The building is a masterpiece but don't do any shopping s i is way over priced except maybe stop by for a coffee. They did a good job in doing the place up.

Beautiful. This is a historical building that was originally built in the late 1800's as a marketplace and now is a modern day shopping mall. It encompasses an entire city block and has everything you need; designer brands, Dr Seus store, sushi, tea room, gourmet chocolate, Chinese food and amazing architecture.

Very stylish. This is a very stylish mall with great architecture inside, I liked a lot fin the siecle elements there. Also both clocks are great. Generally it is very pleasant to walk around there even if you do not buy anything.
AWSOME PLACE. The place is really nice it has the best shop for me Hobbyco it is a bit busy as it is on top of Town Hall station

Nice architecture. It is a shopping mall now with a very nice architecture from the old days. Try the vintage elevator. There are many coffee shop and restaurants inside as well as statue of the Queen Victoria outside.
Visually Stunning. A beautiful historical building with a modern interior mixed with original tile flooring and excellent shopping. Worth seeing.

Beautiful Building. QVB is a beautiful heritage building. At Christmas they have the most incredible tree in the centre. It has a number of floors with lovely features and to add to that it has a number great places to eat from cafes to resturants. It also has great shops from designer to the usual shops in shopping malls. Add QVB to a must see when in Sydney.
Surprised. Was amazed to find this beautiful building in the middle of Sydney - absolutely stunning. Loads to see before you even start on the shops of cafes. Stay a while
Good. This is a building where you can exchange your money for goods and services. It is pretty though and well air conditioned.

Beautiful Old Buiding. A must visit on any trip to Sydney - beautifully restored Victorian building right in the centre of the city. Stay and have breakfast and sit at a cafe - take in the views from every angle then take a stroll through all the specialty shops.

Window shopping. A building to explore, and perfect on a cold rainy day. The shops were mainly beyond our experience and budget, but there are lots of cafes and restaurants. A good site for photography.

Lovely building. There is something for everyone here. It was so easy to get to by train - get off at Town Hall and the underground connects you to this building. Lots of shops and quaint places to eat. The Dr Seuss shop is awesome to look thru. Watching the clock on the hour is also great too. If you have a child who loves toys and models then Hobbyco is a must - my son was amazed with this shop and spent an hour looking at things and deciding what to buy. On the ground floor is an awesome kitchen shop too. Even if you don't buy anything the QVB is just a great place to go and wander.
Just lovely. Lovely old building to walk through. Love looking at the design and features of this building. Just a gorgeous place to visit.
What a fun place. What a fun place to window shop and people watch! Beautiful inside and out. Everyone is so friendly.
A marvelous feat of architecture. This is really a lovely building to explore. The outer walls and structure are beautiful and the interior is superb. A must do whilst in Sydney.

Fantastic architecture for a commercial mall. If younare not going in peak time, is a good place to stay and visit a lot of shops. The architecture is fabulous and you feel in an open area even when you are inside a large commercial mall. There is a large range of very interesting shops.

Beautiful Old Building. Beautiful architecture in this fine old building. The shops are lovely but very high end shopping. We had a lovely breakfast at one of the restaurants. Highly recommend the QVB for the building itself.
Worst shopping in Sydney. Always very dirty, stuff selling in this old building always over priced, hard to get to as the underpass is a maze, really not a big deal

Beautiful building!!!. It is a beautiful building! There is an interesting clock in the middle of the building ! Do go upstairs to have a closer look! If you get tired just sit down at any of the cafes to have a cup of chocolate or coffee! Lots of shops as well !
Only for the architecture .... High end shoppers frequent here. We admired the beautiful ornate dome. Spent 10 mins at max here. Give it a miss unless you are looking for branded goods.

Beautiful old building with great shopping. The building is big with many shops in it. It has at least four or five levels and some good shops. The architecture is amazing and well worth the visit, even if you don't want to shop!
High Tea. What a stunning historical building. The shops here are very expensive housing all the exclusive brand names. We came here for High Tea, which I noted was served by many of the cafes.

Shopping, food and entertainment all in one. We live locally so this is a place where we go on weekends. There are a variety of shop and the hourly play on the clock always keeps the little one happy.
Beautiful. A lovely building that has been well restored. A myriad of small shops to browse around in the charming area. The main clock is worth a visit to see on its own

An architectural masterpiece from a more inspired age!. If you are a keen shopper and collector of everything beautiful then a trip to the QVB is absolutely essential! Such a grand array of shops and stores over several levels. Options for those on a budget too. Coffee shops, chocolatiers, eateries galore. But it is the grand interiors and preserved visual details that really stand out. Regally magnificent!

Victorian Gem in the Heart of Sydney. The QVB is one of the finest examples of Victorian architecture in Sydney. Very much worth a visit. The building is now a shopping and dining complex, and is full of very interesting stores and restaurants. However, it is the wonderful architecture that really impresses. The building is beautiful, and showcases the style, grandeur and craftsmanship of Queen Victoria's era. The building has certainly weathered the march of time. It is in very good shape. I enjoyed my visit to the QVB, and took lots of pictures. I recommend a brief stop here when you are walking around the Sydney CBD.

A magical buidling in a magical city. This historic building in the heart of Sydney seems to stand proud in a sea of modern constructions. Its stone exterior draws your towards it and then inside, where you are exposed to more wonders. The architecture inside is breathtaking, and the two clocks hanging from the high ceilings are themselves a treat to stop and ponder. Even when the stores are closed, the two ends of the building were open, allowing me to walk through the empty levels of the building and explore stain glassed stair wells, glass ceilings, and ornate handrails that were just awesome. If you want to shop, visit when the bustle of people make the place come alive, but if you want to soak up the history, wander through after the stores are closed (and it saves you money as well!).
Olde world shopping... Beautiful building, well wort a visi, great character shops.Decor lovely, and portrays an earlier age.
Beautiful Building. Just walk around this place - it's gorgeous. For some reason it reminds me of Macy's in Herald Square

My What A Building. A pleasure to see! Of course it is filled with shops, and places to eat. I saw the old elevator and wanted to ride it just for it's dated look. It was a bit slow, but did get me to the next level. It was busy, as it was during the lunch time of day.

Lovely building. What a beautiful building. We walked in and found it quite crowded. We visited around lunch time, and the cafes and shops were very crowded. There are probably some nice shops to see here but it was so crowded we just wanted to get out. I recommend not going around lunchtime.

City gem. Being in the CBD can be a bit overwhelming, but there's always a bit of sanctuary walking through the QVB. The designer stores offer some top-notch products and the cute cafe's hidden on the upper floors offer some real delightful spots to grab a bite and a decent cup of coffee or tea. The architecture is absolutely beautiful and offers a lovely glimpse into Victorian times. (Also a great way to escape the sun and heat for a block!)

Wonderful victorian style!. The weather in Sydney changes quite often, this is the perfect place for a rainy day! Victorian style is elegant and luxury! There are many details to discover, shops are open and friendly!
Strangely pleasant. An older building containing some fancy shops. Have a cup of tea and some macaroons when visiting. Worth a visit.

just beautiful. Beautiful building to look at inside and outside. Filled with plush shops < watch the pinch.> a great place to muse around and enjoy the architecture, some of its unique features, like the clock, the old lifts, superb tiling and many more.

Elegant and unique. At least, take a stroll through this historic structure and marvel at the architecture. We stopped at an upper-level Italian restaurant for lunch which was lovely. Very high-end shops that looked like they were all very busy!

A beautiful historic building, some interesting sights and shops within.. I was actually travelling between two destinations when I saw the QVB, and decided I had time to take a peek. The building obviously has a historic quality, but the inside has been well maintained (or updated). Although, the stained glass pieces are still elegant, and the clockwork, well, clocks were also still drawing small crowds--even boutique workers came out to look. Sadly, I was barely able to peek at the end of the hourly event. Many shops within would classify as higher end, and boutique-style. If you're looking for brand names, I think there are shopping areas nearby. Within here, you can find more elegant and I daresay classy items, cultural pieces and art, jewelry, and of course, food from fine dining, to coffee and dessert. Hobbyco was my main stop, and they have an amazing assortment of toys, mostly Japanese model building, but also figures. It's worth a stop if you're an adult with the heart of a kid. But if you bring your kids, they might be there a while.

Queen size! luxury shopping and eating experience. It's covered building accommodating a large number of shops and stores, particularly high-end branded ones. You will love Victorian style stairs, elevators, and passages. Very much accessible to railway station. Very good cafes too.

Free and Wonderful Architecture. This Victorian masterpiece is immense and beautiful, as well as being fun. It's a perfectly preserved 19th-century arcade with indoor shops on four levels. The shops are highly varied but mostly tony and high end. Scattered among them are places to enjoy a coffee or tea.I particularly recommend a visit or at least a fly-by look at the top floor shop that sells original old maps and botanical prints. Very, very good stuff.

How beautiful it still is!. Having been working in Sydney back in 2000, it was a great chance to re-visit The QVB in 2016. The many shops seem the same yet there must have been many new vendors from my last experience, yet it all seemed the same, ageless treasure right in the middle of the city with all the specialty shops all brim full of latest fashions or having a mid season sale, more for the ladies but some interest for men. My interest was the ongoing architecture of the place and how it has stood the test of time, it is truly a great must visit place in your list of things to see in Sydney. On the one hand a capture of times past, on the other a current and present personality for fashion conscious ladies - and she enjoyed t, hard to drag her away - we walked end to end and then other end to end.

A shopping mall basically :(. I expected it to be a lot more but has been deduced to a shopping mall.The design and architecture of the building is amazing but the glitter, husstle and bustle of shopping mall has stolen away it's charm.

Just Beautiful. What a beautiful building right next to Town Hall Station. The architecture is stunning. I've been here a few times but I'm usually rushing through. I was fortunate to have an hour free so I took the opportunity to stroll through the levels. There is a wide range of shops but once again it's the architecture that is stunning.

Gorgeous Victorian!. This beautifully restored long rectangular (takes up the length of 1 block)building is full of small shops, has a large clock with moving figures, a statue of a dog outside, and a talking well (fundraiser for charity). Not shops I would normally frequent, but I enjoyed the whole ambience and set up.
High Tea. Beautiful building and shops everywhere. Window shopping is great. The high tea was worth the mo ey so filling
Beautiful building. Even if you don't want to buy anything, it is worth a visit just to wander around to enjoy the beautiful Victorian architecture. The floor tiles are gorgeous too

Dont skip through the ground level. If you find the time explore the upper levels. The relatively new escalators make this very straight forward. There are several tea or coffee shops to explore but there are also many amazing little shops spread amongst each level. Popped into HobbyCo to get some tips of replacing some broken models. Very helpful. But their architecture is the real treasure and renovations have really improved the levels with models carpets to add to the comfort.
Great Italian food. We had a lovely meal at Vanto restaurant. The staff were very attentive and helpful. We had beautiful,pizza and also pasta.

An Historical Building. I visited there on Sunday. There were many shops selling high price fashion and bags but some of them were not open due to Sunday. I spent an hour inside there.There is an aged lift you must try, but I think only the appearance. There is a big clock which was made in England.It is an ancient building which now is renovated as shopping arcade and cafe. It has three levels, it has a atrium in the middle and with corridors at two sides.

Beautiful old building. On our first night in Sydney we ate at a restaurant at the George St. Entrance of the building and went back the next day to stroll the shops and do coffee, lovely old building, beautiful Architecture.

Fortunately they did not demolish this grand old lady many years ago. It is over 100 years since this marvel was built. Although its facade is very nice its interior is even better- one of those buildings that so many devotees of concrete and glass were not able to demolish in the 1960s has been restored to at least its former glory. well worth the visit

Grand old dame with historical significance . On the way to Darling Harbour from the train station, we passed by this grand old dame. With lots of historical background, you can learn more from the daily guided tours that are conducted. You can also shop and eat in this historical place. A lovely place to visit
Filled With Beauty. QVB is one of the popular locations and it is one of my favourite locations.It is filled with great cafes and shops, most importantly one of the most beautiful buildings.

A wide selection of quality shops, cafes and restaurants. This one of the most prestigious shopping precincts in Sydney that offers the world class tea room, a multitude of fabulous and fancy shops selling top brands and at Christmas one of the biggest and most extravagant and impressive Christmas Trees in town! For a touch of class, visit the QVB. You won't be disappointed.

Exceptional Tour. Patient, knowledgeable guide took us on a 90 min tour of this exceptional building. Loved the stained glass and the interesting clocks, go at noon to see the clock perform its theatrics.

Zfantatic shopping spot in the heart of Sydney. This gorgeous old building dares back to the early settled days of Sydney. It is full of trendy shops, cafes, restaurants and art galleries.You can spend a long time strolling thought the four levels and enjoy a coffee and lunch. There is a wonderful old clock in the centre.
Must See. The beauty of this building is amazing. You must go and see for yourself, stained glass, wrought iron railings, restaurants, shops, BEAUTIFUL.

The old merges into the new. Visited the centre on a busy Saturday. Impressed with how the old merges with new within the building. Excellent shopping experience with all the big name brands situated within the centre.
Can get quite busy around lunch time but there are a few eateries; tip, get in before the lunch rush starts around 12:15.

Goregous Architecture, Stunning Attention to Detail. Good selection of nice boutiques and everyday shopping.. Would definitely recommend to those venturing into the city. Gorgeous facade and interior, with elegant appointment of boutique's. Something for those budget conscious or wanting to pick up something simple, unique and special. I always take overseas guests here when they come to Australia. It also links in underground with a number of other stores and cafe's, restaurants.Very well positioned right next to Town Hall station and a 15 minute or so walk from Central station too.
Wonderful upmarket shopping. Wonderful upmarket shopping mall in a preserved heritage building. Excellent and relaxing with clothes and cafe shops
Queen Victoria Bldg. An old building converted to shopping mall for branded products. Nice architectural design though the shops are a bit expensive. It is worth seeing the place too.

Worth preserving. The QVB and the nearby church are two of the finest old buildings in Sydney. Situated right in the centre of the shopping area close to the Westfield Centre the building oozes charm and class. Mostly high end shops inside with a statue of the Old Queen overlooking the entrance.

Beautiful Historic Building. Wonderful Stained Glass Windows. Love the animated clock & old-fashioned lifts. Interesting shops & lots of eating places. My favourite is Cellinis on the 2nd floor. Great coffee, good food, reasonable prices

Beautiful building. Lots of lovely boutique shops. We also visited here at Christmas a few years ago when they have an enormous tree hanging from the ceiling. Lots of original building items. Very pretty.
Amazing transformation. The 'make-over' this building has had is nothing short of amazing. Vast array of quality shops and eateries. It's a pleasure just to walk through and window shop!

The Christmas Tree is a MUST SEE!. QVB is a beautiful building and is a nice shopping centre. However, for me, the creme de la creme is the QVB Christmas Tree. It really is a thing of beauty and a must see for everyone who visits Sydney at Christmas time.

Beautiful piece of history. The QVB is an amazing building. It's like stepping back in time. The clocks are unique and worth a look at. The shops and restaurants cover all price ranges. Worth a look at.
History. I visit Sydney often and always enjoy the ambenience of this property, a bit of old world that satisfies the needs of todays consuming public

Fine architecture - fine retail therapy. If shopping in a beautiful old building is your thing you won't be disappointed. It's lovely. The architectural detailing is superb, the shops themselves ooze a distinctive quality. Great just to look around.

It is an upscale mall. I can't afford the stores here, but it deserves a walk through. Come on the hour, go to the third floor, and take a look at the clock, there is a little puppet show that is peformed.
Lots of history to see.. Loved this old building, so many great shops. And it has a railway station! Went on a Monday and the place was humming. Loved the statue and the little dog fountain outside.

Interesting to see, beautiful building, very upscale shops for window shopping!. Interesting building to walk through. Very expensive shops and eateries. Beautiful statue of Queen Victoria outside in front. This statue was apparently found in Ireland in the 1980's and then brought here.

At least walk through!. A beautiful, historic building that is a must see! Mostly high-end stores, but be sure to check out Victoria's Basement! Not quite the bargains of the famous Boston Filene's Basement, but a great home store as well as good price souvenirs.

Centre for up-market shopping. The Queen Victoria Building (QVB) is worth walking through even if you aren't shopping. The QVB dates from the 19th century. Now it is mainly filled with up market boutiques selling designer goods. The recent upgrade has been described by some as "wrecking rather than restoration." Most shoppers, however, wouldn't notice the difference. The QVB is in the heart of the Sydney CBD

Magnificent Victorian shopping arcade. Fronted by a statue of her majesty, Queen Victoria, the QVB opens up to a multi level dramatic space which has been renovated to offer multiple galleries of high end shopping interspersed with various restaurants with seating under the arched roof of the building. The hanging clock is a treat to behold.
Stunning!. I loved how the original character of the building has been kept in tact. What an amazing place to visit and walk through. Unique shops and restaurants...had a great afternoon!
Beautiful Building. This building is beautiful. It is high end shopping and even if you are not shopping the beauty of the building is worth going in for.
Beautiful building and shops. We loved it here. The shops were lovely, it was a really beautiful oasis in the middle of a modern city.

Stunning, intricate architectural detail throughout!. Yes, of course, there are multiple high-end retail spots to find fine clothes and to eat in lovely places. Yet I'd recommend, to the non-shopaholics, taking a calmer stroll in this beautiful historical building, and soak up the stunning, intricate architectural detail throughout!

Love this beautiful building. Every visitor to Sydney should visit the Queen Vic. builing, all levels have fabulous shops and coffee shops, spotlessly clean toilets. The whole look and feel inside is of past grandure and is maintained beautifully. Don't miss it.
Amazing inside. Be before at least 4 pm, the shops and restaurants are closing early. Beautiful rooms inside, very nice old style lift.
Very expensive shopping. The QVB feature very expensive shops for tourists. There are a few food outlets. We got a smoothie when we visited as "window shopped" as we walked through.

Beautiful building. This very imposing building has now been morphed into a "mall". Upmarket but mall all the same, it was nice to see some independent stores here but would love to see more galleries and workshops and less clothing
beautiful old building. Beautiful, ornate building,tile floors, stained glass. Two magnificent clocks try to be there on the hour to see moving parts. Oh and this is a shopping mall!

Always a grat place to visit. Love the shops and the atmosphere and visit every time I am in Sydney. Good little coffee bars which also serve good food at reasonable prices. Worth a cake and coffee at least.

Wow. A visit to this building is a must. The way that the original building has been adapted for modern times is excellent. It is just lovely to wander around. The cliocks alone are worth spending time at! Pun intended. The stained glass windows are super and the quaint little shops and cafes make this a place worth visiting.

Spend some time here even if you don't shop much. This is a wonderful building. Originally a marketplace and recently refurbished, it is a joy to just walk around in. Hundreds of small shops (mostly high end) and coffee shops too. Beautiful. Wait for the hour and see/hear the amazing clock.
BEautiful outside and in.. Well worth taking time to shop here. No pressure and plenty to choose from. A good rainy day activity.

QVB Stunning. What an experience. It is like stepping back in time on the inside. Beautifully maintained. A shoppers delight...take your money with you though. However if you just want to window shop could not pick a better place. Simply stunning.

Romanesque architecture building in Sydney. QVB is a stunning Romanesque architecture building built in 1898 (118 years old now) and is one of the most beautiful building in Sydney. You can't miss this one if you are walking towards Hyde Park from the Harbour front. Check out the old elevator which is still in working condition and enjoy a cup of coffee in one of the wonderful cafes.

Great part of Sydney heritage.. The QVB is a must visit to anyone who like heritage buildings. This used to be the Sydney market, but it was renovated and turned into mid to high end shopping centre with outlets for most tastes. It is not at the low end of shopping so expect to pay for the location. There are restaurants, cafes and lots of clothing and speciality shops so Google it for the shop you are looking to visit. Even if you do not want to shop, it is a good visit just to see part of old Sydney!
An architecture delight to the senses. Fantastic Victorian era building its all the trimmings. Shame it's filled with overly expensive designed shops that no one visits.
An architectural gem in the heart of Sydney.. This historic building has been wonderfully renovated to a shopping and care complex whilst maintaining it Victorian charm. A must to visitation!
Old world charm. Magnificent historic building filled with shops on several levels and cafes in the atrium. Wonderful place to shop while admiring the building. Not to be missed!

A masterpiece. A magnificient Victorian structure with an impressive statue of Queen Victoria just outside, which is also an attraction. It has stained glass windows, amazing clocks which chime, ancient mosaic designed tiled flooring, antique lift and a grand centre dome. It now houses several branded stores, restaurants and cafes. Luckily, I was there just before the Christmas season and Swarovski put up a huge Christmas tree below the dome. Don't forget to view the sealed letter from Queen Elizabeth. Overall, had a grand time enjoying the beauty of the building.

Spectacular building. This building must be one of the greatest left standing. Beautifully cared for and escalators and glass safety panels have been added so carefully you hardly notice. I'm not interested in shops but displays are classy. But go for the architecture, the history and the wonderful sympathetic restoration. Quality plus plus. Even a letter from HM the Queen and a register of Australian VC holders including some from Afganistan.

So much to enjoy in this beautiful building . Striking architecture with beautiful large stained glass windows which glistened as the sun shone through the coloured panes, even more coloured glass panels to see in situ above shop doorways, original Victorian flooring which looked perfect within this setting, balustrades ornate and stunning, unique Clocks depicting Aboriginal scenes and so much more to see without even venturing into the many shops situated within this Building. Well worth taking time out of a busy schedule to visit. This Building must have appeared even more striking (when first built) to the people who had the pleasure of being able to afford to visit all those generations ago

Beautiful Traditional building. It is a joy to see such a beautifully maintained Victorian building in the middle of all the boring modernity surrounding it.
The interior is quite spectacular and is well worth a walk around.Absoloutely fantastic toy shop on the top level.Beatifully decorated with such lovely detail,sadly missing in most modern buildings.
Magnificent.. It is good to see theses marvellous buildings preserved for all to enjoy. The shops were very good as were the coffee shops.

Visit to QVB. Whilst in Sydney on business last week, I popped into QVB and did a bit of window shopping.
A great variety of shops of all levels, with friendly staff at the 5 I went into.
Well placed in the Sydney CBD and a good venue for shopping and eating during the day.

Beautifully piece of history and great shopping spot. I absolutely love this building. Architecturally and historically it is beautiful. There are plenty of retailers in this building to take advantage of however, I am recommending this place more for the building and history of Sydney

Beautiful building. This is a must if you are in Sydney because, apart from the architecture, it is great for shopping and it has good places to eat and drink. Don't miss the Bargain Basement which is like an Aladdin's cave.

Very impressive building. A must if you're visiting Sydney I think. Spectacular clocks, stained glass and architecture. Have to admit I barely noticed the shops themselves - which probably isn't meant to be the point!
Great place to shop. Wonderful building, great shopping expereince with very nice places to stop and have a coffee or glass of wine.
Wonderful!. A brilliant collection of shape with all you need to have a good day if its raining outside. Also plenty of places to eat.

Queen Victoria Building. Queen Victoria would be proud to have this beautiful shopping arcade named after her. The Victorian architecture is stunning and well cared for. Loads of shops, cafes and restaurants

Grand old dame. Beautiful architecture that brings back old charm if you are one who is looking for this. There aren't many of such buildings in Singapore so it's really nice to visit one that brings you back in time. Nice place to spend an afternoon browsing. This mall retails mainly branded stuff if you are looking for these.
a must do and see in Sydney. the stained glass and original titles are so worth the visit...the clock which chimes on the hour is so much apart of this historic building of Sydney a MUST DO SEE

Showing the family history. First time daughter had visited Sydney and we had limited time so it was a must visit place. She enjoyed the splendour of the old and the mix of the new, we saw the clock chime. Wow

gorgeous. Even if you're not into high end shopping, or like me have no funds to do so, it's so worth it to just saunter in here and absorb the atmosphere of the building. Tall ceilings with vaults and classic architecture with ornate staircases and glass windows will blow you away. Make sure you have a cheeky look at how the escalators were installed retrospectively to the building! They are suspended off the giant trusses above. Interesting!

Elegant and classic building. Beautiful, elegant and classic building in the central business district of Sydney. Go upstairs to have a look on the greatest hanging clock on the southern hemisphere. Have a cup of coffee and a piece of cake to indulge yourself in such a warmth and classic atmosphere. Lots of stores there to look around.

Where The Benefits of Modern Architecture and the 21 century Merge. This beautiful Victorian building with beautiful stained glass windows is home to a large variety of specialty shops and major brands.This building is several stories of shoppers heaven. There are several European eateries too. You could spend hours exploring this place but bring your credit card.

Gorgeous Victorian Architecture. What a find in the middle of the bustling city. This beautiful building with ironwork, tiles and windows of another era was fun to walk through. We did al floors but the basement and enjoyed looking in the store windows as well and all the architectural details. Beautiful eating places were everywhere an d the food looked delicious.

Beautiful old building. Immaculately maintained, this building is on several levels, with scores of shops , many high-end, and cafes. Large skylight roof keeps floors well lit.Some lovely features, including a very colorful dome. A great attraction.

Wonderful, classy, traditional shopping arcade.. the QVB is the central hub to shopping in Sydney. It has numerous retail outlets, cafes & superb architecture including huge decorative clocks. Make such you pick up a floor plan as the different levels - especially the lower ones can be confusing, especially as they connect to lots of other areas of the shopping district.

A step back in time.. By Sydney standards this is a very old building dating back to Victorian times as implied in the title. It is very ornate laid out on 4 floors with a couple of very impressive clocks (made in England) hanging down from the ceiling over the central atrium. the shops are mainly designer outlets so if you are looking for a cheap and cheerful item of clothing this would not be the place for you! Still well worth a visit though for the atmosphere and architecture.

What a beautiful building!. Its so reminiscent of the great arcades in London. As an architect, I enjoyed seeing the beauty of the building, in and out. I loved the interior shopping/ dining arcade. My wife and I found our breakfast at Parisi within the arcade to be our best breakfast of the week in Sydney.

Beautiful. The building is stunning both inside and out and has lots to offer. It is certainly worth a visit with its shops and lovely cafes. You could easily spend a few hours in here and it is perfect for relaxing.

Take out your wallet!. This beautiful old building was restored in the 1980s to its present glittering self. High-end shops, cafes, restaurants, and just plain gorgeous to look at inside and out. The tile work and glass work are amazing. Have a coffee and look out the window at the café of your choice. Or just walk through to experience the atmosphere.

Beautiful mall, amazing interior and exterior architecture. This is a very large interior mall in Sydney. Multiple floors, including below street level.There are stained glass windows, amazing atria, and many, many other fascinating architectural details, as well as a very large number of stores selling virtually everything.It's quite large, and will take some time to cover all the floors.Definitely worth a visit if you are in Sydney.

Stunning. We visited QVB on a walking tour and went back for a better look. The architecture is amazing and we saw new things each time we looked. Take a look up and check out the two clocks, but make sure you see the English clock on the hour which gives a four minute show. Brilliant.
Must visit!. Beautiful architecture, rich in history and delicious breakfast chartered in house. They open at 10am, so dont get there too early.
Beatiful building even if you aren't in to shopping. The building is quite lovely to look at, even if you aren't there to shop. Lots of stores and eateries. It's well worth a walk through.

Make sure to see this building. More than just a shopping center. The building itself is worth looking at, a gorgeous building inside and as well as out, the architecture is beautiful. Enchanting historic old style building, look at the beautiful stained glass windows and tiled floors.constructed between 1893 and1898, 30 meters wide and 190 meters long an designed as a marketplace, . The name 'The Queen Victoria Market Buildings' in commemoration of her Diamond Jubilee.  Easy to get to by public transport as it is just meters way from Town Hall railway station. Well worth a visit just to see the building itself.

Amazing architecture. This building done in typical Romanesque revival style of architecture is huge and covers an entire block bordered by George, Market, York and Druitt streets. Presently it is converted into a high end Mall which contains innumerable shops and stores and cafes. The interior decorations are amazing and the tiled flooring is so beautiful.A great place to look around and if you have the money then shop by all means,

Royal Shopping Mall. It's a royal building with the old British architecture and large royal clocks. There are numerous high end stores inside the building and nice cafes. One can spend a few hours here viewing and shopping. The entrance of the building is stunning with a huge statue of Queen Victoria of Britain.
Wonderful architecture. We came here with im free tours and there is lovely shops here and architecture of building is wonderful ,check out the talking dog outside

Old meets new. Beautiful building showing all the old architecture, stained glass and large period clocks. The inside is loaded with high end stores and quaint restaurants and pubs. It's 3 levels of old time elegance and beauty

A Sydney Gem. QVB is a wonderful old Sydney gem that has been beautifully renovated and maintained. Worth spending an hour or two shopping and grabbing a coffee or something to eat and one of the many cafes or eateries. Check out Hobbyco on Level 2 (for kids of all ages).

lots to discover. Such a great place. Nicely renovated, pitorescqe quiet place. I can recomand a visit to the rest rooms. The powder room for the ladies is a great find and the gents also seem to enjoy the visit. Very Interesting is the special clock hanging down from the cieling.
Wonderful Building. We were staying at the Hilton so the QVB is opposite. Stunning building with wonderful shops. Fantastic to see it has been preserved in such wonderful condition.

wonderfull. I thought that it was a nice place to visit three levels odd shops
but the place is not overwhelmed with shops

Gorgeous well-preserved Heritage Building. QVB is right across from our hotel, Swisshotel Sydney. The building has beautiful architectural details and wide range of interesting shops. It was our favourite haunt during our stay in Sydney

Very exclusive. More shops, with exxy price tags. Reminiscent of the Figgins Diorama in Melbourne years back. Many of the shops suited to the high end shopper. Love to look, but out of my price range.

Shopping extravaganza. This outstanding shopping mall provides everything that could possibly satisfy retail therapy.We were drawn into the building by its excellent Victorian exterior with the intentions of window shopping and having a coffee. We left several thousand dollars lighter with an assortment of clothing, handbags jewelry and artwork.The atria are splendidly adorned by clocks and during the Christmas season a superb Christmas tree constructed by Swarovski added to the extravagance of this fascinating facility.

Worth a visit, great if you are ready to spend some money. We went in as part of a walking tour then came back to do some site seeing and shopping. It does have a bit of everything but be ready to spend money.
High Tea. The Queen Victoria Building has the best High Tea and the price is very good. We enjoyed the setting and the variety of food,

I got of the U/G train here and was amazed as i can up the stairs what a building. History history history what a great job they have don't here its like stepping back in time the dress shops and Coffee shops are great stop of here for a morning or afternoon tea break its truly worth taking you time out here as you pass via Sydney city
Very very grand and classy. This building so amazing! The architecturally it is simply amazing and the atmosphere it creates is amazing.
great shopping and coffee. A must see when in Sydney, weather you just want a coffee and a bit of people watching or some high end shopping QVB has it all!

Astounding Historical Gem Gleamingly Restored. Well worth a stroll through this magnificent late 19th century structure, now made into a shopping center. Trendy shops in a pleasingly restored setting.

Very grand. QVB occupies an entire block on George Street and is a model of period charm. Built in 1898 it went through many transformations and at one stage it was scheduled for demolition to make way for a car park. Fortunately someone exercised good judgment and it is now a shopping centre housing all you want from boutiques, shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.

A regal shopping centre. We had an auld statue lying around of Queen Vic, so we shipped it off to Sydney. They were delighted to get it, we were delighted to get rid of her! A lovely shopping arcade which was nearly lost in a previous era. Great shops. Great atmosphere. Great spot. Great food. Check out the underground tunnels. Very enjoyable. Maybe slightly dearer than other spots. Has it all.
vintage, beautiful shopping building. An architectural, heritage building, unique atmosphere, lot's of unique stores and tasty foods. It's definitely a must see if in Sydney.

Lovely Victorian Architectural Building. The Queen Victoria Building (QVB) occupies an entire block on Sydney's George Street, and has over 180 of Sydney's high-end fashion boutiques, jewelry shops, home wares, and restaurants. Take a ride on the antique elevator up to the 3rd floor and have tea at the beautiful restored tea room. The main features are the center dome; glorious stained glass windows and splendid tile floors. Don't forget to view the sealed letter, that is not to be opened until 2085, from Queen Elizabeth of England.

Fabulous!. I can thoroughly recommend a visit here. The architecture is amazing with two stunning clocks to admire. The mosaic floors and stained glass windows are amazing, lots of photo opportunities and a step back in time. Several eateries where you can refuel in wonderful surroundings.

Beautiful Example of a Bygone Era. It doesn't matter about the shops that line all floors of this magnificent building as they don't detract at all from the architecture and the stunning vaulted ceilings and central clock. I happily walk through this building every week just to look and to imagine. The tea shop on the 1st floor is a little gem as is the tea room on the upper floor. The building is beautifully maintained. A Sydney Icon.

Beautiful Building With High End Fashion Stores - Pity about the Escalators. The Queen Victoria Building on George Street consists of four main shopping floors with lovely tessellated tilework (much of which is original, particularly under the central dome), stained glass windows and ornate arches. You'll find high end fashion stores to browse, restaurants and cafes here. The building was refurbished in 2008/2009, including new escalators that take you up to the first and second floors. For me, these escalators just seemed out of place. They were designed "to be seen as a new sculptural element" - minimalist and modern. I'm not sure I would agree they're a "sculptural element". Personally, I didn't like them at all.

Interesting shopping centre. This is definitely a great place to enjoy heritage buildings. It is a fantastic old building and shows off the elegance that was put into its initial construction. The clock centrepiece is remarkable.The shopping area is relaxed clean and inviting giving the building the feeling of sophistication and class. Worth a look.

An architectural wonder. The QVB building is a must for any visitor to Sydney - not only is it beautifully built and maintained, for those people who like browsing and shopping it has so much to see and buy.Do not miss the clocks - they're a wonder of the building
Just stop by. My freind told me, for someone first visit Sydney, this is a must to come. I follow.Just stop be to take a few picture but if you dont come, you dont miss anything. Ha!Ha!Ha!

Not a big Deal!. It is a shopping center in a beautiful old building. Not a huge attraction for me. Everything is spread out over 3 or 4 floors that are accessible by elevator and or inconvenient escalators. I do not recommend going out of your way to experience this shopping center - do your shopping at home.

Gorgeous Grand Dame. The QVB is probably the most beautiful building in Sydney with quality stores. Walk all the levels and you will be charmed by the architecture and decor. It is especially magical at Christmas with the giant Christmas Tree in the centre.
style and eats. everything you want to find in an arcade great shops, tasty food, unique atmosphere, easy to get to , and something for everyone

Just Beautiful. Do not waste your time walking around just go to Queen Victoria Building and you will find every thing that you want to see just in one place very decorative attractive nice ambient people so happy and very good coffe shops and restaurants as well.
classic deco. nice place to go, as one can appreciate the historical building and do shopping at the same time.you would find most Aussie brands available, easy and comfortable walk.

High end shopping. Gorgeous building inside and out, the architecture is amazing. Most of the clothing stores are high end designers. There are also many elegant cafe's where you can have a meal. It's definitely a must see if in Sydney.
elegant reminder of the past. Full of great architecture as well as history. Lots of shops and eating places, a real hub in Sydney.

Shoppers delight. Besides the wonderfully atractive and unique shoppes in the mall, the building itself is magnificent and not to be jissed. Wonderful art gallery of aboriginal art and the best pastries and breakfasts in Sydney are also in this mall like building.

Lots of good cafes, bistros, tea rooms, Asian cafe in the basement. Aside from the beautifully restored building over four levels, the international and local boutiques for shopping, there are lots of cafes, coffee bars, bistros, a tea room, ice creameries and an Asian sit down cafe in the basement serving good value noodle and rice dishes. The QVB is always a good place to take visitors to have morning or afternoon tea, coffee, lunch, dinner. All of the eateries have reasonable prices and deliver good choices of menu. With the Town Hall train station below ground and all buses stopping at QVB it's easy to get to for everyone.
Great Christmas decorations. Worth a wander if you're in the area, as a very elegant building. Lots of expensive shops to browse too.

Wow!. Make sure to see this building! The high end shopping is worth the window shopping....and the architecture of the building astounds the eye. Check the lower level shopping for reasonable stores that connect to the train station.

Always busy but worth a visit. There is quite a lot here if you look around, from Victoria's Basement for all things kitchen, more fashion stores than you need toys and models and of course lots of eating options. The building itself is also worth looking at as it is quite beautiful. As with most busy places worth going early to beat the crowds. Given its central location it is easily accessed by train, bus or taxi/car (although these days worth avoiding driving as parking is difficult and expensive).
Incredible architecture!. We didn't go to any of the fabulous shops inside but enjoyed the beauty of the building itself. Lots to see inside -- clock, stained glass windows, floor tiling.
Good Shopping and eating in an architectural gem. Even if it isn't raining (as it was for us) this is an interesting place to visit, with nice shops and cafés.

All time Favourite Australian Shopping Centre. Close to my heart is QVB as I know every nook and cranny having had my office in the northern end of the building near Tea House.Old markets came alive again and redesigned to house great multi level shopping and eating and architecture that never cease to tire me.Not to be bypassed ,a must to do the tour of the building.

QVB is amazing. This building has so much history. It was to be torn down but was saved through public protests. The building is beautifully restored. Well worth a visit. Town Hall railway station has direct access.Christmas time come and see the Sawoski Crystal Christmas tree.
Shopping lovers dream!. This building is incredible! Plenty of mid-range and high-end fashion labels, cafes and specialty stores. Can't go into the city without visiting the Queen Victoria Building.

Grand Old Lady. One of the most beautiful Victorian era shopping centres in the world. Wonderfully restored. The building is an attraction in its own right and well worth looking at both inside and out. I always take my overseas visitors to have a look at it .
queen victoria building. loved the ambience of the whole building, but things were too expensive for people on a tight budget and not many inexpensive eating places

A little bit of elegance in the CBD. A beautiful older lady, just one of the many architectural offerings in Sydney, with her rich detailing in the tiles, stained glass windows, sandstone carvings and heritage lifts. Just gorgeous. The shops are high end and expensive, but also have lovely things to look at even if you can't afford them. Look at the Dr Seuss gallery, have afternoon tea in the cafe at the northern end at the very top or a chocolate from the chocolate shops.The QVB is well worth a wander through.

Beautiful old building. What a charming and beautiful historic building. I don't recommend the Chinese restsurant - very commercial and not good and the shops leave much to be desired but the building itself is a masterpiece.
A wonderful location for old-style window-shopping!. With lots of high-end stores on the middle levels, be sure to visit the top level for the view & the galleries and the ambience!
up to day mall in old building. must see its very nice old building with an ancient floor that the best way to observe is from the 5th floor. very pleasant and impress mall.

For history lovers and shoppers. Shoppers: Everything from expensive designer clothes and jewellery to cheap eats and bargain homemaker items.History lovers: Amazing stories and architecture reflecting an era of decadence, excess and poverty. The stair cases and stained glass windows are glorious. Something new to see at every turn. Allow a few hours to walk around and be amazed.Look over the balcony on the top floor-picture perfect.
Historic building. The Queen Victoria Building is one of Australia's most historic buildings. It has very beautiful architecture and lots of shops to look at and a few great places to eat!

Beautiful building, lovely cafes and shops. You'll find a great variety of shopping to do here, from designer wear down to bargain basement prices for homewares. Take your time to discover the building and enjoy cake and tea at one of their lovely cafes!

A must visit. Even if you do not plan on buying anything, you should make a point of visiting this mall. It is absolutelly beautiful inside and out. Make sure you go to the top floor and take pictures from there. It gives you the best perspectives. Fabulous.
Old and good building. It's an old building with a shopping mall inside it. Expensive brands shops inside the mall and very impressive mall. Outside the building also very lively place

Queen Victoria Building. We enjoyed a wander through this beautiful old building, just near Town Hall station. The most amazing shops line all levels of Queen Victoria Building, as well as cafes and restaurants. Although we did not buy any gifts, we enjoyed an amazing Italian lunch overlooking the levels below. A must for your visit to Sydney.

Takes you into the architecture of the past. What a beautiful building. To think a few years ago this building was undergoing hard times. After major reservation, this is a great place to visit. Very Unique !!! A must see.
High end shopping. It was great to see this historic building being put to great use! The shops are very nice, high-end designer merchandise. It's very pretty and posh.
I love this place. Every time I come up to Sydney I always wander around here and I always stop to have a coffee or breakfast,
Lovely stately retail. A classic old building full of great retail and shops, good fast means on the ground floor, excellent people watching and arch details

Expensive. This is a wonderful shopping location with more shops than we could count. The architecture is amazing, and a feast for the eyes. However, as much as we love this spot, shoppers with and eye for a bargain will find no joy here.
Beautiful Building!. This building is amazing with beautiful features! It is filled with high end shops and a lot of people, but well worth the stop in to look around!

If you are totally cashed up and a shopaholic you will love it. Do not get me wrong....this is a wonderful building from an architectural perspective, but it is now absolutely full of high end designer shops which I believe are attractive to shoppers from Asia rather than from Australia. I only saw a handful of locals there having a coffee in one of the cafes within the building. In the past there had been a much greater variety of shops in this building. I can only guess that the designer shops are capable of paying larger rents for spaces in this place.

A "shopping mall" like you''ve never seen!. This late 19th century building contains some of the most beautiful and unique shops in the city. There are many cafes with tables outside the shops to see activity around, below and above you. The beauty of the building is awesome. Many shops exist on the first and second sub levels of the building, including the one leading directly into the Sydney subway system.

I wish I had more time !. We had been so busy doing all the touristy things around Sydney and unfortunately only found a few hours on our last day to shop. We came across the QVB ... It was absolutely lovely and it was an awesome shopping experience. I truly believe that I did enough damage in the little time I had there and it's probably a blessing for my bankcard that we had to fly home. I will however definitely be going back there for longer next visit to Sydney.
All kinds of good things.. The restoration and inside of this building are remarkable. Many of the shops as high end but food is great and just seeing it including the tile floors is fantastic.

Historical with character. The Building is clean, and a great place to shop with a plethora of shops, cafes and it's a arcade building you can just wander around. Central to Sydney and many other shops, if you are in the City just take a look, the 2 clocks are also amazing in design and size, you can't miss them!
Beautiful Antique Deor. I love visiting the QVB, if only to look at all the old decor. But it also has amazing shopping, fantastic cafes and the one of the best High Teas available around.

Great place to meet, eat and shop. It is always a delight to visit the QVB. You can always find a good place to eat - third(?) floor preferable - and a range of offerings from a simple coffee or tea to something more substantial. It's easy to make this a meeting place for catching up with friends. The shops offer a good range whether you are seriously looking for something or just window shopping. I always love the NY Museum of Contemporary Art shop and the angora shops, plus anything to do with paper/books/parchments. It is too easy to spend money here but you end up feeling you've purchased something special. Mission Jewellers are also worth a visit.

Journey back in time, to the Victorian Era in Europe. The decor is posh, with tiles for clean elegance, and lined by shops on both sides of the arcade that reminds you of 1960s Europe. There are a variety of shops and eateries - in short something for everyone. There is a wonderful coffee shop- Jet Bar Cafe ( a bit noisy, if you are discussing business), and delightful Australian Chocolates- Haigh's. A must visit place in and around Christmas, when the giant Christmas tree decorated by Swarovski crystals magnifies the beauty of the QVB.
Charming.. Great place for breakfast, lunch and shopping. Lots of quirky small shops along with high class stores. The clock is a must to see.

Hub of activity in a building with history. The QVB is an iconic building in the Sydney CBD full of fascinating shops that cater for all tastes and wallets. In the basement is wonderful bargain shop where you can buy some great gifts to take home without paying a fortune. On the first floor, where you enter from George Street, there are a number of cafes which all sell gluten-free food. On the higher floors are the designer-label stores for those that can afford Sydney prices. That makes it sound just like an ordinary shopping mall but it isn't, this is one of the oldest buildings in Sydney. The upper floors are like minstrel gallerys that overlook the cafes and all the shops have a lovely 'olde worlde' feel. Make sure you look up when you reach the base of the dome in the centre of the building. A great place to visit that shows how a modern mall concept can fit into an 1890s building.

Queen Victoria Building. A must see for it is a beautiful building full of exciting fabulous shops and great eating places for you to enjoy a yuppie lunch. Take your money for the shops are not cheap. Just to go there and just look at the fabulous glass panels, ornate ceilings and all the splendor that surrounds you everywhere you look.

A beautiful heritage building in Sydney. One of the most beautiful heritage buildings in Sydney CBD, the QVB houses some of the finest fashion boutiques, jewellery shops, housewares, cafes and restaurants. This place is definitely one of the city's most prestigious shopping centres, in my opinion.During the Christmas period, there is a giant Christmas tree located in the centre of the building. Decorated with the branded-name diamonds, it is known as one of a must see Christmas tree for tourists. Come to spend some good time with friends here during your trip in Sydney, it's worth to visit!
Good Shoping. We found the shopping very good had a great buzz,they have very clean and good rest rooms ,this is a must to know when in a busy city like Sydney

Beautiful Building. I recently visited this building during the Sydney Chinese New Year Festival and many of the shops had their windows decorated with Chinese decorations for the occasion which looked fantastic. The Pandora shop even handed out good fortune cookies. The centre of the building was completely decked out with lanterns with small monkeys entwined with it. The Tea Rooms on the very top level is a must do..very elegant, very yummy and great service. A wonderful venue for that very special occasion.

Large array of shops in beautiful historic building. A wander thru the various levels of this centre is a good way to escape the heat or rain. Lots of interesting shops, recommend Adriano Zumbo cakes, for takeaway afternoon tea and Victoria's Basement for great value , high quality kitchenware.

Walk back in history. I remember mny first triup to Sydney and seeing this old, decrepit building, boarded up and apparently ready for demolition. One a return visit a few years later I couldn't believe the transformation. The Queen Victoria Building is one of Australia's best preserved structures and home to dozens of high and middle end shops. Every part of the build boasts period features, from the animated clock which attracts crowds every time it "chines" to the tiling, true to period paint colours and ornate ceilings and mouldings. It's well worth walking through and if you're catching a train it even offers direct access to Town Hall Station.

Highlite of Shopping and History Combined. The Queen Vic building has been restored to its former glory.The shops are predominately "Label" shops and not so cheap. The variety is excellent. Restaurants are very good and affordable. The Christmas tree fills the 3 storey void during the Festive Season and is worth a visit on its own.Definitely worth a visit in the heart of Sydney.
Yesteryear charm!. Do not miss this vibrant and attractive shopping area in Sydney city.Great shopping and dining areas with lots of variety. Easy access by train and bus.

Grand old Sydney building, excellent craftmanship. I can remember visiting the QVB when I was quite young. The transformation into a shopping hub has been done very well, but the shops are all trying to compete with "the top end", with some of them not quite up to it. I am not a shopper, but even though it is still a grand old building, I can't see myself going back unless showing people around Sydney
a must see. Even if you don't shop here, you must stop by to look and experience this unique Sydney building. Absolutely gorgeous!

A Grand Old Shopping Mall. The Queen Victoria Building was built in the 1890s and originally was a market place. Today it is restored as a shopping mall. It still has some stained glass windows and an old clock and a domed center. A huge brass statue of Queen Victoria in flowing robes is located outside. There is also a small fountain and a black Scotty dog statue to the left of the Queen's statue. The shops inside are generally small boutiques. There is a coffee area in the middle. It has beautiful architecture!

A place worth visting. This is one of the oldest buildings in Sydney, which now acts as one of the largest malls. The structure is breath taking and I'd highly recommend it to anyone visiting Sydney to spend time walking through this building.

worth it for the architecture. This is a spectacular building with such character and detail. Make sure you use the old elevator as well as using the stair well if you're able to walk up and down stairs easy. Look out for the clocks which you view from the upper levels. The shopping is pretty generic so don't get excited about what is essentially the stuff you'd find in a Westfield shopping Mall but the building is brilliant - look outside too and look UP as the statues are gorgeous.

BEAUTIFUL BUILDING. Beautiful building and glad we walked to see it because as we walked from our hotel, we enjoyed seeing the OUTSTANDING architecture of Sydney buildings. However, we found the MERCHANDISE OVER-PRICED.

Perfect for shopping . Everything in one place. You can shop non stop while enjoying the beautiful architecture and the history of QVB.The building connects to the underground station which is the best part for whoever likes to go around the city by public transport.

Well worth a look. This is a very interesting building with plenty of history that was rescued from dilapidation and restored to glory. Well worth popping in just to see the staircases and interior or if you have more time grab a coffee or visit the shops.
