Iconic building housing some great shopping and food. Shopping here is lovely as you are off the street and enjoying walking though the old building. Browse upmarket stores for interesting gifts.

A must see on a visit to Sydney. This 19th century shopping arcade on many levels is up there in the world class. It has shopping and food experiences to meet the most discerning shopper. The building is worth a visit just to enjoy its classical beauty
Historic must see!. Probably our most beautiful building in Sydney along with the Strand Arcade, the architecture is beautiful. Shopping and eating are just the bonus!
Lovely building . Great old building with nice shops, although all a little high end. Top floor was quaint. Facilities clean and a nice floor and the clock chimes pleasantly. Very central

Jigsaw QVB opening soon. A shopping centre with serious character well worth a visit great food, great shops, the building has immense character and is right on top of Town Hall train station plus Jigsaw will be opening soon 1 collection now across 11 countries.

Great city landmark.. Renovated in 1986 this stunning old building now houses an upmarket shopping centre with many top designer shops. Quite striking when you walk in from Pitt Street I immediately noticed the slant on the floor. Look up at the fantastic click. Historic in the centre of the CBD.

Visit The Queen. Shop with a difference !!!!! Instead of visiting the usual malls and department stores, try going to The Queen Victoria Building in George Street. The architecture and stained glass windows are staggeringly beautiful and there are stores of every variety within the fabulous interior.

go on the hour to see the clock. magnificent building with gorgeous shops (well out of my price range) the ceiling is just beautiful, you'll come across at point while wandering around so you might as well pop in and have a look. The clocks move on the hour.

A must see.. This building is the most fancy, posh I've seen. Really really beautiful. Really really expensive. The design inside is like a museum in Italy. The tiling on the floors is out of this world....so so different. Coffee stops all along the walkway. Very cute. Take your $$$$$ if you want to spend up big. I could only afford coffee.
Great Shopping location. This is a superb upmarket shopping location with lots of interesting shops assembled under one roof.
Qvb. Very beautiful old building. Got lots of shops inside as well as cafés. If you go to the middle of the building you will see a beautiful clock as well as during Xmas time the biggest Xmas tree.

Beautiful Building with Fine Shopping and Tea Rooms. We stopped in on a rainy day and what a welcome sight it was -- an historic (1898) building jam-packed with locals and tourists enjoying the three-plus levels of stores and restaurants and home to two fabulous hanging clocks that mechanically celebrate the hour. This place is delightful inside and out. Don't miss it.
Sisters. Beautiful Building. Worth a look and a coffee to see the beautiful architecture.Use the lift and the powder room and walk down the staird for added experience.

Historic architecture with modern shops. This chic shopping domain in the heart of the city is a shoppers paradise with the latest boutiques,cafes restaurants and underground walkways to other well known department stores.
Parking also underneath but its dear.

Exquisite building . Just good to look at, which is all I did. Cannot speak on the shopping or dining experience. Clean bathrooms as well. I passed through this building for 2 reasons - to use the bathroom and as part of the Imfree walking tours. It's a very elegantly designed building - British style.

Again a great shopping venue and coffee spot..... The shops have changed and mix slightly different and down market since the last visit 3 years ago. Well presented shops and lots of great places to have coffee and watch the world go by.
amazing architecture..... Many trips spent here exploring the fabulous architecture and the amazing shopping outlets. great cafes with good buzz.
Absolutely gorgeous. Although the stores aren't that great (in my opinion) the inside of this building is absolutely stunning. Everyone must go visit.

magnificent historic building. Paid a visit to this iconic building in the heart of Sydney in January. It is now a very upmarket shopping centre, but well worth a visit for the architectural value alone. Such an impressive building

so many shops so little time. I think the title says it all. Everything from high end to budget fashion is available. Plenty of places to eat and have coffee. Best kitchen shop that you always buy something in. Plan to spend a few hours at the QVB building to really appreciate what it has to offer.

Beautiful building with plenty of shopping. 3 stories of shopping to satisfy most people. However the architecture and clock in the center are an attraction just by themselves. At Christmastime there is a 3 story tree with Sarovski crystals that light up.

Beautiful building. In the heart of Sydney is the stylish QVB built in the 1890's and now an up market shopping mall. I was there at Christmas and the decorations and tree were fabulous, lots of expensive shops and restaurants inside.

What a nice shopping experience . I am not a shopaholic, but I totally would become one of all shopping centers would look like that. The site is simply impressive and it create such a nice atmosphere of uniqueness. I totally cracked for the Coach bag and I totally blame those surroundings for it ;)

Disappointing. I always used to make a point of going into the city every year in December to see the Xmas decorations in the QVB and the windows at DJ's. But after several years of disappointment over the last few years I wasn't going to bother this time (although ended up there anyway), there's no magic there anymore; which seems IMHO to be the general tend for the whole building; almost all the old fixture stores have gone and it's all these over priced designer tat - which wouldn't be bad, a bit of luxury is what the QVB is all about, but so many of those shops just sell the same thing, the variety has gone. Nowadays the QVB is just a building I have to walk thru to get from Town Hall Station to Pitt Street Mall, (which I realise also sells over-priced generic tat but there's a slightly more variety and slightly less expense)
Classic still young Building QVB. The one of Landmark you must go. Beautiful architectureAddress is 455 George St, Sydney NSW 2000Location in the central business district of Sydney
Historic and Modern All in One. Many levels of modern and unique shopping experiences. Spend hours looking through the many specialty shops in a beautiful piece of history.

Amazing architecture . The QVB is great for food, and shopping as well as for people who enjoy amazing architecture. If you are looking for peace in the bustling city just go to the top level and have high tea and watch the incredible clock tick away.

Stunning building! Great for a stroll. . This is a beautiful mall, with very upscale shops. Go there and experience the English tea time! Watch the people and stroll the many levels. It's huge! Lots of Rodeo Dr kind of shops, but a few non-franchise ones too. On the bottom level, the lower end shopping goes on forever, and connects to another shopping center! Great for a rainy day!

Worth a visit. The building is beautiful. The shops a mixture of high end and high street brands. Some great cafes. Its free and just to see the building and the stained glass windows etc anyone in Sydney should take time out for a visit.

The QVB is just Timeless. The QVB, always a stopover point when I am in the city. Simply a breathtaking building for the architecture, add the vast retailers...Global and local brands...Some of the best coffee to be had in the city of Sydney.

Beautiful building. The building is beautiful inside with wonderful stained glass and tiled floors. Boutiques and cafes make up the entire building. Great place to sit and have tea or coffee. I also chose to have a piece of pavlova and enjoy the atmosphere. Also a great place to sit & relax.
A special place to take visitors. Enchanting historic old style building with lots to see. Australia is only 200 years old but this building was built with class for Queen Victoria.

A Royal Treat!. I would list this grand old lady as one of Sydney's premier attractions. Four floors and a basement of interconnected Victorian elegance, housing a host of speciality shops such as New York Metropolitan Museum and Dr Seuss. The intricate Hobbyist model railway is always great fun to watch. Two very interesting clocks perform on the hour, and there is a host of eating places - mostly quite classy. There are modern escalators between floors, alongside the historic old cage lifts, and (for the men!) an amazing central urinal designed for a male quartet. We come here every time we visit Sydney!

Lovely building . This is a gorgeous building. The clocks are unique and whimsical. It is an easy building to just pop into four a few minutes our to linger four some shopping or a quick bite at a tea shop our bakery.

Amazing old building with a new lease on life. This is a building that was redone in the 1980's into a high end shopping mall.Museum shop, art, tea, clothes and jewelers abound.The building itself is gorgeous but bargain shoppers should check out Victoria's Basement for deals on kitchen and housewares.

Amazing . We went to enjoy some shopping and look at the historic building. The glass windows and clock are beautiful. The only annoying part is there is no signage letting people know the hours of the shops etc.

Queen Victoria. Beautiful icon in the midst of the city and shopping district.
However, there was a construction outside the building.
It was a good visit.

Window shopping in notable surroundings... . The elegant & extensive arcade is located in an historic building... Spread over four stories the inside views were very appealing... There were many elegant stores of designer-labels that we chose to browse rather than buy... We booked ahead & enjoyed a traditional afternoon tea at the 'Tea Room' restaurant on the top level (as opposed to the Palace Tea Rooms on the Level One)...

Fantastic building. Fabulous building with two amazing clocks that require close up inspection to admire the craftsmanship. The stained glass windows and tiled floors are beautiful. Lots of lovely tea shops with fantastic cakes and pastries. Other shops to tempt you to buy, clothes, bags etc. Well worth a visit.

What a beautiful building.. We went into this shopping centre to look at the historic building and it was gorgeous. The big clock is amazing and so detailed and the ceiling dome is beautiful. Check out the Hobby Shop on the top floor!

Stunning historic building with elegant shops. Although the QVB is a shopping complex, the elegant atmosphere of this beautiful historic building make the shopping secondary. Shops range from cafes and standard mall far (Strandbags, The Body Shop) on the basement level to elegant and very expensive specialist shops on the top levels. There is a range of foods to suit any budget or palate. Well worth visiting just to see the building itself.
Wow what a building!. If you are going to shop take heaps of cash or credit cards! If you are going to look at the building it's priceless!Strongly advise you go for the latter.....
beautiful building. the building is very beautiful ... its a good place to do both window shopping and shopping.... it has many eateries also..

Shopping with style. Start at the top and work your way down. Gorgeous tile, stained glass windows, carpets in the halllway, vintage elevator, and at the end, go back up and have tea in the tearoom. My husband was wearing shorts, and no one blinked twice. It was lovely, and he's a grumpy Marine who doesn't "do tea" but even he left happy. We rode the train from central quay and exited,at Town Hall. The malls are all attached, and it was easy, easy to get there and spend a few hours.
Superb and interesting!. Love the building although very expensive shops. Loved the clock and the powder room. A little bit of Victoriana.

Beautiful building. We started on the bottom level of the building, where there are a bunch of low-end shops and eateries and thought- ugh, it's just another mall. But as you go up the floors, you see the beauty of the building. It was Christmas time, so there were nice decorations but other than that, the bldg didn't seem like anything particularly special. Sorry...
Trendy-ish attraction. A nice shopping attraction at the heart of Sydney CBD. Trendy-ish shops, but rather expensive. Excellent coffee shops.

Beautiful old building given over to Boutique Shops. Imagine a building to honour Queen Victoria whose imperial statue stands to the South of the Building and an expensive restoration. Then instead of making it an oasis of history and culture linked conveniently to Town Hall Station and a building for public use, convert it into a four level shopping mall of trendy designer shops and little snooty cafes. A better mix of development would have seen some more culture and history retained.
Amazing location. We chose the QVB to have our Wedding photos taken, couldnt have picked a more picturesque location. Amazing Building

Beautiful spot!. Admittedly, I don't like malls. But QVB doesn't really feel like a mall. I visited during a crazy rainstorm and was amazed at the beauty of the place. There are plenty of places to grab a bite. I had a delicious piece of cake at the Old Vienna Coffee House and then wandered the floors. It was a great spot if you want to escape the rain, get some AC or pick up a few things!
Impressive Building. Beautiful architecture, very impressive building...the only building with lovely Christmas decorations...some beautiful shops, don't forget to look for the clocks...

lovely building. this is a very old building housing a shopping mall it is lovely to go into as its a great building the previous time we were here it was early December and they had a Christmas tree up in the center that reached up all five floors it was magnificent !!!!

Superb clock. This shopping arcade is full of designer name shops and consequently is expensive. The highlightis the central clock which has three different mechanism showing the hour, minute and seconds. It s quite fascinating just to sit and watch it. If you like shopping this is the place for you.

The historic centre of Sydney. Beautiful old building, that is just worth visiting to admire it. The old clock structure with diaromas is an absolute classic.Plenty of boutique shops and eateries to browse through and get a meal or snack.Make sure you have a look at the Dr. Seuss gallery - takes you back in time.Try to go in an off-peak time though - can be very busy.

Beautiful old building. If you are visiting Sydney make sure to wander through here. It has been lovingly restored and filled with a wide variety of shops and cafes. It also links Town Hall station to the shopping area around Pitt St Mall, a great way to walk in inclement weather!

Great building - plenty going on. This building is full of shops and eating places that fit brilliantly into such an ornate space. Had breakfast here looking down a couple of floors and it was a great place to do so.

A Step Back in Time. This historic building gives the visitor to Sydney an accurate feeling of how Sydneysiders used to shop. Heritage listed and very impressive to not only the locals but visitors as well.

Beautiful building. This is a truly beautiful building. The colors are amazing, the stairways are dramatic, and the clocks are ornate! The place itself is so lovely it almost doesn't feel like a mall. The stores are fun to walk through and there are some unique things to purchase. It is also connected to other shopping centers, which on a hot day... Rocks:)
Great building full of Boutique shops. As part of our "I'm free " walking tour of Sydney we walked through the highly ornate and very busy QVB building. Full of shops and eateries :)

Absolutely breath taking. What is great about this shopping complex is that if your husband hates shopping he will just enjoy walking around looking at the beautiful architecture. What an amazing place. They have done so well with the up keep of this building. Truly magnificent even if you cannot afford to buy anything in the shops :)
Shopping Paradise. Great place to shop, brilliant building with excellent shops for all tastes and budget, a must see when visiting Sydney.

Shopping center or cathedral?. So much of Sydney is consumption oriented but they do a first class job of it at the Queen Victoria Biulding.Be sure to stop by this beauty as you walk down George Street, you won't be sorry. I went in the evening when the shops were closed so I was able focus on the architecture, clocks, and stained glass.
Beautiful shopping experience. If only the "malls" of the world could emulate this beautiful and surprisingly peaceful arcade. Yes, it is very British, but totally gorgeous. Check out the Clock :)

Must stop if in town. We found this building via trip advisor. I took our Christmas family photo at the Secret flower chamber at the top level. However our baby was fussy that day, so the photo result was not satisfied. Have some chocolate dessert at the basement.

Iconic Building. Whether you like shopping or not ( unfortunately my wife does ) this is a very beautiful old building and worth a stroll through. Even if you do not wish to purchase anything, most shops are mid to high end you can certainly stop for a coffee and a cake and simply people watch within this lovely old building which has been brought back to a very vibrant use.

Delightful shopping arcade. must see if visiting Sydney. Grand old shopping arcade with some decent high end shops and above average cafes across its levels. If not buying, still worthwhile to wander through for the 19th century architecture.

Beautiful and interesting building. This building has gorgeous stain glass windows and architecture from a bygone era. It's clean, bright and spacious and has a good range of shops and cafés. Highlights are the famous Royal Clock that has animatronic displays on the hour, the spiral staircase, detailed stained glass windows, and at Christmas the giant Swarovski crystal adorned Christmas tree.

Lovely shopping center. This is absolutely beautiful with an amazing crystal decorated Christmas tree during xmas. There are two old clocks aswell and it is generally just. A really different shopping centre. Be warned though, most of the shops are of the more expensive brands but worth a walk through any ways even for backpackers.

" Modern and Historic at one place ". Nice to visit when it's close to Christmas
Decoration and lighting are fantastic at night time
Highly recommended to visit if you are in the area.
Nice place to see. Old style shopping centre with retail shops, cafes and others. This building is old and kept in good condition.

Lovely Building. We didn't do any shopping, but did have a quick lunch and snack. This is a lovely building to just wander through looking at the shops, but more impressive is the architecture. We would certainly go back if we just needed a pleasant hour or so of just looking around

Nice lunch in historic place. We had lunch in one of the cafes on the ground floor. this building a so beautifully restored and we were there at christmas so all the decorations were up. Every floor has different character and going to the top to see the ceiling is worth it.
great shopping. so many shops and access underground so if its raining a great place to hide, there is food courts and can even get access to Town Hall train station.

Time Warp. Modern shopping in an old frame - not sure the prices are so good - but definitely not to be missed if you are in the area - we walked in Pitt street came out a block away - get lost in time and space - the old architecture will take you there.

Beautiful building. Having lived in Sydney as a student in the mid 80s, I remember the excitement when the Queen Victoria Building was reopened in 1986. I seldom visit Sydney these days, but on a recent weekend stay in the city it was a priority to visit the QVB. We just wandered through each level, not actually shopping though. I enjoyed a good coffee upstairs at the Old Vienna Coffee House, which was much quieter than the cafés downstairs. The clock is lovely, though I remembered it doing more when the hour struck?? We were there at 4pm. I don't know if my memories have embellished over the years, or the clock has changed!

Another landmark to see while visiting Sydney. love getting lost in here, I love the "Fat Buddha" restaurant in here too, best YUM YUM and the service is one of my favourites. There is a fatherly like gentlemen that always offers fun service.

Beautiful Building. we walked through this building very quickly -however if you are in the area...it is worth a visit...it's lovely inside..shops for purchasing high priced items...the clock inside is amazing-- truly a great building

Intimate Shopping Experience . Very beautiful historic building with upscale shops on several levels. Love the charming old lifts. Very narrow and busy middle walkway. Limited air conditioning which was difficult to shop on hot days.

Queen Victoria Building.. Completed in 1898 by Architect George McRae, it is of Romanesque style, it consists of 4 main shopping floors, all beautiful shops, and lovely eating choices.
There are two lovely clocks on display, it also contains 33 scenes from Australia history.
High Tea. The weather wasn't very good for several days during our visit so we attended high tea in the Queen Victoria Building, a great way to spend the afternoon.

A trip back in time. Nothing equals the excellence of the decor of this building. Great shops but huge crowds.
Even if you don't by anything you are so in awe of the history of this place., the experience is worth the visit

Very impressive. The architecture of this place is quite splendid as is the interior. It was Christmas time when we where there so the place was seasonally decorated. It have a really pleasant feel about it. The beautiful clocks and the floors are carpeted . Mostly its just small shops and coffee shops selling the most tempting delicacies. Great place to sit and have a coffee.

Beautiful building in CBD. The building and the architectural detail are absolutely stunning, most especially the floors and the windows. The building houses several floors of high end shops worth a browse. A welcome diversion from the many ordinary commercial buildings along the commercial urban strip that is George St.

It is a must.. Now this is perfect if you want to look at a great place this is it.There are great shops to suit all tastes and also very good cafes to treat your self .The history is magnificent you will want to take lots of photos from the gallery .if you are unfortunate to get rain you can easy spend time in here and shop till you drop.

Gorgeous old building but carry a big wallet. This is a gorgeous multilevel historical building right in the heart of Sydney. It has a beautiful interior with amazing architecture, furnishings, tiled floors and stained glass windows. Many of the designer shops stock luxury items so you would need a big wallet to make a purchase. It is worth making a visit even if only to window shop.
QVB is worth seeing. Queen Victoria Building is nicely renovated and worth seeing. Two clocks (one in each wing) are very unique. Lots of interesting shops to visits and some good eating choices.
SHOPPING IN SHEER BEAUTY. This beauty is not only beautiful but all the shops found in this building is so beautifully decorated n tastefully set out so it makes you want to keep going back for more.

Great Architecture. The QVB is right at Town Hall and this old building has great arhuitecture. Great to look at and lots of shops inside, although alot of them are trendy high end expensive shops. Well worth a visit if you're in Sydney.

QVB step back in time. A wonderfully restored building. We enjoyed a salad for lunch and then a magnificent chocolate delight from zumbo. In the second basement level we found an outlet shopping market specializing in main brand crystal, crockery and kitchen homewares. Prices were great (eg waterford cyrstal glasses $49 for 4)

Old world charm. This beautiful building houses one of the best shopping areas of Sydney.
Easy to get to by public transport as it is just meters way from Town Hall railway station

Stunning Building!. This building is in the middle of the Sydney CBD and is absolutely beautiful. I would recommend for anyone visiting Sydney. Doesn't take long just a few minutes to have a look around.

I love this place!. The QVB is a gorgeous place to spend some time: shopping, dining, people-watching. Whether you approach it from the street or the subway, the building is stunning. It has been beautifully restored and the leadlights, wrought iron, clocks and ceramic tiles add to the experience. You certainly don't have to be spending a lot of money to enjoy this place.There are five floors (2 underground) and an enormous variety of shops. It is both a wonderful tourist attraction as well as a practical place to go shopping or meet a friend for coffee.There are lifts and stairways as well as escalators, and the rest-rooms are clean and spacious.it's worth hanging around on an upstairs balcony near either of the two lovely antique clocks to hear them chime the hour. One of them even has an at times gruesome animated show that runs for about 5-6 minutes once the hour chimes.I visited on a rainy day, and was greeted by a little stand at the doorway that dispensed a plastic covering for the many dripping umbrellas that were being carried in. A nice touch.

An Icon. For me this is unmissable when in Sydney. It is a Victorian building of great charm and has been restored to its former glory.Yes it is full of shops but there is a great variety amongst them.the cafes are charming and varied.Well worth a visit if you arein the town Centre

Beautiful Building. This building is beautiful - especially at Christmas, but it is really just a large shopping mall. There are a ton of tourist in there, so it is crowded from open to close. I would recommend just walking through to see it, but unless you want to shop no reason to stay.

This building made me gasp!. What a fabulous shopping mall. I visited at Christmas, where the decorated tree soared from basement to the top floor. Fantastic shops and cafes. So beautiful. Don't miss visiting this place if you visit the Darling Harbour area of Sydney.
ARCHITECTURALLY MARVELLOUS SHOPPING. This is a must see shopping centre. Saved from demolition by a stroke of luck, it has been transformed into a shopping mecca with fantastic boutiques.

Something old and something new.. Queen Victoria Building is one of the most interesting places in Sydney, often missed by visitors. It has rich history and the architecture is very interesting.It used to be a market and, to some extend - it still is. Except no live stock/fruit/vegetables are sold there anymore. It's more like an upscale type of a market with Luis Vuiton and Coach goods, inside. The building has fallen in disarray for a while but it was restored and it's now a hidden gem in hustle-and-bustle of Sydney's Central Business District, just steps away from the Aquarium and the Opera House.

Beautiful!. First visit and well worth seeing. What a great restoration of a landmark building. Many levels of fine shops and places to eat. Many are unique. Well worth a walk through even if you don't shop.
An Elegant Shopping experience. A beautiful walk through this classy shopping mall is worth a visit. Up market shops and food outlets are there for your enjoyment.

Fantastic building!. If you can appreciate the historical features of a building, you will love the QVB. With many levels leading to various shops, eateries and train stations, you won't find yourself too bored or without things to do/see.
Great Shopping. Great shopping in a historical building in Sydney. Enjoy some shopping with cafes and many levels of shops. A must see while in Sydney.

Worth a stroll through.... Beautiful interior... glass, gilt, iron work and brass. Shops were unique, but very specialized ; e.g. luggage shop with only one brand and style ??? Worth a walk thru and maybe a coffee but n9ot a shopping mecca.
Old building. Architecture of this building is beautiful. Lots of store mostly pricy but great for window shopping.

Delightful!. This wonderful old building has been beautifully refurbished and is full of trendy (and expensive) shops. But to see the Victorian splendor of the building itself, the historic clocks hanging from the ceiling, and grab a coffee and people-watch; it shouldn't be missed. We visited at Christmas and the decorations were spectacular.
Not much to see unless you want to shop in expensive shops. I had heart a lot about the QVD but I'll not return to this place. It was just a lot of exclusive and expensive shops.

Can feel claustrophobic. For those into architecture the building is worth a look.
If raining its an undercover route to and from the Townhall station.
Plenty of stores inside for the shopper.
Amazing Christmas Decorations. Second visit to this incredible centre which was enhanced by the Christmas Decorations and very large tree reaching to the top of the building.
Boring, but nice building.. Just your typical shops downstairs. High end on higher floors. Same old, same old. Building is gorgeous though.

Some stunning architecture.. Worth a visit just to see the building itself. Beautiful stain glass windows, grand marble staircases, spiral wrought iron staircase and of course the clocks. For the shoppers designer labels and boutiques.

Cool in more ways than one.. This is a beautifully restored building that houses three floors of up-market shops and cafes. On a hot day there are few places better to wander around and enjoy an iced coffee.

It's majestic . Been in Sydney a couple of days and used to pass this building and never went in until today it very very beautiful with it grand Victorian pillars and the wonder tower clock in the center. The floors are colourful with hundreds of monarch tiles that people walk on and never take the time to just stop and look. The floors have central balcony that in circles in the middle of the building. There are shops of fashion top shop, Karen Miller, Bally, Coach, Pandora, Orton, Michael Kors, Mission and coffee bars and other things to temp the shopper. If you climb the 4 flights of stairs which curl in the middle of the building feel grand and powerful.. Just visit this place in the day or better at night as those fantastic bulbs are illuminated. This a great place to visit and take your camera.

Glam from the past. This building is very beautiful and its lovely to walk through and if you time it right watch the clock do its thing. The shops are mainly for rich folk but still nice to window shop. You can get a coffee and sit and watch the world go by.

Terrific feel and good eateries and shopping!. I often eat here when in the city as there are plenty of options. The other benefit is the train station is directly underneath which makes it very easy to access and then an easy walk to the mall. I would highly recommend it as the architecture is lovely to look at also.

Beautiful building and stunning architectural features. We went in early Jan and the crowds were overwhelming. Despite this we enjoyed walking around and looking at the stunning features of this beautiful building.Be sure to check out Haighs chocolates at the entrance - yum!Be sure to miss the Vienna Cafe up near the top floor. Food was substandard and very highly priced. We went there as everywhere else was full. It is no surprise that this place had empty seats, we would not eat there again.

An elegant old charmer!. What a great old and wonderful building! We visited based on the recommendation of locals who raved about the gigantic Christmas tree. We weren't disappointed. The tree went up all three stories in an interior atrium. Astonishing sight. The building is full of wonderful shops, galleries, and cafes. Definitely worth a couple of hours of your time.

Beautiful old building great shopping. Worth visiting - near Sydney town hall. Lovely architecture. All kinds of shops including plenty which would be of interest to overseas tourists. Great store on upper level with Aboriginal artworks.

Absolutely gorgeous building. Go here just to marvel at he building even if you don't want to shop as it is beautiful. Amazing stained glass windows, majestic staircases. Lots of lovely shops with many designer labels but I just window shopped, apart from buying some Zumbarons for the Adriano Zumbo little shop. Make sure you explore all levels from the exquisite tea rooms at the top to the budget area in the basement. From the basement you can take the escalators up to the Myers store, then go across the walkway and into Westfield shopping centre where you will find more everyday type shops.
Dont miss a visit to this wonderful building. Christmas time just makes this building a must to see. The Christmas tree was wonderful. I love the shops and food outlets

Second time - just as good. Love this shopping venue. This was our second visit to Sydney and made a point of visiting the 'QVB'. There is something so 'swish' about this building and those that are vendors here. Of particular interest to us is the Metropolitan of Art Store and the toy store on the top floor.
Shopping central . There are lots of retail therapy opportunities here with a wide range in an amazing heritage building.

Gorgeous old building . Talk about stepping back in time when entering this beautiful old building! . .the shops are certainly first class and the attention to detail with floor tiles and beautiful timbers used..the haighs shop out the front was my favourite

I prefer the Queen Victoria Building over The Galleria in Milan.. Genuine Architecture of the Victorian era. Many boutiques and Bistros. Many different cultures in these, managed by people from all over the world. I have lived in Sydney all my life except for periods of overseas work. Even so, whenever I am in the city I call into the QVB for coffee. You will see people of all races and countries visiting and photographing.
Many lovely shops. The shopping is lovely and is accessible from town rail station under cover even on a rainy day would be able to walk without getting wet the building is a historic sight

Sydney history. Whenever I am in Sydney,this is my first stop for the day.I always have a coffee on the ground floor and watch the passers by and soak up the atmosphere.It is a beautiful historic building with plenty of shops to browse or buy in and each floor is beautifully restored. A must is the clock tower ,which chimes on the half hour and hour.

Beautiful building - worth a visit . A beautifully kept heritage building in the centre of the city. Loved seeing the stained glass, the huge clocks and the beautiful wrought iron staircase to the very top! Also home to the amazing Haigh's chocolates!

Great Rainy day activity. It was raining cats and dogs so went shopping on this amazing historic building . You can enter underground so you don't have to cross roads and get wet - bonus ! 1 . History dating back to 1800 lovely stained glass windows , ornate balustrades and special clock tower to watch on the hour as a show . 2 we went from top floor to bottom. Not as busy at top as expensive stores but great for wandering around and browsing. An amazing map store located on loop level worth a visit if you like history and maps 3. Toilets best at top level not as many ladies waiting and very clean. 4. Lots of shops and cafes / restaurants . Sit outside and watch the world go by. An easy way to relax for an afternoon - we had great coffee and cake at the Vienna cafe - expensive but a real treat .

Looks like an old building from London. The building reminded me of an old building in London. Queen Victoria Building holds lots of designer shops and there are also a few eateries. They have some great fudge there.
Beautiful building. This is a beautiful building to visit.Shops within are of higher end merchandise and food/beverages are also on the pricey side. Great location for people watching.
Ok to visit if you have time. Although the building is indeed beautiful, this is more a shopping and eating place. Loads of shops and eateries to choose from.

Swarovski Christmas tree - breathtaking.. I've never seen a Christmas tree like it - the Swarovski Christmas tree in the beautiful QVB building took our breath away. Stunning and a must see come Christmas time. I love the old world charm of this building - always lovely to walk through and visit the shops whilst in Sydney.
Beautiful building. This is a lovely building reminds me of the buildings in London England especially Burlington Arcade, There are lots of designer shops and a few eateries.
Don't miss QVB. I really enjoyed browsing around the shops. Quite busy but I did go on a Saturday afternoon. Good selection of shops.

A step back in time. Great place to go and shop. Lots of stores and food to eat. Great old architecture to take photos. Like many places in Sydney this building has been maintained well. Worth a visit and some nice photos.

Lovely surprise. We were just strolling the streets and came across this beautiful building. It was still decorated for Christmas and looked really inviting. I love clocks so loved the clock in the centre of the building which focuses on the history of Australia. It has moving parts with an aboriginal man and ship moving around the perimeter of the clock. Well worth the visit to go through quality shops, listen to this and the other clock in the building as well as rest your feet and have something to eat. A hidden treasure that we didn't expect to find.

Old Made New..... The QVB is full of high end shops and is a distinctive older structure in the heart of the city...if you are a shopper or just want to see an older building made new this is the place....

Stylish and spectacular piece of history. Nothing more to be said = QVB is a must to visit, stroll through, browse and admire the architecture and decore. Beautiful decorations for Christmas and other seasons.
Beautiful at Christmas. This building is a joy to visit at any time but was really lovely at Christmas with a huge tree and beautiful decorations. Great building, good shops, worth a visit.

Nice to browse around. We were there with our toddler daughter 20+ years ago and we took some picture then. We went back with our grown up daughter in 2015 and took pictures at similar locations of the buildings(inside). Not much change - well kept.

Beautiful Victorian building!. Queen Victoria building has been converted to a shopping mall but maintains its Victorian majesty. The architecture is fabulous and it is especially nice right now all decked out for Christmas.

Beautiful architecture. We always spend some time in QBV when we visit Sydney, full of old world charm and character. The huge Christmas tree spanning multiple floors was a hit and everyone wanted a photo taken with it.......even me and I hate having my picture taken :-)

Beautiful building and a link to so much more of the Sydney CBD. No matter if you take a walk around the high class stores in the top levels of the building or go down to the basement and walk either towards Town Hall Station or through (under the road) to the Myer/David Jones buildings, this building is worth a visit every single time you visit Sydney. Great food and coffee available on nearly every floor.

Beautiful building and lovely shops A must visit when in Sydney. This is such a wonderful building. Nice to see some heritage left in tacked for all to enjoy. The shops are varied and the food cages are located throughout ...

A great Building in the City. This Building is in the centre of the City. At Christmad time there is a fantastic Christmas tree with crystals and looks beautiful. The ceiling and windows are leadlite and are gorgeous. There are several shops and so much to see. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful historic building, well worth a wander. Love just wandering in the grand Victorian atmosphere of the QVB. Centrally located (directly above Town Hall Station) it caters mainly to upmarket tastes and specialty shops, but some of these are well worth a browse in an aspirational way! But really it is the architecture that is worth admiring, from the curved iron staircases to the grand balconies and ceilings. A top quality heritage building comes alive.

Well worth a visit to see the Architecture. Just a lovely building located right in the centre of Sydney and worth a visit to see the architecture and the beautiful clock hanging from the roof. Good shops and plenty of nice coffee shops to spend an hour.
Beautiful Building. Not much of a big shopper but I love colonial buildings, so a visit to QVB is a must. Easy walk from Town Hall Station.

Historical in Sydney. I have walked past this building for no less than 5 times, every time I walked along George Street to my destinations. It captures attention with its Victorian architecture. Underneath it, shopping arcades and restaurants.

Take in the Architecture. This is a commercial icon of Sydney - full of shops that sell expensive things. It's a place where you can indulge. Tourists flock there, possibly just to say they have been there. Take in the architecture and its stories.
Amazing Building!. Superb shopping experience - Amazing selection of shops ranging from everyday through to the high end! Very clean and organised - Stunning clock on display in the centre.

Glamorous, luxurious and wonderful. QVB... the greatness of its grand gesture has never seize of amaze me. This victorian sandstone building is beautiful.Houses some of the best fashion houses and restaurants in the city. It is great to just take a stroll through this place...Perhaps some shopping for a pair of designer shoes, perhaps a cup of tea in a gold trimmed Royal Albert cut served on the third floor, or perhaps a piece of cake from Zumbo... Indulge yourself!!!

Part of the town. This building is beautiful, as it was Christmas it was decked out with decorations making the building very pretty. It has three floor to it and all the shop are very nicely presented. Well worth a look even if it's for the architecture.

Always amazed by this beautiful building. Trendy shops in an amazingly decorated heritage building! Just walking around in it is a treat to your eyes. Just love this building. Must see when you are in Sydney!

Shopping in style. QVB is a converted Colonial building, three floors above ground and a huge lower ground floor. The shops are lovely to look at and cater mainly for the fashion industry although there are several cafes and restaurants. Definitely a must see on any ones visit to Sydney

Bars, Architecture and Shopping- A crowd pleaser. If you are looking for a place to cover all bases in a group, this is the place to visit. It offers something for everyone as the title suggests, however avoid peak hour periods it can get quite congested.

Wonderful Victorian shopping center. An extraordinary Victorian building, inside and outside. Worth the visit just for the architecture. Long shopping galleries where 19th century deco has been pretty well maintained. Watch the nice floor tiling, the iron stairs, etc. Some typical Australian shops, usual international junk elsewhere.

Oldschool lift and clock. Totally worth it just to ride the very old ornate lift to the top, and check out the decorative clock hanging from the cieling. Also the staircases near dome at the top level are also facinating!
Prime Upscale Shopping. This was beautifully decorated for Christmas! The shops were upscale and designer stores. It was a lovely place to browse, and spend $. Beautiful building!

Old World Elegance. This is a favorite place for me to see on visits to Sydney. I love the old world elegance and charm and the variety of shopping available in the QVB. There are great quality bargains at Victoria's Basement (below ground) as well as renound brabd name stores and plenty of tempting food options. A must see in Sydney!

Great Brand shopping. If you like high end shopping then this is the spot. All the top brands have a shop there. It is worth a visit and there are also plenty of cafes - easy access to public transport.

Grand Old Building. A must see for the architecture if nothing else. The building is a Victorian style building and has been very well taken care of. We went during the Christmas holidays. The decorations inside were so pretty as well as the Swarovski christmas tree. The building also has many stained glass windows which appear to be well preserved. The shops inside are very trendy and fun to visit. The center is hollow so you can look down on the other levels. There were small tables next to the balconies with many people having late lunch or early tea.

Gorgeous always but impressive at Christmas. I have been visiting the old gal known as Queen Vic for many years and she never smiles.Her building is well kept and glad to see the heritage value has been retained in the renovation process.Information regaring the chiming clock is scarce which is frustrating for tourists.Luxury prices but rents are expensive.Fifteen dollars for a scone and coffee.Swarovski decorated Christmas tree is stunning.
Majestic. Great building next to Westfield Shopping Centre...this building is worth a visit in itself. Iconic with a lot of history, also a major bus stop with 7-8 bays fro various bus services.
Beautiful but just a mall. This is a beautiful work of Victorian architecture and very well maintained but at the end of the day it is just a shoppjng mall. Nothing spectacular.

Food offerings are largely ordinary. Shopping okay. Building beautifully maintained. Christmas decorations, tired.. QVB is one of the most beautiful buildings in the Sydney CBD and it is beautifully maintained. However, the food and beverage offerings, shopping and Christmas decorations are 'tired'. A rethink is needed before this important heritage landmark becomes just another ordinary attraction.

My favourite building in Sydney. It's my favourite building in Sydney but if you are from Europe, probably you've seen a lot so nothing special, it also have top afternoon tea in this building other than shops and cafe.
Great shopping. Brought a really nice watch from here massive discount price prior to Christmas sale already in action

good place to shop. The building is actually an historic building. It is now however like an indoor mall with places to eat and of stores to shop. The prices are normal when compared to other indoor malls.

Great shopping in iconic building. I love the QVB and never get tired of coming here when I am visiting Sydney. The building is stunning and it is kept beautifully. There is a wonderful range of shops and cafes, ranging from cheap and cheerful to luxury, so something for every taste and price tag. I would thoroughly recommend you visit the QVB in Sydney, both for some history and retail therapy!

Beautiful. Beautiful old historic building. Lots of interesting shops and a lovely experience. It's worth going there to see the Christmas tree and the gorgeous old clock which gives you a historic display on the hour.
Delightful Shopping. Part of the shopping experience of the city. The stores are varied and interesting and kept me interested.

Great building housing an upscale shopping mall. This is a old and very nice ornate sandstone building in the Sydney main shopping district. In three floors with a courtyard it houses many upscale shops and cafes. It is pretty well maintained and it is particularly attractive around Christmas with the excellent decorations which change every year.

Your average run of the mill shopping center - situated in an old building with some nice Christmas decorations. I went to QVB in mid-November so it was decked out in all the Christmas decorations. Consequently, QVB was quite beautiful. There was a tall Swarovski Christmas tree of note. There is also a nicely and ornately decorated clock that would animate on the top of each hour.But underneath the nice Christmas decorations, QVB is still a typical shopping center with fairly typical shopping center stores. I don't recall any stores that were very unique, but the stores were not disappointing though. Definitely worth an hour or two of your time.
Good old Queen Vic. Spectacular building and worth a walk through, stop and have a coffee at one of the little cafe's in the area.

Shopping in style. I walk through the QVB every day to get to work and pretty much every day I discover something new. The historic sandstone market building has been transformed into a beautiful place the stroll, shop and have coffee. The shopping is high end but not astronomically expensive - brands like Country Road, Camper, Coach, Fossil etc. Don't miss Haig's Chocolates or the desserts from Zumbo. If you are after peace and quiet head to the upper levels which are much less busy.

classy shopping. Love the old building , a delightful experience different from new shopping malls. Buy some dresses and costume jewellery for a party we are attending. A place worth visiting in Sydney.

Old world charm. What an amazing old building with beautiful decor & stained glass windows. The shops are all rather expensive but the experience is worth it. It was beautifully decorated for Christmas and the Swarovski decorated Christmas tree was out of this world and stood three stories high. Amazing!!!The only negative is the toilets are on ground level, so visit the toilets before heading up the levels.
Fun Shopping Area. The train going around the clock tower brought out the kid in me. We loved the architecture of the building itself. Spectacular. We didn't shop.

Beautiful. If you like photography or/and shopping, it is a must-see. I spend an hour to take pictures inside the building. Make sure to go there at daytime though it opens until 7:00 PM. Why? The stained-glass looks much better when there is bright light outside. Regarding shopping, I bought UGG products there and the price is much cheaper than that in the airport stores.

Step Back into the 1800's. Went to QVB building on a recommendation from someone we were travelling with. Catch a bus there. Building amazing. Restored to original condition. Ornate clock with diaramas and moving parts. Three level Christmas tree a work of art. Many top end shops but something for us mere mortals too. Dr Zuess gallery a winner. Food options worth a visit on their own. M cafe in ground floor fed me my first kale salad. Fresh and tasty. Chinese restaurant 3rd floor $15.00 lunch option includes a glass of wine. Go, sit, eat and be amazed. Will absolutely go there every time in Sydney.
Shopping mall.. This gracious old building of beauty in the heart of the city is a worth a walk through. Great area of shops to look at and browse through.
Christmas Tree. Went to see the Swarovski tree. Was a lovely night and easy to navigate. The tree is very pretty and the building is very nice too. Toilets and easy access. Good stop

Good Shopping in a Sydney Landmark. The QVB is a historical landmark with ultra modern shopping. Couple of cafes in and near the exit of the building. Located in the CBD definitely worth a visit. Highly recommend. Found some great deals on luxury brands as well.

Atmospheric Interior. In the busy city centre this place comes as a surprise. It has been brought back to its Victorian state and was at its best dressed for Christmas.Only had a cool drink but enjoyed the experience.

Lovely interior appearance and great shops. Everything in it was great: there was a food court and many retail shops. Most of them sold clothing, footwear jewellery etc. If you are on a budget, I don't necessarily recommend buying much there as things tend to become a bit pricey. It has a beautiful interior and exterior and you could take some great pictures there. It is probably one of the prettier and more luxurious shopping centres in Sydney!
Beautiful exterior. Walked outside to take photos as the boutiques inside sells expensive merchandise. Awesome Swarovski crystal Christmas tree.
Luxury shops. Filled with luxury branded shops right in the heart of the city. Nice to look around and clean. But they close early around 6pm and were also closed during holidays

Beautiful Christmas tree. With Christmas approaching both the shop and the Christmas tree with thousands and thousands of Swarovski crystals were beautiful. We stopped for a coffee on the mezzanine near the amazing clock as shown in the TA picture above. What a lovely place.

Colourful. This is a quaint, colourful and bustling structure connected right into Town Hall railway station. Extensive shopping inside. When you emerge from this landmark building you step out into George Street, surrounded by still more shopping and teeming life. Upmarket.

Good for pictures. It's a shopping mall, after all..... But the outside is incredibly beautiful, as well as the clock inside the building. There is a very famous tea room in this mall, but there's always a line outside. If you're planning to have tea there, reserve some extra time for the line. If not, just walk around, take some good pictures, and go back to the hotel.

A real treat for a visitor to Sydney !. We went to QVB with some friends from Germany. Being on holidays before Christmas the atmosphere, the shops and the gorgeous Christmas tree with Swarovski crystals were a real visual feast ! A beautiful building to show to Sydney visitors !

Beautiful . Really beautiful building inside and out. Even if your not really looking to shop (as majority of shops here are tailored more to deep pockets).. It's just now to wonder through and stop by for a coffee ☕.

Retail Therapy at QVB. For those who find shopping an enjoyable experience, QVB offers a wide range of retail outlets covering clothing, footwear, leather goods and jewellery, to name a few. Conveniently located above the Town Hall Station and Opposite the Hilton Hotel it is a popular location in the CBD It is a short walk up George St to the Strand and is in close proximity to other shopping centres and department stores.

Great to waste a few hours. We visited this centre in November after we had time to fill in before our train. It was very easy to find & only one stop from Central station. There are a great variety of shops, really cheap 'bling' jewellery places, a great warehouse place downstairs which sells top brand china etc at wholesale prices, & of course many other specialty shops along with the usual food kiosks etc. The food court was great, very busy but no problems getting served or finding a seat & food for all tastes.

Looks and luxury. This awesome shopping centre has style with a capital S. The building is gorgeous and all the shops are classy and have quality products! There are some cafe's where you can rest your feet and quench your thirst after spending your hard earned cash. Easily reached by train and bus, and there are lots of good restaurants and hotels nearby. A must visit for the stylish fashionista!

A "must see" in Sydney. We never visit Sydney without visiting QVB. Such a fabulous old building with amazing shops and of course the clock- be there on the hour to see it. Extra special this visit with beautiful Xmas tree.
Absolutely beautiful building. Great shops and cafes, restaurants, and all sorts of elegant clothing is offered for sale. Goods are not cheap

Historical Gem in the City. Whoever decided not to demolish the QVB but to restore it for commercial use should get a medal! The variety of shops and eateries is amazing, and every time I visit there is something new to see - last time I found a small new shop selling beautiful Syrian artefacts. There are places for high tea, yum cha, great chocolates, antiques......and at the moment, the stunning Swarovski Christmas tree.

Always a highlight for a trip to Sydney. It is always great to wander through the QVB and see all the shops and the excellence of the building, the original lifts that are still in perfect working order. It is always great to sit at one of the many cafes, within the building and just take the sights in and listen to the way the sounds reverb off and within the building.

Awweee with the Christmas deco. This place looks like a classic building but loading with shops and cafe. The Christmas decos was spectaculer and enjoyed the feel. I stopped till dropped the Pandora and it was at least 30% cheaper than Singapore. Worth the visit even if it is just a walk around the mall.

Architecture at it's best!. This is one of my favourite buildings in Sydney. What a glorious way to shop. The best time of the year to shop here would have to be the Christmas season with the railings covered in fairy lights and the magnificent giant Swarovsky Christmas Tree. With it's beautiful domed ceilings and tiled floors this is a great place to enjoy a light meal and spend a few of your hard earned dollars. When you are ready to move on walk through the covered arcade to the Pitt Street Mall for some more shopping.

The most beautiful fully restored building. When you step into the building, you are amazed at the way the building has been restored. Every floor is magnificent. I can't think of a better presented building. The choices of food, retail shops and other services are the very best.
Returning visit. I went to the QVB when it first opened this time I loved discovering the Dr Seuss shop and toy shop with my son but there are other places and its near the train stn!

Such grandeur. So much to admire, love the building with its grand design and architecture - even the lifts which must be Australia's oldest still operating are so special. A wonderful variety of retail stores and cafes - probably one of the best complexes for Christmas shopping and the decorations. parking is expensive so perhaps a train (station next door) is best option unless you are laden with gifts.
Love this place. Beautiful buildings with the best shops! Parking isnt cheap but just love visiting here! Definitely recommend!
A step back in time. Christmas is a beautiful time of year to visit the QVB with all of the decorations and the massive tree in the middle. Lots of great cafes and shops as well.
A Must-see at Christmas time...so beautiful!!!. Even though it gets super busy at this time of the year, it is so worth it to see the beautiful christmas decorations.
True Victorian Architecture. Well preserved and perfectly utilized by the NSW government. Christmas feel already kicked in while we were there with all the decoration. It was amazing.

Visit at Christmas time. Looks its best at Christmas time with fairy lights throughout. If you are there on the hour go to the top floor and watch the scenes on the big clock - King Canute and the waves, Harold getting an arrow in the eye, John sign the Magna Carta, Elizabeth knighting Sir Francis Drake, Henry the 8th and his six wives and Charles the first losing his head. A bit of English history in the centre of Sydney, the whole building dates back to "Empire" days and has that sought of feel about it. The architecture of this building is great inside and out. Easily located near the heart of Sydney with access to the Subway circle at the bottom of the building. Plenty of boutique shops for the fashionable, but most are top end and expensive.

A must experience. Unique - from the Queen Victoria statue to the (VERY long length) this beautiful piece of architecture has it all from gorgeous stained glass to multiple floors of stores with an open center. For people watchers, in addition to the crowds, most eateries have outside seats adjacent to the glass so you can watch in every direction. The Christmas tree is spectacular, going up to the dome. Every type of store imaginable from Victorian high tea restaurant to miniature trains, aboriginal art and high fashion.

Historic Landmark with great ambience. This Building represents a bygone era with wonderful dining and great shops but the building itself is wonderful and has the most amazing clock. At present Santa Claus is present and the most amazing tree.

History that lives. I love this building as the history still lives beautifully in front of your eyes. I also love it that it attracts artists around the building to please your eye balls. You can dine in the cafes or shop if you wish.
Great place to shop. This turn of the century building was restored back in the 90s to it former glory and many shops to choose from
Gorgeous architecture. A must see building from inside and outside. Lots of shopping places and cafes. Situated just in the middle of the town on George st.

Great building. The QVB is a shopping arcade not to be missed when visiting Sydney. Make sure you go up to the top floor and see the clock.There are plenty of shops and some nice places to eat.Public transport is right outside the building.

Iconic shopping experience in Victorian grandeur.. Whether you want to open your wallet of simply take in the amazing Victorian architecture and shops, the QVB in central Sydney, George Street is a must for anyone, including families with kids.There simply isn't a more beautiful Victorian era complex anywhere in Australia to match this.Full of top brand names, exclusive labels and unique specialist shops. Plenty of ground level cafes and upstairs tea rooms overlooking the balconies.Easy access via George Street or via Town Hall station which is below the QVB.Very visitor I show around Sydney is enthralled and wants to take a second look when they come back.

World class. Beautiful array of famous brand shops including fashion, beauty, jewellery, shoes, bags. Good selection of cafes and snacks. My favourites are Haigs Chocolates, Crabtree & Evelyn, T2, and Victoria's basement (for home and kitchen wares). Always a beautiful tree to be seen at Christmas time and just a short underground stroll from Town Hall station. Easy to spend 2-3 hours relaxing in this historically stunning building!
Great bunch of shops. Loved all the Christmas lights and the amazing, tall Swarowski crystals Christmas tree. Was an absolute delight. The shops were bustling with people and the place was great.

A Royal Splendid Arcade. The QVB stands as an icon in Sydney.covering almost a block over 4 levels, it houses an impressive array of shops, cafes and designer boutiques.It is open late and in the festive season, is home to one of the largest crystal Christmas trees.A must when visiting Sydney
Beautiful!. Beautiful shopping arcade with a great mix of stores and some terrific restaurants. The original decor has been beautiful preserved and it's worth being there when the clocks strike!!
Shoppers Paradise. Shoes, beauty products, food. All good. A lovely shopping experience. There are a lot more shops than first meets the eye as there a numerous shopping levels - don't miss them!

Spectacular setting for "designer"shops. The building is beautiful and extensive, access, being a shopping centre is unfettered. There are some amazing looking clocks, the decor is in pristine condition and it is really pleasant to wander around. There are cafes and restaurants so pass the time and people watch.The shops themselves vary from designer clothing, bags, watches etc on the upper floors to bargain shops in the basement.Well worth a visit if you like grand Victorian architecture.

Upscale shopping. This beautiful old building has been redone as a upscale mall in the CBD. Words can not explain how beautiful it is. If you like to shop and enjoy a look back at history this would be the place to go.

Magical. It's very odd being a Brit on holiday in Australia in December. It's just not right seeing Christmas trees everywhere when the temperatures are pushing 30. But go to the QVB and you can't help but feel a Christmas tingle. A vast Christmas tree, beautifully decorated, little fairy lights everywhere and one of the most fabulous buildings you will ever visit.

Visually spectacular hard on the wallet.. Great spot for architecture of the last century and done up to the nines but do not, I repeat do not get sucked into taking your missus here, you will get fleeced.YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED lol she will love it.
Decorated for Chrismas. Upper end shops in old building. Walked through the first time and nice, took a tour and got more history.

Christmas Tree is gorgeous this year. The QVB is a must see for visual eye candy. A restored building, it is full of lovely (but pricey) shops. Each year there is a huge Christmas tree put up in the centre of the building going up 3 storeys, covered with crystal ornaments and lights. Definitely worth a walk through, even if you don't buy anything. A beautiful part of Sydney. Check out the sculptures of Queen Victoria and a little dog at the west end opposite the Town Hall.

Huge building. Very use. Stairs and elevators (lifts) were available as this building gas multiple floors. Mostly high end, expensive shops but fun to window shop. Largest Christmas Tree (artificial) I have ever seen. In heart of Sydney. Highly recommended.
A must-visit place.. A fun place to visit, full of cafes, restaurants and (some expensive) shops. Has a lively, bustling atmosphere
Individual shops in lovely Victorian Building.. Upmarket shopping in a very nice building. Worth a visit even if you do not buy anything. Check out the talking dog statue outside.

Busy place to go shopping. QVB is full of premium shops, there are plenty to choose from. That said you will appreciate the decor and architecture of this building....It is a great experience and a nice way to see the top end of town including the Town Hall building which is located right next door.

Lovely old building, depressing new shops. Part of the charm of an old building like QVB is, to me, in what happens in it. Today it hosts expensive, branded retail outlets and one or two overpriced cafes. That said, the bones of the structure, and indeed its beautiful interior remains intact. See the clocks on the top floor on the hour for a small mechanical show.

Beautiful building with incredible, really different shops inside (eg. Dr Zeuss).. The history of this building, as shared with us by the very helpful salesman in Dr Zeuss store, is that the ground floor slopes out of the main entrance as "back in the day" horses delivered the goods to the markets held in the building and the sloping floor meant the mess the horses left could just be hosed out. It is a magnificent building with many specialty stores & eateries - not to be missed!

Oh my God! It's a perfect copy of one of the buildings in London!. It was awesome to be here. You'll be awed by the lights and reflections of the glass all around. When we were here, it felt like you've been transported to another time. It's just beautiful! Oh we travelled Feb 2014. The choices at the drop-down box are quite limited.

Meeting point - easy to find. My friend and I agreed to meet at QVB because he thought I could easily find it on my first day in Sydney. :-)He was right, it is a perfect place to meet friends - are you early? no worries, killing time here is dead easy.There are so many interesting shops with history and the watch in the middle is amazing.Grab a coffee and feast your eyes on the many spectacular shop windows. :-)
A wonderful place. Did most of my christmas shopping help was a pleasure the building is breath taking and so wonderful at Christmas time the tree is amazing

Beautiful Building - Expensive Brand Shops.. The QVB is a beautifully restored building which has been converted to house all the big name brands when it comes to shopping. Lovely to look at but not something I'd especially go out of my way to visit. Worth a wander through if you're in the area - especially at Christmas time as they have a beautiful Christmas tree in the centre.

feast for eyes and mouth. what a beauty, after so many years its just getting better ! Christmas decorations and the fairy lights are devine, for the cakes and patisseries we forget our diets, this is Sydney pure elegance,- sweet and so memorable, Love you, Sydney ;)

historic building with arcade. Luckily this building was restored and not demolished. It is now quite an upscale shopping spot with a lovingly restored arcade that goes through it. The story of the hunt for the statute of Queen Victora that sits outside is a good one. Seems the City of Dublin had one in "storage" that it was more than willing to provide to the City of Sydney! It is fun to just walk through and view the stores or have a coffee do some people watching. Inside exploration is a perfect rainy day activity.
A mixture of old and new in architecture. Rich mixture of architectural realisations, very nice and chic boutiques, magnificent decorations for Christmas Time.

a shopping with a difference. Love going to QVB Queen Victoria Building.What a fantastic building stunning and renovated back to its original stage full of great stores fashion and food.enjoy the old clock and a must in Christmas.
High end shopping. We walked here on a rainy day just to browse the stores. The tunnels connect to several train stations!

A lovely building in central Sydney. Must see the Christmas tree!. Just a lovely piece of architecture in the centre of Sydney. Lots of shops and eateries to visit, but even if you don't need to shop here you must walk through. The Christmas tree is amazing.

Nice building, nice interior. I actually stumbled into this building. It was raining, it was late and i wanted a place to get away from the rain.I Was just planning to walk through the building to the other end but ended up staying longer to take photos of the interior. It was close to Christmas so the deco is up and they had this huge tree right in the middle.The clock was impressive too - see my photos.

Christmas tree. The Christmas tree in the Queen Victoria Building is beautiful to behold with 65,150 lights and 82,000crystals that shine day and night. It is three stories high within this lovely setting. of nice shops and places to eat.
Great architecture. Good building for photo taking.It is near Chinatown and can be assessable by walking or if taking the train, to get down at Town Hall station.

Excellent shopping - plenty of cafes. Since the building was restored and reopened after spending half of the 20th Century in a basically derelict condition it now offers discounted luxury home ware in the basement, mid level dining and cafes in abundance and plenty of boutique shopping ops for locals and tourists alike - located close to the Town Hall the steps of which are the most famous meeting place in Sydney it is linked by transport to all parts of the CBD and the city beyond - how much the remodelling of Sydney's main thoroughfare George St will have remains to be seen.

A beautiful shopping center in Sydney. Queen Victory Building is a shopping center located in George St. in Sydney. Here there are a lot of emblematic shops in the world. The building is beautiful, it has a Romanesque Revival style and it was built from 1893 to 1898. It is a very good site to shop, but also to walk and see the architecture of the center. Moreover, it is close to another shopping, but smallest center called Strand Arcade.(see also Strand Arcade)(thank you dad for this gift)

Beautiful building with great breakfast. We loved it here. Came every day for breakfast and looking forward to 2016 when we plan to come again. We are not shoppers but we loved the experience and cannot wait to go back. Great place for taking photos.

Beautiful building. This is not just for shopping it is a wonderful building with a very interesting clock. We visited when it was decorated for the Christmas season which made it even more spectacular. A good place for a coffee and people watching.

Awesome building. We love the qvb building for it's grand architecture and beautiful ambience. There are wonderful shops but you can sit and enjoy the details on the ceilings and the beautiful stained glass windows. At this time of year, Santa is there but every time we visit we never cease to enjoy the lovely clocks which you can plainly see on the top floor.

Precious Heritage. You could easily find the Australian how to treasure & protect their historic buildings, such as they bulid the platform to install the escalator. Instead of demolish the histroric buildings, Hong Kong government should learn from the Australian how to treasure & keep the history for Hong Kong.

Love the building, lots of shops to browse, good coffee and tea selection. It was fun to walk around and the architecture and the interior design are piece of art to look around. Lots of shops to browse and some cafe to dine. good place to spend an hour at.

Beautiful old building, restored to its former glory.. This is a beautiful building and the Christmas tree in the foyer was just spectacular. There are an interesting selection of shops and eating places.

Very ornate. the shops in this building are quite exclusive many items of clothing costing well over $500.00 there are a lot of small cafes to try too. there is one shop with ladies bags and shoes to match they look lovely so if you have About $3,000 to spear you could spend it there . the building is very beautiful and is decorated beautifully for Christmas

Beautiful building..with great stores.. We wandered into this incredible building that goes back to Queen Victoria's time..the building itself is a treat. It has two incredible clocks that look handmade, beautiful woods, and fabulous stores, tea rooms, and many other things. They redid this building, and did a fabulous job. Again, a must see..on George Street...near Manly Bay wharf.

Grand old dame building of high-end shopping. The building itself is architecturally beautiful. Easily accessible by Sydney train system ie Town Hall station. Interior is tastefully decorated. Plenty of high-end shops. Restaurants aplenty too.
Beautifully Majestic. Old and beautiful building. The interior was very pretty. Feels like I was thrown back to the past. Love the ceiling especially the dome. Shivers.

Childhood Memories. This is the epitome of Christmas. A wonderland of lights and crystal. Very welcoming Santa. Great shopping especially if you are looking for something different. Can get very busy as the morning rolls on. A special place with great memories.

Lovely Structure and Interior. The establishment is well decorated. The grand Christmas trees with lights and swarovski is really lovely. Though there are not much things to shop as the merchandise is branded and pricey. Just a good stroll to walk throughout all floors.
Classy. QVB is a very classy shopping district. Lots of high end shops added to a glorious victorian Era building

Old Timey Fun!. I kept looking for Mr. Selfridge!! Loved the ambience, especially decked out for the holidays. Grabbed a cuppa overlooking the funky clock. Chichi shops, but lots of good window shopping.
Beautiful place. We didn't have plenty of time to visit Queen Victoria Building but good Lord, the place is so beautiful!!!
One of the oldest building in Sydney. My favorite building in Sydney, not for shopping but I like just walk through and of course these watches are a must!

Grand old building. Australians seem to convert their old buidings into shopping centres, and this is one of them. It houses some interesting shops.Good for a walk through and taking some photos instead of walking on the street side of the building.
Old Victoriana. Step back in time and go to the Tea Rooms on the 3rd level for afternoon tea, or just do a lot of shopping in many of the unique boutiques.

Beautiful Historic Building. QVB is a grand lady with beautiful architecture and a long history. There are several levels of high end shops and wonderful places to grab a bite or enjoy a coffee. The building is decorated for Christmas and is truly a beautiful way to spend time and some money too!

Luxury Shopping. Such a historical building in Sydney and very well connected to public transportation in the underground. The interior is full of luxury boutiques from brands all over the world. Shopping in a classical way!
Fantastic Building. Well with a look great old building and some nice shops, very nice with all the Xmas lights up. Some very nice cakes in the ground floor cafe.

Beautiful Building. Beautiful historic building. The floor tiles are gorgeous and even on a hot summer day it is beautifully cool in here. Check out the two clocks. One telling a little bit of Australia's history and the other on the hour does a grizzly beheading. You need to go up to the top floor to watch the clocks.

Lots of shopping shopping & more shopping. . I heard this place was a market in the past before a Hong-Kong businessman bought it over and turned it into a high class shopping place. Outlets-wise, there is nothing special compared to other shopping centres. However, the architecture of this building is worth a visit if you have some time in you hand.
Free Wifi. You can see complete model of Sydney City here in this building and you will get a free wifi too! You can rest there as long as you wanted :p

Queen Victoria Building (QVB) in Sydney, NSW. This is a old and restored building that hosts a mall in the center of Sydney. There are shops (not all of them are high end), cafes and has four floors. It is a favorite spot for tourists and locals.

Worth a visit. The QVB is very impressive, there are lots of chic shops,
Restaurants and the lovely clock hanging there.

Historic shopping mall. The Queen Victoria Building has everything: A beautifully restored historic building; a large variety of shops of all kinds; restaurants and cafés.
Best of all, there is a train station in the basement, so access is easy.
Amazing building inside and out. This building is a lovely example of older architecture. Outside is stunning and inside much the same. A large selection of shops which cover 5 floors as well!

Great place to visit and enjoy a coffee.. This is a wonderful place to walk around, shop, windoshop , or just sit and enjoy a cup of coffee at one of the many coffee shops.You must look at the large ornate clock in the centre, it's amazing.Easily accessible by train, get off at Town Hall Station, or bus.For those people visiting from overseas or interstate , you can find it opposite Sydney Town Hall.

Lovely old building in the centre of Sydney. The QVB is a great building for its architecture and it's shops! It's particularly popular around Christmas when it has an amazing giant tree in the middle.

A step back in time. This block long shopping destination is amazing. Built @ 100 years ago it still has charm and a very nice selection of shops and eateries. It keeps it's original grand appearance and gives you a real feel for the era of it's construction. A great place to go in the evening or on a rainy day.

An amazing Building. It is rare that you get to shop in a historical MALL .. but that is exactly what this building is. It is a beautiful architectural marvel. From the outside it is amazing .. but once you enter it is jaw dropping ...
