The interior looks like something out of a magazine .. and the shops are of every type and kind you can imagine .. also filled with many high end designer shops... lots of places to try great food and pastries and have a coffee .
A walk down history. Great atmosphere on a Saturday afternoon its bustling with tourist and locals , the array of cafes and eat spots is mesmerizing.
Gorgeous building. Well worth the time just to see the amazing clock in the center of it all. We were fortunate to see it decorated for Christmas. Lots of great shops too.
Impressive Shopping mall . Impressive Shopping Mall that visitors should see. Many opportunities for having some food. Shops more for the luxory demand.
LOVE, Love this place!. This is my favorite place to visit when I come to Sydney. It has character and charm. Shopping and cafe's a plenty.
Shopping. Wow! This is one up market shopping mall. Great shops, well known name brands and a amazing old building. Love what they have done with it.

Love this building. The QV building depicts all that Sydney has to offer. It blends the old and the new in seamless fashion, with new fashion outlets adjoining established shops and cafes. The two things that fascinate me are the original lifts (elevators) with metal concertina doors and the centrally suspended clock that somehow manages to defy gravity.

Cafe timeout. Sitting on the top floor, in cafe Vienna ,is like a little bit of paradise. The view is lux for people watching and just chilling out! The coffee is pretty great too! There's free wifi and no one hurrying you on, just like Vienna.

Beautiful building, great shops.. The building is beautiful, we visited in November and so the tree and xmas lights are up which made it even prettier. Lots of interesting shops. The cafes look lovely to have afternoon tea but we didn't stop in one.
Historic bldg. Amazing food and shopping.within walking distance of the hotels. Sunday brunch perfect spot. Or just for a coffee or treat
shopping at QVB. this is a nice shopping mall ,there are many shops and eateries and Christmas lightings are up and there is festive atmosphere which is nice
Heritage. beautiful architecture indeed... however the shops close earlier than i thought it would be... =( should extend the opening time of course..

Start at the top and work downwards....take a camera!. I had heard how stunning this building is but was delighted with the inside layout and the Christmas decorations are magnificent. So much to see and marvel at...the wonderful and HUGE Clocks and many beautifully presented shop windows & interiors. A pleasure to walk around, topped off by lunch at "The Palace Tea Room". Quality which was everything I expected and more. Delicious and sumptuous.
My favourite window shop. The best place to shop good bra6nds and enjoy the beauty of the building. ..Such a masterpiece....best place to shoot your pics
Wow! You have to go.. What a beautiful building, inside and out. The Christmas decorations were wonderful. The shops were upmarket and rather special. Delicious food available. Take your credit card.
Window Shopping at QVB a Must. Much like Moscow's Gum Mall, QVB's interiors are adorable. If you don't intend to buy from the high end shops, window shopping in this historic place is a must.

Unique Architecture. Shopping mall with beautiful architecture, houses some boutiques, with the Town Hall subway station connected to the basement of the mall. Located along St George's street, the main street of Sydney.

Have You Seen the New Christmas Tree?. Every year the QVB erects a spectacular tree to celebrate Christmas. This year it is a completely new tree with new Swarovski crystal decorations. It will be in the building until the first weekend in January
beautiful clocks nestling amongst the shops. The shops are high brow but the clocks in this building are beautiful - well worth a visit just to see these.

Lovely building and architecture. With plenty of named brands to match the old-world charm of this building, there was plenty to look at. This multi-leveled building is hard to get lost in (until you go underground then it joins up with other buildings and the Town Hall Station which can be a bit of a rabbit warren). There were plenty of very busy and very full cafes, the most difficult part was locating the toilets!Plenty of photo opportunities, particularly from the top floor.
Great shopping trip. A great spot to shop even if you just like to window shop!Lots to look at & it's central to everything.

Posh. This bldg is one of the most beautiful and tourist building here in Sydney, Australia. If you want expensive, good quality, nice boutique or designer store. This is the place to go. Just love this bldg. my daughter booked for our family for Mother's Day for High Tea on the 3rd floor. Very elegant. Really English style.

Always nice to walk through.. A beautiful old building with lots of small and quirky little shops and cafes.Try and go in the christmas season so you can see the amazing christmas tree.....you will not be disappointed.

Shopping in Victorian Elegance. This arcade over 4 floors plus a basement is packed with shops and restaurants. The lower floor is busy with commuters as it links up with Town Hall Railway Station. It is a lovely place, elegant and stylish. Enjoy!

Very Nice & Big Toyshop Top-Floor. This is a very attractive old and chic shopping mall, very well maintained. The two clocks, staircases, and atriums are all worth a visit alone. While actual shopping on offering is not for the masses, it is a surprise is to find a very large, extremely well stocked toy shop on the top floor. Great to visit with kids or get your kids their presents from. Price level very reasonable.

Very beautiful building!. This is a very well restored & beautiful building in sydney. It has lots of shops on all the floors, but not the ones i would go to, very high end of for Japanese tourist market. Ate at cafe there, very expensive but lovely cakes at a Vienna style cafe.
Great Place to Visit. Good cafes and very many shops. Railway station is there. Some great, old architecture. In the middle of Sydney's CBD.

Beautiful Building. Make sure when you visit Sydney on George street is the most beautiful building in sydney at the moment it has a beautiful christmas tree full of crystal ornaments and then you can shop in some of the best shops in sydney and have coffee while you watch the clock change the hour with ornaments blowing trumpets
Just beautiful. Lots of nice cafes, just such a beautiful spot to wander around the shops and gaze at the fabulous building

High Tea-A Wonderful Experience. We four friends met to celebrate a birthday and we had an experience to remember. The Tea Room takes you back in time with beautiful chandeliers and decor. Service was impecable and the cost of $45 each is great value due to the quality & quantity of the food & beverages.

Beautiful, but crowded. A beautiful building turned into a Westfield type shopping center. Beautiful architecture, floors and woodwork, but too crowded for modern mall. Recommend visiting during off peak hours if possible.

Fabulous place to spend a couple of hours!. It was all decorated for Christmas when we were there at the end of October. Decorations were very special! And the variety of shops was spectacular. Plus many restaurants!!

A nice place for latest fashion designs. I always go to the QVB to see the latest fashion designs from trendy shops eg Coach, Cue and other high-end fashion house. It is nice to 'window shop' around and there are Cafes with nice coffee, cakes. There were seats that people could have a rest on each floor some years ago but hardly any now on the ground floor or second floor! The building is heritage listed and architecture very nice. Certainly, a highly recommended building to visit. Location is excellent and easily accessible but train. There are other shop pings in that area. I normally spent a whole afternoon in that area ever time that I visited Sydney.

The place I love to hang out. Regardless I shop or window shopping, I always love to visit QVB everytime I visit Sydney. This is a place I must visit because there are amazing stores inside it and mixed with the historical feeling due to the building's design and layout. Beautiful!

A place of contrasting shopping and wonderful clock !. An exhilarating shopping complex with the wonderful clock. Building has an array of upmarket shops selling exquisite items in upper levels and the walk thru area in the basement gives access to food courts and cheaper variety shops. A must visit for visitors to Sydney.

Nice . This building is great for a stroll and has some lovely decor, especially during Christmas time. The shopping isn't the most fantastic, but it is directly linked to Westfield, which is a mall with lots more choice. Worth a visit
Too busy and rushed. It was handy for something to eat and a nice cup of coffee. Though staff (and patrons) just seemed to be to rushed and not worry about service or really about any others

great building. Beautifully restored building in the CBD. we were there when the Xmas tree was up- so many sparkles thanks to all those crystals . Great atmosphere for a coffee or brunch in one of the many cafes on all levels. Designer shops, but also some great family ones like the ABC shop.

A Wonderous Place. This is a classical architectural building that has been saved from demolition for the nation. What a loss it would have been. This is the ideal place for a rainy day (or any day) with the large, beautiful interior transformed into charming shops and places to eat set in stunning surroundings. Even the escalators have been constructed to not to intrude into the architecture of the huge atrium. This is a delight to visit, not just for the fashion, jewellery and designer stores but for the "ooh" feeling one gets when entering. At Christmas the basement to ceiling giant Christmas tree is a wonder to behold and makes to whole experience magical.

Loved this building. The Victoria building is now filled with upscale shops which we just ignored. We wandered about and road the escalators and elevators for several views of the architecture, clock, and crystal Christmas tree. There is a lovely cafe in the center and beautiful pastries we admired but resisted. The outside as beautiful as well. No one cared we were just sightseeing. The restrooms are even worth a quick look see!

Magnificent architecture. The Queen Vic Building is actually one of the only reasons that we visit the Sydney CBD. It is a lovely old building and is inn stark contrast to the concrete shopping centres surrounding. But its magnificence is magnified once you step inside. Over 4 light filled levels your gaze is constantly moving from the magnificent ceiling, from wall to wall and of course the 2 feature clocks hanging from the ceiling at either end of the building. And if you happen to come here during the Xmas season then you will experience the beautiful and dazzling sight of the floor to ceiling Xmas tree festooned with Swarovski crystals and lights. And if you are still interested in shopping then there are many and varied shops, boutiques and cafes.

Shop, shop and shop !. Oh I loved this place ! It was stylish and beautifully decorated. There were lots of eating places and wonderful shops that were not your run of the mill chains - far from it. We went twice in our short visit and spent a fortune. Lovely service in the shops. Just great and high on my list if we go back.
Great shopping. Traveling by train into the city from the airport, we found that the QVB was a great place to roam through.

Wonderful Use of Classic Building. This grand old building in downtown Sydney was turned into a beautiful and useful arcade of classy shops. We should honor those who orchestrated saving this wonderful structure and ensured the interior provides a charming shopping experience. It is not a small shopping area and offers both upscale and more moderately priced goods. Even if you do not shop to buy, wander about and enjoy.

Beautiful building worth a visit. The Queen Victoria Building is an absolute delight - from the tiles on the floor to the windows and the grand exterior.Inside can be found an array of high fashion clothing stores for both men and ladies, jewellers, accessories, great food outlets and an assortment of other stores . At one end is the quaintly named Ladies Powder Room- well worth a visit.At the time of our visit the Christmas Tree and lights had been installed. The tree is a wondrous thing full of lights reaching right up through from the ground floor to the ceiling. We were horrified to learn that not so may years ago this marvellous building was marked for demolition.

Beautiful. I absolutely love this beautiful building with all the amazing shops to browse and lovely eatery's. My favourite is High Tea. If you love High Tea as I do don't hesitate to enjoy this beautiful Room, Service and Food. It was a very special experience.

Beautiful building. We visited to check out the building and weren't disappointed by the architecture. The shops are mainly high end designer stores, so don't expect many bargains, but it's a lovely place to grab a coffee and browse.

Great place to visit, especially on a rainy day. When we arrived in Sydney, it was pouring for two days. As we had planned a lot of outdoor activities, we had to adjust our plans and find other places to go to. The Queen Victoria Building is a gracious building. The historic building has been transformed into a shopping mall on the inside, but it is done with style. 4 floors or more with small shops and cafe's. We completely forgot about the rain ........... until we left the building.
Great shops and very interesting building. Well worth a walk through even if your only window shopping and is a handy connection for town gall station and MYER and David Jones stores.

A Must Vist Mall. The most popular mall in Sydney due to the historic value and elements of the building and its strategically located at the heart of the city. The merchandise collections also not bad, mostly international brands but also has Australian brands as well, souvenirs and food and beverages.
Wonderful building . Old amazing building contain all brand shop in middle of Sydney market Only one hour you can complete to round the mall to see nice place

Great Ambiance. Had a great selection of shops within a very picturesque old building. A lot of the shops were eateries. As it was a Saturday morning, the place was busy and many of the eateries were full of patrons.
Beautiful mall that must stop by. This mall was really beautiful in and out. The way all small boutique shops decor was all impressive.

Private function room on top floor. Not sure who you have to pay off to get into this room but do it! Incredible private function room with amazing venetian chandeliers, staggering cornices and superb decor. Go if you can, talk your way in, slip them a 20 or do whatever it takes...

Elegant old building beautifully restored with great shopping, good coffee and people watching.. The QVB is a wonderful place to shop, eat and people watch. At Christmas the tree in the centre is a real show stopper. There is a interesting mix of shops from high to mid to lower end. The building has been beautifully restored, takes up a whole city block, is easily accessed from Town Hall train station and other shopping areas by underground arcades.

Must see in Sydney CBD. Wonderfull architecture from outside and inside. Definitively a "must do" in Sydney (but no need to spend all your afternoon there... fifteen minutes are ok to look around and a little bit more if you want to have a coffee in the galerie... perfect in a rainy day !

Holiday beauty. We visited this spot to see the architecture and a coffee, and we're not disappointed. What delighted us though was the spectacle of the gorgeous twinkling lights and stunning 3 story tall Christmas tree. Worth a stop on a rainy Sydney day or a bit of break from a toasty summer day.

Amazing Clocks in a quality place that is timeless. Great place for window shopping and actual shopping. Am looking forward to their Christmas decorations. The clocks have hourly show on the hour that are great to see. with places for food and is apart of Town Hall rail station a car etc is not required.

Beautiful building with wonderful shopping experience.. This has to be one of the most beautiful shopping arcades in the world. While the designer shops are fantastic, it does also cater for more modest tastes and budgets.

Nice shopping mall. I went there to buy Asics shoes then end up there. I didn't realise this building is a shopping mall until I get there. It is big and high ceiling and old cool mall. It connected to Town Hall station, very easy to get there and nice stores for shopping.

Lots of special stores, but unsure as to their value.. It is a magnificent location which was last built in the late 1800s. Saved and refurbished in the 1990s, it now carried the idea of high fashion which should now be reduced to upper-mid fashion. Lots of bling, but your should check out alternatives.

Beautiful building. The building is a must see...beautiful Victorian architecture....
The shops.....so so....some high end brands...
It's connected by link to myers and Pitt st mall
A must go shopping haven when in sydney

Beautiful place. We visit the QVB evertime we visit Sydney. A great place for shopping with all the top brands on show. ts a great place just to stroll around and look back into Sydneys past. Plenty of places to have coffee and or a meal and if you are travelling from outside Sydney the Town Hall station is joined to the QVB.

A must for shopping in Sydney. Whether you want to shop, window shop or enjoy a morning coffee or a fancy afternoon tea The Queen Victoria Building or QVB as locals call it has been a favourite for well over a hundred years. Lots of clothing shops and interesting small shops ,always a treasure to be found on its several floors. Don't miss it when you are next in Sydney
Must visit. Although the assortment of shops lacks cohesion, it is a lovely place to stroll around and have a bite to eat

The QVB experience. Have been to to the QVB many times. The building itself is a great look back into Sydney`s past. It has a very good atmosphere and there are plenty of cafes to have a coffee or a meal. Easy to get to on the train as the Town Hall train station is connected to the building.
A great time . The QVB offers great shopping from the biggest and best brands In a great interior and exterior with its grand design it is a beautiful place if it is wet or unsure what to do

So pretty. This place takes you back in time. Elegance plus. Christmas decorations are currently up. And very subtle. It's just a beautiful
Place.

An ageless and an enduring iconic inner city shopping and eating venue. An exciting tourist must, which caters for a diverse or discerning taste . The design and deco of the shops always attract ,even the frequent visitor ! The Xmas tree is a special attraction at this time of the year ! It's location lends for easy access by all forms of transport .The historic clock ,stained windows are among the many enduring architectural attractions .

Such a beautiful building. Is this the most beautiful shopping centre I've ever visited? Without doubt, the answer is yes!Beautifully restored and chock full of wonderful shops and cafés we had a fantastic time just wondering around and enjoying the atmosphere.The Swarovski tree just added to the magic and gave the whole place a real Christmassy feel.A must visit for anyone in Sydney with some money to spend.
Beautiful. Beautiful building to visit. Olde world building, variety of shops. Great place to get a bite to eat.
Luxurious shopping center. This gorgeous building houses many luxury and specialty shops. There are also small cafes. It is beautiful outside and inside. One can take a break here for a cup of tea.

building is better than buying. Fantastic building with lots of extravagant Victorian features. Spent more time looking at the surroundings than in the shops. Some good interestin, unusual shops but some are very high end, and therefore expensive. Don't miss the incredible Swarovski Christmas tree, it has just been put up and goes the whole three stories of the building.

Gorgeous upbeat Place. There is nothing like an old arcade in the city. Queen Victoria Building is just beautiful and the ambience is magical. The old style has so much character and there is a good mix of shops and cafes. And there are shops for everyone's budget.

Perfect for a rainy day. If you get off the Town Hall train station. follow directions and you'll alight at the QVB---perfect on a rainy day since you'll never get wet. There are so many stores to meander through and cafes to enjoy. On the top floor, I stopped at each clock, particularly the middle one in which the ship goes all around the diameter of the clock. The architectural detail of the QVB is worth noting.
A mixture of old and new. Lovely cool atmosphere in this shopping mall. Plenty of shops for all ages and lovely shops with Australian produce. Cafes and restaurants have lovely surroundings.

Beautifully restored shopping centre. A busy shopping centre on many levels, it is hard to imagine that when I was a child in Sydney this was a derelict building and a blot on a downtown block, considered for demolition. Thankfully someone had a vision and money to preserve this historic building and it has now given pleasure to shoppers for nearly 3 decades since it was re-opened in the 80's. The underground level allows commuters undercover protection in inclement weather with direct access between Town Hall station and the CBD.
very nice historic building. Good to pop in and explore especially if you are into old architecture. Very well maintained and very nice shops etc and quaint cafes for a quick cup of mojo.
Beautiful victorian architecture. If you're not absorbed by the shops, then go to look at the architecture, the wonderful wide staircase and lighting are worth a look.

Old building with shops. A nice old building in the center of Sydney. It's like a shopping mal with many shops in it.
If you are in the business district you should have a look.

Shop Till You Drop. Very nice place to shop also very busy we went on a Sunday and suprised to see everything open.Street level busy but a bit quieter on upper and lower levels.Gents check out the old fittings in the wash rooms.Building Interconnects with other shops and malls so no need to go outside.Ladys shop till you drop.Men go find a Coffee shop and sit it out.Had a lovely lunch at Belgum Chocloate place further up Pitt St.

Great for a rainy day in Sydney. Great place to pop in. There are a few famous clocks in this building. Sadly they are not all in full working order. One is well worth planning to watch from the top floor when it strikes. It details British history in little diorama windows which rotate through all the scenes. There's a toy shop nearby with a working train set and some nice cafes for tired parents!

Lovely historic building. This is a gorgeous building which contains shops on three levels. When we visited everywhere was just gearing up for Christmas with an enormous tree in the centre of the building. The shops are mainly of high-end, expensive type, but a really great place to browse.

Lovely place to shop. Beautiful arcade with lots of lovely shops, small cafes and patisseries. Good places to shop for kids are the ABC shop and Hobbyco. The building architecture is interesting and a treat.

interesting building. Interesting building, the shops were pretty typical of any mall but the actual building was very pretty. Great history here as well, be sure to take the free walking tour that meets across the street by town hall as they go inside the QVB to talk about the history there.

Beautiful . What an amazing building currently lite up for xmas with the massive beautiful tree in the middle.Just go and walk up and down and soak up the age of the building and the history. Read the Queens letter ans shop or eat if you fancy.Located in the heart of the City so easy to access. This photo is from above looking out of the Hilton Sydney.

Just stunning. What a beautiful old building restored and in a central location. Gorgeous stained glass windows and domed ceiling, beautiful staircases do balcony railings. It's so lovely both inside and out.Many lovely shops, cafes,

Totally wowed by stunning old building! Oozes charm and grandeur!. We were totally wowed by this stunningly beautiful Sydney icon from the moment we first saw it on Friday night. So much so that we returned again and again to view each level at different times of the day. Everything from the floor to the highest point of the ceiling is majestic and beautifully preserved. So much to take in,architecturally magnificent. There is currently a beautiful Swarovski sculpture on the ground floor and some stunning light displays higher up. The shops, cafes and even the public amenities are all very grand. We HIGHLY RECOMMEND a visit to this magnificent building.

The Harrods Of The South. It's a lovely building and does resemble Harrod's from the outside. Lots of shops inside plus restaurants and cafes to soothe the way. The lower levels seem to extend quite a way under the street as I discovered by taking one exit and came back to street level looking at the building across the road!
Historic Building. A definite stop for architecture lovers, shoppers and tea lovers. Enjoy a formal afternoon tea, window shopping and the clocks in the atrium.

Olde World Charm & Elegance with Tantalizing Modern Stores. You can very easily spend a few pleasurable hours roaming the 4 levels of this fully restored olde world building in the heart of Sydney. Each level is lined with great shops offering a wide variety of excellent quality items ranging from top-of-the-line clothing to tourist mementos. Rub shoulders with the Aussie locals who populate the whole place each lunch time, taking advantage of the great food and beverages also available in this magnificent shopping plaza.

Amazing building - filled with stores that will empty your bank. Had a great time venturing the 4 levels of this building, cakes, coffee, store after store after store. The wife loved it - as the token bag carrier, I did start to get a little tired of holding the bags. Advice for husbands - forget your wallet before going - advice for wives, remember who has to carry the bags :)

Old buildings are adorbs. I love london and old architecture and this building has all the traits of a beautiful old building. And the shops are fantastic. Very high brow, but doesn't make you feel like you shouldn't dare walk in and have a look at the high fashion. Also the underground tunnels connecting to Westfield I just love.
Lovely buildin. QVB is definitely a place to just walk through and check the beautiful interior and design of this building. Even if you don't buy anything.
The most beautiful Xmas tree!. Lovely arcade just to walk through and marvel at the architecture. Great array of stores. Something for everybody.

Beautiful building plus shopping. The Queen Victoria Building is a very large and beautiful historic building in the middle of the city.The building is beautiful from both the outside and the inside, and there are a mixture of high end and regular shops inside.Well worth a visit.

Nice old building. The atmosphere on this shopping mall is very unique. You could get lost inside the labyrinthlike passageway. If you like old looking building with intricate wall and column patterns you will feel at home inside this shopping mecca.
Beautiful old world glamour. Something for everyone here, a range of cafés, gift stores, boutiques, and gob smacking architecture, definitely worth a squiz
Kelley and food. We love going to Mondial for the argyle pink diamonds and trying some zumbos famous macaroons to eat on the way home.

Easily the most beautiful shopping arcade in Sydney. There are a lot of new, modern and very unattractive shopping malls and arcades in Sydney. The QVB stands on its own as the most beautiful and distinctive of all the shopping arcades in the Sydney CBD (unless of course you have an unlimited budget and want to spend your time in Martin Place). The multi level building has been left with its beautiful original internal structures inside. It is worth going to see this alone. The lowest basement level houses the train station (Town Hall) and connects via a subway to Myers. It houses the cheapest shops in the building. It isn't my favourite area of the building. As you work your way up the levels, things get more exclusive. There is a number of fine jewellers on the top level and also an excellent pet accessories store. This time of year is really lovely to visit because they have the amazing Swarovski Christmas Tree. The tree spans three floors of the building and contains over 100,000 Swarovski cystals. It is beautiful. The whole arcade looks very attractive with the lights at the moment. There is also an Adriano Zumbo counter on the ground level of the building.

Great to see in the lead up to Xmas. Visit between now and xmas to see the lights and the crystal ornaments on the tree that goes from the ground floor to the top.there is also Santas cave on the top floor ....well worth a look

Beautiful historic building, still well and truly alive. In this day of developer greed, it is great to see a magnificent building such as this still serving a purpose, and in this case, still serving its original purpose as a place of commerce. The building has been renovated and brought back to its former glory, having survived efforts to demolish it. A must see if you visit Sydney

Sydney's most beautiful building. My friend and I spent three hours just walking from floor to floor, taking photos as we went. We learned that the QVB is a late nineteenth-century building, designed by the architect George McRae. It is truly inspiring and has to be seen to be believed. Not only overseas visitors but every Sydneysider should take the time to visit this magnificent icon.

A walk through the Queen Victoria Building.. To walk through the Queen Victoria Building is a walk back in history of Sydney. A beautiful building constructed originally as a fruit market in the early days of Sydney. One can just look at the beautiful shops on many levels, view the clock or have a snack, meal or just coffee. This building is in the heart of Sydney.

Beautiful old historic buiding filled with loveley shops & access to train station in basement. Had lunch here recently at the top level so I could enjoy the show when the clock chimes. This is a lovely old building that has been converted so well. The shops on the lower levels levels seem to be less expensive the higher you go the more designer type shops you get. The basement levels are more practical shops on the way to the station. Well worth a look to enjoy the architecture as well as lunch at the top if you have time

FUN COUPLE OF HOURS. Had a great time poking through the shops and watching all the people eating on the courtyards and walkways. The restored buildings is stunning. The whole complex has a nice energy about it.

History ,architecture and shopping all in one. Great to spend time actually looking at this building especially from the top floor. Have a close look at the clocks and the beautiful stained glass windows, Take the time to read about our history. Lots of nice places to eat and shop ,good rest rooms and information service is very helpful

Beautiful place with different shopping experience. Beautiful architectural masterpiece. interesting place with expensive food court/s and it links directly to Town Hall Station. I love visiting this place ..10/10

The QVB and its Grand Clocks. The QVB is one of the iconic buildings of Sydney CBD, converted into a beautiful shopping and eatery area. Its biggest attraction to women visitors would be the 'Victoria's Basement'. It is a world of household stuff of great quality and reasonable prices (Australian standard). The shops are very interesting. Must visit the shop called 'King of Knives' which sells wonderful household cutlery and knives for cutting and pairing. Do not miss the special shop for 'Tea" equipment. A must for tea lovers. So much to do and enjoy the food. An ealy morning breakfast at one of the high quality eateries is my favourite....the Egg Benedict is soooo good.Just visit it once a day.....it is worth all the visits when in Sydney.. and it is right opposite Woolies (Woolworths), which makes it convenient for conveniences.QVB has underground and overground links to MYERS, DAVID JONES and is accessible from the Town Hall Station / Town Hall Square.

Well worth a visit. A good shopping experience especially when either raining or very hot. There is everything from designer to inexpensive in the basement. Loads of little eateries, cafes and access to Town Hall station. Towards the top there are some very interesting shops selling good quality maps. If you have time I would recommend a visit .
Very nice architecture . It's a beautiful historical building. There are plenty of shops here as well. Stroll around and enjoy the detailed decoration.

A magical mix of shops ! :-). My wife and I visited Sydney recently and we visited this Building more than once ! :-) The choice of shopping within the Queen Victoria Building was just incredible, and this was combined with very good cafes and restaurants and very interesting iconic sights, including the clocks and (present when we visited) a display of ballet costumes. We enjoyed visiting the Building very much and came back twice more .. as for the choice of shopping, there were clothes shops, shoes shops, bag and accessories shops, jewellery shops, wonderful model figures (toy) shop, full toy shop, etc., etc. It was all just the most wonderful shopping and when you visit Sydney we would say that the Queen Victoria Building is a `` must see `` icon. A wonderful experience indeed ! :-) :-)
Stunning building!. Walked through this stunning building, well worth a look! Absolutely stunning architecture and interior. Lovely stained glass windows. Some very expensive shops in here though!!
INtersting building. Plenty of shopping and plenty of places to get a drink or a meal all in the same place. After a day walking around Sydney, what else do you need.

Nice setting, lot to eat. The building is superb, I did not find most shops very interesting.There are a lot of eating venues, but most are really small. Many small tables on the gallery, which makes a nice view but does not guarantee a quiet meal. It is good to see it if you are around, but that's it.

Fabulous building. This is one of the most iconic buildings in Sydney. At one time it was going to be torn down, thankfully that didn't happen. Five floors of fine shops and cafes to suit most people. Over the Christmas holidays it is a must see to go and view the Christmas tree that is in the centre of the buildings. It goes from the ground floor to the top. Also look for the large old clock that hangs a bit more than halfway down towards the southern end. Every hour it chimes and provides a pageantry of figures. Well worth your time.

Historic Building. Expensive Shopping and Eateries spoils the experience.. Our hotel was straight across from the QV Building the Hilton so a great location. The building is absolutely stunning however the shopping is not your normal everyday shopping and far to expensive for everyday people. The food outlets are quite expensive also and quite expensive for a nice morning tea or casual lunch. Worth the look but head to Pitt Street Mall for shopping options and mtea/lunch options.

A wonderful Sydney Landmark. Standing above Town Hall Underground station this unique and historic building was first opening in 1898 and has undergone refurbishments a couple of times. Now a trendy place for boutique shops as well as cafes and restaurants.
More shopping than you can handle. A stunning shopping centre in beautiful architecture and so central to anything else in Sydney. Easily accessible and something for everyone.

A must see. Beautiful building, the interior is well worth seeing. We stopped for morning coffee and soaked up the atmosphere. Great fun. I did a lot of window shopping as many of the shops were quite pricey.

Gorgeous building. Love this building! Every time I visit Sydney I head to the Queen Victoria Building, grab a coffee from the hole in the wall cafe (Kikko Cafe), sit in the walkway area of the building & people watch! Coffee is good too!

I LOVE coming here. This is a lovely, lovely place. It's always bustling with activity. There's lots to do here - shopping/window shopping, eating, drinking, etc. The architecture is beautiful. My favourite thing to do when I come here - sip on some coffee/tea and people watch!

Stunning Building - full of gorgeous shops. This nineteenth century, stunningly restored building in Sydney's CBD, is full of gorgeous up-market shops over three levels plus the underground arcades which lead to other shops. Certainly worth a visit.
High Tea A Must. High Tea at the Tea Room was a highlight of our trip. It was a surprise birthday treat and I felt very spoilt with the beautiful chandeliers, furnishings and quality food.

old jewel in a modern city. I really like this building, every time I am in the city I have to stop and have a coffee with a nice pastry in the beautiful coffee shops. The best time to enjoy this place is in Christmas time when they have the beautiful tree in the middle adorned with swarovski crystals.

Opulence. Just to wander around the QVB is a must. Espy the tessalated tilework, the big clock which is a mechanical marvel on the hour; the glass roof and mezzanine floors, setting off the elegant shops is worth the effort of alittle footwork.

Always beautiful. Shops to suit all budgets.. Gorgeous historic building, beautifully presented. Shops to suit everyone from designer to every day chain boutiques. Great way to get from Town Hall station to Pitt Street. Some good cafes along the way.
Not just for the shopping. Many interesting shops, but the building itself is absolutely fascinating and worth a visit. Savour a coffee and enjoy the view.

Stunning Building. This isn't just a mall for shopping, quite the opposite. Walk through from one side to the other and make sure you look up at the stunning ceilings and the clocks. Especially beautiful over the Christmas period. Don't forget to take a trip in the old wooden lifts as well.
Always love this building. So i have been back to QVB several times while at Sydney. And been here last time for the Adriano Zumbo macaroon. love the architecture.

Just to see the building. A very different mall, not necessarily for shopping, in my opinion, rather just wonder and explore the beautiful place in and out.
If you must - have a cup of coffee in one of the nice places in the mall. we loved the Viennese coffee place at the upper floor. fools very European.
A special place!. This is a beautiful building in itself enhanced with boutique shops and gourmet food. An enjoyable visit and delicious lunch.
A Gem. A lovely building which has been very well revamped. Tea is an expensive must to enjoy the venue. There are several places to choose all good.

Extremely impressive old building a must see in Sydney. My wife and I and another couple were in Sydney last week and we visited The Queen Victoria Building several times. This building is just so impressive. We had a great breakfast on the second floor and we all found something to buy even though I bought Adriano Zumbo Macaroons and Haig's Chocolates!!!!

A visit QVB. The beat place to meet up with friends or relatives , plenty of things to see and great places to eat or have a coffee and close to anywhere you may like to go look at or just spend sometime chatting and catching up . We had breakfast in one of the Cafe' before meeting friends and of course visited Haighs' Chocolate Shop a must when we visit the Queen Victoria Building. Then anywhere else in the City you may like to see as it is just about cenral to anywhere one may like to visit and jiust as great to come back to for afternoon coffee

A little bit of elegance.. Some beautiful shops though very upmarket. A pleasure just to look especially at the wonderful jewellers' shops.Some very nice places for coffee and cakes. Free Wifi at some of them.

Best shopping in the world in historic building :-). This beautiful restored building is worth visiting to see the clock and luxurious surrounding. There are affordable shops on the lower level. The basement has my favourite homewares shop luxurious items for up to 70% off Queen Victoria's Basement. Town Hall Station and a handy Woolworths Supermarket are also there. Good to go to if limited for time :-)
Chill And People Watch. Lovely building turned into a very nice shopping and café experience. Put it on your list of places to visit and while away some time over a coffee or snack people watching.
A Beautiful Building.. This is a beautiful iconic Sydney building. When we go to Sydney my family always enjoys visiting the QVB.

Nice visit. Great variety of shops to choose from.
We have visited on a number of occasions and have been fortunate to be there when most of the shops have has specials running.
Tried a few of the restaurants for lunch and were pleased with all of them.
Beautiful building. This building is quite stunning. There are all sorts of shops in here from jewellery, clothes, cafes etc. You can spend ages wandering from floor to floor here

Best attraction in Sydney - both inside and out. One of the iconic buildings in Australia - hard to imagine that they were going to tear it down just a few short years ago. Enjoy the architecture both inside and out - and enjoy a coffee of a lunch in style. Just a lovely relaxing atmosphere

Living history with modern attractions.. The building is a great example of early Australian construction, being completed in 1898.
Worth hanging around for the midday chime and display of the great clocks, best seen from the top gallery.
QVB. A great place to shop or browse. Or you could take an undercover short cut from Pitt to George Streets.
Gorgeous. The architecture is gorgeous, many shops and places to eat, an absolute must visit if going to Sydney!

A unique shopping mall. This is a wonderful experience if you like shopping areas with lots of character. The shops are varied, and some are very expensive. There are great cafes, especially if you are looking for a proper afternoon tea.
65foodie2014. What a beautiful old building both inside and out.....we browsed the shops, both designer and the not so expensive and also had breakfast at one of the cafes....very pleasant.
Stunning piece of History. This is a stunning piece of Sydney's history. It is a beautifully maintained building. Fabulous for a wander or for shopping.
stepping back in time. Wonderfully lavish building with an assortment of shops and cafes. Spend time wandering through the shops or sitting in a cafe for afternoon tea.

Queen of the buildings. The QVB is my favorite place to shop in the city. By keeping the original designs in tact the building provides you a window back into Victorian times. Definitely worth a visit for ever tourist.

The Grandest of shopping complexes.. Fantastically maintained this old Victorian building has been tastefully renovated with a modern twist. The QVB is one of Sydney's greatest shopping complexes. This is top end shopping at its best and all the major brands from around the world are right here. Scattered with a few coffee shops and overpriced eateries.Not a place for bargain shoppers, this place can send millionaires broke !

Amazing Shopping centre. this a beautiful shopping arcade. There are some really interesting places to shop at, such as the antique map shop, and the French porcelain and jewellery shops. They are not cheap, but a great way to spend a hour or so

Beautiful History. This is a beautiful building. We had a look around but found a lot of things out of our price range. Inside it has a beautiful stained glass window and the centre piece clock I could watch for hours. Only problem, was I couldn't work out how to tell the time and day of week from the top part. I'm not sure if there are any instructions anywhere but I could not find anyone to ask.

History and shopping. A great combination for Sydney visitors to combine some history and shopping. There is a vast variety of shopping from the basement to the top floor. Bargains to high end. Be sure to view the building from all angles.

Interesting place to be, at all times. There is always a beehive or activities at the QVB, whether it be at the beginning of the trading hours or closing times. What is most exciting is of course, for the city workers, the discount that the food halls offered at the end of the day.
Upscale shopping mall. Upscale shopping mall. If you, or your friend, is seriously into shopping that is one good place to go downtown.You want to spend 700 dollars on shoes, no problem ...

Thank Goodness They Saved This. What a beautiful piece of architecture. It was great to see this and to enjoy a little of the past in a bustling city. It is well worth a visit and then you can go underground and explore some more. We wouldn't have found it without the l'm Free Walking Tour. Thanks!

An Old World Gem. This building has all the old world charm about it. Excellently preserved on the ourside and a modern high end shopping mall inside attached underground to the Town hall railway station.

Fantastic restoration. To a highlight of a visit to Sydney . Having been restored to its former glory a number of years ago this Victorian building is a marvel . Many interesting shops even if there are not too many bargains

Grand old Lady of Malls. Pierre Cardin (I think it was him) said of the QVB that it was the 'most beautiful shopping centre in the world'. Well, it has its charms because it's a blend of the old, beautifully reconstructed Victorian building into a tiered gallery of shops. Definitely worth a stroll though..but not a 'market' of any sort..so come with well stacked cards.

Majestic Old Building. This beautiful old building has been lovingly & expensively restored to it's original grandeur with efficient modern facilities. High end shops as well as cheaper chains, lovely cafes. The ladies' toilet facilities while modern, had charm of days gone by.

A fantastic buikdin. Thank God they stopped the demolition of this beautiful building. Instead of having a delightful place to visit there would be another ugly high rise to were. Just wande up and down on the levels and enjoy yourself
Typical Sydney Downtown. A nice way to experience typical Sydney's down town life, a traditional old Victorian building with a good shopping experience.

Photo opportunity. . Fantastic old building. Beautifully restored. The stain glass windows , lift and staircase kept the victorian feel. Spend some time to watch the hanging clocks. Expensive shops but we'll worth the visit.

Had a $48 million Refurbishment in 2008 - 9.. I love to stand half way along the George Street side and admire that side of the building, It looks more like Queen Vickie's Palace, it is so good.However her black statue stands out front on the Town Hall side and boy does she look unhappy.Once the old Sydney markets, but during the 1890's recession the State Government opted for a Victorian Romanesque Style of architecture so that many tradesmen could gain employment on the build. Well done the Government!Now it is the "London's Burlington Arcade" of Sydney, full of boutique shops and cafes.Overhead are the 20 different size small domes and the main copper covered dome. At night it is beautifully illuminated on the ground floor for the window shoppers to enjoy, and the side of the building even more so looks like a Palace with it numerous columns.Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.
Great shops and gorgeous old buidling. Lots of great shops, heaps of places to eat for afternoon tea and lunch. Lovely atmosphere - great place to do some shopping.
A must see. Beautiful historic building with speciality stores.Quality cafés, the shopping is probably too expensive for the average visitor but it's a lovely atmosphere for window shopping.
Beautiful Mall. Another heritage bldg in the city. One of the nicest malls I've seen in all the places I've been too.

high end shopping mall in heritage building. this is a beautiful building with colonial architecture.QVB is huge housing high end fashion brand and cafes. Strolling around the mall and taking photos is a must. great experience!

Beautiful place to shop or wander. The historic QVB is a real treasure for fans of architecture or boutique shopping. Beautifully maintained interiors with some wonderful old clocks as features. A host of the top design & fashion boutiques & plenty of choices for coffee or lunch. A relaxing and more refined way to shop if you are sick of traipsing George St or the malls.

My Absolute Favourite Shopping Experience. I confess that I am not a truly dedicated shopper but I LOVE the Queen Victoria. Glorious architecture, a wide variety of shops including the ones I love to look in but could never bring myself to buy. And then there is Victoria's Basement with its wonderful array of bargain priced home goods. The perfect place for a little splurge or a few gifts.
QVB Sydney. Again another must whilst in Sydney. A historic building full of beautiful shops and eateries . .Well worth spending a day . Looking around .

Eating heaven. Stopped in the QVB to eat a light lunch at one of the ground floor cafés. It's a beautiful shopping centre with so much character in the building, the architecture I found amazing.Plenty of shopping to be done over the several floors inside and well worth visiting.

Stunning. This wonderful building is a must see when visiting Sydney.There is a good variety of shops inside but the flooring and architecture are superb.The old lift still works and there is a very welcoming attendand.

Beautiful Old Building!. A lovely historic retail building. The history of the building goes back many years which is unusual in Australia, the building was going to be pulled down some time ago and it would have been a tragedy if it was! my favorite building in Sydney with many stores and cafes inside!
Great high tea!. Attended for high tea and it was fantastic, the food was beautiful and reasonably priced. The service was great and cannot wait to go back. Bookings are a must.

Great Icon of Sydney. Love walking through this place it amazes me each and every time.Quality business sorround you at every level and the tea rooms and cafes are a wonderful place to sit and relax as you take in the building and that amazing clock center piece.Really a must to see and enjoy both tourists a locals alike .
Mind you don't get lost!. Very impressive building. Lots of wonderful shops and cafes of all types. Very very crowded and several floors to visit. It was quite an experience.
What a beautiful old gal!. Gorgeous historic building scheduled for demolition back in the 80's and saved. Now, a lovely high end shopping mall with all the architectural details intact, lovely!
A Mall. This is a big shopping center in Sydney and it's beautiful, there are many stores there, but there is a lot of traffic, especially at night trying to get in.

Here is history to find. An excellent building to shop and eat, good for a rainy day or too hot day. This building is good to see the history of Melbourne. eat or drink something here, after you have seen a lot of old things the city offer.

Lovely building, expensive shops!. Someone recommended I should visit the QVB whilst I was in Sydney as it was a good building to walk around and look at the architecture.They also joked that the higher up the building you went the more expensive the shops were. I can honestly say that they were right on both accounts. The building is wonderful but I definitely would not shop here.

Lovely building with a variety of shops.. I love visiting this building both for the wide range of shops and its beautiful architecture. The basement has some great brand names at sale prices including Royal Albert and Royal Doulton as well as popular chain stores. The higher levels include a wide range of designer brands and unique boutiques.
Need time for this gen. So many fab shops on 4 levels. Hunt for a bargain downstairs, eat in one of many options including high tea or indulge in the many great shopping outlets.

yeah it's OK I guess. It's ok but nothing amazing. There are much nicer sites around Sydney without super expensive shops. One positive is the massive christmas tree they have every year but aside from that, nothing special.
Visiting the QVB. Always a delight visiting the QVB, so centrally located, good variety of shops and leading through to Myers, David Jones and extensive shopping Malls. A good meeting place.

Grand old QVB - shopping in style :). High end shopping in a lovely atmosphere. Fully restored to its former glory. A pleasure to shop in upper floors are high end lower and ground are cheaper. Longchamps, David Lawrence, Cue, Karen Millen, Coach, Vintage jewellery, coffee, cafes, Glue, Seed, Asics Jet Cafe. Something for everyone.

Beautiful. I love this building, and all that is in it. I have visited many times and so love the variety of shops, from old toys to beautiful dresses (and handbags!). Make sure you go to the top level to see the fascinating shops up there. And the Ladies' room is like a ball room!
Beautiful building. This is a beautiful building and worth visiting. many of the shops in the actual building are a bit overpriced 'though.

A beautiful shopping experience..... This exquisite building houses a complete cross section of boutiques and retail outlets over several floors. The upper level layout is gallery style - stunning architecture & huge central clock - with several eateries/cafes spaced between floors. The below ground level walkway links to a metro station and houses fast food as well as shops.
Heritage at its best. One of my all time favourite malls to shop in. All the high end luxury shops, with great food outlets. Starbucks has to be my favourite place!

Beautiful building. Such a charming Victorian building, worth a visit although most shops were out of my price range. Worth the time to visit, maybe stop for a coffee and take a few pictures. I was so happy to find a Lush shop!
Best building in Sydney. nice place to wander around and have coffee. Also has a lot of great shops. Christmas time it is beautifully decorated.
Great building . This is such a charming Victorian building. The shops looked interesting. Worth the time to visit and take a few pictures of the clock, which was cool.

Beautiful Victorian Building. I have visited this shopping "mall" each of my 3 trips to Australia. The antique giant clocks and the stained glass are marvelous. There are some great shops in the mall also. My favorite being Mondial Pink Diamonds - since they made up a cute anniversary band (transacted long distance by e-mail and telephone) with a heart shaped pink diamond. Rare, just like me!

ICONIC steel balconies - Sydney's Covent Garden Market vibe ( Bit upmarket with prices to match). Adore shopping here. Take the lift to the top floor and work your way back down. Have coffee. Good at end of season sale time. Good place to wander adn find presents, nick nacks, middle aged trendy clothes, and somewhere there is a shop that sells model planes and toys in kits...ah...QVB... I love it!

No bins. We love this building, it's steeped in so much history. The shops are beautiful (some really aren't in our price range though!). Only downfall, there are no bins anywhere, even discreetly placed, so if you have any rubbish (say a coffee cup or empty softdrink bottle) there is no where to dispose of it.

Beautiful must-see. A must-see. Right in the city centre, this beautiful building is full of restaurants. Trendy shops and have access to the Town Hall (central) Train station, connecting the centre with almost any location in Sydney. Beautiful for a brunch while enjoying a beautiful Victorian-style building.

Queen Victoria Building, Sdyney. This is a beautiful colonial building which has been extensively renovated and house the high end shopping & foods outlets. It is just in George Street, opposite the Town Hall Station. If you are tired after walking, have a cup of coffee & cakes/pastries in the outlets & people watch. The underground mall is connected to the Westfield shopping mall in the Pitt Street and link to Town Hall station.
Classic design & great shopping. A brilliant older building in Sydney's CBD. A great place to shop or simply grab a coffee.Check out the very large mechanical clock on the hour!

Great Shopping Place. Queen Victoria Building we call it QVB is a place for shopping centre, or a place to do a relax time to have coffee and enjoy the atmosphere. This is QVB attraction is the local brand or Australia or Overseas Brand also. It's so nice to shop here beside the shop it self, we can see the beautifulness of the building it self. Here we can find some restaurant, shops like shoes, bag, shirts, house need, etc. It's a nice place to go.
Beautiful building. A tourist must. Great cafes, shops to buy or window shop. Wonderful restoration of a Sydney icon.Easy accessibility by bus, foot or train.

Beautiful interior. WoW!What a beautiful building and the stores exceptionalMulti storied with something to see on each floor. Plenty of places to eat and drink. The stores had some nice sales. Got a black skirt for $54AU that became $37US. Original price $109AU

Old World Class. I love visiting this building, not for the shopping and lovely eating options, but because the building itself is amazing. Stained glass windows, domes, statues, old world class in a modern setting. Beautiful. And the shopping...yes!!!!1

A beautiful building. I never tire of going into the QVB, it is amazing and something for everyone. Good shops and eating places, but the architecture is lovely and you can spend an afternoon just looking around.
Time to kill..... I have come to love this building. Its such a beautiful old bird that you can stare at it for hours.

Elengance at the QVB. Visiting Sydney the Queen Victoria Building (QVB) is a must see for tourists. It takes visitors back to another era with beautiful architecture and lovely shops. High tea is a speciality at the elegant Tea Room. Located in what was once the original Grand Ballroom of the landmark Queen Victoria Building, The Tea Room epitomises style and quality.

Beautifully restored building.. A beautiful place for a stroll and look at the shops when in the city with time to spare. Well connected to the Town Hall Station and with budget to pricy shopping options ( as you go up ) the building has lots to offer along with its elegance and history. Great at Christmas when they go to a lot of effort to make a magical Christmas scene.

Rescued Gem in the crown. I remember as a young bloke ,when the building was all closed and boarded over.When I go there now I marvel at the architecture and the daily throng that visits.I am not a shopper so I just go to enjoy the ambiance and the photographic opportunities.Easily accessed by foot,rail, Bus and in the centre of the city.Great coffee as well.Go up the stairs, it's worth it

love shopping. a day full of glamour and designers.Queen Victoria is your shopping centre with the same brands find in other shopping centre but like imperial arcade class is garnet to be find.Great coffeeshops with great food attached to one of the most busy railway station town hall and buses to most part of Sydney

My wife loved it!. We stopped there as we were wondering around the streets of Sydney and really much enjoy the architecture as well as the shops in there. My wife ended up spending a few hours shopping around and I spent my time taking pictures. Good place to sit back and relax for a few hours.

A great place to shop (or just stroll). The beautifully restored QVB is a terific place to wander and window shop. There is something for everyone and if you get tired there are plenty of cafes for a meal or just a coffee (or tea). If you want something a bit more up market you can partake of high tea, in splendid surroundings.

A Shoppers Paradise. I hate shopping so being stuck somewhere like this is my worst nightmare. However, travelling with a shopaholic I was forced to endure it. This aside, it is a beautiful building and worth visiting.
Classy shopping. Go for a nice tea-time, or for the great shopping. This beautifully decorated building let's you walk in a great ambiance without the stress of other shopping malls.

Take your time, worth the explore. Coffee, restaurants, shoes ,jewellery, clothing, nik naks, chocolates and practically anything and everything. A bit on the pricey side, but elegant, clean and delightful. A must visit for the old world charm and the designer shopping experience.

Favourite shopping place. Just love this building. All small individual shops selling anything and everything. Beware, its huge and easy to get lost in there. Lots of places for coffee and a rest. On each floor, there were things of interest. Someone playing a Grand Piano, a Jade antique Chinese marriage carriage to name a couple.

Beautiful but pricey shops. Beautiful architecture however the shops can be somewhat on the pricey side. Do take in an expresso and pastry while shopping here. Beautiful decor throughout and we enjoyed the cleanliness of the building.

One stop shopping. For a very different experience in Sydney visit the Queen Victoria Building - from the crazy clutter of Victoria's basement right up through all the floors there is fashion, food and several places just to meet a friend or sit and enjoy a coffee and a pastry. The upper floors have several specialty shops which might just have that unusual memento you want to carry back home with you. Even though I'm a local I know I'll be able to find the right present there for a special person.The top floor serves a very fine afternoon tea.The QVB (as the locals call it) is also a convenient place to catch a bus to the Art Gallery of NSW or a train on the City Circle line to the Australian Museum or Circular Quay.

Check out the clocks!. It's hard to imagine a more elegantly outfitted shopping center! If you're wandering down the streets of Sydney's central business district, don't be fooled by the usual (architecturally beautiful) exterior of the QVB - step inside! The stained glass, the lighting, the wrought-iron spiral staircase, the ceilings, the clocks! Try to time it so you can see the clocks perform at the top of the hour - truly amazing.

Tea rooms Queen Victoria Building, Sydney. What a treat, champagne to start then delicious sandwiches and cakes coupled with delightful tea in a magnificent setting served by attentive staff. A great afternoon.

Christmas time is must see at the QVB!!. Architecture is exquisite, a piece of Sydney's history, from the outside to the inside, I come here every year at Christmas to see the Christmas display, and the Christmas photo's with Santa are the best in town. It is usually in a giant birdcage with Schwarzkopf crystals hanging from the roof, sugar plum fairies, and colourful forest creatures and flowers. It's a must see
Worth a Look. Lovely place to visit especially around Christmas when they have the tree & decorations up. Lots of great shops too.
Beautiful building, expensive shops, nice food. Really beautiful building! Step back in time. Expect expensive shops. Try the food. Great location in the heart of central Sydney.
WOW .. Great snacky eats.. Absolutely amazing eats and shopping. It's has an underground connection to the Ginormous Westfield Mall next door. If you enjoy shopping ..... have at it!
Stunning old architecture. This is a super old building with stunning architecture from the Victorian England era. The shops are a little exclusive but you don't have to shop.

Domed splendour. It's easy to stroll through this glorious nineteenth century retail emporium. You can enjoy the ornate architectural features of the building with its three balcony levels, do some window shopping, or do some actual shopping.If you're in the city centre you won't have to go out of your way to find the QVB as it fills a whole block beside Town Hall.

Gorgeous!. Houses high-end brands and names. Some might think it's no point going there but truly, the building, outside and inside, is quite a sight! Stunningly beautiful and it houses many cafes you can pick from for breakfast coffee or afternoon tea!
Great shopping. Not cheap!!! Lots of up market stores. Places to sit and eat and people watch. Great architecture. A Sydney gem.

The QVB keeps on delivering.. What visit would be complete without some incredible shopping? The QVB has been around for a very long time and doesn't stop delivering great shopping and eateries. Don't forget to go underground - there's even more there !

Beautiful Architecture. Yes, the Queen Victoria Building is crowded, and yes, there are other beautiful buildings in the CBD--but the Queen Victoria is well worth your time and attention, because the architectural details are beautiful! They don't make buildings like this anymore--so, if you want to see something special, take your time, really look around, and do bring your camera.

Most beautiful building in Sydney. Queen Victoria Building or QVB is an exquisite old building in the city of Sydney. This is filled with high end shops and cafes and restaurants of various nature. The interior of the building is beautifully tiled with color full tiles. It has four floors and It also has stained glass windows and original lifts on both sides.

A shopping centre, not too much more. I was here on the way somewhere a few times. It is an impressive building, but nothing you don't see elsewhere in the CBD. Its crowded because of its central location and its used for public transport. Inside, its not more than a shopping centre so its really not a must visit in Sydney if you have got limited time.

Great Building- get ready your camera. QVB is located at Town Hall Station. You can enter the building directly from the station. This is a high end shopping center. The building is built according to ancient architect style. internal and external well present. Good for photographer who like to take building picture.
Photo Opportunity!. Not much shopping to do but good to visit for good photo-taking opportunities. You can also cross over to the other malls if you are up for shopping. Very central!

A Sydney-siders perspective. The QVB is an iconic building and travel destination for locals and visitors alike. It holds many flag-ship and designer stores to peruse through. They tend to get more expensive as you go up in levels. For many years it was derelict and abandoned and the local government and private developers united to renovate in the late 20th century and what Sydney got was a Victorian masterpiece. Be sure to visit at Christmas - the southern hemispheres' biggest xmas tree goes on display complete with swarovski crystal ornaments. See the special clock on the top level on the hour. Best vantage points are with coffee and cake in one of the numerous eateries.
Great architectures. Beautiful building on the outside, e shopping center on the inside is also very well presented. Higher end shopping. One must peek in if they are in the Sydney city centre.
History Abounds. Historical building filled with lots of shops and cafés. Stick around to hear the two, large,beautiful Victorian clocks chime.

Shop till you drop. Haha wonderful brand from the local brand to luxury premium brand as long as you can afford it you can get it. Customer services is just round the corner they glad to help traveler with places around this area.

History and Elegance. If you love historical Sydney you'll love the Queen Victoria Building(QVB). Each time we visit Sydney we end up going through it to grab a snack or make a deliberate short-cut to another destination.It has a great period feel to it along with a some great shops for either browsing or buying.If you're a newbie to Sydney, make sure this is on your list of places to visit, a slice of history.

Stop, visit and shop.. Just full of stores, selling everything from post cards to clothing, food to eat, all in a well preserved building in downtown Sydney. A must place to visit, multi storey, in a truly Victiorian atmosphere.
Beautiful building, average shops.. Worth having a wander through if you have time. A real mixture of shops and cafes. I think its the building that is the highlight.
Absolutely beautiful. Do not miss the "Talking Dog" close to the Queen Victoria statue. Check ou the 2 ceiling clocks at the hour mark. Admire the dome and then go into the "Tunnels".

Amazing building. Awesome from the outside, wow from the inside. The architecture of the building is simply amazing! Easily found locating at george street. The building stands up from far! There are many shops inside, a small shopping paradise (:

Good place for shopping mix with sight seeing. A very nice buiding turn into a good shopping mall. Very centrallise for people who wants to shop for brand names. I like the dog statues outside. Cute Place.

a must-been-to if you are in Sydney. right in the City Center the QVB is a great place to have tea if you don't mind it being busy around you. There's heaps of shops inside and its simply a busy and agile athmosphere in a lovely building.

Designer Shopping all in one place. With everything from designer shopping, art, toys, eateries, homewares. High end as well as (on the lower level) mid range fashion (affordable). All housed in the beautiful historic QVB. Some days your may be lucky to hear a soloist play the grand piano. Make sure you go to the upper level and watch the Royal Clock when activated shows scenes of English Royalty. A treat of the whole family.

A great way to waste a few hours. The Queen Victoria Building is a great place to stroll, have a bite to eat and to find some great shopping. If you are looking for bargain shopping and dining stick to the bottom two levels.
Did someone say shopping?. great place for abit of shopping with lots of floors and lots of brands, also nice to sit and have a coffee with a friend

Restored to former glory. The size of this place is greater than it looks from outside. A shopping mecca for Sydney and lots of food and drinks to help as you spent time wondering around. One of the many must see of Sydney.

Go for the architecture not the shopping.. A stunning building in its own right inside and outside. The shops are a bit upmarket for most people and catering very much to tourists. The clock and upper level galleries are well worth a look.

Stately building. I love this huge old building. You can sit have coffee and chocolates and watch the world go by, take the kids to the ABC shop and Hobbyco, browse the brand shops and look for a bargain in Victoria's Basement.We live in the suburbs but visit the city regularly and always pass through the building. And did I tell you about the clocks? Be there at midday for the chimes. And look out for the central Christmas tree.

Stunning retail heaven!. Went for a walk around Queen Victoria and was stunned at the absolute beauty of the place. I wish we saw more shopping centres give this sort of attention to detail. Although I merely window shopped through here, it was the architecture that would make me a return visitor.

Hip without being hipster. So lovely to see such a historic feeling building in such great state of affaris with a lot of very appropriate shopping and eating available throughout. Its also a fantastic access point to the rail network, so worth the stop if you're on the trains and visiting the city.

Shopping and High Tea. This is one of Sydney's jewels! The building is just stunning to look at, a great display in architecture and beautifully furnished within, We finished our visit with a lovely high tea in the QVB Tea Rooms on the top floor, very decadent.

Great Place For Window Shopping!. This is a great arcade to wander through and have a look in lots of the terrific variety of shops. I love the old style buildings and thoroughly enjoyed window shopping! I've been here before at Christmas time and they certainly decorate the arcade well - worth visit then too!
Time to shop!. Numerous shops and eateries in the QVB. Centrally located in George Street, opposite Town Hall. 3-4 levels of shopping.
Beautiful Architecture. Graceful building, a must view even if just to wander through. If you have time stop have a coffee or tea and sit and watch people go by. Very glamorous.
Very nice . I enjoyed my visit, it was very nice to see and full of lovely shops and lovely architecture. I would definitely recommend a visit

must visit for all. what a beautiful building with so many fabulous shops and cafes.i can sit there the whole day or walk in the shopping area all day long.it is really beautiful.in the centre of the building there is a very old clock.absolutely fabulous roof that has a light show with music on certain days.

An iconic Sydney building. My wife gives this a five for all it's boutique shops
An iconic Sydney that should be on your visit list

Beautiful building. It's worth stopping by here just to admire the heritage building. THe shops are mainly high end so perhaps not really casual shopping. The place has some nice cafe's for a quick meal.

Frenzied shopping in the CBD - this place was packed. Great eclectic shopping mall with stuff crammed into it everywhere! Awesome homewares shop in the basement and plenty of things to do and see. The crowds were large as it was a Sunday but that was good.

Unique and Nice Building~. A very unique building. It looks nice and never expect it is a shopping mall. I like the decoration of this building, wonderful. A lot of shops here and enjoy the shopping plus the cafes available here. It will be a good place for those who love to do shopping.

Very beautiful architecture. This large building is located on Market and George Streets. The Victorian shopping arcade is one of the most ornate in Australia with around 200 shops of all price ranges. The shops are open 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. with Thursday staying open until 9 p.m. Sunday hours are from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. We were not tempted to buy anything but enjoyed the stain glass, and the beauty of the architecture.
Good to spend a few hours.. Worth spending a half day wondering around this lovely old building which contains some interesting (but expensive) shops.
Great Shopping Venue. A definitely not too missed shopping arcade. Huge with lots of branded and high street labels. You will surely forgot the time and have something to buy!

Beautiful Victorian-era designed building.. The shops are very expensive, and are mainly famous clothing brands. There is a coffee shop which was busy when I was walking past. You can walk through to Town Hall Station from the bottom of the QVB.

Sydneysidere love this building, and we shop here too!. This lovely old ex-market building (hence the reason for the sloping floors - so they could wash the floors clean at closing time) is a great example of a beautiful shopping centre, in an historical building, that is enjoyed by locals and tourists alike. It's worth a wander, even if you are just here for a couple of days, to see the gorgeous architecture.I've read on here about the shops being expensive - it's Australia, everything is expensive. Many of the shops on the ground floor and lower ground are Australian chain stores that also exist elsewhere.If you want a coffee, head up to the top two floors where you have good choices. I normally go to Yama for coffee/cake as it's quieter but you are still able to enjoy the building and the buzz.

They don't build them like this anymore. Just strolling around and looking at the beautiful building, clock, staircases etc is a wonder. Then you also have shops! Big hobby shop and clothes and impressive jewellers. Coffee is great and breakfast at the Tea House was lovely, we all tried a different tea than we would usually have.

Worth the visit. The QVB is always visited when I'm in Sydney, the shops (even just to look), the decor, history and splendid of the building. Walking around this grand old lady takes you back in time-ensure you visit yo see the clock windows change, view from the top levels in the middle of the building. Walk around, have a coffee and font forget the lower ground level which will take you to Town Hall Sration or Myers.

The most beautiful "store" in the world!. This beautiful, Victorian sandstone building, really IS the jewel in Sydney's crown, when it comes to retail history.Of course, it is full of cafes and stores offering premium products, but there's quite a few that offer interesting and unique products too. It is impeccably restored and maintained, and is always extremely busy - especially down underground during morning and afternoon peak hour, due to the entrance to Town Hall Station being there.But to just spend an hour or two, wandering around, marvelling at the sweeping stone staircases, the stained glass windows, the animated clocks and the stores full of fabulous product, is worth it.

Definitely worth a visit. One of my favorite places to go in Sydney. There is so much charm to this old building, and it's been faithfully redecorated. The shops are very expensive (apart from in the basement level) but it's a great place to have lunch or a coffee, and take in the beauty of the building.

Shopping and relaxing!. Always one of my favourite places to visit when in Sydney! I love the architecture, but also the morning and afternoon tea options - delicious! Most of all, the shopping! From the bargain basement to my favourite brands including Oroton!
Shopping Center. Beautiful Victorian building converted in a shopping center. Very busy. A mix of European brands ans Aussies

Iconic Shopping area of Sydney. This is a nice building with tons of shops to choose from.Vintage feel with victorian architecture.Very nice to enjoy the weekend with coffee and located in downtown area.A must visit for all tourist in Sydney!

Lovely old building,excellent shopping.. The QVB is a fairly unique design and a must for just a walk through. If you are into shopping, there are more than enough high end stores to keep you happy. The cafes are always busy and the whole place has really good buzz going on.

Busy but a sight to see. From the outside it looks very much out of place amongst the modern sky scrapers and once you wonder inside it's a gem of a find full of modern shops, cafes and access to other major shopping centres in the heart of the city

Bit of everything. I am a sucker for historic buildings and this place is that but continues to be updated to latest. Plenty of shops. Plenty of cafes and always lot of people. I would like better sinage. Maybe someone in it could do an app. With gps could tell u were u r and how to get to a certain store etc

A walk in local history. Go and visit the Queen Victoria Building when in Sydney. Just across from Town Hall Station with direct access its always worth a walk through the QVB.
