Fabulous. Just Walking through this Place is great, Expensive shops but a real European classy feel caracterizes QVB.

Arcade shopping at its best. I prefer shopping in smaller stores where customer service still applies. The service is better, the queues are shorter and i can think about my purchase, without chaos. Great eateries and shops all through this wonderful old lady of Sydney.

It's old but essentially just a high end shopping centre. The building is very picturesque from the outside; the shops inside are typical of the - now all too familiar - monotonous high-end fashion boutiques. If that's your thing, go for it, otherwise admire it from outside.

Stunning looking building - impressive at night. We were not actually planning to visit this building but were just inside a mall and trying to go towards Town Hall station and kept following the directions which also kept mentioning QVB :) When we reached the road, we saw this stunning heritage building all well lit up and then asked someone what it is (can see the pic) and decided to check it out ... full of shops but not really interested in shopping much.

The most beautiful commercial building in Sydney. A few decades ago, they were going to knock this building down - can you imagine?? Now it takes pride of place in the chopping precinct. Its architecture and interior design is a must to see - just stroll through and enjoy or sit and have a coffee and watch the people. Sydney would be a poorer place if this building was not here - one of the few heritage buildings we can enjoy.
very impressive. The building itself is amazing. They had huge Christmas tree and beautiful decoration all over the building which made it very magical

A pleasant surprise. From the outside it's an imposing building but inside it's a very nice shopping experience with beautiful tiled floors and modern bright shops.Over several floors there is a wide range of shops (the wife managed to buy 3 Pandora charms) from shoes to superb confectionary.There was a magnificent contemporary Christmas tree in its centre when we visited.It's well worth a look
A busy hub of shoppers and upmarket stores. You can always enjoy shopping for the latest trends on three levels of speciality stores or stop off for an afternoon tea with your friends.
Fun!. Great place for shopping or just for a snack, the QVB is a window shopper's paradise! Make sure you see the elaborate clock's display on the hour.

Interesting but more. It's an old interesting building, but the shops are mostly to expensive for average visitors. Better visit the shopping center The Strand. It's also on the George street, but you will find nicer shops and a bit more atmosphere.

It's a pretty, over priced shopping center. It is a pretty building, but it's just a shopping mall. It has some quirky shops but most are mainstream. The parking is horrifically expensive, but it's close to lots of buses and on top of a major train hub. It has some nice coffee shop but everything is on the expensive side, no bargains here.

Beautiful Building, a must stop for shoppers!. This is a gorgeous structure with 4 floors. It is a combination of both popular brand names but also has a number of small boutiques which were great. If nothing else, this place is a must see tourist attraction. Worth the visit, even if you don't want to shop!
Beautiful!. I loved it. Although it's an old building, but it doesn't look old it all!Great for shopping and afternoon tea (high tea) at The Tea Room.

STUNNING BUILDING!!!!!. I had already read that this was the most beautiful shopping centre in the world, but was still amazed when I saw it in person. From the huge statue out front, to the beautiful exterior and interior of the building. I felt like I should be taking my shoes off inside lol.The shopping centre has a great variety of stores over approx 5 levels. The clock that you can see in the main pic looks amazing and has all these physical models like a small sailing ship moving around it as time progresses. It is a truely amazing clock!My favourite store was the model store, which covers two levels. It has the largest collection of model airplanes I have ever seen in my life. I spent over 2 hours in the store!There was a link on the underground level, that went under the road and linked to the Westfield Shopping Centre.Every person should see the QVB, even if you don't like shopping :)
Great Building. What an excellent building , the Christmas tree was awesome and the clocks amazing . The shops are quaint with loads of eating places . Nice and clean too .
Shopping!!!. If you love to shop there are some great shops in this building! They also have a couple of cafes that are really yummy for breakfast or brunch!

Sanctuary in the City. We are from Adelaide and visit family in Sydney a couple of times a year. While in Sydney we always seek out and visit the magnificent QVB, It is a sanctuary in the city for us.It is a wonderful piece of history that lives on and has so much style and class compared to many newer stainless steel and glass monoliths. We usually at least stop for a coffee or maybe lunch and stroll the different levels enjoying the architecture and eclectic variety of shops. Of course as we are from Adelaide we always check out Haighs Chocolates!Well worth a visit.
Shopping splendour. This is a must visit for anyone going to Sydney. So many high quality shops in an architecturally exquisite building. History and shopping brought together
Most beatiful bldg in Australia. Even compared to the Opera House! Classic features maintained, although shopping is a bit pricey for me.

History in the heart of Sydney. Visited this place on 29 December. Old building with a lot of history. The glass roof gives a nice atmosphere of light inside. Many upmarket shops and several nice cafe's. Feels like being in London. It is busy...like everywhere in Sydney around this time!
well connected. There is a great variety of stores in the building and the underground access makes getting there an enjoyable experience

Excellent Stores. We visited over the Christmas holiday, so the stores were packed with people. It was a bit hard to move around sometimes. That said, there is an excellent array of stores and the Christmas tree was enchanting. Make sure you see the clock depicting English history.

Christmas at QVB!. Beautiful shops, friendly, helpful staff and cafes to revive us. Lovely Swarovski Christmas Tree shooting its lights up through the levels. We caught our bus just outside the building and the décor of the QVB stayed with us for hours.

An architectural gem in the heart of Sydney. This late 1880s building once housed the City of Sydney Library and was due to be demolished until Malaysian interests acquired, then refurbished it to its former glory at a cost of many millions. But what a stunning result! It is accessed from ground and also below-ground level, the latter serving to link the Town Hall railway station. The huge building now houses a wealth of high-fashion clothing, shoe and accessory boutiques, chic little coffee shops, newsagents, a couple of banks, chocolatiers, jewellers and an upmarket merchandise store in the basement. But most people are happy to marvel at the intricate mosaics once they enter from the Town Hall side (where an imposing statue of a stern, but young, Queen Victoria looks out over busy George Street) or, indeed, any other side on the four-street frontage. In the middle, if you look up past the wrought-iron lace balconies of the upper levels, you will notice a Glockenspiel which delights viewers every quarter-hour with a parade, but the big parade of doll-like figures occurs every hour. It's different from the Galleria opposite Milan's Duomo in that it is far less grand and not as well open to the elements but, for all that, it has an appeal unique to Sydney, and should NOT be missed!

Better from outside than the inside. The exterior of the building is very attractive, especially the lead light windows in the middle on both sides. Inside the building is just shops, shops and more shops mostly expensive labels and boutiques. The clock inside is worth having a glance at.

A trip back in time. This is a shopping mecca to remember. The old building was dressed up for Christmas and in all its splendour. Too bad about the 20th century escalators installed as it takes away from the old time feeling. One of the worlds great Christmas trees complete with Swarovski ornaments is a highlight. Oh, and the shopping is pretty good too. Not to be missed, even if just for a short stroll through.

Crowded and hot. Ok, so it just before christmas. But its also the middle of summer Message to all you muppets who operate shopping malls - turn on the bloody air conditioning or guess what? I don't feel like spending money !

Good for all sort of reasons. This is a charming building beautifully restored. There is great boutique shopping here as well as many please to eat. Be warned though- service at the restaurants decreases the higher you go in the building! The Metropolitan Museum is a highlight, on the top floor, as is Fish fine music. best of all for women, the Ladies room on the top floor is one of the nicest in Sydney! It is entertaining to be there after 3.30 on Fridays and see teenage schoolgirls transforming themselves with a change of clothes and lots of eye make up in preparation for the evening's fun.

Expensive tastes only. As a tourist I've always wanted to see the QVB for the beautiful design and shopping.They building itself is beautiful but the shops inside are for the wealthy. Not good for a young adult on a budget.
great old spot. nice place with interesting shops..try the tea room ..great prices and high tea can be shared between two
Worth a visit. Very Nice building inside and out, lovely with all the Christmas decorations, many nice boutique shops

Always a favourite in town. A beautiful old building of classical architecture, it still holds far more interest than the nearby office buildings and retail centres - may be old but its appeal will last forever.

Royal charm for all. This is an excellent place any time of the year, but especially in the Christmas season. Lost of decorations, Santa's cave for the "Little People" to enjoy and make photos and lots of eateries for all pocket size and taste. You may also browse the place and make photos - all free of charge. So, no matter your budget or the taste you will always find some amusement in this amazing place.
nice architecture. When we visited, it wasn't for the shopping (which looked great), it was for the architecture. So even if you don't want to shop, stop inside to have a look!

Wonderful building, well kept interior but slightly too expensive for me!. I really enjoyed the architecture and interior aesthetic of QVB but found that most of the shops were on the slightly expensive side of life for me. It's a nice place to stroll and if money permits spend a dollar or two! Would love to go back :-)

Magnificent Old Shopping Building. The QVB was decked out for Christmas when we visited, and was lovely as ever. Three floors of nice shops, together with sub-ground floors with some lower priced fare and food, in one of the splendid older buildings of Sydney. It is in the heart of the main shopping area, and connected underground to many of the other malls.

Too good. The Christmas tree was done by Swarovski and amazingly high and beautiful
The four floors were too good and the Victorian watch in between used to have a small entertainment every half an hour
Nice building but expensive shops.. Nice to see the design of this old building but the shopping is not so good as the coffees and purchases are very expensive. So just to hve a look and see is ok.

Historic QVB. Located In the heart of the CBD the Queen Victoria Building offers shoppers a wonderful shopping experience. With transport at the door shoppers can delight in both exclusive designer boutiques and cheaper shopping options. The building itself has a proud history and takes visitors back to a time when to shop was an EXPERIENCE.
History and Grace. such a beautiful old building with modern amentities with lattice and iron and very old architecture. any and every type of shop you could imagine is within this building.

Gorgeous. Entered this to shelter from the rain but wow what a truly beautiful place. We entered to see a floor to ceiling Christmas tree decorated from top to bottom with swarthy crystals it was absolutely gorgeous the building is something else lots of ornate features and mosaic floors make an effort to see you won't be disappointed.

A beautiful old building steeped in history.. The shopping here is awesome, filled with many exclusive shops, however it has much more. Make sure you go to the very top and gaze at the beautiful dome. Take in the old world clocks and the tiled floors. More than just a place to shop!
Beautiful old Lady. We visited in December so the crystal Chrsitmas tree was up - stunning! Lots of great shops, beautiful restoration of a once neglected building - must see and walk through
Best shopping in Sydney. Find a table and grab a coffee and watch the World go by. The QVB is so beautiful, take the time to look around!
Our Wish list. Visited at night time when shops shut and not many people around - able to view the beauty of the building. Went back during the day time when shops open to make purchases

Beautiful at Christmas!. the QVB iis really Beautiful at Christmas with MASSIVE christmas trees the hiehgt of the whole centre! I woudl love to be able to shop here more often however most of the shops are a little out of my budget!
History plus.. This is a great old piece of history in the middle of the city. Top it off with great stores. Don't miss the toy store on the top floor!

Could have spent the whole day here. What a treasure! A massive array of retailing with the emphasis on quality.I could have spent the day in the toy/model shop just on its own. A fantastic place to browse or spend in with an exceptional range of goods on offer, along with food/drink offerings to rest awhile in. The lower floors connect with subterranean retail passages that underpin Sydney and link up with other retail palaces. Not to be missed but allow at least half a day.

Brilliant place. Fantastic, huge Christmas Tree which spans the 3 floors. Great shopping with many specialty shops. Some great cafe / bars to have a sit, chat, people watch and rest the weary feet.A glorious old building which has kept it's charm and character.

WOW. My sister said that this building was almost torn down ages ago. Glad it wasn't. It is stunning. The Christmas tree was up and breath taking. We had a bite, a Cappuccino and gawked at the high end stores. What a great building - and it took my breath away when i first saw it outside... it goes on and on and on. Lovely.

The best building in Sydney. What a joy to walk into the fantastic building with it's tesselated floor and amazing array of shops (too many clothes though), wonderful clocks and stained glassed windows. An amazing Christmas tree was erected through all 3 floors and up to the domed ceiling and the atmosphere was magic. Not to be missed.

Beautifully Preserved Old Archade-styled Building. Sydney tends to be quite pricey any ways...but in the basement of this lovely building...is an amazing shop with some great discounts & unusual items...the building alone is worth the walk-about ...but that basement store ...still puts a smile on my bargain-loving face!! :)

A beautiful building - with something for everyone. Whether you're shopping - high end or budget, just browsing, enjoying the architecture, dining or just socialising over a drink or coffee - you can do it all here. A family could go their separate desired ways for a while then meet for lunch or a coffee very easily, without even stepping outside. It's a lovely building to see, shops are varied and good quality and public transport goes right past. It's good!

shopping spree in Sydney. QVB is great for shopping, there are so many beautiful things to choose from. This is like a paradise in a different world. You will enjoy your stay in sydney as QVB displays quality items .Enjoy shopping.

Beautiful building, worth a visit. This is well worth a wander through if you love old buildings. The shops are mostly expensive and many a bit scary to go in! But there is something there for everyone. There are two interesting clocks (you will have to go to see why they are interesting!), the stained glass and staircase's are beautiful. At the moment there is a stunning Swarovski Christmas tree in situ (for Xmas of course!).

Beautiful building. This is a shopping mall one of a kind. The building itself has lovely architecture so take a moment to look up and around you. Lots of shops of all different kinds and in the basement the most marvellous homewares department, many bargains to be had so leave time for browsing and space in your suitcase!

Wonderful Old Building!. We went to the QVB when it was decorated for Christmas. It has a wonderful 3 story christmas tree with Swarofsky crystals on it. The building has been wonderfully restored and is a must see if you are in Sydney. The shops are on the high end but nice for window shopping. We all loved the QVB!

Quaint. Upmarket shopping befitting of a regal building. We enjoyed wandering around here and trawling the basement for some good deals. Definitely worth spending at least an afternoon exploring the entire building.

Just Classic. This nineteenth century Victorian style building is simply classic. It is situated next to Town Hall Station and is easily accessible from all direction of the city. I will take a walk there every time I go to the city just to see its decoration and the lovely spiral staircase. At Christmas time, there is always a hugh Christmas tree decorated with crystals. It is a place you should not miss when you come to Sydney.

Shopping in Style. What a transformation of a building, from a humble market 100years ago into high fashion and sophistication. A must for high end shoppers and the tourists alike. Parking underneath is actually reasonably priced and there is a maze of tunnels that lead away from this hub. Be warned you will get lost :)

Wonderful building.. I enjoy wandering through here and quietly absorbing its grandeur. The Christmas tree is spectacular, but make sure that you observe it from all levels and from a distance to see its full height and magnificence.
Wander around.. Worth to just see this restoredold building in the city centre. But leave your credit card at the hotel as the stores are expensive.

Beautiful Building. Went to the QVB and it was all decorated for Christmas. Beautifully done and has a Christmas Tree you can stand under! It is 3 stories tall and decorated with Swarofsky crystals. Very nice upscale shops, great architecture and some nice cafés. Worth a visit and you can walk down George St, King St, etc to shop.

Must see. Gorgeous building that has been beautifully preserved and filled with boutiques and eateries. Don't miss the chance to see the spectacular clock up-close by visiting the 2nd and 3rd levels. Whether you are interested in antique maps, jewelry, bargains, clothing, gelato or tea, the QVB has a bit of everything. Most of all the building is just stunning

Beautiful Building. I dashed out of torrential rain into this building - without knowing what it was or what to expect. Wow! The architecture was breathtaking and being before Christmas was beautifully decorated. There's a huge Swarovski Christmas Tree which reaches from floor to the top floor - stunning. There are many floors to this shopping centre, with quality shops and cafes. It was full of old world charm in a very modern city. There was also free wifi available.

Beautiful. This is a great building to visit. The windows, the clock, etc. are all something to see. It was decorated for Christmas when we where there which only added to the charm of the building. There are elevators but we used the stairs and make sure to visit all three floors.

Beautiful architecture. A most lovely building architecturally with all of the stores and shopping boutiques you can think of.
This time of year, the Swarovski Crystal Chritmas tree in the center of the foyer is spectacular.
The "Victoria's Basement" offers real bargain shopping on certain items like British Royalty china coffee mugs etc..

Beautiful old building. Love going here. Lots of beautiful shops, great cafes, just a beautiful building to look at. Go to the tea rooms up on the top floor and have morning or afternoon tea, a real treat!

Beautiful building to take a peak at!. The building is beautiful -both to look at from the outside and to shop in or sip coffee inside. There's free wifi and you can just glance at the beautiful ceiling/setting whenever you'd like a quick stopover in the city.

Older style Building Nice going back to the War Period. QVB is one of those buildings from back in the War, its a one long arcade with multiple levels like Maze with lots of boutique shops just like any other shopping mall in the CBD. The only highlight of QVB that might be at the budget seekers is Queen Victorias Basement where you can purchase Kitchenware for budget prices, but other than that there are allot of obscure stores that specialized in one item most of the shops along the arcade are not that big in size anyway due to QVB built on a thin strip of land between George and York streets. you will find going into the stores to be cramp, even the pedestrian pathway can be cramped at times with tidal waves of pedestrians going in one direction, its certainty cramped in the Basement, make sure you don;t knock anything and break it else you pay for it. Allot of the building inside is old, the lifts are old it probably gets the odd leak from heavy rains and fresh airconditioning.

Olde world charm with a modern twist. To wander through this complex is a great experience. I loved the retention of colonialism mixed with modern fitted shops. Something for everyone. Specialty shops cater for every taste and desire and all do it so well Assistants are very knowledgable about the products they sell and friendly and helpful in explaining to travelers.

Character and charm.. Just nice to wander around this old restored building. Now a very expensive shopping arcade but the architecture costs nothing to admire and at least stop for a coffee in one of the stores.

Heritage on show. The QVB is a gem! Surrounded by high-rise buildings, it sits graciously on its 115 year old foundations, a testimony to the craftsmanship of the builders, tilers, mosaicists and leadlight glass artists of the time. The building is beautiful, and has been restored faithfully over the years. The shops are equally easy on the eye, and several cafes provide a place to sit and enjoy the feel of the place. Thank goodness the city fathers had the foresight to let it stand. Well worth a visit, if only to see the Christmas decorations! A giant Swarovski-draped Christmas tree towers through all four floors.

Lovely building, great places for meals and shopping. A must ...you can spend a whole afternoon enjoying a coofee break or a meal, doing some shopping and admiring the beautiful building with gorgeous little boutiques on all of the 4 levels. The architecture itself is spectacular and you can feel the "empire" all around. There´s a lift taking you up to the varoius floors....amazing style. I found one of my hair salons there that used to be in Double Bay years ago...was thrilled...got an appointment for a haircut.

Nice Elegant Shopping Experience. Be sure and visit as the interior is so different from the outside. The building is distinguished by its design and size. The interior is so different with its collection of boutiques and specialty stores. Be sure and appreciate the massive clock suspended from the ceiling. The overall space is beautiful and presentation of the stores very sophisticated.

A beautiful building. When visiting Sydney take the time to wander all 4 floors to admire the beautiful architecture. At Christmas time there is a magnificent Christmas tree that rises up through the flora and is decorated with lights and Swarovski crystals. A beautiful sight.
Beautiful old building. Worth a visit if in the area, even just to go in for a look. There's a lot of high end expensive stores in the arcade.

Stunning architecture and high end shopping. We frequent this building since it is close by to our hotel. Really enjoyed the design of the building. We especially thought that the hanging clock was fun to look at. The place is a must visit during the day. We did not do much shopping here since most shops sells pricey merchandises and services.
beautiful. Lovely building housing upmarket shops . We only went in to look at the beautiful dome and clock in the Centre and loved this old beautifully restored building.
Lovely building. Nothing much of shopping to do here...just came here to see the structure of the building and you will simply be amazed.

Gorgeous History come Spend Spot. If you enjoy high end spend along with gorgeous historical architecture while in Sydney then QVB is the place..found some of the shop kiche but all the same a very nice place to spend some time in your shopping journey...

A visit to this lovely building is a must. Standing at the top of George Street, the Queen Victoria Building is a masterpiece of stained glass, tiled floors and four floors of excellent shops, cafés and restaurants. The elevator is a delight and even if you don't want to buy anything, you can just soak up the atmosphere. Just lovely.

Lovely old building; marvellous shopping centre!. Soak up the atmosphere of this historic old building with its graceful arches, stained glass windows and cupola topped roof. An array of shops with wonderful displays of their stock make for mind boggling browsing and gratifying retail therapy. Plenty of places to stop for a leisurely morning or afternoon tea, the beautiful Old Vienna Café being the pick of the bunch!!No visit to the City would be complete without a visit to this unique attraction!

Worth a look. Is it a mall or a historic building? It's both. You can even take the old school elevator up or down if you're so inclined. There's also some interesting shops here you might want to look up.
What a wonderful building. I went there a while ago, and was lucky to have a free guided tour. Hearing the history of the building. Well worth walking the different floors.
Lot's of Character!. Love to browse and shop here. Plenty to have a look at and coffee shops are scatterd throughout. Always lovely to browse and check out a bit of history.
Beautiful architecture. Great place to stroll through find chocolate, coffee etc. The clock is very interesting. Go to the second floor to get your best view.

Breathtaking!. I was advised by a friend to visit the Queen Victoria Building and it did not disappoint! I thoroughly enjoyed the history and architecture of the building. The two clocks that were commisioned is a real treasure!

Shopping center or museum?. What a building! You should go inside to walk even if you have no intension of buying. Everywhere you look you get the impression that you are in a museum and not a shopping center.

An upmarket Shopping Centre. QVB is a beautiful building built in the 1800's. Recently renovated it now houses three levels of top name, upmarket fashion houses, boutiques and jewellers. Good for a wander through....
Stepping back in time.. Another large shopping complex in the heart of Sydney. All in a period designed building. Like stepping back in time.

Old!! and great place to shop. Quite expensive the QVB!!
But the lower you go the cheaper the shops - apparently. It joins on to train station too! and pitt street - where theres mre shopping to be done!!
Lovely building. Lots of charactor. Loved the clock in the middle. Also if you are not from Australia and want some free wi-fi, its available here

QVB Sydney CBD must see for visitors. The QVB in the heart of Sydney, is a must see for visitors. A Colonial Treasure in the heart of a bustling city.I didn't know we had such a beautiful building in Australia. The stained glass, light and colour, took my breath away.Wonderful artistry wherever you look. So many clocks, but, time stands still. A very relaxing place to sit and have coffee and then Browse the shops. Don't make it a quick visit, sit and reflect on our history, in this beautiful building.
Old world architecture at its best!. Simply beautiful. Spans over 3 floors with the old, original lifts still in working order. Loved strolling through. Very relaxing.
The Tea Room a must visit. Overall a beautiful old building with upscale shopping. We had a reservation for the Tea Room (located on the third floor) the service and food was outstanding.

Really Cool Old Building. I entered this Shopping Mall and I found it to be really interesting...alot of nice things to visually see such as "Hanging Clocks" or "Stain Glass Windows"... it did seem like more of an "upscale" type of shopping center...I enjoyed walking threw all floors of this Queen Victoria Building. I would definitely recomend people to visit this place.

old is gold. quiet, old shopping mall. pricey too
many good size cafes, mostly italian cuisines (by the looks of it)

Must visit. Visitor will be surprised that it is actually a shopping centre. A beautifully and perfectly restored old victorian architectural building. Was amazed by the look of this building. Located right in the heart of Sydney CBD along George St. Hop off at George St bus stop or Town Hall train stn. Get inside and you will be tempted to shop.

Beautiful. A perfect example of colonial Victorian architecture! The entire building is beautiful through and through. It's worth going just to see the clocks, they are masterpieces. There's nothing like Christmas shopping in the Queen Victoria Building, it's decorated so incredibly well and makes the building even more beautiful. A happy atmosphere permeates the entire building, even with the opulent ambience. Shopping here is generally quite expensive, but the shops are wide and varied, with something to please everyone. Even window shopping is still fun here! It's well connected and served by public transport, and connected directly to Town Hall station, and is quite literally in the heart of the city. It's not to be missed.

A really beautiful building. This building is filled with great shops on 4 levels. Cafes and restaurants are in abundance. The building is over 100 years old and is in wonderful condition and is a fine example of colonial architecture.

QVB: A JEWELL. In my first day at Sydney I was spinning around the center of Sydney and saw a beautiful building. I’ll never imagine it was a commercial building: it looked like a governmental agency. I was really surprised by the architecture and especially by the beautiful windows and spent almost three hours wandering around it and taking pictures. Three fantastic hours.

Love the old architecture. Worth seeing just for the clocks. Most of the retailers are high end but I went for Hobbyco and was amazed. I have never seen so many mecha kits in one place although I would have liked to see some O scale model railroad stuff. I wanted to buy the 1/43 scale NYC bus I saw but don't have room in the suitcase right now.
Royal Shopping Arcade. Consortium of brands and shops. Located conveniently. Must visit place for shoppers. You get all the best brands and also Free WiFi!

Simply charming will appeal to all. QVB is a must to see whilst in Sydney. It is located at Town Hall in the heart of Sydney.The architecture and stained glass throughout the levels is remarkable.Most of the shops are specialty shops but there are many coffee shops and eateries where you can enjoy the ambiance and passing parades of tourists and local visitors.Make sure you see the main clock on the top level it's amazing.Take a walk through each level but most of the food shops are on the lower level.Really well worth seeing.

Must visit!. Strategically located at the heart of Sydney and very well restored. This land mark of Victorian Sydney offer a fresh breeze of history with a modern brush. Walking distance from Sydney tower and the metro line. Great coffee and wonderful a collection of boutiques and brand stores.

Beautiful building. Really well located near Town Hall Station with very good range of shops from designer to budget, lovely eating facilities,all well arranged. A beautiful old building, with lovely
architecture

Not to be rushed.... QVB is beautifully restored... Victorian Sydney better than it probably was! Lots of boutique experiences, quaint to extravagant. Good coffee, and access to Sydney's below bound shopping areas. Who knows what you may find here, or where you will resurface!

QVB A place of intrigue. Well worth the visit to this shopping centre, particularly at Christmas when the Giant Tree is up. Big variety of shopping near the Town Hall train station and buses in George street stop outside.
If you don't enjoy this you will never be pleased!!
Eating places available in plentiful numbers.

Drop in for a view of old Sydney. Wonderful building in the centre of Sydney. Good shopping with underground connections to half a dozen other city blocks, the railways and buses to the west. The tea rooms should be tried for a half hour break from all that shopping

great place to window shop. The QVB is an old Victorian looking building with ornate finishes. You'd never expect it to be a shopping mall. There are multiple floors and the higher up you go, the higher end the merchandise and prices. There are haute couture stores as well as more reasonable prices, (for Sydney at least). There are a number of places to have a nice lunch or even high tea. It is definitely a place to window shop and take in the old world charm of the building.

Beautiful building.. Love the old restored building. full of people rushing about and others relaxing and enjoying the cafes... I like taking photos of the gorgeous winding stairs and ornate ceiling. Upstairs for a real High Tea or down stairs to pick up a kitchen bargain at Victorias Basement. ( just dont take your kids, luggage or wingey husbands down there!)

For shop and visiting. You can use it for everything, even when its raining you can cut the way trough the building. They have some good chocolate shop and the historic building is amazing. But if you dont like the smell of toasted bread do visit the second level.

Everything yoked. A great historical building turned into a central shopping mall with every level of shop for all purses. We went specifically for phone services, but their are many tasteful cafes and upmarket shopping opportunities too, along side some very aromatic chocolatiers.
Really nice. It is the most amazing experience just walking pass the shops, experiencing the Sydney antiques. .... just funnnn!!
Beautiful Window Shopping. Possibly the most beautiful shopping mall in the world and well worth the stroll through. Continue on to see the Town Hall and the church past the Queen Victoria statue.
great shopping. Its a beautiful building, with great shops however the shops are not cheap. in fact i feel that the higher up you go up, the more expensive the shops will get

Free QVB Goodies Bag. We did this tour because it was included in the iVenture Sydney pass - on paper we probably wouldn't have spent $15 a head, however, that would have been a mistake. We thoroughly enjoyed the interesting and informative tour, that included the origins of the building, and its later development/refurbishment. The tour largely went at our pace - we were the only ones that day! As we were shown around, it gave us the opportunity to ID what shops to return to later for a closer look - however, the tour concentrates on the building and not the current residents. My wife and daughter were thrilled with the free QVB goodie bag (made by the same people who make Harrods' bags!) - well worth the $15 we didn't actually pay.

Late 19th Century charm in the heart of Sydney.... The Queen Victoria Building is an icon of the city, taking up an entire city block near Town Hall, the CityRail train station and Pitt Street Mall...Favourite shops there include the ABC store, Bon Bon & Haigh's Chocolates, Jet Cafe, Fish Records, L'Occitane, Glue Store, Luneburger, King of Knives, Old Vienna Coffee House & Victoria's Basement.... :)

Gorgeous building. We are very lucky to have this beautiful building in Sydney. Photo opportunities everywhere. Don't miss the amazing spiral staircase and the lovely historical clock. Pity what's happened to the ABC Shop but you can't have everything.

Old World Charm in a big city. I love this building, one for its old world charm and two for the shopping and dining options. On it's lowest level you can walk from the Pitt Street Mall and under the QVB and onto Town Hall Station, shopping all the way. The shops on the ground and upper floors range from medium priced to very upmarket, so even if you're not there to shop, the window shopping is wonderful. There's men and womens fashion, jewellery, homewares, antiques, art the list goes on and on. The dining ranges from cafes to licenced restaurants. Most are opened for late breakfast, lunch and very early dinner. Trading hours are 9am to 6pm weekdays, and 9am to 9pm Thursdays, and I think it opens at 11am on a Sunday. The architecture is lovely, built in 1898 with stained glass windows grand staircases (lifts and escalators too if you can't do stairs). The clock in the centre of the building that has moving bits to entertain when it strikes the hour, the lady who play the grand piano at certain times of the day, I could go on and on, there's also underground parking (at a price). They have a pretty good website if you want to check anything out before making the trip to the QVB.
Good selection of stores. Beautiful construction remodeled few years ago with the same old world charm you see in Milan or Paris.

Nice place to visit, but shopping is second only to the history. Well, for one, I was reprimanded by one of the shop owners at the top floor for taking pictures of the shop windows. They said it's not allowed. It's a tourist spot, hello?

Stunning old building. Was in the city for other reasons but could not resist walking through the QVB. It still has the old charm - perhaps more of a retail and food hub than its original intent but it still reeks of architectural splendour, charm and beauty.

Stroll in a stunning building - QVB. The QVB is a beautiful old building that had a makeover in 1986. The building is three levels high but has a charm and class that makes it the absolute opposite to your average Westfield Shopping Centre. Most retail outlets in the QVB, to be fair, are high-end shops and cafes - Dolce & Cabbana and esteemed fashion labels where the entire shop has 6 garments for sale to impress upon shoppers exclusivity and eye watering price. Cafes are stylish with tables and chairs out in the main levels, allowing customers the experience of dining or enjoying a skinny soy chai decaf babycino (or whatever absurd combination the beautiful people sip) while viewing the impressive architecture. I soent some time at both Hobbyco (a double level hobby/model store) and at an art gallery that specialises in licenced official Dr Suess prints and scultpures. I could have spent around $50k at the Dr Suess gallery and the same again at Hobbyco. There is also a Victoria Cross display upstairs in the QVB that is worth looking at if you appreciate Australian Military History and are in the area.
Nice Visual. Very impressed with the design. Lots of shops of great variety. A good way to spend some time pottering around.

Exquisite Architecture and Charm. The Queen Victoria Building, or QVB is one of the prettiest buildings in Sydney. There are olde world patterns in the tiles, a lift that looks as if it could be an original feature of the building, an high domed ceilings. The shops are a mix of upmarket, like Ralph Lauren, and speciality shops like Lush and T2. There are numerous cafes and coffee shops, and comfy shoes are a must for a day shopping here. You can easily make this a family day out, the QVB lower level comes out in The Galleries shopping centre, which is a monorail stop. You can then get the monorail down to Darling Quarter for the kids to play.

Worth a walk through. Definately worth walking through the QVB if you are getting off the train at Town Hall station. You can travel for miles underground shopping. Very Victorian and well kept with swanky (and expensive) shops. Keep going on the lower level and get lost in the maze of the shopping mall...

Wonderful Olde World Arcade.. This is a wonderful arcade full of interesting shops beside fashion. The basement has a home, kitchen wares that will keep you occupied for ages with beautiful china from yesteryear. The stunning clock centre piece and stained glassed windows are mind blowing. Take time to have cake and coffee at the Vienna Cafe you wont regret it. Yummy!!

A must if you visit the city!. Queen Victoria Building also known as QVB surrounded by other famous buildings such as the Town Hall & St Andrew's Cathedral, all of which consisting of exquisite late 19th century architectural features bridging the quality of having both of modern & antique touches.This shopping center has a variety of brand businesses, you might want take a rest after walking around the city at the number of cafes present there as well as restaurants & have some food & drinks etc. To sum up it's a place you should visit, you'll just find out time flying by itself as you wander around there.

What a beautiful shopping center. This is a beautiful place to get a cup of coffee and sit and just look at the old moldings and stain glass windows. It was a great place to be on a very wet day in Sydney.

worth seeing the architecture. I just went in to look at the building although I'm sure it's worth spending time shopping. It has been restored to a very high standard and in keeping with its heritage. The spiral staircase, glass backed escalators, stained glass windows and central clock are excellent. It's worth a few minutes inside.

Beautifully restored and worth a look. The Queen Victoria building is a beautifully restored shopping mall with really interesting architecture including tiled floors, moldings and some really spectacular old clocks. Travel up to a higher floor to get a good view of the clocks. Stores are specialized and expensive, but it is worth a visit just to see the glory of the building itself.

Price did not match the quality. Visited on a week day,unfortunately for us the front of house was short staffed which was evident.The QVB building itself is beautiful,the setting is great,but the price of the teas reflect this.Therefore ,the customer expectation(s) would be very high.Champagne high tea was ordered.The sandwiches were good,pastries could have been better for that price range,scones ok.Tea took a long time to arrive and champagne was flat,although after bringing the matter to the service staffs' attention,there was a replenishment.The silver service ware and crockery was well presented but it really needed a clean.Attention to detail is key on delivering a consistent product,it lacked on our visit this time.

A Jewel. So many such fine buildings have been lost to us that it is a special pleasure to visit this one and gaze up and down on the elaborate tile work and ornate mouldings. It enriches any shopping experience.

If it was not here, we'd not know about the grand days. A building that is staggeringly glorious - QVB - it is there, we pass it when in the CBD and I wonder if we truly know how lucky we are. The eclectic nature of the shopping - the vibe of the place - the sheer madness of Town Hall Station. Love the place!

stunning building. Gorgeously decorated old building but so crowded all the time with rail commuters so make sure you get out of their way or be prepared to be trampled. Lots of shops that could have you inside this building all day without leaving! Maybe you need to pick a better time for visiting than I did.

Beautiful building in the heart of the city. The Queen Victoria Building is a beautiful historic building to walk around in the heart of the city and just across the road from Sydney Town Hall. It is also accessible from Town Hall Railway Station which is situated underneath the building. The upmarket shops are a bit expensive but the cafes are ideal for coffee and cake. Buy a cup a coffee and just sit back enjoy the atmosphere and people watch.

An architectural gem. While not as iconic as the Opera House and the Sydney Harbor Bridge, the Queen Victoria Building, built in the late 19th century, is a must-see. Three stories high with subterranean floors, the building now houses boutiques. But, the true draw of the building is not the shops but the architecture, e.g., the stained glass windows, the interior glass dome, and two large mechanical clocks, each with a diorama and moving figures. Located in the central business district, the QVB is a short, worthwhile walk from the wharf.
Beautiful architecture. Great place to look at, but to expensive to buy. Even coffee and cake is too expensive, so I would suggest you look but walk down the street for coffee

Very interesting building.. Great old building full of cafe's and shops. So many interesting things to see and eat. You could certainly spend a lot of money in this place. Also connects to Town Hall railway station for easy access.

Very interesting building. It goes without saying that the building in beautiful and the shopping is great. I would suggest that you stroll around the top floor. There are two unique clocks which, alone, are worth the visit. If you are there on the hour, stop at the clock that looks like a fort. Then, go to the other clock and figure out the day and time. Then, check out the stained glass windows and the unique flooring at the south end by the elevator. The basement has sale merchandise.

Exquisite building. In downtown Sydney, you should not missing getting in the Queen Victoria Building. Every elegant and exquisite shops inside the building with awesome display's. You'll just love it! All the things are very pricey, so meant for high roller shoppers, but lot of wonderful attractions done within the building. You can easily spend over an hour or two just strolling through different shops on different floor. The magnificent watch is jaw dropping. So do visit the QVB if you are visiting Sydney.

Such a beautiful building. This building is really beautiful, ornate staircases, nice tiles and well kept. It is always great to walk around - the vibe is different on each level. The ground floor is always buzzing with activity as it is linked to one of the major train stations.There are ample shops to keep one occupied and cafes to rest your weary leg.Do check out the ladies toilets on the third floor - the doors opens on its own.I think the owners have done a great job in upkeeping and maintaining this building. Really worth a visit and to take in the ambience.
Good shopping and easy to get to. Good shopping, great cafes downstairs and very easy to get to by train. A good rainy day shopping centre in Sydney.

Unusual and Beautiful Building. This place is quite unusual and worth a walk-around inside simply to admire the architecture. We rode the bus into town from where we stayed in Artarmon and the terminus of the bus route was in front of the QVB. So it gave us a convenient chance to see the impressive interior. The shops inside are a bit on the pricey side but the degree depends on taste and budget. They provide a nice opportunity for window shopping at least.

Great shopping for all. This is a beautiful heritage building worth popping in if only for a few photos. The shopping is great too.Each level in the building has a different level of costs and prestige. The opening level is a regular Sydney level, the further up you go the more exclusive the designers; the further down you go the cheaper and more budget the stores become. You can get almost anything you want at almost any price here. There is also a great food court down in the dungeons!
Pretty. If you walk pass it, make sure you go in. The design isn Victorian (I think) and it is work seeing it.

grand place. I was staying near the building and really enjoyed spending time there. There was a remarkableladies' loo too which impressed me...........Had tea with a friend but just enjoyed the overall fun of it
We'll refurbished. ThisOld but seemingly ageless building has everything one could want.high fashion to reasonable eating .One has to visit to appreciate it
Beautiful Arquitecture. Beautiful turn of the century building which now holds high end clothing shops. Nice for a stroll inside but there was no shopping for me!

Beautiful building inside and out. I loved this building. It is so beautifully "old" on the outside and so shiny and elaborate on the inside. The clock was amazing to see. This building should be on your to do list for Sydney.

Beautiful QVB... always good.. always lovely. The way the rest of Sydney should be... and one of the truly remarkable stories... people were sitting on the rooftop in front of the wreckers ball with this one... just imagine if it was gone...........

OMG. Oh My God, the shops and architecture fantastic and the amazing clocks that hang from the ceiling that play chimes and the movements that have you watching what happens on the hour well worth the experience

One of the best places in Sydney. just spectacular! is one of the most beautiful buildings in sydney to walk around shop in and get some food. the tea room is worth visiting but you should pre book. the upper levels have some great shops and the atmosphere and architecture is stunning. a definite must when visiting sydney

nice just to look at. loved the architecture but all the shops were empty and it seems too pricey for the average person so it had a cold, lifeless feel. Just enjoy it for its history but shop elsewhere

Expensive, but great to look at. Its nice to go here and pretend like you'll buy something, makes you feel rich. There are some less expensive shops on the lower grounds which I usually shop in. Some nice places to look at if you're looking for a wedding ring

Look up.... ...its not your vulgar modern shopping mall. You're surrounded by beautiful Victorian-era detail, even in the lifts. If you can't afford to patronise any of the exclusive little stores you can still enjoy a coffee in the adorable surroundings.

I love this building. Mainly because - as hard as I try not to - I always seem to end up coming out of a different door each time. It never ceases to amaze me.Great building. Great shops, food stalls, toilets, the Town Hall train connections. You really could not ask for more. Always a great buzz about the place. People moving to and fro.Bit of a spiritual focal point for my trips to Sydney.

Shopping Centre with a difference. What a difference it makes when your shopping centre is not only practical but beautiful. Couldn't stop admiring the glass on its windows, the floors & clock amongst all these nice shop windows carefully displayed designer garments, jewellery & art. Plenty of coffee & tea outlets as well as restaurants. It is for sure a must see when you visit Sydney.
Love it Love it. Adore this building in Sydney, a paradise for photography and some great shops too. Must go if you visit Sydney.

Shops Galore--a shopper's paradise!. Well laid out, three or four levels of stores of every kind, small restaurants, and many coffee shops. This is a beautiful old building put to good use in the middle of town.
Beautiful building. Stunning building worth a look for the architecture alone. There are some cute shops & some very expensive one!
Brilliant. We loved this place and the guided tour was fabulous. Knocked out by the incredible jade marriage coach. The shops are brilliant. We recommend everyone visits this place.

Interesting architecture for a shopping centre!. This shopping centre is an experience that should not be missed. The Architecture is beautiful and the shops are an unusual mixture. The atmosphere is calm and relaxed with the option to walk through to the more usual Westfield shopping centre. It is good to visit on a wet day.

A beautifully preserved historic building. This stunning old building was built at the end of the 19th century and was scheduled for demolition in the 1950s but thankfully it was saved by "Green Bans" imposed on the demolition by union activists. The stained glass windows, stone archways and intricate architectural detail are fascinating. The modern, refurbished QVB is home to some of the top tier clothing and jewlery stores and a number of high end specialty stores. A favourite for men and boys of all ages is the toy and hobby store at the Southern end of the building.The Foucault's pendulum on the top level is worth the visit.

Always worth a visit. This attraction is easily accessible and has undercover access from the Town Hall Station. It is full of lots of speciality shops and you can continue on the sub-way walk through to Myers and then into Westfield and David Jones. Is always great but particularly good on a wet day because of it's undercover access to other parts of the city.

Picturesque mall dating from the beginning of the century. Quite a few shops inside but what's really interesting (and maybe a bit funny from some perspective) is the way some of the arches are decorated (funny clocks, small castles hanging from the ceiling etc)The Tea Room is a nice place to visit and there are a few good places for lunch or "tea". There's also a "Toy Soldiers' shop (forget the name) with a lot of very well done (and pricey!) miniatures.
Beautiful building. Went over Easter -bit disappointing that some shops were open, some were closed on different days. Would have thought it worthwhile to be open at least Sat & Sun

Beautiful. To think this building was nearly demolished in the 1970s. Oh what a tragedy this would have been. The shops are perhaps not the eclectic mix many of us are use too in a modern shopping centre, but to wander such a beautiful building whilst browsing, stopping to eat or take coffee. A must visit in Sydney.

Beautiful building upmarket shopping. The building is beautiful and well laid out, the shops are up market and sell some lovely things however if your on a budget you may like us only have a coffee in there .

Wonderful - Don't Miss. Wow! This might be called a "mall" if it were in the US, but it so much more. Just look at the intricate mosaic floors, the classic look to the shops, and the classy appointments. To think this there is no admission charge to see such amazing architecture!
Worth a trip. Excellent, very expensive shops in a wonderful setting -- certainly gives Harrods a run for its money. If you like up market shooping at brand shops -- this is the place for you.
Nice building. Great building in the middle of Sydney's CBD. Very busy with shoppers and tourists.If you want to take some photos up on the higher levels is best.
Beautiful Building. This building is worth seeing and is a beautiful part of Sydney's past. The shops have high end products for sale and expensive. The chocolates are awesome though.
Great Old Building. A lot of the shops in here are designer shops, so expensive, but what a lovely old building! Worth going to have a look at!

Bygone era. Whilst there is a lot to be said for modern shops and malls, enter the QVB and you will be reminded of what they all lack. Their is such elegance. Of course you can look at the fantastic shops, and yes, there are good restaurants too, but don't forget to just enjoy the incredible building that you are in.....
beautiful arcade type shopping centre. Beautifully restored well worth a visit! Just bring the creditcard some of these shops are very expensive!

Beautiful old building. Queen Victoria Building,Old and beautiful. Lots nice shops,restaurants,coffee shops. The big clock was very interesting.We had very good breakfast there.The coffee was very good,maybe that's why you will not got refill. The price was reasonable.They took the order was different from US. You ordered food on the counter,then took your number to look for table to sit down.We love the building,love the breakfast.

Quaint, interesting. The two clocks were fascinating, particularly the one that was based on Australian history. Interesting to window shop, but not a shoppers paradise. Lots of eateries. Connects to the other stores by an underground shopping street. The statutes outside were interesting particularly the little dog.
Lovely old building. Well restored. Lots of shops, food and coffee available.. The building is worth a look if you are interested on buildings. Plenty of shops(see website for details).

Amazing historic building. This is a lovely building, well,worth a visit. The clocks are interesting. The interior decor is beautiful . Get a "I'm Free" tour guide to point out all the interesting bits.

Fasinating old building. Well restored old building put to modern day use without destroying it's charm. Top class and good variety of shops. Have a meal in the "basement" in the execptionally good and reasonably priced Thai cafe. Large portions of authentic well cooked Thai food. Completes the whole experience.

Beautiful old building. QVB is certainly worth a visit. Such a beautiful building with leadlight windows, lovely flooring & a great clock, a must see on the hour! The shops are a bit more up market & there are lots of cafes to chose from. Christmas in particular, is sensational with its very large Christmas tree with 1000's of crystals on it. Even the santa scene to have photos taken with santa is usually fantastic.

Beautiful place to shop. Fantastically maintained and stunningly beautiful building. Worth a stroll through even if you don't intend on shopping. If your credit card is itching for a spin this is a magical place to spend a day. If you're in Sydney around Christmas time be sure to go in and check out the Christmas tree. It's several stories high and usualy adorned with Swarovski.
Great shopping. Have shopped in Queen Vic many times and never get sick of it! so much variety, so many place to easy or have coffee. Its a beautiful building! So much to love!

Charming, Lovely $ Overpriced. Like the nearby Strand Arcade I found this place to be charming and lovely. But there wasn't anything special or charming to buy here. The prices were way to high for items you can find everywhere.

OLD WORLDE CHARM. I didn't know anything about the Queen Victoria Building until I wandered inside and what a lovely surprise. The architecture is so beautiful and the shops interesting even if I was only window shopping. There are plenty of places to stop for a coffee or a snack while enjoying the beautiful surroundings. I spent ages inside just taking photos and could have spent longer there if I'd had more time. With so much character, it's definitely a must see when in Sydney.
Awesome. This was a fantiastic building. Stunning inside and out and filled with lots of quirky botique style shops. Love the free Wifi too.

an ancient lady. a great building with lovely shops and cafes. a must see. spend a few hours wandering along the different levels and looking in shops and stopping for a refreshment. an enjoyable shopping experience.
Amazing building. The QVB is a beautiful old building. I found it fascinating. The clocks inside were amazing as well. Lovely old staircases and lifts.

Great Architecture. Fabulous building which has been expertly renovated and worth a walk around to see its different aspects.However, be prepared for the whole building being filled with designer shops and cafe's.They are probably essential to guarantee its future but there are so many other natural things to do in Sydney if you are visiting.

Wow, what a place. Sympathically restored building with amazing shops and eateries. Most of the shops are 'upmarket'. The aboringinal art shop is interesting and reasonably priced.The loos are fantastic!!! A great building to visit on a showery day.

Formal shopping experience in Victorian era charm. The QVB is an iconic central Sydney landmark building that offers prestige old charm shopping in a luxurious, genuine Victorian era buiding that is breath-taking in its architecture and decor.Enter the era of refinery, formal facades, elegant architecture and 4 prominade floors of high fashion shops and gifts to suit both the discerning shopper or the fascinated tourist.From the outside the QVB stands the length of an entire city block, with its sculptured sandstone facade and lead light windows making you wonder whether it's a cathederal or shopping centre ..the quality and style is so similar.Inside the building is spaceous, airconditioned for comfort and restored to its 1890s charm by its careful heritage conscious owners who understand the attraction of such a shopping experience. The shops are many of the prime fashion labels and outlet names, with the presentation style of every shop one of amazing and a match to the building's quality.As you'd expect to see in any Victorian Building, there's plenty of tea shops , even one that serves "High Tea" with linen table cloths and formal waiters.Easily accessible from Sydney's main George Street or take the train to Town Hall Station, that is right underneath the QVB. Buses are also in the street outside.Indulge yourself. Take a look.

A great building. Love to have a walk through the QVbuilding. Some great shops and also access to the Myers complex. There are several eating spots to have a coffee after a wander around such a lovely old building.

Shop till you drop in Sydney. View the Queen Victoria statue outside before going inside this
very special building. (Can be reached by the free tourist bus
that goes around the city). Several floors of designer shops
with lovely clocks and ceilings and glass domes. There is even
a Victoria's Basement(think of the former Filene's basement).

Beautiful high in mall in a Victorian building. We were at the Hilton across the street and enjoyed our visit to the QVB. Apparently, it was built in the 19th Century as a vegetable market. Today it is a high in mall with shops and restaurants.

Christmas Time - the only Christmas Tree with Swarovski decorations. Awesome spot in the heart of Sydney on George St. U can train, bs or the elevated MRTP to get there. Top brands and a number of Oz brands available. Love the cafe's during lunch and weekends

Magnificent Heritage Site!. If you need a fix of high-end shopping in a magnificently restored heritage site, this is it! It has been called "the most beautiful shopping centre in the world" ... elegant shopfronts, exquisite boutiques, stylish cafes and even a bargain basement! Be certain to see the Royal Clock on the top level with breathtaking views of this magnificent building.

Take credit card away from wife!. This magnificent building house MANY very upscale shops and restaurants. It's conveniently located on the Hop-on, Hop-off bus route. All the shops are expensive, so it's not for everyone. A grest place to look at, however, especially the clock!
Great place. Very pretty building inside - shops were good too! Lots of interesting shops. Take photos of the clock!

Beautiful Building, Designer Shopping & You must try High Tea on the upper level...Perfect!. QVB is a Sydney institution! You will find all sorts of shops from food stores on the lower levels to basic high street fashion through to designer stores on the upper levels - it's all here. Easy to find in the centre of Sydney near town Hall this is a must for any trip to Sydney. The architecture is stunning with so many beautiful features including the clock, the tessellated tiled floors and the stunning Victorian cast iron spiral staircases. If you pre book you can also indulge in an old fashioned 'high tea' on the upper level which is well worth doing for that little bit of luxury! The high tea is around $50 per person.

BEAUTIFUL QUEEN VIC BUILDING. A huge variety of shopping experiences awaits you at the Queen Vic Building in George Street, downtown Sydney. There are 3 levels and shops range from inexpensive to luxury/expensive. One of the cheapest coffees can be had in the basement.
shopping. great use of an historic building. lots of shopping and cafes also its along George street one block from pitt Street...shopping shopping

Interesting but you will not need a day here. Architecture and its history are fascinating but unless you are ready to spend a fortune in the shops you only need an hour. They do guided tours, again an hour in length, but you need to book in advance.
Truly beautiful. This is a truly beautiful Heritage listed building in Sydney. Apart from it's beauty it has an aray of great shops and restaurants.

Shop Shop till you drop in an historical building. this building is named after the queesn grand mother quees victoria and very historical building and Beautiful Building in the heart of Sydney . Shop Shop till you drop in an historical building

elegant building. we went here as my friends sister said she had the best coffee in the world here.
Hmm i didn't think so but it was nice.
Beautiful building. so glad they spent the time and money to do it up.
worth going for a look
A beautiful building near the Town Hall. Leave plenty of time to visit this building as there is lots to look at. The architecture is the focus. Some boutique shops worth a visit as well.

Beautiful old building. The heart of city shopping! Visit at Christmas to see the giant sparkling Tree, it's beautiful! And visit the little cafe's that are dotted around the centre on the upper floors, even just for a sit down and a coffee.

An architectural delight. For architecture buffs a building not to be missed on a vist to Sydney! If you close your eyes you can imagine the old queen coming down the road in a horse and carriage to shop in this great place. Wander through the pace and take yourself back in time!

Fantastic restored building with lots of shops. QVB is a great place to visit and shop and it is right on George Street at the Town Hall station. The restoration of this gem is really well done and picture worthy! There are a lot of nice high-end shops, and if you go below ground to the basement floor - which connects to the Town Hall subway stop, there are bargain shops including one of my favorites for kitchen/household items. QVB is also across the road from more shopping malls and only a few blocks from the Westfiend shopping area. Enjoy shopping and checking out the architecture, or stop for coffee at one of the zillion cafe's in Sydney. There is a food court area too.
splendour. What a fabulouos building. Never mind the designer shops. Worth a visit for the superb architecture and how it is preserved!! The clocks alone are worth a visit!

Beautiful historical building!!!. It was amazing to see the interior of the building. It is just as beautiful as the exterior. It houses many fine shops and restaurants. We enjoyed strolling through it and looking at all of the architectural details. In one area, 2nd floor I believe, there is a time capsule with a letter written by Queen Elizabeth to the people of Sydney, to be opened in 2086! ~ the 100 year anniversary of the building's restoration.

Bueatiful building, great shopping. This is one of the few original buildings left in Sydney. It's a gorgeous creature with an array of shopping from medium to high end fashion and plenty of places to eat. There are always buskers and street artists out front and the Tea Room upstairs is a beautiful place for lunch or afternoon tea.

A Christmas tear.... A historical building with amenities even for people who hate to shop, the QVB is an adventure of discovery. From the shop that sells old and rare prints to the cafes and "souvenir" shops, the QVB is well worth at least a couple of hours. At Christmas time, walk through the QVB if for no other reason than to see the multi-story Christmas tree. Hard to find comparable.

u feel u are in melbourne. this and the strand are sydneys old world buildings great to walk around the big clock the victoria cross display and the shops still many not chain types love to visit reguraly my favorite the clothes of joe bananas

grand old lady of shopping. a wonderfull rejuvenation of an old building into a shopping mall. very busy on lower levelsFortunately the architechure is still intact.It also acts as an access point to the sydney underground rail system

Spectacular. This ornate, Victorian building has been made over as a location for high-end shops. It also has free (sponsored) wifi. You may shop or bring your laptop and check email, etc. in beautiful surroundings.

Shopping with Class but prices that make you smile. Lots of post Christmas sales still lingering on in the QVB. Make sure you visit Victoria's Basement for all kinds of irresitable must haves and the Cup Cakes on the same level are delicious. Lush is there too with all their wonderful smells and there are many cafes to rest up before you set off for the higher levels of this not to be missed Sydney Shopping Wonderland
Magestic old building. one could spend hours in this building marveling at architecture and hanging clock, shops are nice as well

Centrally located historic building with shops, cafes and access to underground train station. QVB is well worth a visit when you're in Sydney.It's readily accessible: it's adjacent to Sydney Town Hall, and the Town Hall train station is accessible through the basement level of the building.There's a wide array of shops and cafes- you could easily browse for a couple of hours.The building has been restored sensitively, so it exudes period charm.Shops in the QVB range from designer brand fashion, throughout to Victoria's Basement- a well known discount homewares clearance outlet.Well worth a visit.

Beautiful building, bad shopping. A stroll through this stunning old building is well worth doing. The architecture is amazing and the hum of all the people brings it to life. But the shopping is over priced and there's nothing particularly unique on offer. The cafes are poor at best.

Creative. An old historic building has been revamp and turned into a shopping mall. Just a good drop by for a picture from the balcony overseeing the road down to the people. Just like a Queen waving to the nation
It still has character!!. Yes. It's possibly set up now for tourists and I must admit I have not been for a while. But it does give a taste of the Sydney as it was ~~~~as well as it is.

Victorian gem and fashion heartland. The QVB used to be a sad, bedraggled old matron, in the heart of Sydney. As a child I would go to the City of Sydney library here, and wander around the stacks for hours, descending through drab offices and pokey corridors. Well possums, it has had the ultimate makeover and is now restored to it's original state as a grand shopping arcade, in the Victorian style. There are some of Sydney's best fashion brands here, some great designers (do try on Alistair Trung's clothes - they look better on you than on the hanger!) and great accessories - I love Thomas Szabo, and some of the bespoke jewellery shops have original and modern settings of local opals and pearls, and you can get a handbag to match that lace evening frock... Have a meal (Yama for sushi is a fav with my family) or high tea in the Tea Rooms; sample the ABC shop for DVD's about Australia's wildlife, and buy a little box of handmade chocolates to take to someone special. The clock in the centre of the building strikes the hours in very Australian style, best seen on the third floor, where you will also find great paper and pen shops, antiques and prints and fabulous Florentine leather bound journals. Worth a morning at least!

A must visit in Sydney. We always visit the QVB - my wife loves the shops - I enjoy the coffee!!! My wife likes the fact that QVB isn't full of the usual chain stores you find in other malls. If you want to celebrate a special occasion visit The Tearoom in the upper level of the northern end of the building.
Great Architecture. From the outside, the building is impressive. Be sure to walk around inside and look at the ornate decor, even if you do no shopping.

Very pretty with good food. I visited here with my 17 year old sister planning to spend the day shopping and eating. We really only spent an hour or two though. It was very pretty and had a lot of nice restaurants to choose from but other than that was just another mall. Worth a visit but don't plan on spending an entire day here.

Old world charm. Cities can be cities and some of down town is just plain ugly or dull so it is nice to step in a place with a bit of charm and grace where you are not about to be run over or bumped into, you can escape the heat or the rain. It is always interesting to see other cultures shopping and eating.

what's so special?. It's just another mall, just in a nice old building. What's so great about the place? And the shops....a lot just seem so uninviting, yeah their expensive but they seem unaproachable

Favourite place to shop in Sydney.. My partner bought me to the QVB on our trip to Sydney - we both LOVE to shop and he had been there before. We shopped so much that we had to buy extra luggage space on the flight home. The variety of shops is fantastic, and the atmosphere is wonderful. The building itself was in the process of having the facing restored when we visited - I can't wait to see it next time we are back. We had lovely breakfasts and lunches there, and there was a pianist playing one afternoon. The amenities were clean too.I think we went there every single day we were in Sydney. Next time, I would like to try the dinner experience.
An experience in shopping. Great building, shops and resturants are great, every designer shop here you could want. lovely place to meet up or relax between shopping.

Christmas in Sydney. Would highly recommend a visit during the lead up to Christmas just to see the fantastic tree and to buy those special presents. Most of the shops are exclusive and you are likely to find something different in here

Beautiful building with lovely shops. The building is beautiful, clean and well kept, restaraunts were great, service in all shops very friendly, airconditioning appreciated, wonderful to be able to get a map of all the shops. All staff able to direct us to where we wanted to go.
Stunning old building. Its always nice to come here even if you dont want to shop as it is a lovely building if you like to appreciate architecture

Best Shopping Experience in Sydney. Loved the different shops and the history of the building. The Xmas tree was special. On several floors with a fabulous gallery. Whether its a cafe, designer dress shop or Victoris's basement for all things for the home - we wandered round for hours.
Great architecture. Take a walk on all levels and admire the Victorian architecture. Once above the mostly standard shops on the ground floor there are lots of individual shops to explore.

Olde Worlde Charm. Very interesting renovation. One of many buildings in Sydney's CBD that have been beautifully restored for both visitors and tourist to enjoy. Also very close to transport and Darling Harbour

Victorian indeed, but well up-to-date. A pleasant stop in town, out of the sun or rain, and not in the current modern 'mall idiom' but rather a collection of small outlets including interesting food. I admit going there just to use the toilets (and it is quite an achievement to locate them in the basement, particularly when you are desperate) but I'll return anyway.

Beautiful building. Lots of lovely shops. I especially liked Equip, Coletta and Lovisa for accessories; Lush for soaps, scrubs and gels (all organic and beautifully laid out). Go to Victoria's Basement (yes, at the basement) for really good bargains on household items.
Stunning Grand old Dame. Lots of very good shops in a stunning building that is close to everything including Town Hall Railway Station

Fabulous from top to bottom. It's hard to believe that this beautiful building was threatened with demolition last century but thankfully received a reprieve in the 1980s and was restored to its former glory - possibly even improved? Mostly home to designer labels there are still many retailers selling goods well within the reach of everyone. Lots of places for a quick snack or a coffee and the beautiful Tea Room is definitely worth a visit for a special occasion. High Tea anyone?

Beautiful building and cute shopping spot. The gorgeous architecture and famous clock inside are worth a stopover to the QVB. While there, you also have to make a pit stop at the floor-to-ceiling marble restrooms with very modern sinks! Great place to pick up chocolate too.
old and modern. it's when old and modern meet. the place was a royal premise before, and turned into a shopping centre of labels and signature dishes. I love going there

Old World Style. Great Victorian style building filled with shops and my favorite pizza place in Sydney (so far). The 2 clocks in the center of each wing make for an interesting way to spend some time. The concierge service is so impressive! I would like to personally thank Cherie (Hope that I’m spelling your name correctly) who went out of her way to help us “tourists” find a particular clothing item. Although we weren’t able to find the particular item, your thoughtfulness and helpfulness are greatly appreciated! Thank you very much!QVB also has free wi-fi!!!
Beautiful Building inside and out. Filled with lots of shops and restaurants and beautifully decorated for Christmas. Really oldy worldy.
Shopping with style!. Beautiful construction remodeled few years ago with the same old world charm you see in Milan or Paris. Good selection of stores.
Luxury Shopping. This Building is breath taking!! it was number one by a long way though now that westfileds has been renovated it think it is tie to best shopping in Sydney

After All, It's Still Just A Shopping Center. Ongoing restoration and re-purposing as an indoor shopping center, QVB is worth visiting, if only to see one of two remarkable clocks. The exterior makes for an interesting photo-op, and the interiors are ornate and rich, like the typical high-end shops that occupy space in the QVB. The Old Vienna Coffee House, a supposedly famous patisserie, is located in the QVB. Didn't eat there, but the prices appeared to be "famously" high.

Simply beautiful. Great shopping. You can find most items here, mostly fashion, with food on lower levels. The higher you go, the more expensive the shops become. Just a simply beautiful building to visit and look at. Beautifully restored for its historical past. If you have the time, a tour can be arranged from the Information Desk and quite interesting.
Shop till you drop. Back to back shops the entire length of a couple of floors - easy to part with your money at some of the more upmarket outlets!

Worth a Visit to Check out the Architecture and History of QVB. Worth a visit if you appreciate architecture (or shopping!) We loved pottering around the building, looking at the stained glass windows, mosaic tiles, old elevator, the clock etc. If you have kids, I would suggest a visit to the Paws a While shop on level 2.
