It is a shop for animal lovers and sells everything from ceramic dogs, meerkat figurines to pink wigs for your dog to wear.
Awesome Christmas tree!. The tree went up four floors in the central atrium. We didn't shop, but all of the best stores are there.

Champagne Welcome!. Wonderful atmosphere and especially lovely at christmas with welcoming glasses of champagne and the shops are all amazing. The Victorian architecture is superb and thankfully the loos are 21st century!!
Visit at Christmas. Christmas display very impressive and lovely building. Have high tea in the very girly tea rooms at the top of the building.
A must stop. Such a lovely building! A must stop, even for a quick walk through along George Street. Great upper market shopping and lovely cafes.

QVB. love it..why?? its because the construction of the building is very like much you see in London, then its made from sandstone and the Dome Roof,I like it..then this building is also historic, you also see the monument of Queen Victoria..but then , as you go inside, the floorings..wow, its a made of mosaic tiles..another good vies for the eye, then the ceiling and the Big clock,, make you feel like your in London, the stairs, the elevators still the original look, people who enjoys good quality but expensive things is a must to go here..

One of my favourite places in Sydney. This is a wonderful multi-storey mall in the old colonial style. some great shops and cafes, although the mall can get a little noisy when there are lots of people inside it. There is also the bonus of free wifi, which you most certainly will not get in your 5 star hotel so come here and take advantage of it without the hefty price tag and do some shopping while you are at it.

Beautiful Heritage building in the heart of Sydney. Always worth a visit when in the Sydney CBD.There's a large statue of Queen Vic out the front and the building itself is gorgeous.The boutique shops inside sell everything from confectionery and coffee to opals, clothing and giftware. Often a little pricey, but always worth a browse.Xmas time is always really special with a giant tree up to the ceiling decorated by Swarovski. Really beautiful.

beautiful design. It is a delight to wander through on 2 levels with many shops. It is wonderful to look at the architecture. there are quite a few coffee shops in the main walk-through area. It is always packed with people. You access it straight from Town Hall station and it's right there. It has been there for a very long time and it was renovated to a very upmarket level. It's a must-see.

Mecca of shopping Queen Victoria. Vivian Chan Shaw is magnificent clothing plus you may know this delightful face from the TV antique show.... The cloths last forever, then go have yum cha, visit the basement for the best cullinary and kitchen bargains.... what day with soothing live orchestral music.

Shops Closed on New Years Day. What a shocker. Retailers are constantly moaning that they can't sell their wares to the public, yet every retailer bar one (Vienna Coffee House) was closed throughout the Queen Victoria Building on New Years Day. Hundreds of people (including overseas tourists) were wandering around the QVB but could not purchase anything. That said the Vienna Coffee House did a roaring trade on the first floor. Very very disappointing, we came to Sydney over the new year period and shopping was one thing on our list of things to do. Unfortunately QVB and its store holders came up very short and failed dismally to deliver. Its all well and good to moan about the public not buying but if you aren't open then you the stores have nothing to moan about. The tourists who were there that day must have been wondering what on earth was happening.Finally if the chocolate store at the northern entrance of QVB cannot spell "Christmas" properly on its "Opening Hours Sign", then one wonders about just how much care is taken with its products.

Heritage building and exquisite shopping!. Very nice shopping center- take time explore all the nice boutiques on four floors. This center is conveniently located near Town Hall subway station. Mostly high end, chic boutiques but it is a good experience just to walk around or have a bite at one of the cafes.

Best Shopping centre in Australia. I really enjoy visiting this historic shopping centre when i visit sydney its like you step back in time and always bring cameras with cause the interior is so well deigned.

Free WiFi. A rare thing in Australia - free wifi so everyone gathers outside even when the centre is closed as you can still pick up an excellent signal. It's a lovely centre, beautifully decorated for Christmas when we were there and well worth a visit to study the architecture and design. The shops are gorgeous but I wouldn't dare set foot in any - WAY above my budget but the cafes are okay and not too overpriced. Yes, the toilets ARE worth a visit! A real little haven in the centre of Sydney for relaxing, watching the wealthy do their shopping and of course the free wifi!

Beautiful surrounds for shopping. Apart from being an historic building QVB has great shopping, atmosphere and cafes. Definite must for any visit to Sydney- the hand crafted jewelers are worth window shopping!

Worth a visit!. Try too get there early as it is always busy. We visited just before Christmas to see the amazing tree that fills the centre of the building, worth going for that alone. Some of the shops are a little expensive but the goods are quality. Take your camera as there are some great photo opportunities.

Amazing As it Was Decorated for Christmas. This is a great use of an old building which has been very tastefully modernised on the inside, keeping all the former character. We were lucky to be visiting when all the christmas decorations were in place, the central Christmas tree was amazing as it reached up through all floors.

Worth a visit just to see the clock.. An authentic and sensitively refurbished Victorian shopping arcade.The building is worth looking at from both the outside and the inside. Take time to see that clock at the turn of the hour and also take time to visit the upper floors.Strange to say but the toilets are worthy of a visit too!

Contemporary shopping in a grandeur setting. The Queen Victoria Building is a grand dame of a majestic building in busy Sydney shopping precinct. There are a wide variety of upmarket designer shops to "off the rack" clothing. Several cafes and restaurants make shopping "rest periods" at QVB even more pleasant. The architecture is splendid. It is a buzzy shopping building and even if you are not a shopper the architecture and "tourist attraction" clock to look out for make QVB a Sydney treasure! It is also a couple of minutes away to Pitt Street mall shopping.

A lovely shopping expedition in an elegant building. We visited the week prior Christmas so we had the advantage of the centre being lit with xmas lights and the beautiful Christmas tree however paid the price of Christmas crowds! It is an interesting shopping centre for the architecture and the shops, whether looking for something different to buy or just browsing. There are lifts for those with strollers, though they were incredibly slow, probably due to the crowds. Hobby Co was a big hit with my family.(There are disabled toilets also)

Lovely shopping centre. Spent several hours exploring the 4 levels of this shopping centre. Spent a lot of time in Hobbyco with my son while wife went shopping in other shops. Lots of boutique shops, also the NY Met shop. Worth a visit for the more exotic stuff.

Makes you feel Grand. Beautiful architecture, can you really beleive this is a commercial establishment? A stone's throw away from townhall station, this stunning block houses a host of rich shopping experiences, cafes, beautiful stain glass panes, antique mosaic flooring, banisters, not to mention elevators which are so old, but well maintained. This block also houses HobbyCo which have beautiful Hornby and other minatiure raiway displays and an amazing selection of collectibles, toys(can we call them that?) and models.
Snow! Excitement!. I went to the QVB for the new "snow globe" experience - where at a certain time it starts "snowing" from the roof above the Swarovski Christmas tree. It was absolutely magical!
wonderful architecture. There is a free guided tour inside this beautiful building with the huge clocks!! Secret inside the clock!! from the Queen...Lots of neat shops and cafes too.

Catching up with girlfriends. Lovely place to meet up with girlfriends for a cup of coffee and cake, or a quick lunch. Strolling around the levels slowly to savour the atmosphere of this gorgeous old buildings and window shopping in the lovely boutiques.

Expensive boutique shops in a modernised big old building. Old big impressive building of rather unusual layout, revived and modernised. Has a few reasonable shops but most are expensive, evidently relying on people paying for the atmosphere. OK to visit, and provides a useful pedestrian route from Town Hall station to other key parts of the city, but don't believe the hype re how wonderful it is.

Picturesque Queen Victoria Building. The huge Christmas Tree with crystals was dazzling and eye catching and impressed my Canadian visitor. The clock with the aboriginal scenes was also very interesting. Eateries were vast and plenty of food choices. Enjoyed window shopping as a lot of the stores have overpriced goods and articles. Worth while wandering through and enjoying the old Victorian style architecture, especially all the stained glass windows.
Stunning. Beautiful shops cafes and vibe a must for everyone to see, beautiful historic building restored to perfection.

the best shopping experience. such beautiful building, variety of shops & budgets too, we had fun wandering in & out so many shops, pity the parking was so expensive, wanted to stay longer but got to go after 4 hrs
Worth seeing!. A wonderful restored building, another Iconic Sydney site to see. Classy shops, Fantastic eating areas or just wander through. Wonderful at Christmas to see decorations
Absolutely beautiful. A well-kept and beautiful old building - every hour, when the clock strikes, one can enjoy watching the hanging clocks. Amazing architecture and wonderful shopping for all.

Another attraction you must not miss!. QVB is just beautiful. There are many shops to suit any budget you have but best of all is the art decor of the building. You will just be mesmerized by the two hanging clocks, the ornate floors and stained glasses, the roof... You just need to be there to appreciate the building. It is more than just a landmark. See and feel it for yourself.

Excellent!. If in Sydney make a point of visiting the Queen Victoria Building.Catch the train to Town Hall Station and you're there.Take your time, (lunch at Vanto's restaurant on level 1 - great food) or have a coffee at one of the little coffee shops.Beautiful architecture offering many photo opportunities, and lovely little boutique shops.There is a lift in the building.
Worth a visit. A beautiful building with some very interesting shops. Well worth a visit to see the architecture and do some shopping.

A Fantastic Restoration Trophy. Magnificently beautiful restored Victorian building housing some grta shops, fabulous cafes and is above a major CBD transport hub.
Definitely worth a visit, even if just passing through.
Love the ambience..... I didn't visit on this latest trip, but I nearly always go there when in Sydney, it really is a Must Do, just to wander through the architectural delight that it is.
The Queen Victoria Building. Located in the Sydney CBD, with many lovely speciality shops, coffee bars etc. The building was beautifully restored to its original splendor about 30 years ago
Shop Your Brains Out!. Hey you shoppers, this place is for you! Drop dead great shops in a gorgeous historic building! Stop by for high tea in one of the most posh high tea venues!

amazing historical building. Totally awesome. The architecture is very beautiful and it kept the old theme prominent. Entering the building with old tiles with the bathroom maintain just like the old days, make you fell astonish. The modern shops did not make the old theme fade away. Wow, really beautiful.

Sydney Historical Building. Beautiful Building with multiple levels of Great Shopping! The Basement has good sales and the upper levels have Top Designers to smaller Boutique Shops. Enjoy a coffee and pastry to catch your second wind! Clock in Center is interesting to see close up- details and design are fabulous to observe.
Totaly Unique. Kept in the Old world Charm ,but with modern shopping - offering something different and worth exploring ,it seems to be a local landmark amoungst locals and tourists .

Very touristy. A nice building in the centre of Sydney that contains lots of upmarket shops seemingly aimed at the tourist market. You can see a clock that has a moving display, replicas of the crown jewels, and other strange things. At Christmas it usually has a large tree. A bit upmarket for my taste it is nice to walk through. The shops on the bottom floor(s) (read underground) are cheaper. There is also a large statue of Queen Victoria on the outside on the end nearest the Town Hall.

My favourite shopping place. Historical venue and the kids will love the clock at the top of the building you must see it once it is mostly high range and boutique shopping but I love the cafes and coffee shops and the atmosphere. I am always sure to stop by when i am visiting. You you have never been it is a must see.

A 'must see' if you a inSydney. Originally there was an attempt to demolish this old building some years ago buy luckily it was saved and for nearly 30 years it has stood out as a classy but somewhat expensive shopping experience. It is full of high class shops and cafe's and it has a wonderful atmosphere. Well worth a visit for breakfast or lunch and do some people watching!

Lovely (old) new shopping complex.. If you like little shops and quirky old buildings that have been given a lovely internal makeover then the QVB is for you. I just like it as it gets me out of the 30C sun and into the cool!

Beautiful historical building, black AMEX needed for shopping. I love the architecture of this building. No matter how many times I visit, I still find something new to admire. The shopping can be quite expensive and it's becoming increasingly more touristy but that's to be expected. Only a short walk from Town Hall rail station so very easily accessible. I can never resist the boutique chocolate shops!

Nice shops but too cramped. It's a really lovely building with nice shops, however it's incredibly hard to enjoy with way too many people for both the size of the building and the stores within. Much patience is required.

A must see for all. In particular this is well worth a visit during the festive season when the tree goes through all floors in the atrium and has swarovski crystals. The building is stunning and one of Sydney's jewels. look at the stained glass and the beauty of the clock. Oh yes and the shoping too!

Nostalgic elegance. The Queen Victoria Building is one of the most old-world elegant shopping centres in Sydney. From the basement to the top floor, there are shops aplenty to meet the needs of most shoppers; from the very expensive to the economical. Shop till you drop if you like, but if you need sustenance or just a beverage break to recharge yourself, there are also plenty of cafes and eateries serving cuisines from different cultures. One of my favourites is the ChaTime beverage shop where one can find many different types of tea and not-caffeinated drinks both hot and cold.One shortcoming of the place is the lack of seats for shoppers who just wish to have a rest without eating or drinking and for those who are waiting while their partners/friends are happily drowning in the sea of merchandise in QVB.
Gorgeous. This beautiful old building and the shops contantined within are lovely. Some shops are high end and some regular retail. It's very enjoyable strolling through and looking around.

Elegance, fin-de-siecle splendour, and great shopping. This fully-restored relic of a bygone age is like Milan's Galleria or London's Burlington Arcade. There's something there for everyone: even the children, who are as fascinated as the rest of us when the figures emerge from the large clock suspended in the three-storey atrium. Designer clothes and accessories vie with reasonably-priced food outlets for commercial space in this bustling marketplace.
Clock and architecture. These two are the niceties of QVB. At every hour the clock displays a story. Go to level 4 there is a nice tearoom there. At Christmas they decorate it with big xmas tree.
loved it could not get enough of it.. We loved it steeped in history, well presented and the staff were very helpful, friendly & it was like stepping back in time.
So many shops, where to start. If we have a money tree we'd have a ball, the shops are all so expendsive, more gluten free food would be nice

Nice to look at. QVB has always been nice to look at. Everytime I am in city I walk through and past it.Shops are nice to browse, but very expensive mostly. But if you want kitchenware, the shop downstairs "Victoria's Basement" has good discounts.And now QVB has free Wifi available! So you can sit at a cafe with your computer, and use the internet for free! :)

Revamped and updated attraction. Viositors to Sydney will appreciate the cosmopolitan atmosphere of the QVB. Its variety of shopping venues in the heart of the city is worth a walk through enen if sopping is not intended.
Looks great. Looks great but the who's all seemed the same and a little boring then again didn't go looking for shops for cloths even tho, worth te visit if you to the time

Wonderful old restored building. This building was on the verge of being demolished but was saved and restored by Ipoh Gardens,a Singapore based company. The restoration is magnificant and the clock pictured is amazing. You could watch the figures and workings of the clock for hours. A building not to be missed but it needs to be explored in it's entirety.

So special. This building is so special, it has to be seen, in the modern age it is a real treat to wander inside this building and just take in the architecture of yesteryear, it is truly beautiful, so glad it has been preserved!!

Art Deco gorgeous. Lovely, lovely building. High end, expensive shops so don't bother with them unless you're into miniature modelling (Hobbyco), or really want name brand goodies. But just look at the place: stained glass, wonderful staircases, spectacular clocks,
go there and shop. go there to see the building and the clocks inside outside there is a monument of a dog that talks and barks

More than meets the eye. While you can easily past the time here as an adult with some retail therapy (both higher end and for the masses) and the beautiful architecture; young kids will love a trip here to marvel at the model-train display at the hobby shop (you don't even have to go inside the store!) The lower level also connects with Myer for even more shopping!

Excellent Window Shopping. QVB is definitely for an acquired taste and budget. If you've never been it's certainly worth a walk around the several levels. A plethora of antique and modern jewellery shops as well as a few unique toy/collector stores. If you're looking for something to eat proceed to the top two levels and there's a few to choose from you.
Stunning building. Love the QVB! A stunningly restored building featuring numerous shops on several levels. If you have the money to spend, then this is the place to shop.
MUST BE DONE. if you go for a walk in sydney CBD, you cant miss this and probably buy one or two things. try the chocolate at the east entrance...MMM!!!
QVB building. Food shopping you name it is here. From the ground floor up it get more expensive so start at the bottom and work your way up.

Really it's just an old-school shopping centre. For the most part this is just a shopping centre, there's a couple of interesting clocks - one English & one Australia - that play a clockwork show when the hour strikes.
Nice building with shops. My favourite would be the manual elevator, other than that, it is just another building with shops to me.
Marvelous salute to a unique regent.. truly well preserved and managed, with its rows of cafe and boutique shops to tempt. a great place to meet and greet.
Downtown redeveloped mall. A mixture of known and unknown commodities very well presented. Also contains a great food court. Conveniently located in the Sydney CBD.

Architectural delight. To think that once upon a time this building was a hair away from demolition... It is an architectural delight. So many shops!! All connecting in the labyrinth of the Sydney train system. You could get lost in this place ~ but to wander in that magnificent building, to look to the soaring leadlight ceiling... to see that enormous tree in the center of the centre at Christmas... it is just so breathtaking. Go to the basement for a store with a million surprises. But don't take the littlies, aisles are narrow with so many things at their eyeline. Get a babysitter and spend the afternoon on your own... yeah, it's a personal treat...
Great Architecture. I am not a shopper but I love walking through this arcade. The infrastructure is excellent and the floor tiles are beautiful.

Glamour shopping. Rivals any ritzy shopping arcade in the world. Lots of cafes and specialist designer shops. Then there are the discount shops underneath where you wander to catch the train at Town Hall.

QVB - Fancy shopping stores and boutique quirky ones too.. Beautiful building worth a wander through just for the architecture of the period.
Lots of fancy shops, high end of the market.
A few interesting select market ones. An everything dog shop, best model and collectable toy shop i've ever seen. a whole shop for wallets, a whole shop for toy soldiers and military scenery.

QVB High Tea. I would not recommend the expensive high tea in the QVB Tea Room. The service is barely satisfactory. Pots of very weak tea are served, and only free hot water is offered if you wish to top these up. If you are booked at 11am you will be pushed out by 12.30 for the next sitting. It is overpriced for what it is. The management really needs to lift their game.

Loved it. Will return.. This building fascinates me. I love the shops and the decor and because of the time of year we visited the Xmas decorations. I like the fact that the shops are individual and boutique.

Magnificent QVB!. What an extraordinary building the QVB is! Architecturally brilliant with arches, columns, beautiful staircases and stained glass windows allowing natural light, it's the perfect setting for the many designer shops and cafes. Unique features such as the two magnificent mechanical clocks, memorials and historic displays mean it's a place to linger in and enjoy. A must see for visitors to Sydney!

Amazing building given new lease of life. This shopping mall is a great example of preserving some important Victorian got his architecture. Most tourists will only walk through the ground floor - big mistake, go to top floor to see amazing clocks suspended from the ceiling. The shops at this level are high end items you never thought you'd need! Not to be missed.

Beautiful Building. The architecture of the building is the best feature. While the QVB is full of high end retail and some cafe dining, some of the best aspects of a visit are just enjoying the architecture, and the details, which include vintage elevators and two wonderful large clocks, one in each end of the building.

Its a nice distraction.. The QVB is pretty much just a mall, it isn't much else than that. Yeah, the buildings fasacde and interior are well maintained to have a dated look but I wouldn't call it a tourist destination.

Beautiful building. Nice to walk through and glance around once but it's just shops.. Somewhere you are likely to pass by or through without trying and not worth going out of your way for. A pretty building but just a fancy shopping mall at the end of the day.
A lovely building in the heart of the city. A wide variety of shops and beautiful ceilings and interior decor. Check out the toy store & tea room upstairs. However parking will set you back some.
Once worked there. The changes that have been made to this building since I worked there in the 50's are wonderful, having been restored to it's former glory was a master stroke
Shop til you drop. Lovely old building with a wide range of shopping to choose from. They even have free Wi Fi which is a bonus when shopping with teenagers.

Must See. QVB is a masterpiece. Gracious - a step back in time. Excellent cafes & shops. Victoria's basement is a must if you are looking to replace any kitchen equipment. Bargains galore. Worth a browse. Also check out the chiming clocks which go off on the hour. View from upstairs for the best photographs.

History that must remain. Beautiful building in the hear of Sydney in George Street, great shopping and nice eateries inside. Truly an outstanding building that should be kept, even while the ever changing landscape around it becomes higher and more reflective, this building needs to stay to remember the culture history and because it should be listed!! Its so beautiful
Lots of shops. Located on George Street, the QVB is great for shoppers. I find things are pricey but what isn't pricey in Australia. Another area to go to is the Westfield Mall, which is nearby.
Beautiful Architecture. Absolutely stunning scenery, british architecture at its best. Beautiful, really a work of art, amazing shopping experience as well
My favourite place. When I travel by train to the City I always go to Town Hall Station so I can walk through the QVB. An amazing place that just gets better each visit to the City

Another Gem. Another of those wonderfully restored building that give us the chance to glimpse old Sydney. To think it was almost pulled down. Thankfully it was saved and has be come a very popular place to shop, eat and just enjoy the archietecture.

Beautifull Old Building. Always love visit this building. Admire the architecture. Wait for the clock to Ring. Great shops even for window shopping & nice place for High Tea. My favourite shop are Victoria basement which sell kitchen / house utilities with best price.
Great shopping. If you want to shop... go here for sure. I also loved the building itself. Lots of variety so something for everyone.

BEAUTIFUL AND ELEGANT. I love QVB and whenever I visit the city I always drop in. From the nice cafes, to the beautiful restaurants and elegant shops, QVB has it all! I enjoy shopping, eating and relaxing at QVB. QVB is family/children friendly and I certainly recommend it.

A nice but frantic place. The architecture of this building is beautiful and there's a particularly interesting clock housed inside the building which is an attraction in itself.
The shops though are expensive - the higher, the more expensive, and it's always busy. The food outlets too are expensive but it's a great place to meet and wander around if you have time to spare.

A Grand Old Lady. You can come here for five imuntes or five hours. There are many cafes and shops to browse, as well as the clocks which change and show the different scenes of history. It was the best place saved from wreckers and brought back to her former glory many years ago. Just look at her now!

A Beautiful Building. Filled with various types of shops from high end fashion to beautiful kitchenware as well as quaint little cafes, this is a must see if you enjoy history, beautiful architecture or just want somewhere lovely to stroll through and it's free for the eye to see.

charming, good shops. I did not have time to visit many shopping centres in Sydney, but made a point to visit QVB . This is my third visit to this 19th century mall. Lots of good brands, interesting nook and crannies... very pretty.

If only there are more character shops. I like strolling through QVB even if I don't mean to shop there, the ambiance is just lovely. Though I find the souvenir shops lacking character... in a beautiful setting like this, there ought to be more unique merchandises rather than the usual fashion outlet.

Best building in Sydney. Love the ambiance here. You can go to the basement for affordable shops, such as Victorias Basement, always good for kitchen goodies. Then there are the other floors with top name shops. At the very top you can have lunch or treat yourself to a high tea. The high tea is in lovely surroundings and the food is fab. Dont eat too much before you go as you get plenty there. Ask for the red chairs, you feel like a princess sitting in them rather than the normal ones.....

Lovely building that hints of Empire times, but has modern conveniences. This building's architecture, as well as The Strand down the street, recalls to mind the heady days of the British Empire. However, it is filled with modern, contemporary shops and cafes, and it is certainly worth spending a couple of hours walking through the arcade. It is also right smack in the middle of the Sydney shopping belt.

Great any time of year. My favourite time of year is Christmas, when the biggest tree I have seen inside fills the central transept through up to the stained glass dome above. The cafes get quieter the higher up you go.

The Old Girl is worth a visit. What's not to like about an huge, old building covering several floors which has been renovated into a shopping mecca? Shop till you drop, eat till you can hardly move and don't miss the extraordinary clock on the second level BUT make sure you are there just before 12 noon to see it in its true magnificence.

Beautiful Building. Lovely building, great place to spend a couple of hours gazing in the shop windows and enjoying a coffee and cake at one of the lovely coffee shops. I think the higher up you go the more elegant (and $$$) the shops become. Beautiful.
An Elegant Venue. Just love this blast from the past - style and elegance that conveys you back to another era. Pity they sold out years ago and dumped the little Aussie investors.

beautiful. a wonderful place to meander on a chilly Sydney day or when its hot outside. Lots of great shops, tea rooms and a gallery if you make it to the top floor.
The christmas tree is one of Australias best

Nice architecture with a selection of shops.. The QVB houses some famous brands but most intersting a large hobby shop with a wide selection of model planes, die casted model aircrafts, train sets, kites.. Etc. had an interesting time looking at each of them.
The building also has 2 interesting clocks, one of which has a puppet show every hour (or half hour).
Very nice buidling. Excellent place for a short visit during stay in Sydney. very nice , clean and the clocks were nice with scenes from British history.
Amazing building. The building is beautiful outsideand inside. A lot of shops and restaurants but everything is expensive
Great architecture. Its just great architecture. The shops inside are also good. A good place for shopping and seeing the art. Great place for photography also.

Breathtaking.. Loved this building. The architecture.
Loved shopping here. Had a great day out.
Definitely go there again.

Just Looking. Love the architecture - well worth a visit.But also includes great shopping,restaurants. The QVB Tea Rooms should be on the to do list!
Love this place!

so pretty. very nice old building with lots of new shops and eateries inside.
cheque out the bathrooms, original tiles very pretty!
Terrific. The diversity of shops and experiences. So many different ones. So many different "leads" off to other areas and shops
Nice. Nothing much, but it is always good to visit. I love the building structure. Itis centrallylocated in Town Hall.

Wonderfully preserved historic building. A mecca of shopping within one of the most highly regarded restored historic building. A must for any visitor to sydney both in historic terms and then its current retail hub.

Beautiful Shopping Centre. This is a shopping centre with a lot of expensive shops and stuff. It has a beautiful look from the second floor, when you look down and see the tiles on the other floors.
See this place on a rainy and cloudy day in Sydney.

Great Shopping Opportunities. I have been shopping in the QVB twice now and really enjoy it. It's wonderful to see a shopping complex not filled with the usual shops that are littered through places like Westfield and Centro. There are some fantastic little boutique places such as the military figurine and the lithograph shops that you would travel into the city just to see. I have picked up some wonderful gifts both the times I have been. The building itself is majestic and well maintained. I love the big old clock in the middle - it's great to see that some old buildings have been left with their original beauty.The QVB is quite expensive so it's not a place you could go slurging in unless your rich. The food court is extremely noisy so avoid if you can.
Majestic Building. This is fun to walk through. If you get a chance and you fancy a HIgh Tea the tea rooms are wonderful and the experience fantastic.

Great shopping venue. Great for local shoppers and tourists alike. There are all the usual shops you get in good shopping centres for locals, and also lots of unique shops for tourists buying gifts etc. Also there are plenty of cafes and restaurants and several cater well for those needing a gluten-free diet. It's also wheelchair friendly with plenty of lifts to different levels.
Beautiful Building well worth a visit. Shops are expensive but they are in a beautiful building and the High Tea was well worth the visit.
Beautiful renovation. Unless you have a very thick wallet, just enjoy the frontages of shops and building. Very overpriced for the normal person but nice to have a look around.

Sydney heritage shopping. Grand old Sydney building. Romanesque Revival style over 4 floors (plus a subterranean level to Town Hall Station and Market Street) and filling one city block. Beautifully restored and full of shops catering to all comers. Mostly middle-high end fashion stores (Coach, Longchamp, Ferragamo) and cafes on the ground floor level. Upper levels have jewellers, antiques, sportswear, more fashion, eyewear, hobby & models for big kids (men), the tea room,collectors items and some quirky boutiques. Adults will love the people watching from cafes, open space, architecture and good quality shops. Kids love the big clocks with dioramas & animated figures which can be viewed up close from the top floor. There are lovely old wrought iron stairs with nice wide treads or modern escalators to choose from to make your way up to the top. Photo worthy from all angles, inside and out. At the southern exterior plaza there is a massive statue of Queen Victoria herself and a smaller 'talking" statue of Islay, her dog. The western side is a commuter hub for buses and the subterranean (lower ground) floor is a major commuter route. Avoid these in the mornings around 7-9am and in the afternoons from 4-6.30pm when they get very crowded and everyone is in a rush.
Classic building, classic shopping. Even of you don't buy anything on one of its stores, just walking through the building is an experience. The architecture is amazing. A great heritage building.
Admirable. wonderful dining experience and had a good time looking around the building

Queen Victoria Building. Beautiful building with numerous shops. Interesting venue to browse or buy. Located right next to Town Hall Station and the Sydney Town Hall. Also opposite the Hilton Hotel so very accessible by train bus or monorail.

Beautiful Building. This is a lovely place to shop or have a meal or coffee . It is worth a visit just to enjoy the beautiful old building.
We visit every Christmas to see the huge Christmas tree covered in crystals.
An architectural delight.. The building is majestically beautiful. Shopping and browsing is a bonus. Allocate adequate time to explore all levels and enjoy the complex.

Gorgeous old building. I love to visit the QVB simply because of the stunning architecture. There's plenty of great shops there too though. Make sure you go to the lower levels and the higher ones, not just ground floor!

Beautiful - Every time!. I never get sick of visiting and shopping in this "grand old lady"! This still has to be one of the classic places to visit when in Sydney. There is a great mix of shops and things to while away the time - especially on a grey day. Make it a must on your next visit.

Beautiful historic building!. What an amazing building. There are more levels than what appears at first. Shopping is very upper market, with all the major houses accounted for. Sadly for the average shopper most shops are above our price range. We (grandmother, daughter, 2 granddaughters) had brunch at one of the eateries in the open in the centre of ground floor, sadly we were very disappointed it was only average.I was very impressed with the fact that the bottom level connects with Town Hall railway station.

A most beautiful building. Make sure you see it, especially at Christmas.. The QVB is a beautiful building. Shopping is generally expensive here. But it is definitely worth a wander through. At Christmas they display a large Christmas tree in the building.
Architecture takes this mall to another level. Old, grand and elegantSpend some time enjoying yourself whether it be shopping, window shopping or eating

Gorgeous architecture and tiles.. I love going in here just to look at the stain glass windows the tessalated floor and see the 2 clocks chime at different times. They also have a little show as they chime. Worth going there when the Xmas tree is up also.

Swaroski Christmas Tree.. Gorgeous building, and the main clock in the middleis beautiful. My wife and I waited for the hour, to see the clock's movement. The tree made up of the Swaroski crystals was incredible!

A beautiful piece of architecture. I first took my young son to the QVB when it was newly renovated. As a 7yr old he stated "what a beautiful building mum". Since then we have moved back to Sydney, I always meet overseas visitors upstairs at Vanto,or it was Cafe de Paris. Wonderful experience overlooking the balconies down through the levels of this magnificent building. Each level has a wonderful selection of stores from homewares to designer clothing. I recommend the QVB as a "must see" for all travellers whether from overseas or interstate or as I do as a tourist in my own city.
Amazing. This a great place to shop...admire the architecture as well. Not to far away I a open mall as well.
Grand old building and some cool shops. Great around Christmas time when they have the floor to ceiling Christmas Tree. Cool boutique shops.
Worth a visit. Fabulous building which is worth a visit for its own merit, the fact that it houses a variety of shops, boutiques and cafes/restaurants is an absolute bonus!

My 2nd fav sydney building (after the House). Stunning , outside and in , and fantastic shopping esp upstairs on level 2 and 3. Great views from up there too , and don't miss the clock with all the stunning detail.

Yesteryear. I love going into the QVB when in the city. I don't go in everytime I go to town but go in every 2nd- 3rd trip to the city. I needn't necessarily buy anything when I go but I love to browse through the shops and I love the atmosphere there. I'm a sucker for history and love the old buildings.

Slice of time. Externally the building holds many attractions and has been lovingly renovated through various stages. I used to visit the library while it was housed here . . when the voids at different levels had been filled in! Presentation of interior these day is enticing and very attractive to explore. Prices are elevated the higher up you shop though hours of intriguing window shopping are free. A multitude of Café's, food, clothing and other goods. Underground connections to Town Hall railway station and other city shops.

Heaven. I dont think I have ever been in a place where I have ever wanted to spend money like ths place. It trapped me in a happy place. We couldnt afford to be here, but still we spent. Boutiques of just the most stunning products, the first decent service we had recieved and architecture to blow the mind. Take the time and max the cards.
Example old fashion class and style. great shopping for new and old. Lovely place to meet friends and enjoy stroll. Sham clock hasnt been fixed

Stunning. You could spend all day here looking around at the different shops. Have a meal at one of the many cafes etc and don't just stop on the ground floor, keep going down underneath as there are more shops. I particularly have to admire the building itself, the iron staircases, the marble floors and tiles the beautiful stain glass windows and always like to visit the florist to see what new in... don't miss this place, I'm sure you would love it and its not a touristy junk place, its beautiful and old
Photo Opportunity. The QVB is a beautifull old building,great place to take some photos of the Dome and the Clock Tower

Shops Galore!. You could easily get lost for hours here, there are so many shops and lots of great sales on at the moment. The variety of stores is amazing....from antique jewellery, designer handbags, boutique clothing and so much more. The food court at the bottom is a great find, it is spotlessly clean, quiet and has a great variety of food to choose from.

Lovely old worlde charm building. Thriving, iconic building in mainstream Sydney CBD Great shopping and atmosphere with insight into what it would have been all those years ago when it was first built. A favourite haunt for shoppng or just to while away time in the CBD.

Beautiful decor. Amazing decor, absolutely beautiful and a joy to just walk through and window shop. If you're in Sydney in December, be sure to pop in and see the massive Christmas tree that is put up every year inside the QVB.

Beautifully restored commercial building.. This building beautifully restored is so accessable from Town Hall station and worth a visit to anyone who enjoys style and a taste of history. Shops are interesting, some have reasonable prices too!
Beautiful building. Great place to have breakfast or a coffee. Shopping is first class.

QVB. The QVB offers you both style fashing & good food. There is something for everyone. The architecture of the building is simply stunning allowing you to take in a little of the past. A definiate on anyone's "To do list" when visiting Sydney, whether you are a local or a visitor to the city

Top Lunch Spot. For years we have visited the QVB most weekends, and our favourite lunch spot is QV Bar on the ground floor. There, you can enjoy the best Caesar salad in town, drink a proper coffee and watch people buy pink diamonds at Neuman Mondial.
Shopping in a nice setting. Lots of variety in shops and eating places. The building is lovely

Beautiful Place to Shop. Have to say this is a really pretty building, somewhat confusing if you at some points as you go down and lose track of where you are. Great shops - Oroton is a must look at - all the big brands that you know and love.

Quality shopping in a piece of history. Good quality of stores from small designers to more australian speciality chain stores, this is a great space to shop down to the uneven floors and the unusual shop. Experience has been improved by the addition of some great lunch time restuarants on the higher floors and the traditional tea rooms

Looking is Free. This is a beautiful building to explore, and visiting is free. There are two clocks with animated scenes that perform regularly. They hang from the roof and can be seen from nearby balconies. The building also houses some crown jewels replicas. Window shopping at the expensive stores is also free. It's worth seeing at least two levels of the building to fully enjoy it. Another good point. The toilets are free and clean.This building is also fairly close to the Strand Arcade, another piece of Sydney old-world charm.

old world charm with wonderful shopping outlets. I love the shopping and the old world charm. There is just about everything you can imagine in this building and it is so gorgeous. It is my treat to visit there when I go to Sydney. I love to shop there as there is so much variety and quality.
You must see it.. There are two clocks you can get a good look at on the third level. They are quite handsome and intricate.
Expensive shopping. Great place to look around and view the old architecture. Shops are over pricerd but some nice brands there.
Great building. Loved the unique decor of the arcades, mosaics, etc.
Stunning building. Lots of lovely shops and cafes. Beautiful tea rooms on the top level. Go there for high tea.

Historical Building with amazing shops. Sydney has the best shops, this building has so much character and features just so much warmth when ou walk threw the building. There are up market shops in the complex and the unfortunate thing is that you need to walk threw the place a few times before you actually see the shops, the building is just so overwhelming that you are so captivated by all the features that you really dont care about the shops. Amazing place and a must see.

History and a few decent shops. At first glance the QVB is just a rare historic Sydney building with some overpriced shops and cafes, but a few are actually quite decent: Hobbyco, the ABC Shop, Laksa House in the basement to name a few. Moreover the upper levels can be a place to escape the crowds, grab a seat and take a breather.

Beautiful Architect. From the exterior to the interior, it is truly a piece of beauty. It is a symbolic building for Sydney. And it is a great place to walk about and shop with all different brands that it provides in the whole building. A place in which you must visit when you come to Sydney

Beautiful, great shopping experience!. Shops for teenagers like - Gloss, Glue Store, Sports girl.
It's connected to the Town Hall station (nearly ALL trains stop there every few mins as well as Central station).
Many good shopping places.
Recommended for visitors and is a must visit! People who live here also go like everyweek.
Beautiful building. A beautiful old building, worth visiting to just to look at the detail in its design.

Beautiful historical building!. It is a beautiful historical building that refurbished to a shopping mall. However, I don't like the escalators crossing different floors. They do not match with the historical feel inside.

I love this building. I really loved the QVB. It was reminiscent of Melbourne’s block arcade, but on a much larger scale. A magnificent old building, it is now filled with all sorts of shops and restaurants. The old curved staircases were magnificent and the décor in general was lovely. A real highlight in the centre of Sydney. And I agree with trishws - the clocks were awesome!

Atmosphere interest and great shops. Lovely old historic place fantastic clock which entertains the crowds lovely for afternoon tea on the top level fabulous shops you can spend several hours here on all the levels including underground well worth a visit

If you visit Sydney and don't see the QVB, turn around and go back.. The Queen Victoria Building has everything you'd ever need in a shopping experience, and probably more. The last time we stayed in Sydney on our way to Singapore, we spent one night at the Hilton opposite. Instead of joining the queue for breakfast in the hotel, we slipped across the road and found a restaurant in the QVB for a more relaxing (and cheaper!) start to the day.Shops for everyone, and definitely fashion choices you won't get outside of Oz. And, of course, if you need the odd boomerang or didgeridoo, try the end store at the top.All this and real character in the heart of one of the world's nicest cities. You'll love it.

Love the ceiling clocks. Grandeur architecture inside out with a statue of Queen Victoria outside. Lots of (window) shopping to do here, grab a bite at one of the many cafes here with seating along the walkways.

Time to Whip out the Platinum Card!. The QVB has this wonderfully historic architecture to it, comprised of a sandstone exterior and elegant marble floors. It is located in the CBD, and you will find many of the high-end stores and some boutiques. Even if you plan just to window shop, I find temptation usually gets the best of me, and I end up purchasing several items.

One of the best historical Sydney buildings. This is a fascinating and very grand building and I love to just wander through here, browsing at the many shops and ornate architecture. You can get a train or bus straight here (Town Hall Stop) and then explore the many levels and there are shops for any interest or budget. Don't forget to go outside and admire the outside and the statue of Queen Victoria. When you get hungry head down to the food court on the bottom floor or grab an ice-cream from New Zealand Natural. If you're not done then head out to Pitt Street Mall.

A wonderful sens of history. To think that they nearly pulled it down for a carpack a few decades ago.This is Sydney CBD at its best - heart of the city with the most beautiful architecture.The retail outlets wwould prefer that I do more shopping here but I just enjoy the building.I often park here when I visit the city and this puts you in the heart of the city.

Beautiful QVB. Gorgeous shopping centre in a beautifully restored historic building. Prices and quality of shopping increases floor by floor with stunning boutiques on the top floor. The centre clock is exquisite and if are visiting around Christmas time it is just magical. Food courts on the ground floor and delightful coffee shops throughout.
shopping. A bit confusing the first time we went inside but then became familiar with the layout. Good choice.

Victorian splendour. This is a lovely shopping area in a refurbished Victorian era building. There are plenty of cafes, restaurants, clothes shops etc as well as an antique clock which chimes on the hour.
quaint. great speciality stores and gorgeous architecture. a must do for those visiting sydney

well worth a wall through for the architectural value alone. unexpectedly entered QVB to get out of the sun then taken aback by the interior of this building is fantastic, don't forget to go downstairs too. loved all the unique outlets and trading

A historical site that is a sight for sore eyes. It is nice to see new life being infused into an old building. Internally the building is full of character and atmosphere with plenty to see as you browse or just take tea on the upper floor. Don't miss this place.
QVB visit. Beautiful shopping in an amazing building. Have a coffee and watch the world go by!

Spectacular Building. The building is spectacular. You really have to check out the rile work and clocks closely to appreciate the history and quality. The shops are very good, but also very expensive.

I love to walk through here. It was refurbished into its present condition as a small shop arcade in the 80s. It was done brilliantly. Originally it was the fish markets, then a library and finally it was made into one of Sydney's most beautiful buildings inside and out. The floors are tesselated. The central stairs are spiral. Hand rails cast iron. The top floor houses a clock display of the history of Australia. It is automated and starts every hour on the hour.
Busy, busy, busy. so much choice of good quality goods, bustling with people and plenty of entertainment
splendid. Beautiful very classy & some great shopping something for everyone from stunning designer shops to the more affordable retail outlets just a georgeous building that needs to be seen
Great place to explore and shop for just about anything!. This is Sydney's best shopping with a big slice of history thrown in.
Beautiful. Beautiful interiors, beautiful shops, Beautiful interiors, beautiful shops,

Go Here at Christmas if you can. This is a step back in history. Lovely old shops with modern interiors and many varied types of shopping. We first visited at Christmas in 1987 and on many other occasions since. There was a huge Christmas tree that stood from the ground floor right through several floors to the very top of the building.This really is a mustand if you can manage a visit during the festive season all the better. (last visit five years ago)
Like stepping back in time. Some very cool cafes and shops. Worth the visit...

SHopping an eating is great. Just walking or sitting in the QVB is great. Window shopping is a must as you wander from level to level. There are many fine eateries and coffee shops. The restrooms are from a time past and are beautiful. The variety of shops is amazing from designer shops to jewellery. A visit is a must.

Fantastic architecture, history and elegance!. I visit the QVB not for its shopping (don't get me wrong the shops there are fantastic!) but to see its beauty! The cafes there might be a bit pricy but I guess being inside a great architecture is worth it! When Sydney is advertised overseas the Harbour Bridge or the Opera House are the most common icons, I think the QVB is just as an icon as those two. During Christmas, there is a massive Christmas tree towering right up to its ceiling. And all other times, you can just admire the beauty - the architecture and elegance of the place.
A wonderful place. Great shops and keep an eye on the clock as it moves and just looks wonderful

Gracious, elegant shopping mall. What's not to like? Great shops, elegant and gracious, a clock that puts on a show once an hour, and brilliant tea rooms. It's right above Town Hall railway station, and is a must see spot in Sydney. Bring your camera.

Nice place to shop and have a coffee, or just browse. Nice to have this classy place in the middle of Sydney! Expensive labels, great coffee shops on the superior levels. The shops and eating places get cheaper on the ground and basement floors. As they should... Great for whiling away a couple of hours. Underground passage to the new Westfield, for those who wish to go from Victorian architecture to a 21st century shopping centre.

Christmas time. At Christmas its worth going to see the huge Christmas tree that goes right through to the top level.Also, wait for the clock to stike on the hour and see what happens.Excellent place to shop for that special gift.
nice building. just a place to see in sydney no need to go shopping just the building is really butifful
Grand old lady of Sydney. This is an interesting building, with some lovely shops and restaurants. Is has the mechanical clock and old fashioned lifts and the ABC shop. I love it.

A lovely building a lovely place to shop. I love this building and you really can see some great aspects of yesteryear, but be sure to look carefully at the fine detail also that can sometimes be lost through the glitz and glamour of fancy stores. The facade work, the tiles, the metal work and the grand staircase and it's stained glass windows.This is a lovely place to see and do some shopping and plenty of Australian art and souvenir stores if your not from Australia. Well worth the visit.

Beautiful Architecture. Since we were staying at the Grace Hotel, we would come to the QVB for coffee and free wi-fi in the mornings. This building is stunning and full of very high end retail chains as well as small local boutiques.
QVB. Excellent shopping opportunities. Interesting architecture.
Fantastic Architecture. Lovely shopping area, have a coffee in one of the many fine cafes.
Excellent place to shop.... Great place to shop. Especially during May and June time. During end of year finance. Everything is like aleast 20% discount.. worth the visit.. ^^

Another grand old lady. It is hard to believe that there was talk of demolition before the building was re-developed, after severe deterioration and neglect, and given a new life in 1986. While rather odd in its architecture, its rounded windows looking a Romanesque church, the building houses levels of upmarket shops and boutiques/kiosks; eateries of many kinds and is also part of an underground commuter and connection system which includes Town Hall Station. On a wet day it helps minimise outdoor walking in the general precinct.

Old World Style Ornate Shopping. I was only here briefly so I didn't get to look for any bargains. The subway leaves you off very close to the Queen Victoria Building. Beautiful, ornate, old world style shopping with a couple floors of shops to browse. I have pictures attached.
Great shopping. Whether you are a serious shopper or just like to browse, there is something for you here. Lots of nice cafes, too.

Not to be missed - especially at Christmas Time. I have always loved this building, there is a clock that 'puts on a show' during the hour and is a craftsman masterpiece. At Christmas time the tree is always a sight to be seen - last year there were hundreds (if not thousands) of crystals hanging from it and is spectacular. The restoration some 20 years ago to its former glory has been maintained and the shops are of very high qualtity.
QVB. What a grand old lady, well worth a visit, especially when you come from WA where if it is old you rip it down and build a menorial to the current Premier!

Historic Shopping Experience. Mix your retail therapy with gawking at historical architecture. The QVB is an opulent and beautifully restored relic of old Sydney, built from our own Sydney sandstone. There are hundreds of shops, getting more pricey as you go up. Quite a lot of tourist shops, but nice galleries and art shops too. And plenty of high end fashion. I love the antiquated elevator and the central dome.
Great architecture. Beautiful architecture and there's a little shop at the entrance that sells delicious chocolates.
A Piece of Sydney's History. A truly beautiful piece of Sydney's history...try and google the history of the building before you visit... did I mention the shopping?
Great shops & resturants. All the major shops are available in QVB, with very good quality cafe's & restaurants in a historical building
but keep your credit card in your wallet. grand old restored building well worth the walk through
Beautifully restored building!!. Its nice to see such a lovely old charmer, in the middle of modern suburbia. Great shopping complex. Andy's is great to eat at as well.Best banana bread.

A bit Kitchy but if you like Old Worlde charm this is for you.. I like the QVB, have done so for years, but having traveled a little more, and seen more, it now has been relegated to quaint. The shopping is good with a variety of specialty boutiques and the like, but don't plan to spend a full day here, it's part of the wider shopping and cultural experience.I like the QVB far more than the more modern malls on offer in Sydney but if you've seen Europe or London this will be a bit Old World 'Lite'.
Great mix of shops. Can get quite crowded on a Thursday night with commuters on their way home. Expensive.
Beautiful building. The QVB is a beautiful building, both inside and out. It's certainly worth a visit.
Don't shop. Just look!. A truly beautiful building with some very expensive stores inside. Skip the stores and see the building. Even the restrooms are impressive.
A step back in time. Wonderful shops and eateries. The building is worth a visit alone it is like a step back in time. How sad it would have been to lose this beautiful icon.

Beautiful architecture. Head over to QVB and check out the stunning interior - and not to mention the shops! Head downstairs for the bargains and street wear and upstairs if you want to splurge! It is also amazing at Christmas time, with an enormous tree filling the center atrium.

TAKE A NICE WALK. Easy access fro Central station by 555 free bus .. lots of nice olde buildings in the area as well as a short walk to Rocks and Circular Quay too!!You never can tell if you may find what you are looking for as its just shops with restaurants and coffee stays .. lots in the area too see but no big deal .. rugby shop just across the street too!!

Bygone Charm for modern shopping. This wonderful building was refurbished in the late '80s. It still has the rustic charm of a bygone era, but the shopping is very modern. Checkout the clock, and at Christmas the tree at the centre.
Great window shopping in an iconic building. Iconic old building in Sydney's CBD, lots of high end shops and coffee shops.
Great window shopping. Lovely old building with boutique shopping. Expensive but nice to look
Worth a stop. I always take visitors to see the QVB. It's a beautiful building with nice cafes. The clock is worth taking a look at.

Shopper or not, don't miss the QVB. We were most impressed with all of the shopping opportunities in the heart of Sydney. The QVB, the Pitt Street Mall, Strand Arcade and entire area was wonderful. The usage of the Victorian era buildings is well done and inviting.
Beautiful. Lovely building worth going in and window shopping. Take the escalators up and enjoy the building from the inside as well.
Superb building. Great shops but for me the biggest attraction is the building itself - beautiful architecture all in pristine condition.

The World's best shopping arcade?. This magnificently restored building is a delight to stoll through just to savour its beauty. The up-market shops and eateries are the very epitome of elegance and create a delightful ambiance. An added attraction is its location in Central Sydney. A truly beautiful place to visit.

A Sydney Icon. This imposing building locally called The QVB was completed in 1898 and covers one complete block. It houses many shops selling jewellery, clothes, bags etc. It also has two impressive clocks, one The Royal Clock reveals six English historical scenes on the hour. The other The Great Australian Clock has the Australian theme. There are a lot of cafes dotted along the walkways and it's a good place to wander along window shopping if not buying.
top shopping. beautiful building worth just going to admire window .antiques designer shops. love it

Restored to its former glory in the 1800's this building houses many boutique shops.. Tourist and locals alike can enjoy the beauty and splender that is to offer in the arcade several floors of shops and resturants also admiring the inticate artwork and grandure it has to offer.

Architecture and shopping. The QVB has a beautiful facade filled with numerous shops -generally more expensive the higher you go. It is also a good underground walkway between Sydney central place and town hall if you are trying to escape the rain. The elaborate clock has an hourly chime , and on the top level there are carriage displays.
Beautiful building, full of an array of shops. There is shopping for everyone! Food hall is good. A must do in Sydney.

Upmarket shopping in a historic building. To be honest, the building is itself the main attraction, as it is a fantastically ornate historic building. Great to just wander around and see the design. It has lots of fancy shops, but unless you are looking to spend top dollar then probaby best to shop elsewhere.

Historial building with great boutique shops. A fantastic collection of shops in a beautiful historical building.
I agree with some of the reviewers which say that the staff think they are above you unless you walk into the shop with a pole up your bum.
But if you want to shop then shop here, just ignore the rude sales staff.

Beautiful building with luxury shops and yummy eateries. Lovely experience, especially at Christmas time with the Swarovski sponsored tree. The clock is like a a giant Cocock clock with a mini show each hour, which is lots of fun and can be seen from one of the higher levels. QVB has an extensive range of stores, from low quality cheap fashionable clothing on the lower level, to specialised stores on the higher level and high quality branded stores throughout, so a little bit of everything. There are also cafe-style restaurants in between the stores. In addition, the bottom level of QVB is an underground air con transfer tunnel to the Town Hall train station which is a major transit point. Great place for tourists to visit.
a great restoration of a historic building. this was a great restoration of a decayed historic building (originally the city produce markets) now full of mostly chain shops
By Gone Era. Restoration is wow, a city within a city a must see and experience.
Looks great.. The architecture is very nice and the variety of shops is attractive

Gorgeous. The QVB might just be the most beautiful mall I've seen. On our last day in Sydney, we spent one hour touring the building before heading to the airport. The was live piano performance on the top floor. Just people watching and window shopping will bring you much joy. It is one of those memorable experiences that will last a long time after you've returned home. Checking out the QVB is a must-see if you're visiting Sydney.
love it. I remember when this building opened in the 1980,s it wowed me then and still does ,not just shops but an experience.
A Photographers delight. QVB is like stepping into a time machine. It takes you back to the grandure of old Sydney. A truely magnificent building with a mirriad of shops and dining choices.
A step back in time.. Large variety of shops catering to all needs and tastes in this beautifully maintained building.

Beautiful building. What a fantastic building, not just from the outside, even thought they were busy with renovations on the exterior it did not detract from the building as the covering was printed just like it would of been if the building had not been covered. When you go inside the tiled floors are beautiful and the doom is beautiful. Very well converted. also beatiful shops. Well worth a visit
put it on your list. the building is spectactular and the shops inside are as good
Gorgeous shops. Beautiful shops, too expensive but nice to look at.

Great Building ~ Excellent Restoration. The Queen Victoria Building, nowadays referred to as the QVB, was completed in 1898.A Romanesque style architecture was chosen so that many out-of-work craftsmen (stonemasons, plasters, stained window artists) could be employed.The building underwent many remodelling changes to suit the needs of its different tenants over the years.The building was mainly empty and facing demolition during the period 1959 to 1971. The restored building reopened to the public in November 1986.The lower ground level is a busy daily commuter "passageway" from the Town Hall Station to the Pitt Street Mall and beyond. The QVB building covers an entire city block bound by George, Market, York and Druitt Streets.A multi-million dollar refurbishment was completed in 2009. It involved balustrades, bathrooms, carpet, new escalators connecting upper floors, elevators, painting (vibrant colours) and signage.Numerous bus routes stop at or near the QVB. Town Hall train station is minutes away.Well worth visiting for a coffee and snack and to explore the variety of shops on the four levels.View the various stained glass windows around the building.Do not forget to view the large clocks.The Concierge desk is located on the ground floor near the centre Dome. Guided tours are held on a regular basis. Bookings are essential and a fee is charged.Click on the website link on main screen for various info topics about the QVB
Great shopping. Beautiful Victorian era building that was saved from the scrapheap. Excellent shops for locals and tourists and many places to eat when tired!
Great Shopping. Fantastic selection - keep eye out for sales though!

One of Sydney's most beautiful buildings. If you are in Sydney a visit to the Queen Victoria Building is delightful A beautiful looking building built in the late nineteen centuryIt is at 455 George st Sydney CBD at Town hall station easily reached by bus or trainIf you go by car there is plenty of parking as well as valet parkingInside the building is just wonderful to look at there are 4 floors with around 200 shops it is air conditioned and there are escalatorsThere are stained glass windows and floors of shops selling almost everything from fashion, arts and crafts, novelties, antiques , jewelery shoes bags and souvenirs it is not cheap here but there are some really beautiful unusual things Food is available in the many restaurants and on the top floor High Tea is one of my favourites better to book though it is very popular with Sydneysiders The bottom floor has a food courtOne of the main attractions is the huge clock built in the shape of Balmoral Castle in the center of the building when it chimes lots of little figures come in and out children and adults all love watching itTo see this building when it is decorated inside for Christmas is truly an amazing site
Beautiful!. A great bulding that used to be the Queens home, and now is an expensive shopping mall. It is beautiful inside, and well worth exploring. Make sure you check out the clocks inside!

Gorgeous building. Such a huge variety of shops for all budgets! Lovely Victorian decor and pleasant to walk around in. Tip: go to Modena's pizza bar. You get a DELICIOUS rectangular pizza (lots of different toppings) with salad and a tasty milkshake for about $15 dollars.

A beautiful restoration.. This lovely old building has been beautifully restored. Full of interesting shops and eateries, the giant Christmas tree in December is Everyman's delight. The kids love the clock that chimes every quarter hour and the little figurines that come in and out as it chimes.

Beautiful shopping centre. See it to experience a bit of Sydney shopping history. From luxury goods to more sensibly priced goods, this building connects walkways from Town Hall train station through to Pitt St Mall. A great spot for people watching

Excellent. Pierre Cardin once said this is the most beautiful shopping centre in the world. Haven't travelled the world yet, but this is certainly one of the most beautiful shopping centre I've seen. One could just sit down, have a cuppa and admire the building.

A beautiful building well worth a visit. Quite simply a beautiful building, which is well worth a visit. Inside there are some interesting shops and places to eat. The location is convenient to Town Hall Station (train) and inner city buses.

Worth a visit, but nothing amazing. This place is right next to the Town Hall station so it really is in the city centre. It is a boutique shopping mall for people with large wallets, however there are some nice places and the building itself is quite nice, too. I do not think it is a must-see though, when I was there I didn't spend much time looking at the architecture and also make sure you don't go there on busy hours because it gets totally overcrowded and I personally got the urge to kick some peoples' feet in front of me
interesting. interesting architecture, interesting shops. Good for some shopping therapy

Beautiful place, good shopping. The building is wonderful and the galleries inside are a dedalus of shops connected to each other by subways, so that you must be careful not to get lost inside. Luckly there are a lot of maps which shows you where you are every moment. During sales season you will find a lot of things to buy at cheap prices, but it is not the most convenient place to do your shopping, becuase there are also other shopping centres and galleries where you can find better prices.
