The building is well worth the visit.. The building is spectacular and well worth the visit. We were there during the Christmas holidays and the decorations were beyond spectacular. The shopping is very upscale (expensive). There are many opportunities to have an expensive tea or lunch in the building.
Beautiful building. I always come here when I am in Sydney,even if I am not shopping. It is a beautiful building with all the shops you could dream of,cafes and a delicious hand made chocolate shop.

The building is great but the shopping is dull.. The store are aimed at bored rich house wives and retirees. The building is worth a visit though, and chances are you will visit it if you use town hall station.

Overpriced and stuck up. I think the customer service in this building is appalling. I understand it's an upmarket area, but if you're not dressed for the Queen the staff in this building don't have the time of day for you even if you've got the money to spend. Would not go back.

Half Open Half Closed. Most shopping malls are either open or they're closed. On this public holiday, you had to search out which shops were open. Other than that, it's a beautiful building and well worth checking out.
good shopping. everywhere is great for shopping around sydney one more place to do it in style

Shopping at the QVB. When staying at the Hilton Syd the QVB is just opposite, lovely building to wander around and window shop, great places to eat, and Victoria's Basement is a foodies delight of equipment.

'Great to look at but average shopping. This is a beautiful building and well worth a visit.
Just thought shops and coffee areas average.

Worth a visit. This is one of the most beautiful Victorian buildings in Sydney. Worth a walk through or a window shop. If you have more time, have lunch in the Tea Room on the third floor, where you will be enticed with an excellent traditional tea of sandwiches, scones and petit fours. A little pricey at around $40, but a nice escape from the busy shopping areas.
Beautiful Sight to see. Very nice shops, connected to train station, in the middle of CBD. Great location and attractions

Beautiful building. It was decorated for Christmas and was very beautiful. Though I think it would have looked as lovely without the decorations. And, there is everything in there you could want or need, from shops to food.
A must do!. I spent approximately an hour there.The building is Nice, i liked the architecture and the christmas lights, the swarowsky christmas tree is amazing!Beautiful building in Sydney.
Love to shop. So much to see and buy. Many beautiful shops with unique and different things to buy. Just love the building
Very comprehensive, a wide range of shops. Nice building and design, a good selection of shops and food. A pleasure to visit
Old World Charm. A beautiful building which houses a number of good quality designer shops. The two clocks are amazing but try and be there when they chime and perform.
A Christmas Wonderland. If you can see the building during Christmas season, it's even more enjoyable
I love the old feeling it has to it. I love older buildings then rather new 1's and this one is just great to go and see. The statue of Queen Victoria is just beauitful and so life like
fantastic. wonderfull large shopping mall in city centre lots of different shops over 5 floors and a wonderful christmas tree going all the way up the middle of it!!!!!

Pretty building, but not extraordinary; worth visiting if it's on your route. The Queen Victoria Building (QVB) has a pretty interior, primarily because of its colorful glass roof, turn-of-the-century decor, and arcade design. But it's not pretty enough to warrant going too far out of your way, especially because its exterior is rather plain; the Sydney Town Hall, located next to it, is a far more interesting building. There's nothing for tourists to do inside the QVB because it's just a mall with pricy stores, so unless you enjoy shopping (or window-shopping), you won't spend more than five minutes here. Many of the stores are the usual, ubiquitous pricy chains such as Swarovski, Ferragamo, and Ralph Lauren; but to be fair, a few are more interesting non-chain stores, such as Peter Nathan Toy Soldiers. Coffee lovers are advised that there are several cafes here, including a Starbucks. If you decide to visit, don't forget to see the statue of Queen Victoria herself, looking unamused outside the south entrance to the QVB.
Nice shopping area. This building is now use as a mall. It is a beautiful building with lot of character.

Shoppers delight. Greart shopping, great food choices in a Heritage Building. Well worth a visit. Dont forget to try a handmade chocolate from Bon Bon. The girls behind the counter were delightful and happy to assist.

Great building, so-so shopping.. The most intriguing shop I found was the bargain basement which held deals on housewares. Other than that, the building is occupied by a number of big name designers and expensive shops which probably don't appeal to the average tourist who is there to see the historic building. Beautiful coloured glass and dark wood Victorian era mall. Easy access to other transportation hubs.
very nice to look at and shop too. a very nice build old building with high end shopping...good experience
A beautiful way to shop. Waste away an afternoon shopping in this beautiful historic building. Lots of great fashion brands, beautiful architecture and some nice places to stop for afternoon tea.

Shops in a beautiful building. The beauty of this building is probably most appreciated from the outside. Although the interior is interesting as far as architecture goes, it is filled with shops and too many people. For an amazing view, go to the Hilton Zeta bar across the street at night and be wowed by illuminated rotunda.If you are into high tea, definitely make reservations for high tea at the QVB. It's quaint, delicious and a fun little outing.

a fantastic building with plenty to shop/see. Its not often i would think to visit a building however the QVB is very pleasing to the eye. I managed t make my way through about 20 stores and left without abusing my credit card too greatly. The building is rich in style and history and if you have not been to sydney before well worth the look. I ambled around with no particular goal and just soaked up the shopping buzz.

Worth a visit - even if you don't like shopping. The Christmas tree was amazing and the decorations fab. The building itself has been well resorted and it is worth having a look round and maybe a coffee and cake - though shops, whilst plentiful, are not inexpensive.

Beautiful Building. This building, right in the heart of Sydney's CBD, is beautiful. It's really worth a visit for the exterior and interior architecture, which has been very maintained. Be sure to look at the clocks and the tile work. The building is full of stores; many are expensive, but there is a nice selection of items from clothing to toys to gifts. There are also a few cafes; my favorite was the old Vienna coffeehouse upstairs, which had great desserts, reasonably-priced lunches, and allows you to sit in the atrium so you can enjoy a leisurely lunch and the architecture! Don't miss the basement level; it's not as stunning architecturally, but it has some good stores and is connected to the train station.
shops with a wow factor. Lovely variety of shops, lots to see and a beautiful building.

Great for the experience and a coffee.. If you have the money shop shop shop but it is very very expensive so why not head down to the other departments stores or the Bondi Junction shopping centre the exact same brands at cheaper prices. Lovely old buildings so great for photos.

A great Victorian building to admire rather to shop. There's no other place in the world like this where you can shop like a real Victorian. The shops are mostly sophisticated fashion brands though, you just have to have good imagination.Tips: You can still walk through it even the shops are all closed, usually about 5pm, fri and sat about 9pm. So, go at night after the crowds left (like we did), take time to admire this old beautiful building, be inspired by its colourful tiles and architecture design. Most importantly, imagine how people a few centuries ago used to stand on the same spot you are standing. A true experience and the real meaning of travelling.
Nice building. Nice historic architecture.Nice clocks inside.Coffee shops overpriced.Crowds, expensive fashion shops
Shopping Center. QVB is like any other major shopping malls in Sydney with similar shops. It is simply house in a historical building.
A great central but busy area to shop. Very central, with some beautiful shops at reasonable prices. They have extended upwards so you could spend a couple of hours perusing the shops
For a wedding reception Plus.. The tea rooms are such a wonderful place to have a reception. Excellent service/food. Surroundings special.

Shopping housed in great architecture. Various renowned brands are here so it's a one-stop shop if you're into them. It's actually quite nice to just sit and admire the architecture of the building.
Links to Galleries is great and provides access to more shopping. :)
Shopping Heaven. You could get lost in this place it is wonderful has everything you need and more

Exceptionally beautiful building with excellent shops and facilities. A very pleasant surprise visiting this beautiful building in the middle of the city of Sydney. So much better than the awful Westfield building. The shops were excellent and the facilities excellent......tea and cakes for only $5 after 2.30.p.m. Well worth a visit to see this exceptional building.

Beautiful Victorian building. The Queen Victoria Building is a magnificent example of Victorian architecture with ornate exterior and interior details. It was originally the market building for Sydney and fell into quite a dilapidated state before it was restored to become a shopping mall. While I'm not a big fan of the mostly expensive shops and cafes inside, at least they've enabled the building to survive.It's worth wandering around, looking at the tiles, the old-fashioned lifts, the dome and the clocks. On a recent visit to Sydney, they had a really interesting art video projected onto the dome every hour, which was well worth watching. If you're in the CBD, the QVB would be an interesting place to stop.

Nice architecture now a shopping mall.. QVB is a nice old building with art deco feel to it. Clock at the top, a letter from Queen Elizabeth written to the people of Sydney and not to be revealed till 2085 are some of the things to look out for. Otherwise it is merely a shopping place
wings of history. if you like to feel the wings of history this is the place. small shops and expensive. quality coffee. A Place to spend an afternoon after a long walk recomended

Can't miss this!. This was not on our list when in Sydney only a short time in May 2010, Fall in Australia. Other travelers we met on the Hop On, Hop Off bus, strongly urged us to take this in. If you're looking for a place to walk and shop/window shop, as well as take in some Australian history, this is the place for you. It's worth the "hop off."It's not a building, but an entire city block that houses 19th century and Romanesque architecture, beautiful tiled floors and stained glass. There are five stories that comprise 70 upscale designer boutiques, as well as the city library. Beautiful, colorful and nice to see where the privileged shop. Before the end of our time there, we managed to find one shop that was willing to work with us. My husband purchased a beautiful Australian opal bracelet and ring for me at a reasonable cost. Suffice it to say, this was my souvenir from Sydney.

Go see the clocks on the top floor. Interesting history about the building. Other than that it is nothing more than an upscale shopping center. The center clock in the building shows a BEHEADING at the top of the hour. Fun thing to show my kids. They thought it was weird.

Lovely Building but not practical with little kids. The Queen Victoria Building (QVB) is a lovely historic building which has been beautifully restored. There are many shops with the more expensive ones being on the higher levels.A nice attraction is the clock which 'comes alive' at various times throughout the day. This is best viewed from the upper levels. This is lovely for kids to see as much as adults. The problem I found was that there is only one baby change room in the whole building (and there are 4 levels!). The change room is in the basement tucked away and is very difficult to find. I thought that I had maybe just missed the other change areas as I felt sure that such a large building should have more than one place to change kids. I checked the website and sure enough I did manage to find the only change area in the whole building.It seems like an afterthought that people may actually want to change their children's nappies and I was a bit annoyed at this sentiment. I don't like feeling like a second class citizen just because I have little children.

Too Name Brand. Lovely old building, they have done a fabulous job with the restoration and rehabilitation of a great piece of architecture. Filled with high end stores and tiny cafes, they are using every available space. Australians don't believe in using heaters, so even sitting at an indoor cafe I had to leave my jacket on during winter. I had a disappointing lunch at one of the many cafes, and browsed all the stores. There were too many name brand stores for me. I much preferred The Strand, another lovely old arcade shopping center only a few blocks away, with little antique shops and one of a kind design names and jewelers.

Great Building - and don't miss the clocks. It's a very impressive building from a time when people built to impress. And it's magnificent, even if you aren't really interested in shopping (I'm not). Make sure to go to the upper levels and examine the two clocks - not only are they large but at various times they open up and reveal historic scenes.

A Very Beautiful Building. The building itself is very beautiful and the design is excellent. Shopping in Australia is expensive so expect high prices. It is still a great walk and will offer an interesting perspective into the Australian culture.
Magnificent archtecture. A structure like no other, filled with upscale shops and little places to eat or snack. Take the tiny, old fashioned elevator to the top for the most breathtaking view.

the building is absolutely fabulous and gorgeous....shame about the shopping.!!!. shopping in sydney is appalling...the stuff is so lacklustre...and exhorbitantly priced...and this is coming from me who is a compulsive shopper..and comes from london...i normally find every country cheap but sydney takes the cake from london..please take all your own stuff from here..the duty free in sydney is atleast 50% more expensive than singapore duty free.food and all is expensive
